But whosoever returns (to usury), those are the ‘Denizens of Hell’, where they will abide therein.

276.Munir Mezyed: Allâh will bring usury to nothingness while make almsgiving profitable. Allâh demonstrates not his own love for the one who is ungrateful and sinner .

277.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, do righteous acts (in this ‘worldly life’), establish the regular Prayer and pay Zakāt, their reward is with their Lord. There will come no fear upon them, neither will they ever grieve.

278.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, act piously towards Allâh and give up what remains of usury if you are inclined to profess a belief (in Allâh).

279.Munir Mezyed: However, if it happens that you do not give up (usury), then you must beware of a war, which is declared against you from Allâh and His ‘Messenger’. If you repent, you will have your capital. Act not unjustly, and you will not be wronged.

280.Munir Mezyed: If it happens that the debtor is in difficulties of paying his debt, let him have respite till things are easier. But if you remit it as alms, it will be better for you, if you have spiritual gift of knowledge.

281.Munir Mezyed: Guard yourselves against a day in which you are (destined) to be brought back to Allâh. Then every Human self will be paid in full that which it has earned, and they will not be wronged.

282.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, When you contract a debt for a certain time, write it down; and let a scribe write it down between you according to justice, and let not the scribe refuse writing according to what Allâh has taught him. Let him, (the debtor), who incurs the liability dictate, and he must act piously towards Allâh, His Lord, and not diminish ought thereof. But if the debtor is foolish, or weak, or unable to dictate him, then he must let his agent dictate in justice. Call to witness from among your men two witnesses; but if there are not two men, then one man and two women from among those whom you choose to be witnesses. If one of those women would make a mistake, then the other of them would remind her. The witnesses should not refuse when they are called to testify.  Be not averse to writing down (the contract) whether it be small or great, with (record of) the term thereof. That is more equitable in the sight of Allâh and more right for bearing witness, and easier, that you may avoid falling into doubts. When it is a present trade which you transact between your own selves, then you would not be at fault if you did not write it down. Take witnesses whenever you make a commercial contract, and let no harm be done to the scribe, nor to the witness; but if you do so, this is indeed an act of injustice from your part. Thus, act piously towards Allâh. He will instruct and teach you (about how you should behave & act). Indeed, Allâh is the All-Knowing of each and everything.

283.Munir Mezyed: If it happens that you are on a journey and you cannot find a scribe, then let pledges be taken (mortgaging). But if one of you trusts the other, let him who is trusted return what he is trusted with, and act piously towards Allâh, His Lord. Conceal not the testimony, for he who conceals it has caused his heart to be sinful. Indeed, Allâh is All-Knowing of all what you do.

284.Munir Mezyed: Unto Allâh belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth. Whether you allow what is in your minds to be visible or conceal it, Allâh will call you to account according to it. Allâh is capable of doing whatever He wills.

285.Munir Mezyed: The ‘Messenger’ believes in that which has been sent down to him from his Lord, as well as the ‘Monotheistic Believers’. Every one of them believes in Allâh, in His ‘Angels’, in His ‘Scriptures’, and in His ‘Messengers’. We make no distinction at all between His ‘Messengers’. They say: “We have heard; and we do comply with everything Allâh has commanded. We implore your (divine) clemency, O’ Lord, and to You is the definitive course."

286.Munir Mezyed: Allâh will not let any ‘Human Self’ be burdened beyond what it can bear. It will be rewarded for that (good deeds) which it has earned, and will be chastised for that (evil deeds) which it has earned. (Those Monotheistic Believers Pray to their Lord, saying): "Our Lord, take not us to task if we forget or fall into error. Our Lord, lay not on us a burden like that which You did lay on those before us. Our Lord, put not on us a burden greater than we have strength to bear, pardon us, forgive us, and show clemency toward us. You are our Great Guardian; thus, make us victorious over a people who who persist in disbelief (in Allâh)."

3.SurahEnglishNames: The Family of Imran, The House of Imran

1.Munir Mezyed: Alif-Lãm-Mĩm.

2.Munir Mezyed: Allâh! There is no God but He, the Ever-Living, the One Who sustains and keeps safe all that which exists.

3.Munir Mezyed: He is the one Who sent down upon you, (O’ Muhammad), the ‘Book’, (the Glorious ‘Qur’ān’) in truth, verifying and establishing that which is before it. He revealed the ‘Torah’ and the ‘Gospel’

4.Munir Mezyed: Aforetime, as  a source of religious insight to the people. He revealed the ‘Criterion’. Indeed, those who give no credence to the ‘Holy Verses’ of Allâh will be subjected to an extremely severe punishment. Lo! Allâh is All-Mighty, the Lord of Retribution.

5.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, nothing is hidden from Allâh, whether on the earth, or in the heavens.

6.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who shapes you in the wombs however He wills: for there is one God; and there is none other but He, the All-mighty, the All-wise.

7.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who has sent down to you, (O’ Muhammad), the ‘Book’, (the Glorious  Qur’ān) in which some ‘Verses’ are absolutely tangible. And they are the essence of the ‘Book’, while other ‘Verses’ are allegorical. But those in whose hearts is perversity follow the part thereof that is allegorical, seeking discord, and seeking an interpretation (suitable for them). No one knows its real interpretation but Allâh. Those who are firmly and deeply planted in the spiritual knowledge and enlightenment say: "We believe in it. All of it is from our Lord." No one is paying attention to (this fact) except for those people who have high self-awareness.

8.Munir Mezyed: (They say): "Our Lord, let not our hearts be deviated (from the truth) after You have already given us the revelation in the knowledge of You, and bestow upon us Your (divine) clemency. Verily, You are the Most Generous Benefactor.”

9.Munir Mezyed: Our Lord, absolutely, You are the one who will gather the people together on an ‘Inevitable Day’. Indeed, Allâh never fails to fulfill His promise."

10.Munir Mezyed: As for those who excessively indulge in disbelief (Allâh), - definitely neither their wealth nor their children will avail them against (the wrath of) Allâh. It is they who will be the fuel for the Fire.

11.Munir Mezyed: (They are like) the clan of ‘Pharaoh’ and those who were before them. They refused to give credence to our ‘Revelations’. Thus, Allâh seized them for their sins. Allâh is indeed extremely severe in punishment.

12.Munir Mezyed: (O’ Muhammad), say unto those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) : "You will be defeated and gathered together to ‘Gehenna’; what a dreadful abode is!"

13.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, there was a sign (of Allâh’s power & Glory) for you in the two armies which met (on the battlefield. The first one consists of monotheistic believers) fighting for (serving) the cause of Allâh. The second one consists of those who  persist in disbelief (in Allâh). The monotheistic believers saw them with their own eyes twice their number. Allâh strengthens with His aid whom He wills. Indeed, there is a lesson in this for those who have deep spiritual insight

14.Munir Mezyed: Beautified for people is the love of worldly desires: women, children, stored-up heaps of gold and silver, freeze branding horses, cattle, and arable land. These are the pleasures of the ‘worldly life’, but Allâh has with Him the best bode, (‘Al-Jannah’).

15.Munir Mezyed: (O’ ‘Prophet’), say (unto all the people): "Shall I inform you of something better than those (‘worldly desires’)? For those who act piously, there will be gardens in the presence of their Lord with rivers flowing beneath, where they will abide therein, and purified spouses, and contentment from Allâh. He is All-Seer of the (His) servants.

16.Munir Mezyed: Those who say: "Our Lord, indeed we have become ‘Monotheistic Believers’, therefore, redeem us from our sins, and guard us against the torment of the Fire."

17.Munir Mezyed: (They are) the steadfastly persevere, the truthful, the obedient, the ones who pursue righteousness, and who seek forgiveness during the last part of the night.

18.Munir Mezyed: Allâh bears witness that there is one God; and there is none other but He, as well as the ‘Angels’ and those who have spiritual gift of knowledge and enlightenment, upholding (the Creation) in justice. There is no god but He,  the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

19.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, the system of faith and worship in the sight of Allâh is Islam. Those who were given the ‘Scripture’ (‘Jews’ & ‘Christians’) differed not but after the full knowledge of the Truth had come to them- due to jealous animosity between them. Whoever denies Allâh’s signs (must know that) Allâh is certainly too swift at reckoning.

20.Munir Mezyed: If it happens that they argue with you, say: "I have submitted (myself entirely to the authority of) Allâh, as well as those who follow me." Unto those who were given the ‘Scripture’ and unto the illiterate ones, say: “Have you submitted yourselves (entirely to the authority of Allâh)?" If it happens that they submit (themselves entirely to the authority of Allâh), then they will attain spiritual insight. But if it happens that they take no heed, then Your duty is only to convey and promulgate the ‘Message’. Allâh is All-Seer of (His) servants.

21.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who give no credence to the signs of Allâh, kill the ‘Prophets’ unjustly, and slay those among men who enjoin justice - give them the tidings of extremely painful chastisement (that awaits them in the ‘Hereafter’).

22.Munir Mezyed: Those are the ones whose deeds have become null and void in this ‘worldly life’, and in the ‘Hereafter’. There will be none to give them help.

23.Munir Mezyed: Have you not considered, (O’ Muhammad), those who were given a portion of the ‘Scripture’? They invoke the ‘Scripture’ of Allâh, (the 'Qur’ān'), in order to judge between them, and then a party of them turns away from it in a repulsive manner.

24.Munir Mezyed: That is because they say: "Never will the Fire touch us except for certain number of days;" and because they were deluded in their belief by (the fabricated myths) which they used to mythologize.

25.Munir Mezyed: Then how will it be when We bring them all together to an ‘Inevitable Day’? Each ‘Human self’ will be paid in full according to what it has earned. It will not be wronged.

26.Munir Mezyed: Say: "O’ Allâh, Lord of Sovereignty, You give authority to whom You want, and You take away the authority from whom You want. You give honor and prestige to whom you want, and You humiliate whom you want. And whatever is veracious lies in Your hand. Indeed, You are capable of doing whatever You will.

27.Munir Mezyed: You cause the night to pass into the day, and You cause the day to pass into the night. You bring forth the living from the dead; and You bring forth the dead from the living. You give the means of subsistence to whom You want without measure.

28.Munir Mezyed: Let not the ‘Monotheistic Believers’ take the impious as friends or allies instead of the ‘Monotheistic Believers’. Whoever does that has nothing to do with what Allâh has prescribed, unless he does (out of fear), as precaution in guarding himself against them. Allâh warns you against His divine retribution. And to Allâh is the definitive course.

29.Munir Mezyed: (O’ ‘Prophet’), say: "Whether you conceal what is in your hearts , or bring it to light, Allâh knows it. He knows perfectly well whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Allâh is capable of doing whatever He wills.

30.Munir Mezyed: There will come a ‘Day’ when each ‘Human self’ is confronted with all the good it has earned, and with all the evil it has earned, wishing there would be great distance between it and its evil deeds. Allâh warns you against His divine retribution. Allâh is Full of Kindness to His servants.

31.Munir Mezyed: Say: "If you demonstrate your own love for Allâh, then follow me. Thus, Allâh will demonstrate His own love for you, and will redeem you from your sins. Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful."

32.Munir Mezyed: Say: "Obey Allâh and the ‘Messenger’." If they take not heed, (then let them know that) Allâh does not demonstrate his own love for those who persist in disbelief (in Him).

33.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, Allâh chose ‘Adam’, ‘Noah’, the family of ‘Abraham’ and the family of  ‘Imrān’ over all the people of the world.

34.Munir Mezyed: They were offspring of one another. Allâh is the All-Hearer, All-Knowing.

35.Munir Mezyed: (Mention), when the wife of '‘Imrān’ said: "My Lord, certainly, I vow to You that I will let what is in my womb be devoted to Your service. Thus, accept this from me. Indeed, You are the All-Hearer, the All-Knowing."

36.Munir Mezyed: When she gave birth to a baby girl, she said: "My Lord, I have given birth to a baby girl,- Allâh Knows perfectly well what she gave birth to- the male is not like the female, and I have named her ‘Mary’. Thus, I earnestly seek refuge for her in You, and for her descendants from ‘Satan’, the condemned."

37.Munir Mezyed: Thus, her Lord accepted her with full approval and made her grow up in a virtuous environment, placing her in the care of ‘Zachariah’. Whenever ‘Zachariah’ entered the sanctuary to (see) her, he found her being supplied with sustenance. He asked: "O’ ‘Mary’, Whence comes this to you?" She answered: "It is from Allâh. Indeed, Allâh gives the means of subsistence to whom He wants without measure."

38.Munir Mezyed: There where ‘Zachariah’ implored and prayed to his Lord, saying: "O’ my Lord, grant me from You a virtuous offspring. Indeed, You are the All-Hearer of supplication."

39.Munir Mezyed: Thus, the ‘Angels’ called him while he was standing in prayer in the sanctuary: "Indeed, Allâh announces to you the joyful news of (a son whose name is) ‘John’,  (coming) to confirm a word from Allâh. He will be a noble leader, a chaste and a ‘Prophet’ among the righteous.”

40.Munir Mezyed: He said: "My Lord, how can I have a son when I am already senile and my wife is barren?" Then one (of the ‘Angels’ said unto him): “Such is the will of Allâh. Thus, Allâh does whatever He wills."

41.Munir Mezyed: He said: "O’ my Lord , give me a Sign.” He said: "Your sign is that you will not speak to the people for three days except by gesture. Thus, celebrate the praises of your Lord frequently, glorify Him and declare His divine glory in the early mornings and in the evenings."

42.Munir Mezyed: Behold! The ‘Angels’ said: "O’ ‘Mary’, indeed Allâh has preferred you, purified you and chosen you above all the women of the worlds.

43.Munir Mezyed: O’ ‘Mary’, be an obedient devotee of the Lord, prostrate yourself before Him and bow down (in prayer) with those who bow down!"

44.Munir Mezyed: This is part of the tidings of the unseen, which We reveal unto you, (O’ Prophet). You were not present with them when they cast their pens (to find out the one) who should take ‘Mary’ to his custody, nor were you present with them when they argued about it.

45.Munir Mezyed: Behold! The ‘Angels’ said: "O’ ‘Mary’, indeed Allâh announces to you the joyful news of a word from Him, whose name will be ‘Christ’, ‘Jesus son of Mary’, greatly honored in this ‘worldly life’ and the ‘Hereafter’, and of those who are brought near (to Allâh).

46.Munir Mezyed: He will speak to the people in his cradle, preaching to them when he will be a matured man. He will be of the righteous.”

47.Munir Mezyed: She said: "My Lord, how can I have a child when no man has touched me?" (The ‘Angel’) said: "Such is the will of Allâh. He creates whatever He wills. When He decrees a matter, He only says unto it: ‘Be,’ consequently, there it is.

48.Munir Mezyed: He will give him wisdom and teach him the ‘Scripture’, the ‘Torah’, and the ‘Gospel’,

49.Munir Mezyed: Making him a ‘Messenger’ to the ‘Children of Israel’, (who will say unto them), 'Indeed, I have come to you with a sign from your Lord, in that I (am capable of) creating for you out of clay the likeness of a bird, then I breathe into it. It will become a bird by the Permission of Allâh. I (am capable also of) healing the blind and the leper, and giving life to the dead by the Permission of Allâh. I will inform you of what you eat and what you store in your houses. Indeed in that is a sign (of Allâh’s power & glory) for you, if you are prepared to profess a belief (in the Omnipotence & Omnipresence of Allâh).

50.Munir Mezyed: I have come to you to authenticate what was before me of the ‘Torah’, and to make lawful some of that which was forbidden to you. I have come to you with a sign from your Lord; therefore, act piously towards Allâh, and obey me.

51.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, Allâh is my Lord and your Lord, thus, worship ( & venerate) Him alone. This is the upright Faith."

52.Munir Mezyed: Nevertheless, When ‘Jesus’ felt their inclination towards disbelief, he said: "Who will be my supporters for (serving the cause of) Allâh?” The ‘Disciples’ replied: “We are the supporters for (serving the cause of) Allâh. We do believe in Allâh. Thus, (O’ ‘Jesus’), bear witness that we have submitted (ourselves completely to His authority).

53.Munir Mezyed: Our Lord! We have believed in what you have revealed, and followed the ‘Messenger’, (‘Jesus Christ’). Thus., enroll us with those who bear witness."

54.Munir Mezyed: (The impious) hatched a plot (to murder ‘Jesus son of Mary’); but Allâh had a different plan for him. Allâh is the best One in setting up a plan.

55.Munir Mezyed: Behold! Allâh said: "O’ ‘Jesus’, indeed I will take you and raise you to Myself, purifying you from (the blasphemy) of those who excessively indulge in disbelief; and I will make those who follow you (in submission to Allâh alone) superior over those who fall into disbelief until the ‘Day of Resurrection’. Then you are all bound to return unto Me, and then I will judge between you concerning that in which you used to differ.

56.Munir Mezyed: As for those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) - I will chastise them with an extremely severe punishment in this ‘worldly life’ and the ‘Hereafter’. There will be none to give them help.

57.Munir Mezyed: But for those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism and do righteous acts (in this ‘worldly life’)- Allâh will pay them their reward in full. Allâh demonstrate not his own love for those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong.

58.Munir Mezyed: What We recite to you, (O’ Muhammad), are ‘Revelations’ and (the Holy Verses of) the Wise ‘Reminder’, (the 'Qur’ān').

59.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, the likeness of ‘Jesus’ in the sight of Allâh is as the likeness of ‘Adam’. He created him from dust, and then said unto him: "Be," consequently, there he was.

60.Munir Mezyed: This is the Truth from your Lord, thus, be not among those who harbor doubts.

61.Munir Mezyed: Then whoever argues with you about it after receiving this full knowledge of the Truth, say: "Come, let us all call our sons and your sons, our women and your women, ourselves and yourselves, and then we will pray humbly and make the curse of Allâh be upon the liars.”

62.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, this ('Qur’ān') is the upright narration. There is one God; and there is none other but Allâh. Indeed, He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

63.Munir Mezyed: But if it happens that they take no heed, then (let them be sure that) Allâh is All-Aware of those who indulge in corruption.

64.Munir Mezyed: (O’ Muhammad) say: "O’ ‘People of the Scripture’, let us come to an equitable agreement between us, that we will worship no one but Allâh, ascribe no partner to Him, and that none of us will take others for lords beside Allâh." But if they take no heed, then say: "Bear witness that we are Muslims.”

65.Munir Mezyed: O’ ‘People of the Scripture’, why do you argue concerning (the Faith of) ‘Abraham’? The ‘Torah’ and the ‘Gospel’ were not revealed until after him? Do you not possess self- awareness that allows you to understand?

66.Munir Mezyed: Here you are arguing about that whereof you have some knowledge. Why do you then argue about that of which you have no knowledge? Allâh knows perfectly well while you do lack the knowledge.

67.Munir Mezyed: ‘Abraham’ was not a ‘Jew’ or a ‘Christian’, but he was a monotheist who had surrendered (himself completely to the authority of Allâh). And he was not of the Polytheists.

68.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, the people who have the best claim to ‘Abraham’ are his followers, and this ‘Prophet’, (Muhammad), and those who are adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism. Allâh is the True Guardian of the ‘Monotheistic Believers’ (of the unfeigned faith).

69.Munir Mezyed: There is a group among the ‘People of the Scripture’, (‘Jews’ & ‘Christians’) who would like to mislead you. But they will not be able to mislead anyone except themselves. But they do lack the ability to perceive that.

70.Munir Mezyed: O’ ‘People of the Scripture’, (‘Jews’ & ‘Christians’), why do you refuse to admit the truth of the ‘Revelations’ of Allâh while you bear witness (to their truth)?

71.Munir Mezyed: O’ ‘People of the Scripture’, why do you confound truth with falsehood, and conceal the truth while you know it?

72.Munir Mezyed: A group among the ‘People of the Scripture’ says (unto each other): "Do believe in that which is revealed unto the Monotheistic Believers at the beginning of the day, and disbelieve in it at its end, so that they may renounce their faith.

73.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, trust none but those who follow your own Faith." Say: "Indeed, the only divine guidance is the guidance of Allâh. (Do you fear that) some people might be given the same knowledge that you were given, and then they will argue with you before your Lord?"  Say: "Indeed, the bounty is in the hand of Allâh. He grants it to whom He wills (of His servants). Allâh is All-Encompassing, All-Knowing."

74.Munir Mezyed: He selects for His mercy whom He wills. Allâh is the Lord of the great bounty.

75.Munir Mezyed: Among the ‘People of the Scripture’, there is one who, if you entrust him with a large amount of money, he will return it to you. Among them (Also), there is one who, if you entrust him with one ‘dīnār’, he will not return it to you, unless you stay standing over him. That is because they say: “We have no duty towards the ‘Gentiles’." They deliberately speak a lie against Allâh, while they are full aware of it.

76.Munir Mezyed: Nay, he whoever fulfills his commitment and acts piously, (let him know that) Allâh demonstrates his own love for the ‘Pious’ ( or for those who show reverence & obedience to Him /or for those who guard themselves against falling into temptation or sin).

77.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who exchange the covenant of Allâh and their faith for a small price will have no share in the ‘Hereafter’. Allâh will not speak with them, or look at them on the ‘Day of Resurrection’, nor will He purify them. Consequently, they will be subjected to an extremely painful punishment (in the ‘Hereafter’).

78.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, there is a party among them distorting the ‘Scripture’ with their tongues so that you may think it is part of the ‘Scripture’, while it is not. They say: "This is from Allâh” while it is not. They deliberately tell lies about Allâh while they are fully aware of it.

79.Munir Mezyed: It is not (possible) for any human being that Allâh should give him the ‘Scripture’, the authority of moral judgments and Prophethood, and then he would say to the people: "Be my worshipers rather than Allâh's," but instead, he would say: "be faithful preachers of the Lord because of what you have taught of the ‘Scripture’, and because of what you have studied."

80.Munir Mezyed: He would never command you to take the ‘Angels’ or ‘Prophets’ as deities. Would he command you to abandon the Faith after you had submitted (yourselves to His authority)?

81.Munir Mezyed: Behold! Allâh took the covenant of the ‘Prophets’, saying: "Take whatever I gave you from the ‘Book’ and wisdom as there will come to you a ‘Messenger’ who will verify and establish what is with you. You must believe in him and support him." Then He asked them: “Do you acknowledge and accept my covenant?" They replied: "Yes, we do."  He said: "Then bear witness, and I am with you among the witnesses."

82.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, whosoever takes no heed after this, they are the sons of  disobedience.

83.Munir Mezyed: So is it other than the religion of Allâh they desire, when all that is in the heavens and on the earth have submitted themselves to His will, either willingly or by compulsion? And unto Him, they are (destined) to be returned.

84.Munir Mezyed: (O’ Muhammad), say: "We believe in Allâh, and in that which has been revealed unto us, and in that which was revealed unto ‘Abraham’, ‘Ishmael’, ‘Isaac’, ‘Jacob’, and the ‘Descendants’, and in that which was vouchsafed to ‘Moses’, ‘Jesus’ and the ‘Prophets’ from their Lord. We make no distinction between them, and to Him, we do surrender."

85.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, whoever seeks a religion other than Islam, it will not be accepted from him, and he, in the ‘Hereafter’, will be among those who are doomed to eternal perdition.

86.Munir Mezyed: How will Allâh give divine guidance to a people who renounced their faith after they had witnessed that the ‘Messenger’ was true, while at the same time the full knowledge of the Truth had come to them? Allâh will not illuminate the path of a people who are grossly unfair and morally wrong.

87.Munir Mezyed: As for such, their penalty will be that in them abides the curse of Allâh, the ‘Angels’, and all the people,  all together.

88.Munir Mezyed: They will remain in this curse forever, and the divine chastisement (in the ‘Hereafter’) will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.

89.Munir Mezyed: But those who repent after that and amend their ways, (let them Know that) Allâh is indeed Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

90.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who renounced their faith after accepting it and insisting on increasing their disbelief in Allâh (let them Know that) their repentance will never be accepted. They are the ones who have gone astray.

91.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) then die as Faithless- the whole earth full of gold would not be accepted from anyone of them if he offered it as a ransom. And they will be subjected to an extremely painful punishment, and there will be none to offer them help.

92.Munir Mezyed: You will not obtain the greatest reward, (entering ‘Al- Jannah’), unless you expend of that which you love. Thus, whatever you expend, (be sure that) Allâh is Well- Aware of it.

93.Munir Mezyed: All types of Food were made lawful to the ‘Children of Israel’ except for what ‘Israel’ had made unlawful for himself before the ‘Torah’ was revealed. Thus, Say: (O’ Muhammad, unto them), "Bring the ‘Torah’ and recite it, if you are truthful."

94.Munir Mezyed: Then after that, whoever invents a lie against Allâh, such are the ones who are grossly unfair and morally wrong.

95.Munir Mezyed: Say: “Allâh has spoken the truth; therefore, follow the creed and the belief of ‘Abraham’, who was a monotheist, not among the ‘Polytheists’."

96.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, the first ‘House’ (of Worship) was established for mankind was that at ‘Mecca’, a ‘Sacred Place’ and a source of spiritual growth for all the beings.

97.Munir Mezyed: In it are clear signs such as the standing place of ‘Abraham’. Whoever enters it will be safe. Pilgrimage to the ‘House’ is incumbent upon all the people, on everyone who is able to undertake the journey to it. As for the one who falls into disbelief in Allâh, (let him know that) Allâh is indeed Self-Sufficient, above any need of the worlds.

98.Munir Mezyed: (O’ Muhammad), say: "O’ ‘People of the Scripture’, why do you refuse to give  credence to the ‘Holy Verses’ of Allâh while Allâh (Himself) is Witness over what you do?"

99.Munir Mezyed: (O’ Muhammad), say: "O’ ‘People of the Scripture’, why do you create difficulties in (serving) the cause of Allâh for those who adhere to Islamic monotheism?  You intend to make it look deviant while you are witnesses (to the truth). Allâh is not oblivious to what you do.

100.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, if it happens that you obey a party of those who have received the ‘Scripture’, they will do their best to make you renounce your Faith.

101.Munir Mezyed: Would it be possible for you to fall in disbelief in Allâh while it is you to whom the ‘Holy Verses’ of Allâh are recited, and among you is His ‘Messenger’? Whoever holds firmly to the (‘Message’) of Allâh will definitely be guided to the right path.

102.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, act piously towards Allâh in accordance with what is required, and die only as Muslims.

103.Munir Mezyed: Hold firmly to the cord of Allâh all together and do not be divided, and  remember with gratitude the grace of Allâh upon you : When you were enemies, He united your hearts by His grace, thus, you became, by His Favor, brethren. You were on the brink of a pit of fire, and then He saved you from it. This is how Allâh shows you His Signs (of power & glory) so that you may attain spiritual insight.

104.Munir Mezyed: Let there be among you a group of people inviting to goodness, enjoining right conduct and preventing whatever is wrong. Those are the ones who will ultimately achieve a blissful life/or gain eternal salvation.

105.Munir Mezyed: Be not like the ones who became divided, and differed after the full knowledge of the truth had come to them. For those, a great chastisement awaits them ( in the ‘Hereafter’).

106.Munir Mezyed: There will be a ‘Day’ when some faces will turn white and some faces will turn black. As for those whose faces have turned back, (it will be said unto them): “Did you renounce your Faith? Therefore, taste the chastisement as an outcome of your constant refusal to accept Islamic monotheism."

107.Munir Mezyed: But, as for the those whose faces have turned white will relish in clemency of Allâh. They will remain therein forever.

108.Munir Mezyed: These are the (Holy) ‘Verses’ of Allâh. We recite them to you, (O’ Muhammad), in truth. Allâh does not intend to do injustice to (His) creatures.

109.Munir Mezyed: Unto Allâh belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Unto Allâh, all matters are returned.

110.Munir Mezyed: You are the best nation that has been raised up for mankind. You enjoin right conduct, forbid what is wrong and believe in Allâh. If only ‘the people of the Scripture’ had embraced Islam, it would have certainly been better for them. Among them are believers (of unfeigned faith), but most of them are walking in the path of disobedience.

111.Munir Mezyed: They will not harm you but a trifling hurt. If it happens that they fight against you, they will turn around and flee, and then they will not be helped.

112.Munir Mezyed: Ignominy is pitched over them wherever they are found except when they are under a covenant with Allâh, and a covenant with men. They brought the wrath of Allâh upon themselves, being pitched by misery. This because they refused to give credence to the ‘Revelations’ of Allâh, (the Lord of all the worlds), and slew the ‘Prophets’ without right. That is because they used to walk in the path of disobedience and keep on falling into sin.

113.Munir Mezyed: Not all of them are alike; among the ‘People of the Scripture’, there is an upright party. They do recite the (Holy) ‘Verses’ of Allâh during the periods of night and do prostrate in prayer.

114.Munir Mezyed: They believe in Allâh and the ‘Last Day’, enjoining right conduct, preventing whatever is wrong and hastening to do righteous acts. Those are among the righteous.

115.Munir Mezyed: Whatever good thing they do, (be sure) they will not be excluded from obtaining their reward. Allâh is Well-Aware of the ‘Pious’ (or of those who show reverence & obedience to Allâh  / or of those who guard themselves against falling into temptation or sin).

116.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh)- neither their wealth nor their children will avail them against (the wrath of) Allâh. They are the ‘Denizens of Hell’, where they will abide therein.

117.Munir Mezyed: The likeness of what they expend in this ‘worldly life’ is the likeness of freezing wind striking and destroying the harvest of people, who have wronged themselves. Allâh wronged them not, but they wrong their own selves.

118.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, take not as intimates others than your own people. They would spare nothing to ruin you, and would like to see that you are seriously harmed. Animosity has already appeared from their mouths, and what their hearts conceal is greater. We have certainly made the signs clear to you, if you do possess self- awareness that allows you to understand.

119.Munir Mezyed: Here you are showing them your love, while they do not love you, although you believe in all the ‘Scriptures’. When they meet you, they say: "We adhere to Islamic monotheism.”But when they are alone, they bite their fingertips in rage against you. Therefore, say unto them: "Die in your outrage!” Indeed, Allâh is Well-Aware of what is in the hearts.

120.Munir Mezyed: When a single good deed touches you, it makes them upset. But when a misfortune befalls you, they rejoice over it. If you persist in patience and continence, and act piously, their evil schemes will not harm you. Indeed, Allâh is All-Encompassing of what they do.

121.Munir Mezyed: (Mention) when you, (O’ Muhammad), left your household in the morning to lodge the ‘Monotheistic Believers’ in their pitches for the battle (of ‘Uhud’). Allâh is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

122.Munir Mezyed: Behold! Although two parties among you were about to lose courage, Allâh remained their Guardian. Therefore, let the Monotheistic Believers depend on  Allâh with full trust

123.Munir Mezyed: Allâh had already given you victory at (the battle) of ‘Badr’ although you were few in number. Therefore, act piously towards Allâh so that you may be thankful.

124.Munir Mezyed: (Recall the time ) when you said to the Monotheistic Believers: "Is it not enough for you that your Lord should strengthen you with three thousand ‘Angels’ specially sent down?”

125.Munir Mezyed: Nay, if you would persist in patience and continence and act piously toward Allâh, while the enemy was coming rushing at you, your Lord would strengthen you with five thousand ‘Angels’ sweeping on.

126.Munir Mezyed: Allâh made it not but as a sign of joyful news and as an assurance to your hearts. Triumph comes only from Allâh, the Almighty, the All-Wise,

127.Munir Mezyed: So that He might cut off a part of those who lack Faith in Allâh or quell them. Thus, they turn back disappointed.

128.Munir Mezyed: (O’ Muhammad) let it not be your concern, whether Allâh is going to forgive them, or whether He is going to chastise them, for indeed, they are grossly unfair and morally wrong.

129.Munir Mezyed: Unto Allâh belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. He forgives whom He will, and chastises whom He will. Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

130.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, devour not usury, doubled and multiplied, but act piously towards Allâh (show reverence & obedience to Allâh) so that you may achieve a blissful life/ or gain eternal salvation.

131.Munir Mezyed: Guard yourselves against the Fire, which has been prepared for those who lack Faith in Allâh.

132.Munir Mezyed: Obey Allâh and the ‘Messenger’ so that you may be delivered from all the consequences of your sins.

133.Munir Mezyed: Hasten to forgiveness from your Lord and a garden as wide as the heavens and earth, prepared for the ‘Pious’

134.Munir Mezyed: Who expend (on serving the cause of Allâh) during the time of ease and adversity, restrain their anger, and forgive people. Allâh demonstrates his own love for those who pursue righteousness.

135.Munir Mezyed: And for those who when they commit an immorality or wrong their own selves, celebrate the praises of Allâh and seek forgiveness for their sins - Who besides Allâh can forgive sins?- and persist not in doing what they used to do while they know.

136.Munir Mezyed: Those, their reward is forgiveness from their Lord and gardens with rivers flowing underneath where they will abide therein. Excellent is the reward of the faithful workers.

137.Munir Mezyed: Verily, similar situations as yours had passed on before you. Travel in the earth and see the dreadful outcome of those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh).

138.Munir Mezyed: This (Qur'ān) is a comprehensible statement to mankind, a source of spiritual insight and an admonition for the ‘Pious’(for those who show honor and reverence for Allâh/or for those who guard themselves against falling into temptation or sin).

139.Munir Mezyed: Do not be dispirited or sad, for you will indeed be superior if you place your Faith in Allâh.”

140.Munir Mezyed: If a wound has touched you, be sure a similar wound has touched the others. Such days of varying fortunes, We alternate among the people so that Allâh would identify those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism and take to Himself from among you martyrs - Allâh does not demonstrate his own love for those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong -

141.Munir Mezyed: And that Allâh would purify the ‘Monotheistic Believers’ (from their sins through trials) and exterminate those  who persist in disbelief (in Allâh).

142.Munir Mezyed: Or do you think that you will enter ‘Al- Jannah’ while He has not identified yet the ones who strive hard and fight (bravely) in His cause, and those who resort to patience and constancy?

143.Munir Mezyed: Verily, you used to long for death (i.e. for martyrdom) before you encountered it. Now you have seen it before your very eyes.

144.Munir Mezyed: Muhammad is not more than a ‘Messenger’ like the ones who have passed away before him. Thus, if he died or was slain, would you turn back on your heels to disbelief? The one who turns back on his heels does no harm to Allâh, and Allâh will reward the thankful.

145.Munir Mezyed: No ‘Human Self’ can ever die except by the permission of Allâh at an appointed time. Whoever desires the reward of this ‘worldly life’, We will bestow on him thereof; and whoever desires the reward of the ‘Hereafter’, We bestow on him thereof. We shall reward those who express their gratitude (to the Lord for His endless blessings).

146.Munir Mezyed: So many faithful preachers fought with the Prophets. They fainted not for what smote them in (serving) the cause of Allâh , neither weakened, nor did they surrender to their enemies. Allâh demonstrates his own love for those who persist in patience and constancy.

147.Munir Mezyed: Their words were not but that they said: "Our Lord, redeem us from our sins and from our extravagant spending on our affairs, plant firmly our feet and grant us victory over a people  who persist in disbelief (in Allâh).”

148.Munir Mezyed: Thus, Allâh will give them the reward of this ‘worldly life’ and the good reward of the ‘Hereafter’. Allâh demonstrates his own love for those whose heart is perfect towards Allâh.

149.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, If it happens that you obey those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh), they will try to make you turn back upon your heels. Thus, you will then become among those who are doomed to eternal perdition.

150.Munir Mezyed: Nay! Allâh is your Protector; and He is the Best Helper.

151.Munir Mezyed: We will cast terror into the hearts of those who excessively indulge in disbelief ( in Allâh), because they ascribe partners to Allâh, for which He had sent no authority. Their abode will be Fire. Dreadful is the residence of those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong.

152.Munir Mezyed: Verily, Allâh did fulfill His promise to you when you were exterminating your enemy by His Permission until the moment when you lost your courage, disputing over the order and disobeying after He had shown you that which you loved. Among you are some who desire this ‘worldly life’, and some who desire the ‘Hereafter’. Thus, He made you fall back so that He might test you. He has certainly forgiven you. Allâh is Full of Grace to the  Monotheistic Believers.

153.Munir Mezyed: Behold! You climbed up the high ground without even looking aside at anyone while the ‘Messenger’ was calling you from behind. Thus, Allâh repaid you with sorrow upon sorrow so that you might not mourn over what you had lost and the injuries you had suffered. Allâh is Well Acquainted with all that you do.

154.Munir Mezyed: Then, after the sorrow, He sent down upon you security (in the form of) slumber overcoming a party of you while (the other) party, who worried about themselves, thought wrongly of Allâh as the thought of ignorance. They said: “Do we have any role to do with in this issue?” Indeed, the whole issue belongs unto to Allâh." They conceal within themselves what they will not reveal it unto you. They say: " Had we any role to do with in this issue, some of us would not have been killed right here." Say: "Even if you had been inside your houses, those who were appointed to be slain would have come out to their death beds”. (It meant to be) so that Allâh will identify what is within you, and purify what is in your hearts. Allâh is Well-Aware of what is hidden in the hearts (of mankind).

155.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who fell back on the day when the two armies met- it was ‘Satan’ who caused them to backslide because of some of that which they had earned. Allâh has already forgiven them. Indeed, Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, Most Forbearing.

156.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, do not be like those who indulge in disbelief in Allâh, saying of their brethren who traveled through the land or went out to fight, "If they had been with us, they would have not died or have been slain." Thus, Allâh makes that to be an intense regret in their hearts. It is Allâh who gives life and causes death, and Allâh is Well -Aware of all that you do.

157.Munir Mezyed: Whether you are slain for (serving) the cause of Allâh or die, forgiveness and clemency from Allâh are far greater than what they amass in this ‘worldly life.’

158.Munir Mezyed: Whether you die or being slain; unto Allâh, you are (destined to) be gathered.

159.Munir Mezyed: It was due to the clemency from Allâh that you dealt gently with them, otherwise, if you had been rude or hard–hearted, they would have not stayed with you all this time. Therefore, pardon them, ask Allâh to forgive their sins and consult with them in certain issues. When you have taken the decision, then depend on Allâh with full trust. Indeed, Allâh demonstrates his own love for those who rely completely on Him with full trust.

160.Munir Mezyed: If Allâh helps you, then no one can defeat you. But if He forsakes you, then who can offer you help after Him? Let the ‘Monotheistic Believers’ depend on Allâh with full trust.

161.Munir Mezyed: It is not possible for any Prophet to defraud, and whoever defrauds will bring what he has defrauded with him on the ‘Day of Resurrection’. Then each ‘Human Self’ will be paid in full for what it earned; and they will not be wronged.

162.Munir Mezyed: Is the one who follows the good pleasure of Allâh like the one who brings the wrath of Allâh upon himself and his abode is hellfire? Dreadful is definitive course!.

163.Munir Mezyed: They are in different ranks in the sight of Allâh, and Allâh is Well-Aware of all that they do.

164.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, Allâh conferred a great favor upon the ‘Monotheistic Believers’ when He sent among them a ‘Messenger’ from themselves reciting to them His (Holy) ‘Verses’, purifying them (from ‘Polytheism’ & ‘Atheism’), and teaching them the ‘Scripture’ and wisdom, while, before that, they had been living in manifest deception.

165.Munir Mezyed: Why is it that when a single disaster struck you (in ‘battle of Uhud’), although you had struck the enemy (in the battle of Badr) with one twice as great, you began to say: "From where is this?" (O’ Muhammad), say unto them: "It is from your own selves." Indeed, Allâh is capable of doing whatever He wills.

166.Munir Mezyed: What struck you on the day when the two armies met was by the permission of Allâh so that He may identify the ‘Monotheistic Believers’,

167.Munir Mezyed: And may identify also those who are ‘Hypocrites’. For it was said unto them: “Come and fight for (serving) the cause of Allâh, or at least defend yourselves.” They said: “If we had known that there would be fighting, we would have definitely followed and fought with you." On that day, they were nearer to disbelief than faith, uttering with their mouths what was not in their hearts while Allâh knows perfectly well what they conceal.

168.Munir Mezyed: Those who stayed home during the fight said of their slain brethren: “If they had obeyed us, they would not have been slain." Say: "Then prevent death from yourselves if you are truthful."

169.Munir Mezyed: Think not of those who are slain in (serving) the cause of Allâh as ‘dead’. Nay, they are alive with their Lord, receiving the means of sustenance from Him.

170.Munir Mezyed: They are delighted in what Allâh has bestowed upon them of His bounty, getting good news regarding those (who will be martyred) after them, who have not  joined them yet - that there will come no fear upon them, nor will they ever grieve.

171.Munir Mezyed: They are getting joyful news of favor and bounty from Allâh, and that Allâh will not allow the reward of the ‘Monotheistic Believers’ to be lost.

172.Munir Mezyed: Those are the ones who responded to (the call of) Allâh and the ‘Messenger’ after injury had struck them. For those who did good among them, and acted piously toward Allâh, will receive a great reward (from Allâh).

173.Munir Mezyed: Those unto whom the people said: "Indeed, the people have gathered against you, so fear them." Nevertheless, the threat of danger invigorated their faith and they said: “Allâh is Sufficient for us. He is the best Disposer of affairs on Whom we  depend with full trust!

174.Munir Mezyed: Thus, they returned with grace and favor from Allâh. No evil ever touched them, as they follow the good pleasure of Allâh.  He is the Lord of Great Bounty.

175.Munir Mezyed: It is only ‘Satan’ who tried to frighten you with his supporters. Thus, do not fear them but show honor and reverence for Me if you are true believers (of unfeigned faith).

176.Munir Mezyed: Let not those who hasten into disbelief in Allâh sadden you. Indeed, they can do no harm to Allâh at all. Allâh desires not to appoint for them any share in the ‘Hereafter’. They will be subjected to a great punishment in the ‘Hereafter’.

177.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who purchase disbelief in Allâh at the price of Faith can do no harm to Allâh at all. They will be subjected to an extremely painful punishment in the ‘Hereafter’.

178.Munir Mezyed: Let not those who are inclined to disbelieve (in Allâh) think that our respite to them is good for themselves. We only extend it for them so that they may add sins to their sins. They will be subjected to an extremely disgraceful punishment (in the ‘Hereafter’).

179.Munir Mezyed: Allâh will not leave the ‘Monotheistic Believers’ in the state which you are in until He separates the evil from the good. Nor will He reveal unto you the secrets of the Unseen. But Allâh chooses of His ‘Messengers’ whom He wills. Thus, place your Faith in Allâh and His ‘Messengers’. If you adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism and act piously, then you will have a great reward.

180.Munir Mezyed: Let not those who hoard up what Allâh has bestowed upon them of His bounty think that it is good for them. Nay, it will be the worse for them as their necks will be encircled on the ‘Day of Resurrection’ by that which they hoard up. Unto Allâh belongs the heritage of the heavens and of the earth. Allâh is Well Acquainted with all that you do.

181.Munir Mezyed: Verily, Allâh heard the saying of those who said: "Indeed, Allâh is poor, while we are rich." We will record what they say and their act of killing the ‘Prophets’ unjustly. Then We will say unto them: “Savor the punishment of the burning Fire.”

182.Munir Mezyed: This is because of what your hands have put forth. Indeed, Allâh would never be iniquitous towards His servants.

183.Munir Mezyed: The same are those who say: “Allâh took our promise not to believe in any ‘Messenger’ unless he shows us a sacrifice consumed by Fire (from the heavens).” Verily, there came to you ‘Messengers’ before me, with knowledge of truth and even with what you speak of. Why, then, did you slay them if you were truthful in your claim?"

184.Munir Mezyed: If it happens that they belie you (O’ Muhammad, grieve not) as so many ‘Messengers’ before you were belied, who came to them with the knowledge of truth, with the ‘Psalms’ and with the ‘Enlightening Scripture’.

185.Munir Mezyed: Every ‘Human Self’ is destined to taste death. You only be paid fully your reward on the ‘Day of Resurrection’. Whoever is removed away from the Fire and admitted into ‘Al- Jannah’ has ultimately achieved a blissful life/or gained eternal salvation. (Know that this) ‘worldly life’ is not more than a provision of vanities..

186.Munir Mezyed: We will let you experience hardship in your possessions and in yourselves. You will surely hear much annoying words from those who were given the ‘Scripture’ before you, and from those who are ‘Polytheists’, but if you persist in patience and constancy and act piously towards Allâh: This will be a sign of firm determination.

187.Munir Mezyed: Behold! Allâh took a covenant from the ‘People of the Scripture’ to make it clear to the people, not to conceal it. But they hurl it forcefully behind their backs and exchanged it for a small price. Therefore, evil is that which they have purchased.

188.Munir Mezyed: Think not that those who express joy in what they have done, and love to be praised for what they themselves have not done, are safety from divine punishment. For lo! They will be subjected to an extremely painful punishment (in the ‘Hereafter’).

189.Munir Mezyed: Unto Allâh belongs the (Absolute) Sovereignty of the heavens and of the earth. Allâh is capable of doing whatever He wills.

190.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and earth, in the alternation of the night and day, are signs (of Allâh’s power & glory) for those who possess high self- awareness.

191.Munir Mezyed: Those who celebrate the praise of Allâh and declare His indefinite glory, while standing or sitting or lying on their sides, and contemplate the creation of the heavens and  earth, (say): "Our Lord, You created not this (‘world’) in vain. Exalted are You. Guard us against the punishment of the Fire.

192.Munir Mezyed: Our Lord, indeed the one whom You cause him to enter the Fire, You have disgraced him. There will be none to offer help for those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong.

193.Munir Mezyed: Our Lord, indeed we have heard a crier calling unto Faith, saying: ‘Have Faith in your Lord.’ Thus, we attain to faith. Our Lord, redeem us from our sins, deliver us from all our evil deeds, and cause us to die with the righteous.

194.Munir Mezyed: Our Lord, vouchsafe us what You have promised us through Your ‘Messengers’, disgrace us not on the ‘Day of Resurrection’. Indeed, You are the One Who never fails to fulfill His promise.”

195.Munir Mezyed: Thus, their Lord responded to them: "Never will I let the work of any worker among you be lost in vain, whether male or female. You are all related to one another. Those who migrated, those who were forced to leave their homes, those who were persecuted in (serving) My cause, and those who fought (bravely) and were slain, I will deliver them from all the consequences of their sins, and admit them into Gardens beneath which rivers flow as reward from Allâh. From Allâh comes the best reward.

196.Munir Mezyed: Let not the inconstancy of those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) throughout the land deceive you.

197.Munir Mezyed: It is but a brief opportunity for joy. Hellfire is their eternal refuge. Dreadful is the abode!

198.Munir Mezyed: But, those who act piously towards their Lord will have Gardens beneath which rivers flow. They will remain therein forever as generous reception and entertainment from Allâh, and that which is with Allâh is best for the ‘Pure in Heart’.

199.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, among the ‘People  of the Scripture’ are those who believe in Allâh, in that which is revealed unto you and in that which was revealed unto them. They humble themselves before Allâh and exchange not the (Holy) ‘Verses’ of Allâh for a small price. Those will have their reward with their Lord. Indeed, Allâh is too swift at reckoning.

200.Munir Mezyed: O you who adhere firmly to monotheism, resort to patience and constancy, outdo all others in endurance, remain stationed, and act piously towards Allâh, so that you may ultimately achieve a blissful life/or gain eternal salvation.

1.Munir Mezyed: O’ mankind, act piously towards your Lord, who created you from a single ‘Human self’ (‘Adam’), creating from it its mate (‘Eve’), dispersing from both of them many men and women.  Thus, act piously towards your Lord, the One by whose Name you swear to settle your matters, and build strong and positive relationships with your family. Indeed, Allâh is Ever-Watchful over you.

2.Munir Mezyed: Give to the orphans their wealth, substitute not your bad things for their good ones, and devour not their wealth (by adding it) to your own wealth. Indeed, this is a capital sin.

3.Munir Mezyed: If it happens that you fear that you will deal not fairly with the orphan girls, then wed those that please you of other women, two or three or four. But if you fear that you will not be able to deal fairly with them, then (wed only) one, or what your right hands possess. That would be more adequate so that you might not be inclined towards injustice.

4.Munir Mezyed: Give to the woman whom you marry their dowries as a wedding gift. If they give up willingly a portion of it to you, then it is lawful for you to consume it up, and enjoy it without fear of any harm.

5.Munir Mezyed: Give not to the prodigals their wealth that Allâh has assigned to you to manage. But feed and clothe them from it, and speak kindly unto them.

6.Munir Mezyed: Test well the orphans until they reach the age of marriage. If then you perceive in them sound judgment, deliver to them their wealth, devour it not wastefully or hastily, lest they attain to full age. However, if the guardian was self-sufficient, he should abstain generously (from taking any share from the wealth of orphans). But if he was poor, let him take for himself what is just and reasonable. When you deliver to them their wealth, take witnesses in their presence. Sufficient is Allâh in taking account.

7.Munir Mezyed: For men and woman, there is a share of what the parents and close relatives leave, whether there is little or much of it-  (It is) an obligatory share.

8.Munir Mezyed: If relatives, orphans or destitute people, were present at the time of division, then make provision for them out of it, and speak gently unto them.

9.Munir Mezyed: Let those (executors and guardians) have the same concern as they would have for their own if they had left weak offspring behind. Therefore, let them act piously towards Allâh and speak right words.

10.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who devour the wealth of the orphans unjustly eat up only a fire into their bellies. They will be burnt in the inferno.

11.Munir Mezyed: Allâh commands you concerning your children to give the male the equivalent of the portion of two females. If there are only daughters, two or more, then their share is two-thirds of the inheritance. If there is only one, then her share is half. For the parents, to each one of them is a sixth share of the inheritance if the deceased left children. But if there is no children, and the parents are the only heirs, then his mother will have the third. If the deceased left siblings, then the mother will have the sixth after any bequest he may have made or debt. (All the shares will be distributed) after the payment of legacies and debts. You may not know whether your parents or your children are more beneficial to you. Indeed, Allâh is All-knowing and All-wise.

12.Munir Mezyed: Your share is half of what your wives leave if they have no children. But if they have a child, then your share is one fourth of what they leave, after the payment of legacies and debts. The wives will have fourth if you leave no child. But if you leave a child, then their share is eighth of what you leave, after the payment of legacies and debts. If a man or woman leaves neither ascendants nor descendants but has a brother or a sister, then each one of them will have sixth. If there are more than two, they will be sharers in the third, after the payment of legacies and debts, as long as there is no loss is caused to any one. This is a commandment from Allâh. He is All-knowing, Most Forbearing.

13.Munir Mezyed: These are the limits (rules & laws) set by Allâh. Whoever obeys Allâh and His ‘Messenger’ will be admitted by Him into gardens with rivers flowing beneath. They will remain therein forever.  This is the most ultimate success and the supreme one.

14.Munir Mezyed: But, whoever disobeys Allâh and His ‘Messenger’, and transgresses His Limits, will be admitted by Him into a fire. He will remain therein forever. And he will be subjected to a disgraceful punishment ( in the ‘Hereafter’).

15.Munir Mezyed: Those women among yours who commit adultery, call to witnesses against them four witnesses from among you. If they testify, confine them to the houses until they die, or Allâh provides them a way out.

16.Munir Mezyed: The two persons (the man & the woman) who commit adultery among you, punish them both. If they repent and amend their ways, leave them alone. Indeed, Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, Most-Merciful.

17.Munir Mezyed: Forgiveness granted by Allâh is for those who do evil in ignorance and repent soon afterwards. They are the ones whom Allâh will turn in forgiveness. Allâh is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

18.Munir Mezyed: Forgiveness would not be granted for those who commit evil deeds continuously till when death is approaching one of them, then he says: "Indeed, I have repented now," or for those who die as faithless. These are the ones for whom We have prepared a painful chastisement (in the ‘Hereafter’).

19.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, It is not lawful for you to inherit women against their own will, or to create difficulties for them in order to force them to give up a portion of what you have given them in order to obtain divorce, unless they have clearly committed adultery. Thus, treat them with kindness and respect. If you dislike them, you may dislike something wherein Allâh has placed a lot of goodness.

20.Munir Mezyed: However, if you intended to replace a wife with another wife, and you have given one of them a heap of gold, then take not from it anything. Would you take it wrongfully without any right, and with an apparent transgression?

21.Munir Mezyed: Would it possible for you to take it since both of you have gone in unto each other, and they have taken from you solemn covenant?

22.Munir Mezyed: Wed not those women whom your fathers got married, except for what has already passed. Indeed, that tradition was debauchery, hateful and evil way.

23.Munir Mezyed: It is forbidden for you to wed your mothers, your daughters, your sisters, your paternal aunts, your maternal aunts, the daughters of your brother, the daughters of your sister, your foster mothers that have suckled you, your foster milk suckling sisters, the mothers of your wives, your step daughters who are in your guardianship, born of your wives to whom you have gone in - but there is no iniquity upon you if you have not gone in them to marry their daughters - the wives of your sons who spring from your own loins, and two sisters in wedlock at the same time, except for what has already passed. Indeed, Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

24.Munir Mezyed: (It is also forbidden for you to wed) the women whom are already married, except for those (captives & slaves) whom your right hands possess. This is the ordinance of Allâh for you. Therefore, lawful to you are all the women beyond those mentioned as long as you seek them with your property in honest wedlock, not debauchery. Consequently, whoever you like among them, you must give them their dowries which decreed for them. There is no iniquity upon you if you agree mutually after what is appointed of the dowry. Indeed, Allâh is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

25.Munir Mezyed: Whoever among you is not able to afford to wed free, monotheistic women, then let him wed from the monotheistic maids whom your right hands possess. Allâh is All- Aware of your Faith as you are one from another. Thus, wed them with the permission of their masters, and give them their dowries according to what is reasonable if they are chaste, not committing fornication, nor taking secret paramours. However, when they are sheltered in marriage, if they commit adultery, then their punishment will be half of that for free unmarried women. This is for him among you who fears to commit adultery. But to resort to patience would be far better for you. Allâh is Oft-forgiving, Most Merciful.

26.Munir Mezyed: Allâh wants to make clear (what is lawful and what is unlawful) to you, in order to guide you to the ways of those before you and to grant you forgiveness. He is All-knowing and All-wise.

27.Munir Mezyed: Allâh intends to grant you forgiveness while those who follow their worldly lusts want to see you deviating tremendously.

28.Munir Mezyed: Allâh intends to lighten the burden for you for man was created weak.

29.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to monotheism, devour not one another's wealth wrongfully unless it is in trade by mutual agreement, and slay not one another. Indeed, Allâh is the Most Merciful to you.

30.Munir Mezyed: Whoever does that through aggression and injustice, We will drive him into a Fire. This, for Allâh, is an easy thing to do.

31.Munir Mezyed: If you avoid the major sins which you are forbidden to do, We will deliver you from all the consequences of your sins, and admit you into an honorable entrance (i.e. ‘Al-Jannah’).

32.Munir Mezyed: Covet not the thing in which Allâh has made some of you exceed others. Men will have the benefit of what they have gained. Women will have the benefit of what they have gained. Thus, ask Allâh of His bounty. Indeed Allâh is Ever All-Knowing of everything.

33.Munir Mezyed: To every one, We have appointed heirs to what is left by parents and relatives. Those with whom your right hand was pledged, give them their share. Indeed, Allâh is Ever a Witness over all things.

34.Munir Mezyed: Men are protectors of women because Allâh has made some of them to excel others, and because they support them financially. Therefore, the righteous women are faithfully obedient, guarding in the absence of the husband what Allâh orders them to be guarded.  However, those women from whom you fear disloyalty and misbehaving, admonish them first, (next), abandon their beds, and (finally), beat them (lightly). If it happens that they obey you, then seek not a way against them. Indeed, Allâh is Ever Exalted and Grand.

35.Munir Mezyed: If you fear a dissension between the couple, then appoint an arbiter from his family and an arbiter from hers. If both of them want reconciliation- Allâh will cause it to happen between them. Indeed, Allâh is All-Knowing, All-Aware.

36.Munir Mezyed: Worship (& venerate) Allâh alone and ascribe nothing as partner to Him. Show kindness and respect to the parents, the relatives, the orphans, the needy one, the neighbor who is among your relatives, the neighbor who is not among your relatives, the fellow-traveler, the wayfarer and the slaves whom your right hands possess. Allâh does not demonstrate his own love for the one who is arrogant and vainglorious,

37.Munir Mezyed: ( Nor) those who are niggardly and bid other people to be niggardly, hiding what Allâh has given them of His bounty. We have prepared for those who lack faith (in Allâh) a disgraceful chastisement,

38.Munir Mezyed: And (also) those who expend their wealth to impress the people,and believe not in Allâh and in the ‘Last Day’. Whoever chooses ‘Satan’ to be his companion-  what a dreadful companion he chooses!

39.Munir Mezyed: What harm would have been upon them if they had believed in Allâh and in the ‘Last Day’, and expended of what Allâh bestowed upon them? Allâh is All- Aware of all that they do.

40.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, Allâh would never ever do injustice even as much as the weight of an atom. If there is a single righteous good deed, He multiplies it, and gives a great reward from Himself.

41.Munir Mezyed: What if We bring a witness from each nation; and We bring you, (‘Muhammad’) , a witness against these people?

42.Munir Mezyed: On that day, those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) and disobey the ‘Messenger’ will wish that they could be turned into dust, and that they would not have hidden a word related to Allâh.

43.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, approach not Prayer when you are drunken so that you may know what you utter, nor when you have a seminal discharge till you wash your whole body with water, unless you are on a journey. However, If it happens that you are unable to find water when you are ill, or on a journey, or one of you coming out of the privy, or being in contact with women, then you can take for yourselves clean sand , and rub therewith your faces and hands. Indeed, Allâh is Oft-Pardoning, Oft-Forgiving.

44.Munir Mezyed: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the ‘Scripture’?  They purchase error and desire that you would go astray from the right path.

45.Munir Mezyed: Allâh knows better than you who your enemies are. Allâh is sufficient as a Guardian and sufficient as a Supporter.

46.Munir Mezyed: Among the ‘Jews’ are those who distort words through false interpretation and say: “We have heard your words, (O’ Muhammad), but we disobey,” (adding): "Listen to us!” Distorting with their tongues and slandering (your own) faith and beliefs. if only they had said: "We hear and obey", and "do make us perceive the intended meaning," it would have been better for them, and more appropriate. But Allâh has cursed them for their disbelief, so they adhere not to Islamic monotheism, except for a few.

47.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who were given the ‘Scripture’ (Jews & Christians) , believe in what We have sent down (to Muhammad) since it establishes the Truth that which is with you, before We wipe out faces and turn them toward their backs, or curse them as We cursed the ‘violators of the Sabbath’. The Commandment of Allâh is always executed.

48.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, Allâh forgives not that partners should be set up with him. Therefore, He forgives all besides that to whom He wills. Whoever sets up a partner with Allâh has indeed committed an unpardonable sin.

49.Munir Mezyed: Have you not seen those who attribute purity to themselves?  Nay, Allâh purifies whom He wills. They shall not be wronged, not even as much as a hair on a date-seed.

50.Munir Mezyed: See, how they fabricated lies against Allâh. That by itself is an unpardonable sin.

51.Munir Mezyed: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the ‘Scripture’? They believe in superstition and the mythological deities saying unto the ‘Polytheists’ that they are more rightly guided than those who adhere to Islamic monotheism.

52.Munir Mezyed: They are ones whom Allâh has cursed. Thus, he whom Allâh has cursed will not find any helper for him.

53.Munir Mezyed: Or do they have a share in the Supremacy? Then in that case they would not give the people anything, not even speck on a date seed.

54.Munir Mezyed: Or do they envy the people for what Allâh has given them of His Bounty? Indeed, We gave to the children of ‘Abraham’ the ‘Scripture’ and wisdom, giving them a mighty kingdom.

55.Munir Mezyed: Of them were some who believed in him, and of them were some who turned away from him. Thus, Hellfire is an adequate abode for them.

56.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who give no credence to our ‘Revelations’, We will burn them in Fire.  Whenever their skins are roasted, We will change them for other skins, so that they may taste the punishment. Indeed, Allâh is All-Mighty, All-Wise.

57.Munir Mezyed: Those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, and do righteous acts ( in this ‘worldly life’), We will admit them into gardens with rivers flowing beneath. They will abide therein. They will have therein purified spouses. And We will admit them into a cool shade.

58.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, Allâh commands that you should render back the trusts to their owners; and that when you judge between the people, you must judge with justice. Indeed, graceful is what Allâh admonishes you. Indeed, Allâh is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.

59.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who  adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, obey Allâh and the ‘Messenger’ , and those who are in authority among you. When you differ in anything among yourselves, refer it to Allâh and His ‘Messenger’ if you believe in Allâh and in the ‘Last Day’. This would be more effective and a better way to permanently settle a dispute.

60.Munir Mezyed: Have you not seen those who claim that they believe in what was revealed unto you, and in what was revealed before you? They desire to go for judgment to one of their mythological deities, while they have been ordered to disbelieve in them. But ‘Satan’ desires to lead them far astray.

61.Munir Mezyed: When it is said unto them: "Come to what Allâh has sent down and to the ‘Messenger’," you will see the ‘Hypocrites’ turning away from you with utter aversion.

62.Munir Mezyed: How would it be if a misfortune smote them as a consequence of what their hands have sent forth? Then they would come to you swearing by Allâh, “We seek for nothing but goodwill and conciliation!"

63.Munir Mezyed: Those are the ones of whom Allâh knows what is in their hearts. Thus, do not rebuke them but preach and communicate with them passionately and effectively concerning themselves.

64.Munir Mezyed: We sent no ‘Messenger’ but to be obeyed by the permission of Allâh. If only those (‘Hypocrites’) came to you after wronging themselves—seeking Allâh’s forgiveness and (asking) the ‘Messenger’ to pray for their forgiveness, they would have certainly found Allâh Oft-Forgiving and Most Merciful.

65.Munir Mezyed: But nay, by your Lord, they will not be truly believers till they ask you to judge any dispute arises between them, not finding any discomfort in their hearts and minds against your decision. Thus, they ought to accept (your decision) with full submission.

66.Munir Mezyed: If We had ordered them to sacrifice themselves or abandon their homes, they would not have done it except for a few of them. However, if they had done what they were exhorted to do, it would certainly have been far better for them and more strengthening.

67.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We would then have given them from Ourselves a great reward.

68.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We would have guided them into the right path.

69.Munir Mezyed: Whoever obeys Allâh and the ‘Messenger’, such will be in the company of those on whom Allâh has bestowed His grace of the ‘Prophets’, of the truthful, of the martyrs, and of the righteous. How excellent these companions are!

70.Munir Mezyed: Such is the bounty from Allâh. Sufficient is Allâh as Omniscient.

71.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, remain vigilant, and either go forth in parties or go forth all together.

72.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, there is among you who would linger behind from fighting. Then if a misfortune befell you, he would say: ”Allâh indeed bestowed a favor upon me because I was not present with them.”

73.Munir Mezyed: But if a bounty ( triumph) came to you from Allâh, then he would say - as if there were no friendly relation between you and him- " Oh! I wish I had been with them. Consequently, I would have achieved a great success."

74.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, let those ones who desire to sell this ‘worldly life’ for the ‘Hereafter’ fight for (serving) the cause of  Allâh. Thus, whoever fights for (serving) the cause of Allâh gets killed or attains victory, We will definitely grant him a mighty reward.

75.Munir Mezyed: Why should you not fight for (serving) the cause of  Allâh, and for the sake of the weak among men, women and children, who cry out: "Our Lord, rescue us from this town whose inhabitants are grossly unfair and morally wrong and send us from You a guardian, and send us from You a helper.

76.Munir Mezyed: Those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism do fight for (serving) the cause of Allâh while those who indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) fight for (serving) the cause of their mythological deities. Therefore, fight against the followers of ‘Satan’. Indeed, the (evil) scheme of ‘Satan’ is ever weak.

77.Munir Mezyed: Have you not seen those who were told to hold back their hands from fighting, to establish the regular ‘Prayer’, to pay ‘Zakāt’ (i.e. the Prescribed Purifying Alms)? However, when fighting is ordained for them, a group of people among them fears their enemy as much as they fear (the wrath of) Allâh or even more. They say: "Our Lord, Why have you ordained for us fighting? Would you not grant us respite to a near term?" Say, (O’ Muhammad): "Short is the pleasure of this ‘worldly life’. The ‘Hereafter’ is far better for the one who acts piously.” They will not be wronged (by the Lord), not even as much as a hair on a date-seed.

78.Munir Mezyed: Wherever you may be, death will overtake you, even if you were in strong rock fortresses, with lofty walls set on high. When a single righteous good deed befalls them, they say: "This is from Allâh," but when a single evil deed befalls them, they say: "This is from you, (O’ Muhammad)." Say: “All things are from Allâh," What is wrong with these people that they could hardly understand a word?

79.Munir Mezyed: Whatever good thing befalls you, it is from Allâh, and whatever bad thing befalls you, it is from yourself. We have sent you, (Muhammad), as a ‘Messenger’ to mankind; and Allâh is sufficient as Witness.

80.Munir Mezyed: Whoever obeys the ‘Messenger’ obeys Allâh indeed. Whoever turns away, (needs to know that) We have not sent you as a guardian over them.

81.Munir Mezyed: They say: "We are obedient,” but as soon as they leave you, some of them spend all night planning against what you say. Allâh records what they plan by night. Therefore, rebuke them not, and depend on Allâh with full trust . Allâh is All-Sufficient as a Trustee.

82.Munir Mezyed: Do they not then ponder over the (Glorious) 'Qur’ān'? Had it been from other than Allâh, they would have found therein much inconsistency.

83.Munir Mezyed: When there comes to them any information whether of safety or fear, they announce it in public. If only they had referred it to the ‘Messenger’ or to those charged with authority among them, the ones in charge would have tested and used it more properly. Had it not been for the grace and clemency of Allâh upon you, you would definitely have followed ‘Satan’, except for a few of you.

84.Munir Mezyed: Thus, fight, (O’ Muhammad), for (serving) the cause of Allâh. You are not made responsible except for yourself. Motivate and inspire the ‘Monotheistic Believers’ to fight. It may be that Allâh will restrain the power of those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh).Lo! Allâh is much more Powerful and Sufficiently Powerful to give exemplary punishment.

85.Munir Mezyed: Whoever intercedes in a good cause will have the reward thereof, and whoever intercedes in an evil cause will have a share in its burden. Allâh is Ever Keeper over all things.

86.Munir Mezyed: When you are greeted with a greeting, greet with a better one or at least return it. Indeed, Allâh ever takes account of all things.

87.Munir Mezyed: Allâh! There is no god but He. He will definitely gather you all together on the ‘Day of Resurrection’ about which there is no doubt. Who is more truthful in his word than Allâh?

88.Munir Mezyed: Why should you be divided into two different groups concerning the Hypocrites? Allâh has cast them back to disbelief as a consequence of what they have gained. Do you seek to guide the one whom Allâh has caused to go astray? He whom Allâh has caused to go astray, you will never ever find a way to guide him.

89.Munir Mezyed: They wish you would renounce your faith as they have renounced theirs, then you become equal. Therefore, choose not friends (or allies) from them till they emigrate for (serving) the cause of Allâh. However, if they turn against you, seize them, slay them wherever you encounter them (in battle), and take neither friend nor helper from among them.

90.Munir Mezyed: Except for those who are allies of a people you are bound with in a peace treaty, or those who come to you with no desire to fight against you, or their own people. Had Allâh willed, He would have empowered them to fight you. So, if they hold aloof from you, refrain from fighting against you, and come out for peace, then  Allâh gives you no reason to fight against them.

91.Munir Mezyed: You will find others who desire to have security from you, and security from their people. Whenever the temptation of disbelief arises, they plunge into it. If they keep not aloof from you, nor do they come out for peace, nor do they hold their hands, then seize them and slay them wherever you encounter them (in battlefield).  Against these people, We have given you full authority over them.

92.Munir Mezyed: It is not for a monotheistic believer to kill a monotheistic believer , unless it is an accident.  Whoever kills a monotheistic believer by accident should set free a monotheistic slave, and pay restitution (blood-money) to the family of the murder victim unless they remit it as alms. However, if he (-the victim-) belongs to a people at war with you and he is a monotheistic believer, then (the murderer) must free a monotheistic slave. If he belongs to people with whom you have a peace treaty, then (the murderer) must pay the restitution (blood-money) to the family of the murder victim, and set free a monotheistic slave.
