If then (the murderer) is unable to find a slave to free, then he will atone by fasting two consecutive months in order to seek repentance from Allâh. Allâh is Ever All-Knowing, All-Wise.

93.Munir Mezyed: Whoever kills a monotheistic believer intentionally, his retribution is Hellfire where he abide therein. The wrath of Allâh abides upon him. He has cursed him and prepared for him a vehement chastisement.

94.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, When you go forth to fight for ( serving) the cause of Allâh, investigate properly before you start fighting and say not unto the one who initiates the greeting of salaam (Islamic greeting that means ‘Peace’): “You are not a monotheist", seeking the spoils of this ‘worldly life’. But with Allâh there are infinite spoils. You too were such before, then Allâh bestowed His favors upon you. Thus, investigate properly. Indeed, Allâh is Ever Well-Aware of all what you do.

95.Munir Mezyed: Not equal are those among the ‘Monotheistic Believers’ who stay home except for those who are handicapped, and those who struggle hard and fight (bravely) for (serving) the cause of Allâh with their wealth and with their lives. Allâh has preferred in grades those who struggle hard and fight (bravely) with their wealth and with their lives above the ones who stay home. To each, Allâh has promised good reward ('Al-Jannah'), but Allâh has preferred those who struggle hard and fight (bravely) for His cause above those who stay home by much greater reward.

96.Munir Mezyed: Degrees of rank come from Him, and forgiveness and clemency. Allâh is Ever Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

97.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those whom the ‘Angels’ take their souls while they are dealing unjustly with themselves, (the ‘Angels’) ask them: “What were you after?” They reply: "We were weak and oppressed on earth." The ‘Angels’ ask: “Was not the earth of Allâh vast enough for you to emigrate therein?" The abode of these people is Hellfire - What a dreadful definitive course!

98.Munir Mezyed: Except those who are really weak and oppressed among men, women and children, who lack strength and courage to change their lives, or to find a way to emigrate.

99.Munir Mezyed: For these, there is a hope that Allâh will pardon them. Allâh is Ever Oft Pardoning, Oft-Forgiving.

100.Munir Mezyed: Whoever emigrates for (serving) the cause of Allâh will find many dwelling places and abundant resources on the earth. Whoever leaves his home as an emigrant to Allâh and His Messenger, then death overtakes him- his reward has already been secured with Allâh.  Allâh is Ever Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

101.Munir Mezyed: When you travel in the land, you would not be at fault  if you shortened the Prayer, fearing that those who lack Faith ( in Allâh)  may attack you. Indeed, they are a manifest foe to you.

102.Munir Mezyed: When you, (O’ Muhammad), are among them, and you call them for Prayer, ask only a party of them to stand with you to Prayer, and let them carry their arms. Then when they have performed their prostration, let them take their positions in the rear and then ask another party who has not yet prayed to come forward and pray with you, letting them take their precaution and their arms. Those who indulge excessively in disbelief (in Allâh) would love to see you neglecting your arms and your luggage so that they may launch a surprise attack against you. - You would not be at fault if you laid down your arms due to injuries caused by heavy rain, or due to illness. But you should always take your precautions. Indeed, Allâh has prepared for those who lack Faith (in Allâh) a disgraceful punishment.

103.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, when you complete your Prayer, celebrate the praises of Allâh and declare His indefinite glory, while standing or sitting or lying down on your sides. When you are safe, then establish the regular Prayer. Indeed, Prayer is enjoined on the ‘Monotheistic Believers’ at specific times.

104.Munir Mezyed: Slacken not in pursuing the enemy. If you are suffering , they are suffering too, even as you are suffering. But you expect a reward from Allâh while they expect nothing. Allâh is Ever All-Knowing, All-Wise.

105.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We have sent down to you, (O’ Muhammad), the ‘Book’ in truth so that you may judge among the people in accordance with what Allâh has shown you. Thus, refute strongly the (argument of ) the traitors.

106.Munir Mezyed: Seek the Forgiveness of Allâh! Indeed, Allâh is Ever Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

107.Munir Mezyed: Argue not on behalf of those who act unfaithfully towards their own selves Indeed, Allâh demonstrates not his own love for the treacherous and sinful one.

108.Munir Mezyed: They may be able to hide their evil deeds from you, but they can never hide them from Allâh. He is with them by His Knowledge when they harbor at night ideas, which He disapproves. Allâh ever encompasses what they do.

109.Munir Mezyed: Ah! You are of those who may argue on their behalf in this ‘worldly life’. But  who will argue with Allâh on their behalf on the ‘Day of Resurrection’? Who is going to supports their cause?

110.Munir Mezyed: Whoever commits evil deeds and wrongs himself and then implores Allâh for forgiveness will find Allâh Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

111.Munir Mezyed: Whoever commits a sin commits it only against himself. Allâh is Ever All-Knowing, All-Wise.

112.Munir Mezyed: Whoever commits a sin or iniquity and then he throws it on to someone innocent has indeed burdened himself with calumny and a flagrant sin.

113.Munir Mezyed: Had it not been for the grace of Allâh and His clemency upon you , a party of them would certainly have made a decision to deceive you. However, they cannot deceive any one but themselves, nor can they do any harm to you. Allâh has sent down to you the ‘Book’,( the 'Qur’ān'), given you wisdom and taught you that which you knew not. Ever great is the grace of Allâh to you.

114.Munir Mezyed: There is no good in most of their private consultations except in him who enjoins almsgiving or kindness or reconciliation between people. Whoever does this, seeking the good pleasure of Allâh, We will give him a mighty reward.

115.Munir Mezyed: Whoever opposes the ‘Messenger’ after the spiritual insight has been manifested to him, and follows others than the way of the ‘Monotheistic Believers’, We will let him pursue the way he is pursuing. Thus, we will cast him into the ‘Gehenna’ - what a dreadful shelter!

116.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, Allâh forgives not that partners should be set up with him. Therefore. He forgives all besides that to whom He wills. Whoever sets up a partner with Allâh has strayed far away indeed.

117.Munir Mezyed: The ‘Polytheists’ implore and pray to nothing but female deities besides Him (Allâh). Actually, they implore and pray to nothing but a rebellious devil.

118.Munir Mezyed: Allâh has cursed him. ‘Satan’ said: “Indeed, I will recruit a definite share of Your worshipers.

119.Munir Mezyed: I will definitely lead them astray and stir up vain desires in them. I will definitely order them to slit the ears of cattle; and I will order them to change the true nature that was created by Allâh." Whoever takes the devil to be his lord has certainly incurred a great loss upon himself.

120.Munir Mezyed: ‘Satan’ only makes them (false) promises and stirs up vain desires in them. However, the promises of ‘Satan’ are nothing but deception.

121.Munir Mezyed: For these people, their abode will be Gehenna. They will not be able to find a way to escape from it.

122.Munir Mezyed: Those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, and do righteous acts (in this ‘worldly life’), We will admit them into gardens with rivers flowing beneath. They will abide therein. Such is the truthful promise of Allâh. Who is more truthful in word than Allâh?

123.Munir Mezyed: Entering ‘Al-Jannah’ will not be in accordance with your vain desires, nor the vain desires of the people of the ‘Scripture’ ( the ‘Jews’ & the ‘Christians’). Whoever does an evil work will be requited for it and will not find for himself besides Allâh a guardian or a benefactor.

124.Munir Mezyed: Any monotheistic believer, male or female, who does righteous acts, will enter ‘Al- Jannah’, and will not be wronged, not even as much as a hair on a date-seed.

125.Munir Mezyed: Who is better in Faith than the one who submits (himself entirely to the authority of) Allâh, seeks to do good and follows the creed of ‘Abraham’, the  (Genuine) Monotheistic Faith? Allâh chose ‘Abraham’ as a close friend.

126.Munir Mezyed: Unto Allâh, belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is on the earth. Allâh is Ever Encompassing all things.

127.Munir Mezyed: They seek your legal advice about the rights of women. Say: “Allâh instructs you about their rights, and that which is recited to you in the ‘Book’, concerning the rights of the orphan girls whom you give not what is prescribed for them and yet whom you desire to marry, and concerning the weak among children, and that you ought to deal justly with orphans. Consequently, whatever good thing you do, (be sure) Allâh is Ever All-Aware of it.”

128.Munir Mezyed: When a wife fears cruelty or desertion on the part of her husband. They would not be at fault if they put forward the terms for peace between them. Reconciliation is better although greed is part of human nature! If you seek to do good and act piously, (then you will fine) Allâh is indeed Ever Well-Acquainted with all what you do.

129.Munir Mezyed: You will never ever be able to deal fairly with more than one wife, no matter how hard you strive. Therefore, be not inclined completely to one while leaving the other one hanging in midair. However, If you amend your ways and act piously, (then be sure that ) Allâh is indeed  Ever Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

130.Munir Mezyed: If they split up, Allâh will give the means of subsistence to each one of them from His capacity. Allâh is Ever All-Sufficient, All-Wise.

131.Munir Mezyed: Unto Allâh, belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is on the earth. Indeed, We had recommended the ‘People of the Scripture’ before you to act piously towards Allâh. Thus, we recommend you, (O’ Muslims), the same thing. However, if you are inclined to disbelief in Allâh, (then you’ll need to know that) whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is on the earth does belong to Allâh, and that Allâh is Self-sufficient, Worthy of all praise.

132.Munir Mezyed: Unto Allâh, belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is on the earth. Allâh is All-Sufficient as a Trustee.

133.Munir Mezyed: If He wills, He can easily terminate you, O’ people, and can easily bring others instead of you. Lo! Allâh is Ever All-Potent over that.

134.Munir Mezyed: Whoever desires the reward of ‘this worldly life’, (let him know that) Allâh possesses the reward of this ‘worldly life’ and the ‘Hereafter’. Allâh is Ever All-Hearer, All-Seer.

135.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, be strict in maintaining justice, and be witnesses for Allâh even though it might be against your own selves, or your parents, or your relatives, whether the one under suspicion is rich or poor. Allâh must be given priority over them. Therefore, follow not your fixations so that you may be able to act equitably. If you hide the truth or evade it, then (you’ll need to know that) Allâh is Ever Well-Acquainted with all what you do.

136.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, place your trust in Allâh, and in His ‘Messenger’, in the ‘Book’ (the Qur'an) which He has sent down to His ‘Messenger’ and the ‘Scripture’ which He sent down to those before him. Therefore, whoever disbelieves in Allâh, in His ‘Angels’, in His ‘Books’, in His ‘Messengers’ and in the ‘Last Day’, has strayed far away indeed.

137.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who adhere to Islamic monotheism, then renounce their faith and then again believe, then renounce their faith, and then increase in disbelief- Allâh will never forgive them, nor will He guide them into the right way.

138.Munir Mezyed: Let the ‘Hypocrites’ know that they will be subjected to a painful punishment. in the ‘Hereafter’.

139.Munir Mezyed: They take those who lack Faith (in Allâh) as allies or friends instead of the ‘Monotheistic Believers’. Is it glory they seek among them? Indeed, All Glory belongs only unto Allâh.

140.Munir Mezyed: It has already been revealed unto you in the ‘Book’, (the 'Qur’ān'), that when you hear the (Holy) ‘Verses’ of Allâh being denied and mocked at, then do not sit with them, till they engage in some other discussion. Otherwise, you will be like them. Indeed, Allâh will gather together the ‘Hypocrites’ and the impious all in ‘Gehenna’.

141.Munir Mezyed: Those ‘Hypocrites’ who wait and watch you closely- if it happens that you obtained victory from Allâh- would say: "Were we not with you." But if those who lack Faith ( in Allâh) gained a success, they would say: “Did we not prevail over you, and protect you from the ‘Monotheistic Believers’?" Therefore, Allâh will judge between you on the ‘Day of Resurrection’. Allâh will never grant to those who lack faith (in Allâh) a way to prevail over the  ‘Monotheistic Believers’.

142.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, the ‘Hypocrites’ think that they can beguile Allâh, but it is He Who will render them for their attempt. When they stand up for Prayer, they stand up lazily. They do it only to be seen by men and celebrate not the praises of Allâh but a little.

143.Munir Mezyed: They are swaying in between, (belonging) neither to these nor to those. He whom Allâh causes to go astray- you will never find a way to guide him.

144.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, take not those who lack faith (in Allâh) as allies instead of the ‘Monotheistic Believers’. Do you want to give Allâh a manifest proof against you?

145.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, the ‘Hypocrites’ will be in the lowest depths of the Fire, and you will find no helper for them,

146.Munir Mezyed: Except who repent, amend their ways, hold fast ( to the cord) of  Allâh , and perform their duties towards Allâh faithfully, then they will be with the ‘Monotheistic Believers’. Allâh will grant to ‘Monotheistic Believers’ a great reward.

147.Munir Mezyed: Why would Allâh chastise you if you have faith (in Him), and express your gratitude (to Him for His endless Blessings)? Allâh is Ever All-Appreciative, All-Knowing.

148.Munir Mezyed: Allâh demonstrates not his own love for public utterance of anything evil, except by one who has been wronged. Allâh is Ever All-Hearer, All-Knowing.

149.Munir Mezyed: If you do righteous good deeds openly or keep it secret, and forgive others for their faults, (then you’ll need to know that) Allâh is Ever Oft-Pardoning, All-Powerful.

150.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who disbelieve in Allâh and His ‘Messengers’ and wish to make distinction between Allâh and His ‘Messengers’, and say: "We believe in some and disbelieve in others,” and seek to find a way in between-

151.Munir Mezyed: Those in truth are the ones who lack Faith ( in Allâh). We have prepared for them an extremely disgraceful punishment.

152.Munir Mezyed: Those who believe in Allâh and His ‘Messengers’ and make no distinction between any of them, (let them be sure that) Allâh will pay them their reward in full. Allâh is Ever Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

153.Munir Mezyed: The ‘People of the Scripture’, (the ‘Jews’ & the ‘Christians’), ask you to bring down a book upon them from the heavens. Indeed, they asked ‘Moses’ for even greater than that. They said: “Show us Allâh in person". Thus, a thunderbolt seized them in consequence of their wrongdoing. Then they took up the calf (for worship) after the full knowledge of the Truth had come to them. Yet, We pardoned all this; and We gave ‘Moses’ an apparent authority.

154.Munir Mezyed: We raised over them the ‘Mount (Sinai)’ at their covenant. We said unto them: “Enter prostrating at the gate." We said unto them: “Do not violate the ‘Sabbath’.” We took from them a solemn covenant.

155.Munir Mezyed: However, (the wrath of Allâh abides upon them) because of their breaking the covenant, of their disbelief in the (Holy) ‘Verses of Allâh’, of killing the ‘Prophets’ unjustly and of saying: “Our hearts are enveloped in ignorance." Nay, Allâh has sealed their hearts because of their disbelief and so they are not willing to profess a belief (in the Unity& Oneness of Allâh) but a few of them.

156.Munir Mezyed: (The wrath of Allâh abides in them) for their refusal to admit the Truth of the Oneness of  Allâh, and for the hideous calumny which they utter against ‘Mary’,

157.Munir Mezyed: And of their saying (in boast): "Verily, we have slain the ‘Messiah’,’ Jesus the son of Mary’, an Apostle of Allâh.” Yet they slew him not, nor crucified him, but they had only his likeness. Indeed, those who differ about this case are in sate of doubt concerning it. They have no certain knowledge thereof, but only their assumptions. They killed him not for sure.

158.Munir Mezyed: Nay, Allâh has raised him to Himself. Allâh is Ever All-Powerful, All-Wise.

159.Munir Mezyed: There is none of the ‘People of the Scripture’, but he will definitely believe in him (-’Christ’-) before his death. And on the ‘Day of Resurrection’, he, (-’Jesus  Christ’-) will be a witness against them.

160.Munir Mezyed: And for the iniquity of the ‘Jews’, We have forbidden them (to eat) certain foods, which had been formally lawful to them, and their deterring many people from the path of Allâh,

161.Munir Mezyed: And for their taking usury which was prohibited for them, and for their devouring the property of people wrongfully. Thus, We have prepared for those who lack Faith ( in Allâh) among them a painful punishment.

162.Munir Mezyed: But those among them who are firmly and deeply planted in the spiritual knowledge and enlightenment, and the ‘Monotheistic Believers’ who believe in what has been sent down unto you (Muhammad) and that which was sent before you, and those who establish the regular Prayer and pay Zakāt (i.e. the Prescribed Purifying Alms), and those who profess a belief (in the Unity& Oneness of ) Allâh and in the ‘Last Day’; such are the ones to whom We shall give a great reward.

163.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We have inspired you, (O’ Muhammad), as We inspired ‘Noah’ and the ‘Prophets’ after him, as We inspired also ‘Abraham’, ‘Ishmael’, ‘Isaac’, ‘Jacob’, the ‘Descendants’, ‘Jesus’, ‘Job’, ‘Jonah’, ‘Aaron’, and ‘Solomon’. To ‘David’, We gave the ‘Psalms’.

164.Munir Mezyed: We inspired the ‘Messengers’ whom We have mentioned to you before and also other ‘Messengers’ whom We have not mentioned to you. Allâh spoke to ‘Moses’ directly.

165.Munir Mezyed: (We sent all these) ‘Messengers’ as heralds of glad tidings and as warners, so that people will not have any argument of excuse before Allâh, after the ‘Messengers’ had been sent to them.  Allâh is Ever All-Powerful, All-Wise.

166.Munir Mezyed: However, Allâh testifies that whatever He has sent down to you, He has sent it down with His Knowledge, and the ‘Angels’ also testify to it. Sufficient is Allâh as a Witness.

167.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who indulge excessively in disbelief (in Allâh) and deter the people from the path of Allâh have strayed far astray.

168.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who indulge excessively in disbelief (in Allâh) and act unfairly , Allâh will not forgive them, nor will He guide them to any path,

169.Munir Mezyed: But to the path of Hell where they will abide therein. And this is too easy for Allâh to do so.

170.Munir Mezyed: O’ mankind, the ‘Messenger’ has indeed come to you with Truth from your Lord. Therefore, it is for your own benefit to believe in him. But If you disbelieve, (then you’ll  need know that) unto Allâh, does belong all that is in the heavens and on the earth. Allâh is Ever All-Knowing, All-Wise.

171.Munir Mezyed: O’ ‘People of the Scripture’, do not exceed the limits in your faith, or utter aught concerning Allâh except the truth. The ‘Messiah’, ‘Jesus son of Mary’, was only a ‘Messenger’ of Allâh, His word which He sent to ‘Mary’ and a spirit from Him. Therefore, believe in Allâh and His ‘Messengers’, and do not say: “Three" (i..e Trinity in Christian doctrine). It is better for you to refrain (from believing in the Trinity). Indeed, Allâh is but one God. Exalted is He above having a son. Unto Him, belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Allâh is All-Sufficient as a Trustee.

172.Munir Mezyed: The ‘Messiah’ (himself) would never disdain to be a servant of Allâh, nor would the ‘Angels’ who are near to Him. Whoever disdains the worship of Allâh and display an arrogant attitude (towards Allâh"s authority). Allâh will gather them all together to Himself,

173.Munir Mezyed: Then, as for those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, and do righteous acts ( in this ‘worldly life’) , He will pay them their rewards in full and give them more out of His bounty. As for those who disdain and display an arrogant attitude (towards Allâh"s authority), He will chastise them with a painful punishment. Thus, they will not find for themselves besides Allâh any guardian or helper.

174.Munir Mezyed: O’ mankind! Indeed, the full knowledge of the Truth has come to you from your Lord.  And We have sent down to you a brilliant light, (this 'Qur’ān').

175.Munir Mezyed: Then as for those who believe in Allâh and hold fast to Him, He will admit them into a mercy and grace from Him, and will guide them into Himself on a right path.

176.Munir Mezyed: They seek your legal advice. Say: “Allâh instructs you about the dead one who has neither parents nor children. If a man dies, leaving a sister, but no child, she will have half the inheritance. If she dies first, then he will inherit her, if she left no children. If there are two sisters, they will have two-thirds of the inheritance. If the siblings are men and women, the male will get twice the share of the female." Allâh makes things clear unto you, lest you go astray. Allâh is the All-Knowing of everything.

1.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, fulfill your covenants. Livestock animals are made lawful to you as food, except for that which is recited to you (in this Glorious 'Qur’ān'). Hunting is not lawful for you during ‘Pilgrimage’ or 'Umrah’. Indeed, Allâh ordains whatever He chooses.

2.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, do not violate the sanctity of rituals of Allâh, or the ‘Sacred Month’, or the offerings, or the garlanded, or those repairing to the ‘Sacred House’ seeking the grace and pleasure of their Lord. When you are free from the duties of ‘Pilgrimage’, then you can go for hunting. Do not let your hatred of a folk- because they hindered you from entering into the ‘Sacred Mosque’ - lead you to commit aggression. Thus, cooperate with each other on righteousness and piety and collaborate not with each other on iniquity and transgression. Indeed, Allâh is extremely severe in punishment.

3.Munir Mezyed: Forbidden to you for food are carrion, blood, the flesh of swine, the meat of animal of that which has been offered a sacrifice to other than Allâh (or on which the name of Allâh has not been mentioned while slaughtering), or that which is strangled to death, or that which is beaten to death, or that which has a fatal fall, or that which is gored by horns, or that from which the wild animal has eaten, except for what you are able to slaughter it before dying, or that which is sacrificed on stone altars. It is forbidden also to use arrows seeking luck or decision as this is grave disobedience. This day, those who indulge excessively in disbelief (in Allâh) have given up all hope of your faith. Therefore, fear them not, but show honor and reverence for Me.  This day, I have perfected your religion for you, completed My Favor upon you; and I have chosen for you Islam as a religion. Consequently, whoever is forced by severe hunger with no intention of sinning, then (he must know that) Allâh is absolutely Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

4.Munir Mezyed: They ask you, (O’ Muhammad), what is made lawful for them as food? Say (unto them), "It is made lawful for you to eat wholesome good food, and that which you have trained the birds and beasts of prey to catch. You train them according to what Allâh has taught you, so eat from that which they catch for you, pronounce the name of Allâh over it and act piously toward Allâh. Indeed, Allâh is extremely swift in reckoning."

5.Munir Mezyed: This day all wholesome good things are made lawful for you. The food of those who have obtained the ‘Scripture’ (Jews & Christians) is made lawful for you, and your food is made lawful for them. It is made lawful for you (to wed) the chaste women from the ‘Monotheistic Believers’ and chaste women from those who have obtained the Scripture (the ‘Jews’ & the ‘Christians’) revealed before your time. Thus, (You can wed them) when you give them their due dowers in case you desire chastity, not seeking to commit lewdness or secret intrigues. Whosoever renounces his faith ; his deeds are worthless, and he will be among those who are doomed externally to perish in the ‘Hereafter’.

6.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, when you intend to perform Prayers, wash your faces, your forearms to the elbows, lightly rub your heads, and do wash  your feet to the ankles. If it happens that you are in a state of ceremonial impurity, then you must wash your whole body. But if you are ill, or on a journey, or one of you comes from the privy, or you have been in contact with women, and you find no water, then seek wholesome dust and wipe your faces and your hands with it. Allâh does not intend to let you experience hardship, but He intends to purify you, and to complete His Favor upon you so that you may express your gratitude (to Him for His endless blessings).

7.Munir Mezyed: Remember the favor of Allâh upon you and the covenant with which He bound you when you said: "We hear and comply (with everything Allâh has commanded)." Subsequently, act piously towards Allâh. Indeed, Allâh is All-knowing of that within the hearts.

8.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, be persistently standing firm for Allâh , witnesses in justice, and let not the hatred of a people prevent you from being fair. Act fairly and proportionately, that is nearer to unfeigned piety. Subsequently, act piously toward Allâh. Indeed, Allâh is Completely Aware of what you do.

9.Munir Mezyed: Allâh has promised those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism and do righteous acts ( in ‘this worldly life’) that they will have forgiveness and a great reward (i.e. ‘Al-Jannah’).

10.Munir Mezyed: But those who indulge excessively in disbelief (in Allâh)., and refuse to give credence to Our ‘Revelations’ will be the ‘Denizens of the Gehenna’.

11.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, remember the favor of Allâh to you when some people determined to stretch out their hands against you, He restrained their hands from you. Subsequently, let the ‘Monotheistic Believers’ depend on Allâh with full trust.

12.Munir Mezyed: Verily, Allâh took the covenant from the ‘Children of Israel’, and We raised up among them twelve leaders. Allâh said: "I am with you if it happens that you establish the regular Prayer, pay Zakāt (i.e. the prescribed purifying alms) and believe in My ‘Messengers’ while honoring and assisting them, and giving Allâh a good loan, I would definitely deliver you from all the consequences of your sins, and admit you into Gardens underneath which rivers flow. But whoever among you becomes impious after this, he has definitely gone astray from the virtuous path."

13.Munir Mezyed: As a result of their breach of their covenant, We cursed them, and caused their hearts to grow hard. They alter the words from their genuine context and fail to look after a portion of that whereof they were admonished. You will always continue to witness a deceptive action from their part except that of a few. Thus, forgive and show clemency toward them. Indeed, Allâh demonstrates his own love for those who  attain perfection in Righteousness/or in Faith.

14.Munir Mezyed: Likewise, We also took a covenant from those who call themselves ‘Christians’, but they too have failed to look after a portion of that whereof they were admonished. For that reason, We stirred among them enmity and hatred, which will continue to exist up until the ‘Day of Resurrection’. Lo! Allâh will soon inform them of what they used to do.

15.Munir Mezyed: O’ ‘People of the Scripture’, (Jews & Christians), indeed Our ‘Messenger’ has come to you to clarify for you much of what you used to conceal from the ‘Scripture’ and to pass over much which is no longer substantial. Verily, there has come to you from Allâh Light, (& enlightenment), and the most remarkable ‘Book’, (this Glorious 'Qur’ān').

16.Munir Mezyed: Wherewith Allâh guides (into all the truth) all those who pursue His good pleasure to paths of peace, brings them out of darkness into light by His decree, and guides them into a straight path.

17.Munir Mezyed: Verily those who say, “Allâh is indeed the ‘Messiah’, ‘son of Mary’.” have  abandoned their (unfeigned) Faith. Say, (O’ Muhammad unto them): "Who possesses the power to prevent Allâh if He intends to cause the ‘Messiah’, ‘son of Mary’, to perish, as well as his mother, and all those who are on the earth together?" Unto Allâh, belongs the (absolute) sovereignty of the heavens, the earth and all that is between them. He creates whatever He wills. Allâh is capable of doing  whatever He wills.

18.Munir Mezyed: Both  the ‘Jews’ and the ‘Christians’ say: "We are the children of Allâh and His loved ones." Say: “Why, then, does He chastise you for your sinful and immoral acts?” Nay, you are not more than human beings among those whom He has created. He forgives and shows clemency on whom He wills, and chastises whom He wills. Unto Allâh, belongs the (absolute) sovereignty of the heavens, the earth and all that is between them. And unto Him is the definitive course.

19.Munir Mezyed: O’ ;People of the Scripture’, indeed Our ‘Messenger’ has come to you to clarify for you (some religious matters) after a cessation of the ‘Apostles’ lest you say: “There has not come to us neither any herald (to brings  glad tidings of how to attain eternal salvation), nor a warner (to give sufficient warning about how to avoid Hellfire). Indeed, there has come to  you a herald and a warner. Allâh is capable of doing whatever He wills.

20.Munir Mezyed: (Mention) when ‘Moses’ said unto his people: "O’ my people, remember the favor of Allâh upon you when He raised ‘Prophets’ among you , made you kings, and gave you what He had not given anyone among the worlds.

21.Munir Mezyed: O’ my people, enter the ‘Holy Land’ which Allâh has appointed to you. Turn not in flight, lest you turn back as losers.”

22.Munir Mezyed: They said: "O’ ‘Moses’, it is indeed inhabited by people of great might and power, and we will not dare to make entry unless they depart from it. If it happens that they depart from it, then we will definitely make entry.”

23.Munir Mezyed: Then two men of those who show honor and reverence for Allâh , and on whom Allâh bestowed His favor, said: “Enter in upon them by the gate, for when you have entered it, you will definitely be victorious. Therefore, depend on Allâh with full trust if you are inclined to profess a belief (in Allâh).”

24.Munir Mezyed: They said: "O’ ‘Moses’, we shall never enter it as long as they are there. Thus, go, you and your Lord, and fight. We are definitely going to sit here."

25.Munir Mezyed: ‘Moses’ said: “O’ my Lord, I have no authority over anyone, except over my brother and myself, so separate us from the sons of disobedience.”

26.Munir Mezyed: The Lord said, "Indeed, the land will certainly be forbidden them for forty years, (during which) they will wander in the earth perplexed. So grieve not over the sons of disobedience.

27.Munir Mezyed: (O’ Muhammad) recite to them  ( the ‘Jews’ & the ‘Christians’) the incident of the two sons of ‘Adam’ (‘Cain’ and ‘Abel’) when  they both offered an offering, and it was accepted from one of them and was not accepted from the other. He said: “Indeed, I am going to kill you." (The other) said: "Allâh accepts only from those who are ‘Pious’(who show honor and reverence for Allâh).

28.Munir Mezyed: But if it happens that you stretched out your hand against me so as to kill me, I will not stretch out my hand against you so as to kill you. Indeed, I show honor and reverence for the Lord of all the worlds.”

29.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, I intend to let you bear the burden of my sins as well as yours, so you will be among the ‘Denizens of Hell’. This is (the divine) chastisement for the ones who keep on falling into sin.

30.Munir Mezyed: His ego induced him to kill his own brother. Subsequently, he killed him and became of those who are doomed to eternal perdition.

31.Munir Mezyed: Then Allâh sent a raven, which scratched the earth in order to show him how to bury the naked corpse of his brother. He says: "O’ woe is me! Am I unable to be like this raven, that I may bury the naked corpse of my brother? Thus, he became of those who express sincere regret.”

32.Munir Mezyed: For that reason, We prescribed for the ‘Children of Israel’ that whoever kills a human being, unless it is in punishment for murder or for spreading corruption in the earth, it will be as if he killed all mankind. In the meantime, whoever saves a life; it will be as if he saved the whole of mankind. Verily, Our ‘Messengers’ came to them with full knowledge of the Truth, even then after that many of them became prodigals on the earth.

33.Munir Mezyed: The rightful chastisement of those who wage war against (the religion of)  Allâh and His ‘Messenger’, and endeavor to spread corruption on the earth, is that they should be murdered, or crucified, or their hands and feet should be cut off on opposite sides, or be expelled from the land. This will be their ignominy in this ‘worldly life’, and in the ‘Hereafter’, they will subjected to an extremely dreadful doom,

34.Munir Mezyed: Except for those who express sincere regret before they fall into your power. In that case, you must know that Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

35.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, act piously towards Allâh , seek to come closer to Him, and strive hard in His cause, so that you my ultimately achieve a blissful life/or gain eternal salvation.

36.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who persist in disbelief (in Allâh) - if they had all that is on the earth, and twice as much again and offered it to ransom their own selves from the (divine) penalty of the ‘Day of Resurrection’, it would not be accepted from them. Theirs will be an extremely painful doom.

37.Munir Mezyed: They will have a strong wish to get out of the Inferno but they will never ever get out from there, and theirs will be a permanent doom.

38.Munir Mezyed: The thief, male or female, who persists in stealing, cut off (from the wrist joint) the (right) hand as a retribution for what they have gained, an exemplary punishment from Allâh. He is All-Vigorous, All-Wise.

39.Munir Mezyed: But whosoever expresses sincere regret after his wrongdoing and strives to amend his ways, then (he must know that) Allâh will forgive and show clemency towards him. Indeed, Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

40.Munir Mezyed: Are you unaware that unto Allâh belongs the (absolute) sovereignty of the heavens and of the earth? He forgives and shows clemency on whom He wills, and chastises whom He wills. Allâh is capable of doing whatever He wills.

41.Munir Mezyed: O’ ‘Messenger’, let not those who blindly hasten towards disbelief ( in Allâh) distress you, of such as say with their mouths: "We profess a belief (in the Unity & Oneness of Allâh)," but their hearts have not attained to Faith.  Of the ‘Jews’ who listen to mendacity, listening to other folk, who have not come to you, altering the words from their genuine context, saying: "If you are given this, then you must take it, but if you are not given this, then you must beware!" Whosoever Allâh intends to lead him into temptation, you will never have (the power to save) him against the (wrath) of Allâh. Those are the ones whose hearts Allâh intends not to purify. For them is ignominy in this ‘worldly life’, and for them an extremely dreadful doom in the ‘Hereafter’.

42.Munir Mezyed: They show a keen interest in listening to mendacity and in devouring whatever is forbidden. So, if it happens that they come to you, (O’ Muhammad), then you can judge between them or you can turn away from them. However, if you decided to turn away from them, then they could never harm you at all. Subsequently, if you (decided to) judge, then judge with justice between them. Indeed, Allâh demonstrates his own love for those who treat people fairly and consistently.

43.Munir Mezyed: How could it be possible to ask you to judge between them while they have the ‘Torah’ in which is the judgment of Allâh? Yet they turn back after that. These are the ones who are tempted to disbelieve ( in Allâh).

44.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We sent down the ‘Torah’ (unto ‘Moses’) in which was spiritual insight and light. The ‘Prophets’, who submitted (themselves completely to the authority Allâh), used to judge by it for the ‘Jews’. So did the Pious Preachers and Rabbis as they were required to preserve the ‘Scripture’ of Allâh; and they were witnesses thereto. Therefore, let not the fear of people overtake you, but beware of My wrath and exchange not My ‘Revelations’ for a small price.  Whoever judges not according to what Allâh has revealed, they are (indeed) the Faithless people.

45.Munir Mezyed: We ordained therein for them: Life for life, eye for eye, nose for nose, ear for ear, tooth for tooth, and for wounds retribution. But whoever remits the retribution as alms, it will be considered as atonement for him. Whoever judges not according to what Allâh has revealed, they are (indeed) the iniquitous.

46.Munir Mezyed: We also caused ‘Jesus son of Mary’, to follow in the footsteps of those earlier ‘Prophets’, authenticating (the divine law) of the ‘Torah’ which was sent down before him. And we gave him the ‘Gospel’ containing divine insight and light, authenticating also (the divine law) of the ‘Torah’ which was given before it as a source of spiritual insight and admonition for the ‘Pious’(or to those who show reverence & obedience Allâh/ or to those who guard themselves against falling into temptation or sin).

47.Munir Mezyed: Let, then, the people of the ‘Gospel’, judge according to what Allâh has revealed therein. Whoever judges not according to what Allâh has revealed, they are the sons of disobedience.

48.Munir Mezyed: We have also sent down unto you (O’ Muhammad) the ‘Book’, (this Glorious   'Qur’ān') with truth, authenticating the ‘Scripture’ that came before it, and preserving the same safe from corruption. Thus, judge between them according to what Allâh has revealed, and take not in their self-deceived beliefs for the epistemic  by swerving from the knowledge of truth that has come to you. To every one of you, We have prescribed a (divine) law, and a particular method. Had Allâh willed, He could have made you one community, but (His divine wisdom is) to try you in what He has given you respectively. Therefore, compete eagerly with each other in virtuous deeds, as you are all bound to return unto Allâh. Eventually, He will inform you of that in which you used to differ.

49.Munir Mezyed: Thus, judge between them according to what Allâh has revealed, and take not in their self-deceived beliefs for the epistemic, but beware of them, lest they tempt you to swerve you from some of that which Allâh has revealed unto you. If they are tempted to turn away, ( then be sure) Allâh intends to chastise them for some of their sins. Indeed, most of the people are sons of disobedience..

50.Munir Mezyed: What! Do they endeavor to maintain the judgment of the time of ignorance? But who is better than Allâh in judgment for a people who have have a definite faith.?

51.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, take not the ‘Jews’, or the ‘Christians’ as allies. They are but allies of one another. However, whoever among you takes them as allies has become one of them. Indeed, Allâh will not illuminate the path of those who deliberately keep on sinning.

52.Munir Mezyed: Yet you can see those in whose hearts there is an infirmity hastening towards them, saying: “We fear lest a turn of fortune would impinge us." But perhaps Allâh will bring conquest or a command from Him, so they will express sincere regret about that which they stored secretly in their hearts.

53.Munir Mezyed: Those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism will say: “Are these the ones who swore by Allâh with their strongest oaths that they were with you?" Their works have become null and void, and they have become among those who are doomed to eternal perdition.

54.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, whoever of you apostatizes from his faith, then (he must know that) Allâh will bring other people whom He will love, and who will love Him; who will be humble towards the ‘Monotheistic Believers’, but stern towards those who do lack faith (in Allâh). They will strive hard for (serving) the cause of Allâh, and will not fear the fury and vitriol of the reproacher.  This is the bounty of Allâh which He bestows on whom He wills. Allâh is All-Encompassing, All-Knowing.

55.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, your guardian is Allâh, and also His ‘Messenger’, and the ‘Monotheistic Believers’ who establish the regular Prayer, pay Zakāt (i.e. the prescribed purifying alms), and bow down to worship.

56.Munir Mezyed: Whoever chooses Allâh, and His messenger, and  the Monotheistic Believers to be his guardians, (needs to know that) the party of Allâh will certainly be the triumphant.

57.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, do not take the ones who take your religion in ridicule and fun from among those to whom the ‘Scriptures’ were delivered before you, nor those who do lack Faith ( in Allâh) (as friends or allies), and act piously towards Allâh if you are (really) ‘Monotheistic Believers’ ( of unfeigned faith).

58.Munir Mezyed: When the call is proclaimed to Prayer, they take it in ridicule and fun. That is because they are a people who possess no self- awareness that allows them to understand.

59.Munir Mezyed: Say: "O’ ‘People of the Scripture’, (Jews & Christians), do you denounce and revile us for any other reason than because we profess a belief (in the Unity & the Oneness of) Allâh, and in the ‘Revelation’ which has been sent down to us and in that which has been sent down before us, and that most of you walk in the path of  disobedience?

60.Munir Mezyed: (O’ Muhammad), say: "Shall I inform you of something worse than this, as to the chastisement which you are going to have from Allâh? Among (the ancient ‘Jews’) who incurred the curse of Allâh and His wrath, those of whom (some) He transformed into apes and pigs, those who worshiped the devil (or the mythological deities) are in worse plight , and further astray from from the established course. “

61.Munir Mezyed: When they come to you, they say: "We profess a belief (in the Unity & the Oneness of Allâh)." Yet they entered into your company with unbelief, and went forth from you with the same. But Allâh is Fully Aware of what they have stored secretly within themselves.

62.Munir Mezyed: You can see many of them hastening to sin and transgression, and  eating of things forbidden. Evil indeed is that which they have been doing.

63.Munir Mezyed: Why do not the Pious Preachers and Rabbis forbid them from uttering evil words and from eating things forbidden? Evil indeed is that which they have been practicing.

64.Munir Mezyed: And the ‘Jews’ say: “The hand of Allâh is tied up." May their own hands be shackled, and may they be anathematized for what they say. Nay, both His Hands are widely outspread. He expend as He wills. Indeed, the ‘Revelation’ which has been sent down unto you from your Lord will increase tyranny and disbelief of many of them. We have cast among them enmity and hatred until the ‘Day of Resurrection’. So often as they will kindle a fire for war, Allâh will extinguish it. And they seek to spread corruption on the earth, but Allâh demonstrates not his own love for those who seek to spread  corruption.

65.Munir Mezyed: If only the ‘People of the Scripture’ (Jews & Christians) had believed (in the truth about the Prophethood of Muhammad) and acted piously, We would definitely have delivered them from all the consequences of their sins, and admitted them into the Gardens of Delight.

66.Munir Mezyed: If only they had established (the divine law of) the ‘Torah’, the ‘Gospel’, and what had been revealed unto them from their Lord, they would definitely have eaten of good things both from above them, and from under their feet. Among them, there is a party on the right course, but how evil is that which many of them do!

67.Munir Mezyed: O’ ‘Messenger’, convey, (preach and promulgate the message) which has been sent down unto you from your Lord. And if it happens that you do not, then you have not conveyed His message. Allâh will establish and guard you against the (wicked) people. Indeed, Allâh will not illuminate the path of those who do lack faith (in Him).

68.Munir Mezyed: Say, (O’ ‘Muhammad’): "O’ ‘People of the Scripture’, (Jews & Christians), you follow nothing unless you establish (the divine law of) the ‘Torah’, the ‘Gospel’, and what has been revealed unto them from your Lord. Indeed, the ‘Revelation’ which has been sent down unto you from your Lord will increase tyranny and disbelief of many of them. Thus, don’t grieve yourself too much for those who do lack faith (in Allâh).

69.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism and those who are ‘Jews’, ‘Sabians’ and ‘Christians’, whoever of them believes in (the unity and oneness of) Allâh and the ‘Last Day’, and does righteous deed, there will come no fear on them, neither will they ever grieve

70.Munir Mezyed: Verily, We took the covenant of the ‘Children of Israel’, and sent Our ‘Messengers’ to them. Whenever a ‘Messenger’ came to them with what they themselves did not desire, some of them they denied , and others they killed.

71.Munir Mezyed: They assumed there would be no trail. Thus, they became blind, and deaf. Then Allâh turned unto them in forgiveness. Afterwards many of them again became blind and deaf. Allâh is the All-Seer of all what they do.

72.Munir Mezyed: They have certainly blasphemed (against Allâh), who say: “Allâh is indeed the ‘Messiah’, son of Mary,” while ‘Christ’ himself said: "O’ ‘children of Israel’, worship Allâh, my Lord and your Lord." Indeed, he who associates others with Allâh (must know that) Allâh will exclude him from ‘Al-Jannah’, and his habitation will be Gehenna. Those who  deliberately keep on sinning will have none to help them.

73.Munir Mezyed: They have certainly blasphemed (against Allâh), who say: “Allâh is indeed the third of three,” when here is no God, besides one God. If they do not refrain  from what they say, an extremely painful doom will definitely be inflicted on those who persist in disbelief (in the Unity & Oneness of Allâh).

74.Munir Mezyed: So will they not turn towards Allâh in repentance, and seek His forgiveness? And  Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

75.Munir Mezyed: ‘Christ, son of Mary’, is not more than a ‘Messenger’, like the other ‘Messengers’ who have preceded him. His mother was a veracious woman of integrity. They both eat food. Look how We show them clearly (and impartially) the signs; and then look how they are deceived ( into going away from the established course.

76.Munir Mezyed: Say, (O’ Muhammad): "How could you worship besides Allâh, that which possesses for you neither harm nor profit? But Allâh is the One who is the  All-Hearer, All-Knowing."

77.Munir Mezyed: Say, (O’ Muhammad): "O’ ‘People of the Scripture’, (Jews & Christians), exceed not the limits in your religion beyond the truth and do not follow the self-deception of a people who have gone astray before, and who misled many, and have gone astray from the virtuous path."

78.Munir Mezyed: Those among the ‘Children of Israel’ who refused to  profess belief (in the Unity & the Oneness  of Allâh)  were anathematized by the tongue of ‘David’, and of ‘Jesus, son of Mary’. (This befell them) because they refused to comply (with what Allâh has commanded) and used to transgress.

79.Munir Mezyed: They did not prohibit one another from wrongdoing that they did. Evil indeed was that which they used to do. (in Allâh)

80.Munir Mezyed: You can see many of them taking those who do lack Faith (in Allâh) as their guardians. Evil indeed is that which their own selves have sent before them. For that reason the wrath of Allâh abides upon them, and they will remain in the doom forever.

81.Munir Mezyed: However, if they had believed in (the unity & oneness of) Allâh, in the ‘Prophet’, and in that which has been revealed unto him, they would not have dared to take them as their guardians. But many of them are walking in the path of disobedience.

82.Munir Mezyed: You will certainly find the most intense of the people in animosity towards those who  adhere to Islamic monotheism are the “Jews” and those who associate others with Allâh.  And you will find the nearest of them in affection to those who adhere to a belief are the ones  who say: "We are indeed ‘Christians." That is because there are priests and monks among them; and because they do not display an arrogant attitude (towards Faith).

83.Munir Mezyed: When they hear what has been revealed to this ‘Messenger’, you could see their eyes overflowing with tears, because of the truth which they have recognized. They say: "Our Lord, we adhere to faith, so write us down among the witnesses;

84.Munir Mezyed: And why should we not believe in Allâh and in the truth which has come to us?  We earnestly hope that our Lord would enroll us among the righteous people?

85.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, Allâh will reward them for what they said with Gardens beneath which rivers flow. Therein they will abide. Such is the reward of those who attain perfection in Righteousness /or in Faith

86.Munir Mezyed: But those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh), and give no credence to Our ‘Revelations’ are the ‘Denizens of the Inferno’.

87.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, do not forbid the wholesome good things which Allâh has made lawful for you, and do not to transgress. Indeed, Allâh demonstrates not his own love for the transgressors.

88.Munir Mezyed: Eat of the things which Allâh has provided for you, lawful and wholesome, and act piously towards Allâh in whom you believe.

89.Munir Mezyed: Allâh will not call you to account for that which is unintentional in your oaths, but He will call you to account for breaking the oaths which you take in earnest. The atonement thereof, then, is the feeding of ten poor persons with such average food as you feed your own families with, or the clothing of them or the freeing of a slave. But whosoever finds not the means will have to Fast for three days. This is the atonement of your oaths when you have sworn. Keep your oaths! This is how Allâh shows you clearly his ‘Revelations’ so that you may be grateful.

90.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to monotheism, the intoxicants, the game of chance, (sacrifices at) altars and divining arrows are only the abomination of ‘Satan’. So shun each one of them so that you may ultimately achieve a blissful life/or gain eternal salvation.

91.Munir Mezyed: The devil (‘Satan’) intends only to create enmity and hatred among you by means of intoxicants and game of chance, and to keep you back from celebrating the Praises of Allâh and declaring His indefinite glory, and from Prayer. So, will you not then refrain?

92.Munir Mezyed: Obey Allâh and the Messenger, and be cautious and alert. But if it happens that you turn away, then you must know that the duty of Our ‘Messenger’ is to convey clearly and openly the Message.

93.Munir Mezyed: Those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism and do righteous act would not be at fault in what they ate (in the past) if they act piously, and do righteous acts, and again they act piously toward Allâh and profess a belief (in the Unity & Oneness of Allâh), yet again act piously and pursue righteousness. Lo! Allâh demonstrates his own love for those whose heart is perfect towards Him.

94.Munir Mezyed: O’ who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, Allâh will certainly try you in respect of some game which your hands and lances can reach, so that Allâh may identify the one who shows honor and reverence for Him in secret. Whosoever, therefore, transgresses after this, will have an extremely painful doom.

95.Munir Mezyed: O’ who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, kill not game while you are in a state of ‘Pilgrimage’. Whosoever among you kills it intentionally, its indemnification is a quadruped like to that which he has killed, as determined by two just men from among you, as an offering to be brought to ‘Ka’bah’, or as an atonement, he must feed a number of needy people, or the equivalent of that in fasting, so that he may taste the consequence of his deed. Allâh has pardoned what is past. But whoever reverts to it, Allâh will take retribution from him.

96.Munir Mezyed: It is made lawful for you to hunt and to eat (fish) of the sea as a provision for you and for the travelers, but it is forbidden to you to hunt as long as you are in the state of ‘Pilgrimage’. Therefore, act piously towards Allâh to whom you are  (destined) to be gathered.

97.Munir Mezyed: Allâh has appointed the ‘Ka'bah’, the ‘Sacred House’, to be an establishment for mankind, and the sacred month, and the offering, and its garlands. That you may know that Allâh knows all that is in the heavens and on the earth, and that Allâh is the All-Knowing of all things.

98.Munir Mezyed: Know that Allâh is extremely severe in punishment and that Allâh is also Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

99.Munir Mezyed: The sole duty of the ‘Messenger’ is to convey ( & promulgate the message). Allâh knows whatever you disclose and whatever you conceal.

100.Munir Mezyed: Say, (O’ Muhammad): "Not equal are the malicious and the wholesome, even though the abundance of malicious things may please you." Therefore, act piously towards Allâh, O’ men of intellect, so that you may ultimately achieve a blissful life/ or gain eternal salvation.

101.Munir Mezyed: O’ who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, do not  ask about things which, if they are made known to you, would cause you trouble, though if you ask about them while the 'Qur’ān' is being sent down, then they will be made known to you. Allâh has left them out on purpose. Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, Most Forbearing.

102.Munir Mezyed: A people before you asked about such things, some more later on they abandoned their faith.

103.Munir Mezyed: Allâh has not ordained any 'Bahīra' (a she-camel whose milk was spared for the mythological deities and nobody was allowed to milk it) or 'Sā’iba' (a she-camel let loose for free pasture for their mythological deities and nothing was allowed to be carried on it) or ‘Wasīla' (a she-camel set free for the mythological deities because she has given birth to a she-camel at its first delivery and then again gives birth to a she-camel at its second delivery) or 'Hām' (a stallion-camel freed from work for their mythological deities. But those who those who do lack faith in (Allâh) invent lies against Allâh, and most of them do not possess self- awareness that allows them to understand.

104.Munir Mezyed: When it is said unto them: "Come to that which Allâh has revealed and to the ‘Messenger’," They say: ”Sufficient for us is that wherein We found our fathers." What! Even though their fathers knew nothing, or sought not to attain spiritual insight.

105.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, keep yourselves safe. He who goes astray cannot harm you when you yourselves are rightly guided. Eventually, you are all (destined) to return unto Him, then He will inform you of what you used do.

106.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, testimony should be taken among you when death draws nigh to one of you, at the time of making the will, two just persons from among you, or two others from among others than you, if it happens you are travelling through the land and the calamity of death befalls you. If you have doubt (about their testimony), detain them after their Prayer and let them swear by Allâh (saying): “We will not exchange our oath for any price, even if it should be a relative, and we would not hide the testimony of Allâh, for then we would surely be of the sinful." towards Allâh.

107.Munir Mezyed: But if afterwards it gets known that these two were guilty of the sin of perjury,  let two others stand forth in their places, from among those who are the most deserving, nearest in kinship, and they both swear an oath by Allâh (saying): "We affirm that our testimony is more rightful than the testimony of the other two, and that we have not trespassed the truth, for then indeed we should be among the those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong.

108.Munir Mezyed: Thus, it is more likely that they will bear true witness or fear that other oaths will be taken after their oaths. Act piously towards Allâh and listen attentively (to that which you are admonished). Allâh will not illuminate the path of sons of disobedience.

109.Munir Mezyed: They day will come when Allâh gathers the ‘Messengers’ together and say unto them: "What response did you receive?" They will answer, "We have no knowledge. Indeed, you are best Knowing of the unseen.”

110.Munir Mezyed: Allâh will say: "O’ ‘Jesus son of Mary’, remember My Favor upon you and upon your mother when I invigorated you with the ‘Spirit of Holiness’ so that you would be able to speak unto the people in the cradle, and when of middle age; and when I taught you the ‘Scripture’, the wisdom, the ‘Torah’ and the ‘Gospel’, and when you fashioned a creation out of clay, in the likeness of a bird, by My Permission, then you breathed into it a new spirit , and it became a bird by My Permission, and you were able to heal the night-blind and the leprous by My Permission, and when you raised the dead by My permission, and when I restrained the ‘Children of Israel’ from putting you to death when you came to them with the full knowledge of the Truth. And those who lack faith in (Allâh) from among them said: “This is nothing but an appreciable sorcery (and devilry).”

111.Munir Mezyed: (Remember) when I inspired the ‘Disciples’ to believe in Me and in My ‘Messenger’, they said: 'We  profess a belief  (in the Unity& Oneness of Allâh), and bear witness that we have submitted ourselves (entirely to the authority of Allâh).

112.Munir Mezyed: (Remember) when the ‘Disciples’ say: "O’ ‘Jesus, son of Mary’, is your Lord capable of sending down to us a ‘Table Spread’ with food from heaven? He said: “Act piously towards Allâh if you were (indeed) believers (of unfeigned faith).”

113.Munir Mezyed: They said: "We desire to eat from it, in order that our hearts may attain a definite faith and we may know that what you have told us is the truth, and that we may be thereby among the witnesses."

114.Munir Mezyed: ‘Jesus, son of Mary’, said: "O’ Allâh, our Lord! Send down for us a ‘Table Spread’ with food from the heavens, that it may be to us a festival, to the first of us and to the last of us, and a sign ( of Allâh's power and glory) from you, and provide sustenance for us, for you are the Best of Sustainers.”

115.Munir Mezyed: Allâh said: "I am going to send it down unto you; but whosoever of you fall into disbelief (in the Unity& Oneness of Allâh) afterwards- I will definitely chastise him with a chastisement by which I have not chastised anyone among the worlds."

116.Munir Mezyed: Allâh will Ask (‘Jesus’ on the ‘Day of Judgment’): "O’ ‘Jesus, son of Mary’, did you tell the people to worship you and your mother as two gods besides Allâh? He will answer: "All Glory and Perfection be to You! I could never say that which I had no right. If I had said it, you would have definitely known it. You know what is in inner self while I do not know what is in Yours. It is You alone who are the Knowing of all hidden things.

117.Munir Mezyed: I said nothing to them except that which you commanded me to say: ‘Worship (& venerate) Allâh, my Lord and your Lord’ and I was a witness of them so long as I was among them, but since you caused me to die, You have been the Watcher over them, and you are a Witness to all things.

118.Munir Mezyed: If You intend to chastise them, then they are certainly Your servants. And if You intend to deliver them from all the consequences of their sins, then You are certainly the One who is All-Mighty, All-Wise."

119.Munir Mezyed: Allâh will say: "This is the day when only the truthful will profit by their truthfulness”. For them are Gardens beneath which rivers flow; therein shall they abide. Allâh is well pleased with them, and they are well pleased with Him; that indeed is the most ultimate success and the supreme one.

120.Munir Mezyed: Unto Allâh belongs the (absolute) sovereignty of the heavens, of the earth and of whatsoever is therein, and He is capable of doing whatever He wills!

1.Munir Mezyed: All the praises and gratitude belong unto Allâh who created the heavens and earth, and brought into being darkness and light. Yet those who lack faith (in Allâh) have set up equals to their Lord.

2.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who created you from clay and then He decreed a term. There is another term fixed with Him. Yet you, (who lack faith in Allâh), are deeply skeptical (about the ‘Resurrection’).

3.Munir Mezyed: He is Allâh, the God, both in the heavens and on the earth. He knows whatever you conceal and whatever you openly profess. And He knows what you earn.

4.Munir Mezyed: Never came there to them a sign of the signs of their Lord, but they take no heed.

5.Munir Mezyed: Verily, they refused to acknowledge the Truth when it came to them, but soon they will come to them the tidings of that at which they used to scoff.

6.Munir Mezyed: Have they not seen how many generations, We utterly destroyed before them? We had established them in the earth as We have not established you, (-the Quraysh Tribe of Mecca-). We sent the heavy clouds over them pouring down abundant rain, and made the rivers flow under them. Then We destroyed them as a consequence of their sins and raised up after them another generation.

7.Munir Mezyed: Even if We had sent down unto you a writing upon parchment and they had felt it with their hands, those who do lack faith (in Allâh) would have said: “This is not more than an appreciable sorcery ( & devilry).”

8.Munir Mezyed: They say: "Why has not an ‘Angel’ been sent down unto him?"  If We had sent down an ‘Angel’, the matter would have been decided, and then they would have been granted no respite.

9.Munir Mezyed: Had We made him an ‘Angel’, We should have made him as a man, too. We would have covered them with that in which they cover themselves.

10.Munir Mezyed: Verily, the ‘Messengers’ have been mocked at before you, (O’ Muhammad), but that which they mocked at encompassed those who used to scoff.

11.Munir Mezyed: (O’ Muhammad), say: "Travel through the land, then observe how dreadful was the   outcome of those who refused to acknowledge the Truth.

12.Munir Mezyed: (O’ Muhammad), say: “Unto whom belongs all that is in the heavens and on the earth?" Say: “Unto Allâh.” He has taken upon Himself to show clemency. He will certainly assemble you for the ‘Day of Resurrection’. There is no doubt in it. Those who are caught in in self-destruction won't (change their minds to) profess a belief (in the Unity & Oneness of Allâh).

13.Munir Mezyed: Unto Him belongs whatever exists in the night and in the day, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing."

14.Munir Mezyed: (O’ Muhammad), say: "Is it other than Allâh I should choose to be as a guardian, the Creator of the heaven and earth, who feeds and is not fed?” Say: “I have been commanded to be the first of those who submit (themselves entirely to the authority of Allâh),”And be not ,(O’ Muhammad), of the ‘Polytheists’.

15.Munir Mezyed: Say, “If it happens that I disobey my Lord, I fear (the divine) retribution of a dreadful day.”

16.Munir Mezyed: On that day, if the retribution is averted, Allâh indeed has shown clemency toward him. And that is the most ultimate success and the supreme one.

17.Munir Mezyed: If Allâh touches you with affliction, none can remove it except him. And if He touches you with good fortune, (none can preclude it) Thus, Allâh is capable of doing whatever He wills.

18.Munir Mezyed: He is the Omnipotent over His servants, and He is the All-Wise, the All-Aware.

19.Munir Mezyed: (O’ Muhammad), say: "What thing is the greatest in testimony?" say: “ Allâh is a Witness between you and me. And this 'Qur’ān' has been revealed unto me so that with it I may warn you, and whomsoever It reaches.  What! Do you really bear witness that there are other gods besides Allâh?” Say: “I bear not witness thereto.” Say: “He is the One God, and definitely I am innocent of that which you associate with Him.”

20.Munir Mezyed: Those unto whom We have given the ‘Scripture’ (Jews & Christians) recognize him (‘Prophet Muhammad’) as they recognize their own sons. But those who are caught in in self-destruction won't (change their minds to) profess to a belief (in the Unity & Oneness of Allâh).

21.Munir Mezyed: Who is more grossly unfair and morally wrong than the one who invents a lie against Allâh and gives no credence to His ‘Revelations’? Indeed, those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong will never ever achieve a blissful life/or gain eternal salvation.

22.Munir Mezyed: The day will come when We gather them all together, then We say to those who associated partners (with Allâh) : "Where are your partners whom you used to allege?"

23.Munir Mezyed: Then they will have no excuse except that they will say: "By Allâh, our Lord, we were not ‘Polytheists’."

24.Munir Mezyed: See how they lie against themselves, and that which they used to mythologize will fail them.

25.Munir Mezyed: Among them are (spiritually blind) who listen to you, but We have placed coverings on their hearts, lest they understand It, and deafness in their ears (lest they hear It). Even if they were to see every sign (of Allâh’s power and glory), they would not believe therein, so much so that when they come to you, arguing with you. Those who lack faith (in Allâh) would say: “This is not more than myths of the ancients.”

26.Munir Mezyed: They forbid others (to follow the ‘Prophet’), and they themselves kept away from him. They sabotage none but their own selves, yet they lack the ability to perceive it.

27.Munir Mezyed: If you could only see when they are made to stand before the Inferno, they would say: “Oh, would that we might be sent back. Then we would not repudiate the signs of our Lord, in fact, we would be among the monotheistic believers.”

28.Munir Mezyed: Nay, it has become obvious to them that which they used to conceal before. If they were sent back, they would definitely return to that which they are forbidden. They are indeed liars (& spiritually blind).

29.Munir Mezyed: They say: "There is no (other life) except this our ‘worldly life’, and we are not going to be raised again."

30.Munir Mezyed: If you could only see when they are made to stand before their Lord, He would say (unto them): "Is not this second life the truth?" They will say: “Yea, by our Lord.” He will say: “Taste then the chastisement as an outcome of your constant refusal to accept Islamic monotheism..”

31.Munir Mezyed: Those indeed are the sons of eternal perdition who deny the meeting with Allâh, so much so, that when the ‘Inevitable Hour’ shall come on them unexpectedly, they will say: "Alas for us, we failed to care for it properly!" They will bear the burdens (of their sins) on their backs. Certainly, evil is that which they bear!

32.Munir Mezyed: This ‘worldly life’ is not more than a play and pastime. Surely the abode of the ‘Hereafter’ is far better for those who act piously. Do you not possess self- awareness that allows you to understand?

33.Munir Mezyed: We know indeed that which they say grieves you. Surely it is not you that they refuse to believe but it is the ‘Revelations’ of Allâh that the iniquitous aim to refute.

34.Munir Mezyed: Verily, (many) ‘Messengers’ (of Allâh) have been belied before you, but, in spite of their rejection and persecution, they resorted to patience and constancy until Our help came to them. There is none to change the word of Allâh. There have already come to you some of the tidings of the past ‘Messengers’.

35.Munir Mezyed: If their turning away is hard on you, then you can seek a passage into the earth or a ladder to heaven and bring them a (miraculous) sign. Had Allâh imposed His will, He could definitely have brought them all together to his divine guidance, so do not be of those who do lack knowledge (of Allâh).

36.Munir Mezyed: Only those who (attentively) listen can acknowledge (all the Truth). As for the dead, Allâh will raise them to life. Eventually they are all bound to return unto Him.

37.Munir Mezyed: They say: “Why has not a (miraculous) sign been sent down to him from his Lord?" Say: "Allâh is certainly capable of sending down a (miraculous) sign, but most of them do lack knowledge (of Allâh’s power & glory).

38.Munir Mezyed: There is not an animal that crawls on the earth, nor a bird that flies on its two wings, but they are communities like your own selves. We have left out nothing in the ‘Book’. Eventually they are all bound to return unto their Lord.

39.Munir Mezyed: Those who give no credence to Our ‘Revelations’ are deaf and dumb, living in (utter) darkness.  Whom Allâh wills, He lets him go astray; and whom He wills, He places him on the right path.

40.Munir Mezyed: (O’ ‘Muhammad’), say: “What if the chastisement of Allâh comes or there comes upon you the ‘Inevitable Hour’, will you cry unto any other than Allâh, if you are truthful?”

41.Munir Mezyed: Nay, It is Him alone you call upon, and He may, if  he wills, remove (the stress) which caused you to call upon Him;  and you will forget then whatever partners you used to associate with Him."

42.Munir Mezyed: Verily We sent Ours ‘Messengers’ to people before you, then We afflicted them with adversity and hardship so that they might humble themselves.

43.Munir Mezyed: Why, then, when Our (divine) retribution came upon them, did they not humble themselves? But their hearts were hardened, and ‘Satan’ made their evil deeds seem fair to them.

44.Munir Mezyed: When they forgot that with which they had been admonished, We opened to them the gates of all things, until, in the midst of their enjoyment in that which they were given, We seized them unexpectedly, and lo! They were greatly surprised.

45.Munir Mezyed: So the last remnant of the people who were grossly unfair and  morally wrong was cut off; and all the praises and gratitude belong to Allâh, the Lord of all the worlds.

46.Munir Mezyed: Say, "What do you think, if Allâh intends to take away your hearing and your sight, and sets a seal upon your hearts, who is the god, other than Allâh, that is capable of restoring them to you?  See how We expound (our) signs (of power & glory) in various ways, yet they take no heed.”.

47.Munir Mezyed: Say, "What do you think, if the chastisement of Allâh comes upon you unexpectedly, or openly, will any be destroyed except ones who live in sin.

48.Munir Mezyed: We sent not the ‘Messengers’ but as heralds and warners. So whosoever adheres firmly to Islamic monotheism and mends his ways, they will have no fear upon them, nor will they ever grieve.

49.Munir Mezyed: But those who give no credence to Our ‘Revelations’, the (divine) retribution will touch them,  for they refrain not from (sin) and disobedience.

50.Munir Mezyed: (O’ Muhammad), say: " I never tell you that I possess the treasures of Allâh, or that I know the (secrets of) unseen , nor do I tell you that I am an ‘Angel’. I only follow what is revealed unto me." And say: "Can the (spiritually) blind be held equal to the enlightened one?" Will you not, then, cerebrate?"

51.Munir Mezyed: Warn therewith (the 'Qur’ān') those who fear that they will be gathered unto their Lord, that they have, apart from Him, no guardian nor intercessor, so that they may act piously/or that they may guard themselves against falling into temptation or sin).

52.Munir Mezyed: Lest you become one of who are grossly unfair and morally wrong, do not drive those who cry unto their Lord, morning and evening, seeking (only) His pleasure, nothing of their account falls upon you , and nothing of their account falls upon them, that should make you to drive them away.

53.Munir Mezyed: This is how We tried some of them by others, that they may say: "Is it these whom Allâh has favored from among us?" Does not Allâh know best those who are grateful?

54.Munir Mezyed: And when those who believe in Our ‘Revelations’ come to you and say: ”Peace be to you”! Your Lord has taken it upon Himself to show clemency- so that if anyone of you commits a sin out of ignorance, then repents, and mends his way, he will know then that Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.”

55.Munir Mezyed: This is how We distinctly explain Our ‘Revelations’: that the path of those who are ungodly sinners may become apparent.

56.Munir Mezyed: Say (to the ‘Polytheist’), “I am forbidden to worship those - others than Allâh - whom you you call upon.” Say, “I have no intention of taking in your self-deceived beliefs for the epistemic: If it happens that I do, then I will go astray. And I will not be of those who attain spiritual insight.”

57.Munir Mezyed: (O’ Muhammad), Say: “I stand upon a cognizable sign from my Lord, and you have already denied Him. Not within my power is that which you desire to be hastened. Judgment belongs unto Allâh alone. He relates the Truth, and He is (indeed) the Perfect Judge.”

58.Munir Mezyed: (O’ Muhammad), say: “If that which you desire to be hastened were in my power, certainly the matter would have been decided between you and me. Allâh knows best the ones who live in sin.”

59.Munir Mezyed: With Him are the keys of the unseen; none knows them but He. He knows whatsoever is in the land or in the sea. Not a (single) leaf falls, but He knows it. Not a one grain in the deep darkness of the earth, not a thing, wet or dry, but it is recorded in a ‘Comprehensive Book’.

60.Munir Mezyed: It is He who takes your soul by night; and He knows what you work by day. Then He raises you up again therein, that the appointed term may be fulfilled. Lo! You are (destined) to return unto Him, and then He will inform you of what you have been doing.

61.Munir Mezyed: He is the Omnipotent over His servants. And He sends over you guardians (‘Angels’), until, when death approaches one of you, Our ‘Messengers’, (the ‘Angels’ of death) take his soul, and they never fail in their duty.

62.Munir Mezyed: Then they are returned unto Allâh, unto their True Lord. Surely, Judgment belongs unto Him. He is the Swiftest in taking account.

63.Munir Mezyed: Say, “Who delivers you from the risks of the land and of the sea? You call upon Him humbly and secretly (saying), 'If it happens that He delivers us from this, we will definitely be of the thankful.'"

64.Munir Mezyed: Say: “It is Allâh who delivers you from it and from every distress. And yet you still attribute partners unto Him."

65.Munir Mezyed: Say, “It is he who has the power to send upon you a chastisement from above you or from beneath your feet, or to confound you by splitting you into sects, and to make some of you taste the violence of one another. See how We distinctly explain Our ‘Revelations’ in various ways, so that they may understand ( & distinguish truth and falsehood, and that they may prefer truth).

66.Munir Mezyed: But your people, (O’ Muhammad), have refused to give credence to the 'Qur’ān'', though it is the Truth (from your Lord). Say: “I am not a guardian over you.”

67.Munir Mezyed: For every ‘Prophecy’ has a term appointed for its fulfillment; and soon will you come to know.

68.Munir Mezyed: When you see those who engage in vain discourse about Our (Holy) ‘Verses’, then turn away from them, until they engage in a discourse other than that. If it happens that ‘Satan’ caused you to forget, then do not sit, after recollection, with these iniquitous people.

69.Munir Mezyed: Those who act piously are not held accountable for the (evil deeds of the scoffers) at all. But it is incumbent on them to admonish them so that they may act piously/ or that they may show honor and reverence for Allâh.

70.Munir Mezyed: And forsake those who take their religion for play and pastime, and whom the ‘worldly life’ has deluded. But remind with the ‘Qur’ān’, lest a ‘Human Self’ be given up to destruction for what it has earned, for there will neither be any protecting friend nor intercessor, other than  Allâh, and even though it may offer any ransom, it shall not be taken from it. Such are they who are given to destruction for what they have earned. They shall have a drink of scalding water and an extremely painful doom as an outcome of their constant refusal to accept Islamic monotheism.

71.Munir Mezyed: Say: “Shall we call upon others, besides Allâh, that which can neither profit us nor harm us?  And shall we turn back on our heels after Allâh has guided us? (We would then be) like one whom the devils entice away, leaving him blindly bewildered in the land, and who has companions providing a means for him to receive spiritual insight, saying to (him), “Come to us.” Say, “Indeed, the divine guidance of Allâh is the only guidance. And we have been commanded to submit (ourselves completely to the authority of) the Lord of all the worlds,

72.Munir Mezyed: To establish regular Prayer and to act piously towards Him/or show honor and reverence for Him " And it is He unto Whom you are (destined) to be gathered.

73.Munir Mezyed: And it is He Who created the heavens and earth in truth. When He says: "Be," consequently, there it is. His word is the (ultimate) truth, and His is the (absolute) sovereignty on the day when the trumpet will be blown. He is the Knowing of the unseen and the visible. He is the All- Wise, the All-Aware.

74.Munir Mezyed: (Mention) when ‘Abraham’ said unto his father, ‘Azar’: “Do you take idols for gods? Indeed, I see you and your people in utter deception."

75.Munir Mezyed: This is how We showed ‘Abraham’ the supremacy of the heavens and earth so that he might be of those who have a definite faith (in Allâh).

76.Munir Mezyed: When the night darkened upon him, he saw a star. He said: “This is my Lord.” But when it set, he said: “I do not like those that set.”
