57.Munir Mezyed: Never think that those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) can frustrate (Our Power) on the earth. Their final refuge is the Fire; what a dreadful refuge!

58.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere to Islamic monotheism , let those whom your right hands possess and those of you who have not yet reached puberty, ask for your permission (before coming into your private room) on three occasions: Before the Morning Prayer, when you put aside your clothing for rest at noon, and after the Night Prayer. These are three times of privacy for you. There is no blame on you or on them (if they come in without permission), apart from these occasions, that you go about one to the other. This is how Allâh makes for you the ‘Revelations’ easy to perceive. Lo! Allâh is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

59.Munir Mezyed: When the children among you reach puberty, then let them (also) seek permission as those before them sought permission. This is how Allâh makes for you His Revelations easy to be perceived. Lo! Allâh is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

60.Munir Mezyed: As for women past child-bearing, who have no hope of getting married, they will incur no sin if they discard their (outer) garments without unleashing their feminine charms. But if they refrain from this, it will be better for them. Lo! Allâh is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

61.Munir Mezyed: There is no blame on the blind, nor any blame on the lame, nor any blame on the sick, that you eat in your own houses, or the houses of your fathers, or the houses of your mothers, or the houses of your brothers, or the houses of your sisters, or the houses of your paternal uncles, or the houses of your paternal aunts,  or the houses of your maternal uncles, or the houses of your maternal aunts, or (houses) whereof you possess the keys, or the houses of your friends. It is no iniquity on you that you eat together or separately. Thus when you enter any of these houses, greet one another with a blessed, pure and good salutation appointed by Allâh. This is how Allâh makes for you the revelations perceivable, that you may understand.

62.Munir Mezyed: The true ‘monotheistic believers’ are only those who believe in Allâh and His ‘Messenger’ (‘Muhammad’), and when they are with him on a collective cause, they do not leave until they have obtained his permission. Certainly those who ask for your permission are the ones who truly believe in Allâh and His ‘Messenger’. Thus, if they ask you for permission for some affair of their own, give permission to whomever of them you will, and ask Allâh for their forgiveness. Indeed, Allâh is Oft- Forgiving, Most Merciful.

63.Munir Mezyed: Treat not the supplication and praying of the ‘Messenger’ for you as the supplication and praying of you for one another. Allâh indeed knows those of you who surreptitiously sneak away, taking cover behind one another. So let those who go against his order beware, lest a bitter trial befall them or a painful chastisement afflict them.

64.Munir Mezyed: Absolutely, unto Allâh belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth. He knows well where you stand. (He knows) the Day when they will be brought back to Him. Thus, He will inform them of what they did. Allâh is All-Knowing of all things.

1.Munir Mezyed: Blessed is the One Who sends down the Criterion on His servant so that he may give warning to all the worlds.

2.Munir Mezyed: He unto Whom belongs the (absolute) sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. He has not taken to Himself (any) child, nor has He any partner in the sovereignty. He has created everything, and then ordained for it a measure.

3.Munir Mezyed: Yet some choose to take, apart from Him, gods that create nothing but are themselves created, and have no power to hurt or profit themselves, and they have no authority over death, or over life, or over resurrection.

4.Munir Mezyed: Those who persist in disbelief (in Allâh) say: "This ('Qur’ān') is nothing but a mendacity that he, (‘Muhammad’), himself has mythologized It, and others have helped him at it”. Verily, they have brought an inequity and a falsehood.

5.Munir Mezyed: They say: "Legends of the ancients, which he has written, and they are dictated to him in the early mornings and evenings."

6.Munir Mezyed: Say (unto them): "It has been sent down by the One Who knows the secret of the heavens and earth. Indeed, He is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful."

7.Munir Mezyed: They say: "What kind of ‘Messenger’ is this? He eats food and goes about in marketplaces. Why is not an ‘Angel’ sent down to him to be a herald with him?

8.Munir Mezyed: Or (why) has not a treasure been sent down upon him from the heaven?  Or why has he not a garden whereof he may eat?" Those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong say: “You follow but a bewitched man!”

9.Munir Mezyed: See how they set forth parables for you. But they have gone astray, and they never be able to find a way.

10.Munir Mezyed: Most Blessed is the One Who, if He willed, He could easily give better than all that - gardens under which rivers flow- and will assign to you mansions.

11.Munir Mezyed: But they refused to admit the existence of the ‘Hour’ (i.e. the ‘Day of Judgment’), and We have prepared a blazing inferno for those who refuse to admit the existence of the ‘Hour’.

12.Munir Mezyed: When the inferno sees them from a distant place, they will hear its raging and its sighing.

13.Munir Mezyed: And when they are cast into a narrow place thereof, chained together,, they will plead there for destruction.

14.Munir Mezyed: (They will be told) “Plead not today for one destruction, but plead for many!'

15.Munir Mezyed: Say, (O’ Muhammad): "Is that (punishment) better or the Eternal Paradise, which has been promised to those who act piously? It will be a reward and a final destination for them.

16.Munir Mezyed: Abiding therein, they will have whatever they desire. This is a promise which your Lord has bound Himself to fulfill.

17.Munir Mezyed: The day will come when He gathers them together, and all those whom they worship ( & venerate) besides Allâh He will say (unto them): "Was it you who led my servants astray, or did they themselves stray from the (right) path?”

18.Munir Mezyed: They will say: “Glory be to You! It would not be appropriate for us to take any guardian besides You, but You make them and their fathers live a life of luxury until they forgot to honor and celebrate Your name. Thus, they are doomed to eternal perdition."

19.Munir Mezyed: So those whom you used to worship will give you the lie regarding what you allege. Thus, you can neither avert (the chastisement), nor obtain help. (O’ mankind), whoever among you act unfairly, We shall make him taste the severe punishment.

20.Munir Mezyed: We never sent any ‘Messengers’ before you but they definitely eat food and went about in the marketplaces. We have made some of you a trial for others. Will you endure patiently? Consequently, Your Lord is Ever All-Seer.

21.Munir Mezyed: Those who expect not to meet Us (in the ‘Hereafter’) say: "Why are no ‘Angels’ sent down on us, or why do we not see our Lord?" Verily, they are arrogantly proud of themselves, and exceed all bounds (in their transgressing).

22.Munir Mezyed: The day when they will see the ‘Angels’, no joyful news will be there for the ungodly sinners, and (the Angel) will say: "All kinds of joyful news are prohibited and unreachable."

23.Munir Mezyed: We will look upon whatever deeds they have done; and We will turn them into scattered motes.

24.Munir Mezyed: The companions of ‘Al-Jannah’ will, on that day, be in a better lodging and better resting place.

25.Munir Mezyed: They day will come when the sky is split open with glittering white clouds, and the ‘Angels’ are caused to descend in a spectacular descending.

26.Munir Mezyed: The sovereignty on that day will be the true (sovereignty), belonging unto the Most Beneficent, and it will be a tough day for those who persist in disbelief (in Allâh) .

27.Munir Mezyed: They day will come when the one who is grossly unfair and morally wrong bites his hands, saying: “Oh, would that I had taken a way in the company of the ‘Messenger’!

28.Munir Mezyed: Ah! Woe unto me! Would that I had not taken so-and-so for a friend!

29.Munir Mezyed: He verily led me astray from the 'Revealer of Truth', (the 'Qur’ān'), after it had come unto me. ‘Satan’ is proved to be a deserter to man in the time of need."

30.Munir Mezyed: The Messenger will say: "O’ my Lord, certainly my people have taken this  'Qur’ān' as a thing to be neglected."

31.Munir Mezyed: This is how We made for every ‘Prophet’ an enemy among the impious. But Your Lord is sufficient as a guide and a helper.

32.Munir Mezyed: Those who persist in disbelief say: "Why has not the 'Qur’ān' been revealed unto him all at once?" We send it down in parts so that We may (entrench it in your mind) and strengthen your heart with it. We are revealing it (unto you) clearly and progressively.

33.Munir Mezyed: Whenever they come to you with a pretext, We provide you with the truth (to refute their pretext), and the best explication (to raise their awareness).

34.Munir Mezyed: Those who will be gathered on their faces to ‘Gehenna’, such will be in a dreadful situation, and further astray from the right way.

35.Munir Mezyed: Verily, We gave ‘Moses’ the ‘Scripture’ and appointed his brother, ‘Aaron’, with him (as) an assistant.

36.Munir Mezyed: Then We said: "Go both of you to the people who deny Our signs (of power & glory) Then (after they had been warned), We destroyed them with complete destruction.

37.Munir Mezyed: The people of ‘Noah’, when they denied the ‘Messengers’, We drowned them, and made them a lesson for the people. We have prepared an extremely painful punishment for those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong.

38.Munir Mezyed: (We also destroyed the people of)  'Aad’, ‘Thamūd’, the ‘companions of the well’ and many generations between them.

39.Munir Mezyed: For each We presented examples; and each We destroyed with complete destruction.

40.Munir Mezyed: Verily they have passed by the township on which was showered with the rain of evil. Can it be that they have not seen it? Nay, they have no expectation of being resurrected.

41.Munir Mezyed: Whenever they see you, they take you not except in ridicule, (saying): "Is this the one whom Allâh has sent as a ‘Messenger’?

42.Munir Mezyed: He would almost have led us astray from our gods if we had not been faithful to them." They will come to know when they see the chastisement, who is more astray from the (right) path.

43.Munir Mezyed: Have you seen the one who takes his self-deceived beliefs as his god? Would you then be a guardian over him?

44.Munir Mezyed: Or do you think that most of them hear (or discern) and understand? They are but like cattle; nay, they are farther astray from the (right) path.

45.Munir Mezyed: Have you not seen how your Lord extend the shadow? If He willed, He would definitely make it still. We have made the sun its indication.

46.Munir Mezyed: Then We slowly draw it back up towards Us.

47.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who makes the night for you to be a garment and sleep for a rest,  and Who makes the day for a rising.

48.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who sends forth the winds as joyful news of His Mercy. We send down pure water from the sky

49.Munir Mezyed: So that We may resuscitate by it a dead land, and give it for drink to many living beings among Our creation, beasts and people.

50.Munir Mezyed: Verily, We distribute it among them, so that they may remember ( Allâh"s blessings). But most of the people refuse except ingratitude.

51.Munir Mezyed: Had We willed, We could have sent a warner into every town.

52.Munir Mezyed: So do not obey those who lack faith (in Allâh) and strive hard against them with this ( 'Qur’ān') in a mighty striving.

53.Munir Mezyed: He is the One who merges the two seas; one palatable and sweet, and the other salty and sour. And He has set a barrier and insuperable partition between them .

54.Munir Mezyed: He is the One who created  man from water and made him kindred of blood and marriage. Lo! Your Lord is Ever All- Powerful.

55.Munir Mezyed: Yet they worship (& venerate), besides Allâh, that which can neither benefit them or harm them. Thus, the one who lack faith in Allâh is a strong supporter (of ‘Satan’) against his own Lord.

56.Munir Mezyed: We have sent you (O’ Muhammad) but as a herald of good tidings, and a warner.

57.Munir Mezyed: Say: “I ask of you no wage for (my efforts to guide you) except that one who may decide to take a way unto his Lord.”

58.Munir Mezyed: Depend on the Ever-Living One with full trust, who dies not, and celebrate His praises and declare His divine glory. Sufficient is He to be the one who is Fully Aware of the sins of His servants.

59.Munir Mezyed: He is the One who created the heavens and earth, and all that is between them in six Days, and then established Himself on the Glorious Throne.  (That is) the Most Beneficent. (O’ Prophet) ask (only) Him about (His divine & majestic qualities), since He is Fully Aware of all things.

60.Munir Mezyed: When it is said unto them: "Prostrate before the Most Beneficent", they say: What is the Most Beneficent? Shall we prostrate before whatever you order us?" Your preaching but increases aversion in them.

61.Munir Mezyed: Most blessed is the One who has placed mansions of the stars in the sky; and He placed therein a tremendous lamp (sun) and luminous moon.

62.Munir Mezyed: He is the One who has appointed the night and the day to succeed one another for whoever seeks to ruminate (on His Sovereignty) or to express his gratitude (to Him).

63.Munir Mezyed: The (devoted) servants of the Most Beneficent (Allâh) are those who walk modestly on the earth, and when the ignorant ones address them, they reply: “Peace."

64.Munir Mezyed: They are the ones who spend the night prostrating themselves before their Lord and standing.

65.Munir Mezyed: (They are) those who say: “Our Lord, save us from entering the torment of ‘Gehenna’! Its torment is definitely an everlasting agony.

66.Munir Mezyed: How dreadful indeed it is as a lodging-place and an abode!"

67.Munir Mezyed: Those who, when they spend, are not recklessly extravagant and not niggardly, but maintain moderation.

68.Munir Mezyed: They never implore and pray to any other god along with Allâh, neither do they kill anyone- since Allâh has made life sacred- except in the cause of justice, nor do they commit adultery, for Whoever commits any of these offense will have to incur an extremely severe penalty.

69.Munir Mezyed: His punishment will be much greater on the ‘Day of Resurrection’, and he will abide therein in disgrace (and humiliation),

70.Munir Mezyed: Except for those who repent, adhere to Islamic monotheism, and do righteous deeds. For such, Allâh will replace their evil deeds with good deeds. Lo! Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

71.Munir Mezyed: Whoever repents and does righteous good deeds has surely turned unto Allâh with sincere repentance.

72.Munir Mezyed: (They are) those who never testify in the favor of falsehood, and when they pass near an evil vain talk, they pass by with sublimity.

73.Munir Mezyed: Those who, when they are reminded of the ‘Revelations’ of their Lord, they  fall not down deaf or blind.

74.Munir Mezyed: And who say: “Our Lord, vouchsafe us the feeling of great pleasure of our wives and of our offspring, and make us an example for the Pious ”( or for  those who show honor and reverence for Allâh/ or for those who guard themselves against falling into temptation or sin)

75.Munir Mezyed: Those will be recompensed with the loftiest dwelling for what they endured patiently (in their struggle for the cause of Allâh), and they will be met therein with a salutation of welcome and peace,

76.Munir Mezyed: Abiding therein. How marvelous it is as a lodging-place and an abode!

77.Munir Mezyed: Say (O’ Muhammad) ""My Lord would not concern Himself with you if it were not for your prayer. Now that you have denied (the Truth), then the punishment is inevitable.

1.Munir Mezyed: Ta. Si’in. Mim!

2.Munir Mezyed: These are the Verses of the most remarkable Book, (the 'Qur’ān').

3.Munir Mezyed: It may be that you, (O’ Muhammad), kill yourself with grief because they are not inclined to believe (in Allâh).

4.Munir Mezyed: If We willed, We could send down on them from the sky a (prodigious) sign  so that their necks would remain bowed in humility before it.

5.Munir Mezyed: Whenever a ‘New Revelation’ comes to them from the All-Merciful (Allâh)  to admonish them, they turn away from it.

6.Munir Mezyed: So they have obstinately refused to give credence to ('Qur’ān'). Thus, the (noteworthy) information of what they scoff at will come to them.

7.Munir Mezyed: Have they not considered the earth in which We caused different types of gracious plants to grow in pairs?

8.Munir Mezyed: verily, in this is a sign (of Allâh's power & glory), yet most of them are not inclined to believe( in Allâh).

9.Munir Mezyed: Absolutely! Your Lord is definitely the One Who is All- Mighty and the Most Merciful.

10.Munir Mezyed: (Remember) when your Lord called ‘Moses’ (saying): "Go to the people who are grossly unfair and morally wrong,

11.Munir Mezyed: The clan of ‘Pharaoh’. Will they not act piously?”

12.Munir Mezyed: ‘Moses’ said: “I fear that they will deny me,

13.Munir Mezyed: And my breast will be straitened. And my tongue is not persuasive in speaking. Thus, send for (my brother) ‘Aaron’ (to accompany me).

14.Munir Mezyed: Beside that, they have a charge (of murder) against me, and I am afraid that they will sentence me to death.”

15.Munir Mezyed: (Allâh) said: "Nay! Go you both with Our signs (of power & glory which I have provided you). We will definitely be with you all, listening attentively.

16.Munir Mezyed: So go, both of you, unto the ‘Pharaoh’ and say: 'We are the ‘Messengers’ of the Lord of the worlds,

17.Munir Mezyed: So permit the ‘Children of Israel’ to go with us.' "

18.Munir Mezyed: ‘Pharaoh’ said "Did we not bring you up among us when you were a child?  You spent so many years of your life among us!

19.Munir Mezyed: Then you committed that (nefarious) deed of yours which you did. And you were one of the ungrateful."

20.Munir Mezyed: (‘Moses’) said: “(I do confess and deeply regret that) I committed that (nefarious) deed (unintentionally) when I was of those who are astray.

21.Munir Mezyed: Thus, I fled from you when I became afraid that you (would sentence me to death), then my Lord vouchsafed me the authority of moral judgments and appointed me as one of (His) Messengers.

22.Munir Mezyed: As for that past favor that you castigate me with (is owed to the fact) that you have (unjustly) enslaved the ‘Children of Israel’."

23.Munir Mezyed: ‘Pharaoh’ said: “What do you mean by the Lord of all the worlds?”

24.Munir Mezyed: ‘Moses’ said: "Lord of the heavens, the earth and all that is between them, if you are convinced with certainty.”

25.Munir Mezyed: ‘Pharaoh’ said unto those around: "Do you not hear (what he is saying)?"

26.Munir Mezyed: ‘Moses’ said : "Your Lord, and the Lord of your forefathers."

27.Munir Mezyed: ‘Pharaoh’ said: Indeed! Your Messenger, who has been sent unto you, is absolutely lunatic.”

28.Munir Mezyed: ‘Moses’ said: "Lord of the east, the west and all that is between them. (For this very reason, you must worship & venerate him) if you do possess high self-awareness that allows you to understand.”

29.Munir Mezyed: ‘Pharaoh’ said: “If it happens that you choose a god other than me, I will definitely put you in jail."

30.Munir Mezyed: ‘Moses’ said: "Even if I brought to you something manifest?"

31.Munir Mezyed: ‘Pharaoh’ said: “Do bring it forth then, if you are of the truthful!"

32.Munir Mezyed: So he cast his staff; and suddenly it turned into veritable serpent.

33.Munir Mezyed: Then he drew forth his hand (from his armpit after placing it therein), it was glittering white in the eyes of the beholders.

34.Munir Mezyed: ‘Pharaoh’ said unto the chiefs around him: “Indeed! This (man) is certainly an expert magician.

35.Munir Mezyed: He seeks to drive you out of your land by his sorcery. Therefore, what do you suggest?"

36.Munir Mezyed: They said: "Give him and his brother respite, and (in the meantime) send forth heralds to all cities,

37.Munir Mezyed: To bring to your presence every expert magician.”

38.Munir Mezyed: Thus, the magicians were assembled for an appointed time of a fixed day.

39.Munir Mezyed: It was said unto the people: "Are you too going to come?

40.Munir Mezyed: They say, “We may follow (the faith of the magicians) if they become victorious.”

41.Munir Mezyed: When the magicians came, they said to ‘Pharaoh’: "We shall certainly obtain a (big) reward, if we attain victory, shall we?"

42.Munir Mezyed: He said: "Yes, indeed. You will then be among the closest senior advisors to me."

43.Munir Mezyed: ‘Moses’ said unto the magicians: "Do throw whatever you are going to throw!"

44.Munir Mezyed: Thus. they threw their ropes and their sticks, (saying): “By the great power of ‘Pharaoh’, it is we who will definitely attain victory."

45.Munir Mezyed: Then ‘Moses’ threw his staff and suddenly it swallowed up what they simulated.

46.Munir Mezyed: Consequently, the magicians were impelled to fall down prostrate,

47.Munir Mezyed: Saying: "We believe in the Lord of all the worlds.

48.Munir Mezyed: The Lord of ‘Moses’ and ‘Aaron’.”

49.Munir Mezyed: (‘Pharaoh’) said: “You have believed in him before I gave you the permission. Certainly he is your chief who taught you sorcery. Therefore, you will definitely come to know (the one who has the impressive power, me or the Lord of ‘Moses’). I will most definitely have your hands and feet cut off alternately, and then I will definitely have you crucified all together. "

50.Munir Mezyed: They said: "No harm! Verily, we are bound to return unto our Lord.

51.Munir Mezyed: Indeed!, we ardently hope that our Lord will redeem us from our sins for we are the first to believe (in the Lord of all the worlds)."

52.Munir Mezyed: We inspired ‘Moses’, saying: “Set forth with My servants by night!  Certainly, you are going to be pursued."

53.Munir Mezyed: ‘Pharaoh’ sent heralds into the cities

54.Munir Mezyed: (Announcing publicly): "Indeed, those are but a small troop,

55.Munir Mezyed: Who are raging furiously against us;

56.Munir Mezyed: And we are truly very cautious multitude.”

57.Munir Mezyed: Thus, We deprived them of gardens, springs,

58.Munir Mezyed: Treasures and honorable status.

59.Munir Mezyed: This is how We caused the ‘Children of Israel’ to inherit these luxuries.

60.Munir Mezyed: Thus, they (‘Pharaoh’ & his host) pursued them at sunrise.

61.Munir Mezyed: When the two hosts came in view of each other, the companions of ‘Moses’ said: "We will be definitely overtaken."

62.Munir Mezyed: ‘Moses’ said: "Nay! Certainly my Lord is with me. He will guide me.”

63.Munir Mezyed: Thus, We inspired ‘Moses’ (saying:) "Strike the sea with your staff.” It parted, and each part became like a great towering mountain.

64.Munir Mezyed: Then We brought the others (‘Pharaoh’ & his host) close to them .

65.Munir Mezyed: Eventually, We saved ‘Moses’ and all those with him.

66.Munir Mezyed: But We drowned the others.

67.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, in (parting the sea) was a sign (of Allâh’s power & glory); yet most of them were not inclined to believe ( in Allâh).

68.Munir Mezyed: Indeed! Your Lord is the One who is absolutely the All- Mighty, the Most Merciful.

69.Munir Mezyed: Recite to them the anecdote of ‘Abraham’.

70.Munir Mezyed: When he said unto his father and his people: " "What is it that which you devotedly worship (& venerate)?"

71.Munir Mezyed: They said: "We worship idols but we shall always be faithfully devoted to them.”

72.Munir Mezyed: He said: "Do they hear you when you implore and pray unto them?”

73.Munir Mezyed: Or do they benefit or harm (you)?"

74.Munir Mezyed: They said: “But we found forefathers doing the same."

75.Munir Mezyed: He said: "So, have you thought carefully about what you have been worshiping,

76.Munir Mezyed: You and all your fathers before you?

77.Munir Mezyed: Surely, they are enemies unto me, except for the Lord of all the worlds,

78.Munir Mezyed: Who created me. Thus, He will guide me (into all the truth).

79.Munir Mezyed: He is the One who feeds me (when I become hungry) and gives me to drink (when I become thirsty).

80.Munir Mezyed: When I become ill, He is the One Who heals me.

81.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who will cause me to die, and then give me life.

82.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Whom I do look forward to forgiving my sins on the ‘Day of Judgment’.

83.Munir Mezyed: My Lord, vouchsafe me the authority of moral judgments, unite me with the righteous,

84.Munir Mezyed: Let my name be mentioned in reverential tones among later generations,

85.Munir Mezyed: Make me one of the inheritors of the garden of the perfect happiness,

86.Munir Mezyed: And forgive my father. Indeed, he is among those who have gone astray.

87.Munir Mezyed: (O’ My Lord), disgrace me not on the day when they will be raised up,

88.Munir Mezyed: The day when neither wealth nor sons will avail,

89.Munir Mezyed: Except for the one who comes unto Allâh with a sound heart.”

90.Munir Mezyed: ‘Al-Jannah’ will be brought near (that day) to the Pious ( or to those who show honor and reverence for Allâh/ or to those who guard themselves against falling into temptation or sin).

91.Munir Mezyed: And ‘Gehenna’ will appear plainly visible to the beguilers.

92.Munir Mezyed: It will be said unto them: "Where are those that you used to worship

93.Munir Mezyed: Instead of Allâh?  Will they be able to help you or help themselves?”

94.Munir Mezyed: Then they will be overturned into the (inferno),  they and the beguilers

95.Munir Mezyed: And the soldiers of ‘Iblīs’ (-Satan-), all together.

96.Munir Mezyed: They will say while blaming one another therein:

97.Munir Mezyed: "By Allâh (the Lord of all the worlds), we were truly lost in utter deception

98.Munir Mezyed: When we considered you to be the same as the Lord of all the worlds.

99.Munir Mezyed: No one had the ability to lead us into error except the ungodly sinners.

102.Munir Mezyed: (What a pity!) If we could only have a chance to return (to the ‘worldly life’), then we would definitely become among the Monotheistic Believers.”

103.Munir Mezyed: In (the anecdote of ‘Abraham’) is definitely a lesson, yet most of them (who heard the anecdote) are still tempted to disbelieve ( in Allâh).

104.Munir Mezyed: Indeed! Your Lord is the One who is absolutely the All- Mighty, the Most Merciful.

105.Munir Mezyed: The people of ‘Noah’ obstinately refused to believe the Messengers (of Allâh, the Lord of all the worlds).

106.Munir Mezyed: When their brother ‘Noah’ said unto them: “ Will you not act piously?

107.Munir Mezyed: Lo! I am a Faithful Messenger (of your Lord) to you,

108.Munir Mezyed: Thus, act piously towards Allâh and obey me.

109.Munir Mezyed: I ask of you no reward for (my efforts to guide you into all the truth). My reward comes from the Lord of all the worlds.

110.Munir Mezyed: Thus, act piously towards Allâh and follow me.

111.Munir Mezyed: They said: “How do you expect us to believe you when you are followed by a group that has the lowest status.”

112.Munir Mezyed: He said: “What knowledge have I of what they used to do?

113.Munir Mezyed: Their reckoning rests with none but my Lord; if only you could become aware (of the ultimate truth).

114.Munir Mezyed: I am not the one who is going to drive away those who accept (Allâh into their life)

115.Munir Mezyed: I am just a plain warner (who gives you sufficient warning about how to avoid Hellfire).”

116.Munir Mezyed: They said: “If it happens that you do not cease (this nonsense), O’ ‘Noah’, you will definitely be of those who are stoned (to death)."

117.Munir Mezyed: He said: "O’ My Lord, indeed, my people obstinately refused to believe me.

118.Munir Mezyed: Thus, do judge between them and me with definitive judgment, and save me and those who are with me of the monotheistic believers.”

119.Munir Mezyed: So We saved him and those with him in the laden ark.

120.Munir Mezyed: Then, afterward We drowned the others.

121.Munir Mezyed: In (saving ‘Noah’ and the monotheistic believers and drowning the faithless people) is definitely a lesson, yet most of them (who heard about the dreadful end of the people of ‘Noah’) are not inclined to believe ( in Allâh).

122.Munir Mezyed: Indeed! Your Lord is the One who is absolutely the All- Mighty, the Most Merciful.

123.Munir Mezyed: (The people of) 'Aad’ obstinately refused to believe the ‘Messengers’ (of Allâh).

124.Munir Mezyed: When ‘Hūd’, their brother, said to them, ‘Will you not act piously towards Allâh?

125.Munir Mezyed: Lo! I am a faithful ‘Messenger’ of your Lord to you,

126.Munir Mezyed: Thus, act piously towards Allâh and follow me.

127.Munir Mezyed: I ask of you no reward for (my efforts to guide you into all the truth). My reward comes from the Lord of all the worlds.

128.Munir Mezyed: Do you build on every hill a lofty fortress for vain pleasure?

129.Munir Mezyed: You take for yourselves mansions as if you were going to live forever,

130.Munir Mezyed: Yet when you seize, you seize as tyrants.

131.Munir Mezyed: Thus, act piously towards Allâh and follow me.

132.Munir Mezyed: Act piously toward the one who amply provides you with (many great tangible gifts) that you know.

133.Munir Mezyed: He provides you with cattle and children,

135.Munir Mezyed: Lo! I fear for you the punishment of a hazardous day."

136.Munir Mezyed: They said: "It is all the same to us whether you preach, or are not of the preachers.

137.Munir Mezyed: This (our faith) is no other than the custom and tradition of the ancients,

138.Munir Mezyed: And we are not going to be chastised."

139.Munir Mezyed: Thus, they obstinately refused to believe him; consequently, we utterly destroyed them. In ( devastating 'Aad’) is definitely a lesson, yet most of them (who know the dreadful end of ‘Aad’) are not inclined to believe ( in Allâh)

140.Munir Mezyed: Indeed! Your Lord is the One who is absolutely the All- Mighty, the Most Merciful.

141.Munir Mezyed: (The people of) ‘Thamūd’ obstinately refused to believe the Messengers (of Allâh).

142.Munir Mezyed: When ‘Sālih’, their brother, said unto them, ‘‘Will you act piously towards Allâh?

143.Munir Mezyed: Lo! I am a Faithful ‘Messenger’ of your Lord to you,

144.Munir Mezyed: Thus, act piously towards Allâh and follow me.

145.Munir Mezyed: I ask of you no reward for (my efforts to guide you into all the truth). My reward comes from the Lord of all the worlds.

146.Munir Mezyed: "(Do you presume that) you will be left secure forever in what is here before us,

148.Munir Mezyed: Tilled fields and date-palms with tender spadix;

149.Munir Mezyed: And that you will keep on skillfully craving houses out of mountains?

150.Munir Mezyed: Thus, act piously towards Allâh and follow me.

151.Munir Mezyed: Follow not the creed of the prodigals

152.Munir Mezyed: Who excessively indulge in corruption on the earth and seek not to improve the welfare of others.”

153.Munir Mezyed: They said: "You are  of those who are bewitched!

154.Munir Mezyed: You are not more than a human being like us. (In order for us to believe your words), you must bring to us a (miraculous) sign if you are of the truthful."

155.Munir Mezyed: He said: "This is a she- camel (that you requested). Thus, it has the right to have a portion of the water to drink, and you have your portion of water to drink, on a day appointed.

156.Munir Mezyed: Touch it not with evil lest the divine retribution of a great day would seize you.”

157.Munir Mezyed: However, they hamstrung it, and then they became regretful.

158.Munir Mezyed: Thus, divine retribution overtook them. In (devastating ‘Thamūd’) is definitely a lesson, yet most of them (who heard about the dreadful end of ‘Thamūd’) are not inclined to believe ( in Allâh) .

159.Munir Mezyed: Indeed! Your Lord is the One who is absolutely the All- Mighty, the Most Merciful.

160.Munir Mezyed: (The people of) ‘Lot’ obstinately refused to believe the ‘Messengers’ (of Allâh).

161.Munir Mezyed: When ‘Lot’, their brother, said to them, “Will you act piously towards Allâh?

162.Munir Mezyed: Lo! I am a Faithful ‘Messenger’ of your Lord unto you,

163.Munir Mezyed: Thus, act piously towards Allâh and follow me.

164.Munir Mezyed: I ask of you no rearward for (my efforts to guide you into all the truth). My reward comes from the Lord of all the worlds.

165.Munir Mezyed: What! Of all creatures, do you approach males

166.Munir Mezyed: Whilst leaving your wives that your Lord created for you? Nay! You are a transgressing people!"

167.Munir Mezyed: They said: “If it happens that you cease not (this nonsense), O’ Lot, you will definitely be of those who are outcast.”

168.Munir Mezyed: He said: “I definitely loathe what you do.

169.Munir Mezyed: O’ my Lord, save me and my family from what they do."

170.Munir Mezyed: Thus, We saved him and his family, all,

171.Munir Mezyed: Except for an old woman (his wife) among those who remained behind.

172.Munir Mezyed: Then afterward We utterly destroyed the others.

173.Munir Mezyed: We rained on them (an evil) rain. Extremely dreadful was the rain of those who had been warned.

174.Munir Mezyed: In (devastating lot) is definitely a lesson, yet most of them (who heard about the dreadful end of Lot) are not inclined to believe (in Allâh).

175.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, Your Lord is  All- Mighty, the Most Merciful.

176.Munir Mezyed: The ‘companions of the wood’ (brushwood or thicket) obstinately refused to believe the ‘Messengers’ (of Allâh).

177.Munir Mezyed: When  Shuʿayb said to them: “Will you act piously?

178.Munir Mezyed: Lo! I am a Faithful ‘Messenger’ of your Lord unto you,

179.Munir Mezyed: Thus, act piously towards Allâh and follow me.

180.Munir Mezyed: I ask of you no reward for (my efforts to guide you into all the truth). My reward comes from the Lord of all the worlds.

181.Munir Mezyed: Give full measure, do not be of those who minify,

182.Munir Mezyed: And weigh (things) with the true and straight balance!

183.Munir Mezyed: Do not underestimate (the value of) the property of the people, or be involved in spreading corruption on the earth.

184.Munir Mezyed: Thus, act piously towards the One who created you and the former generation."

185.Munir Mezyed: They said: "You are of those who are bewitched!

186.Munir Mezyed: You are not more than a human being like us; and we think that you are one of the liars!

187.Munir Mezyed: Thus, do let a piece of the sky fall upon us if you are of the truthful!"

188.Munir Mezyed: He said: "My Lord is fully aware of what you do."

189.Munir Mezyed: Thus, they obstinately refused to believe him; consequently the divine retribution of the day of overshadowing overtook them. Surely it was the divine retribution of serious day.

190.Munir Mezyed: In (annihilating the ‘companions of the wood’) is definitely a lesson, yet most of them (who heard about the dreadful end of the ‘companions of the wood’) are not inclined to believe ( in Allâh).

191.Munir Mezyed: Indeed! Your Lord is the All- Mighty, the Most Merciful.

192.Munir Mezyed: Absolutely, this ( 'Qur’ān') is a ‘Revelation’ from the Lord of all the worlds.

193.Munir Mezyed: The faithful Spirit (‘Gabriel’) has brought it down

194.Munir Mezyed: Upon your heart, (O’ ‘Muhammad’), so that you may give warnings

196.Munir Mezyed: It has been prophesied in the Scriptures of the ancients.

197.Munir Mezyed: Is it not a sign to them that the distinguished scholars of the ‘Children of Israel’ know it?

198.Munir Mezyed: If We had revealed it  ( 'Qur’ān') unto any other nation than the Arabs,

199.Munir Mezyed: And he had recited it to them, they would not have believed in it.

200.Munir Mezyed: This is how We let it pass unheeded though the hearts of those who keep on falling into sin.

201.Munir Mezyed: They will never believe in it until they see the painful doom.

202.Munir Mezyed: It will come to them unexpectedly, while they lack the ability to perceive it.

203.Munir Mezyed: Then they will say: "Are we going to obtain a respite?”

204.Munir Mezyed: Do they still hope for Our divine retribution  to be hastened?

205.Munir Mezyed: Have you then considered if We give them enjoyment for years

206.Munir Mezyed: And then there comes to them that with which they are threatened?

207.Munir Mezyed: All that which they used to enjoy will not benefit them.

208.Munir Mezyed: We never destroyed a town before sending a warner

209.Munir Mezyed: To warn them. We have never been iniquitous (towards Our servants).

210.Munir Mezyed: It is not the devils who have brought down this ( 'Qur’ān').

211.Munir Mezyed: It will neither be convenient for them, nor they will be able (to produce it).

212.Munir Mezyed: Surely they are completely debarred even from hearing it.

213.Munir Mezyed: Thus, invoke not beside Allâh, any other god, lest you become of those who will be chastised.

214.Munir Mezyed: Warn (O’ ‘Muhammad’) your tribe of near kindred (of the consequences of their sinful deeds)!

215.Munir Mezyed: Lower your wing to those ‘Monotheistic Believers’ who follow you!

216.Munir Mezyed: If it happens that they fail to obey you, then say: "Indeed, I am innocent from what you are doing."

217.Munir Mezyed: Depend on the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful with full trust,

218.Munir Mezyed: Who sees you when you arise (in the midnight to pray)

219.Munir Mezyed: And your arduous effort in prostration among those who prostrate.

220.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.

221.Munir Mezyed: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?

222.Munir Mezyed: They descend upon every sinful impostor.

223.Munir Mezyed: They give ear, but most of them are liars.

224.Munir Mezyed: As for the poets, those who keep on falling into temptation follow them,

225.Munir Mezyed: Do you not see that they wander in every valley,

226.Munir Mezyed: And that they say what they do not do?

227.Munir Mezyed: Except for those (poets) who adhere to Islamic monotheism and do righteous acts, celebrate the Praises of Allâh frequently and vindicate themselves after they have been wronged. Those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong will come to know by what overturning they will be overturned.

1.Munir Mezyed: Ta. Si’in!. These are the ‘Verses’ of the  'Qur’ān' and of the genuine Book.

2.Munir Mezyed: (This 'Qur’ān') is a source of inner guidance and spiritual transformation, and joyful news for the ‘Monotheistic Believers'.

3.Munir Mezyed: Those who establish the regular Prayer, pay Zakāt and acknowledge the existence of the ‘Hereafter’.

4.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who refuse to admit the truth of the Hereafter, We have beautified their (sinful) deeds in their eyes so that they may continue to wander blindly.

5.Munir Mezyed: These are they who shall have an awful chastisement, and in the ‘Hereafter’  they will be the ones who are doomed to eternal perdition.

6.Munir Mezyed: Surely, you, (O’ ‘Muhammad’), are receiving this ( Glorious) 'Qur’ān' from the One, (who is) All-Wise, All-Knowing.

7.Munir Mezyed: (Mention) when ‘Moses’ said unto his family: "Surely I see a fire. I will bring you news thence, or I will bring you a burning torch, so that you may warm yourselves.

8.Munir Mezyed: As soon as he reached it, he was called: “Blessed is whosoever is in the fire, and whosoever is round it! Glory be to Allâh, the Lord of all the worlds!

9.Munir Mezyed: O’ ‘Moses’! Indeed, it is I, Allâh, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

10.Munir Mezyed: Do cast down your stick!” When he saw it moving as if it were a serpent, he turned in flight and returned not. (Then he was called again): "O’ ‘Moses’, do not be afraid. Lo! The ‘Messengers’ (of Allâh) do not (have any reason) to be afraid in My Presence,

11.Munir Mezyed: Except for the one who does wrong and afterwards change evil for good. Lo! I am Oft- Forgiving, Most Merciful.

12.Munir Mezyed: Put your (right) hand into your bosom, it will come forth glittering white without patches (on the skin).  (These are) among the nine (miraculous) signs (for you to show them) to ‘Pharaoh’ and his clan. Indeed, they are sons of disobedience.”

13.Munir Mezyed: But when Our signs ( of power & glory) came to them, they said: “This is an apparent sorcery (and devilry).”

14.Munir Mezyed: They became impious towards them unjustly and arrogantly, although their own selves were convinced thereof. Thus, look and see how (dreadful) was the consequence of those who spread corruption!

15.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We endowed ‘David’ and ‘Solomon’ with knowledge of truth, and they said: "All the praises and gratitude belong unto Allâh who has preferred us above so many of His Pious servants!”

16.Munir Mezyed: ‘Solomon’ inherited ‘David’. He said: “O’ people, we have been taught the language of birds; and we have been granted of all things. This is indeed an apparent act of kindness beyond what is due.”

17.Munir Mezyed: His soldiers of the jinn, men and birds were assembled before ‘Solomon’, and they all were set in rows.

18.Munir Mezyed: Until, when they came upon the valley of the ants, one of the ants said: “O’ ants, enter your dwellings, lest ‘Solomon’ and his soldiers crush you, while they perceive not."

19.Munir Mezyed: Thus, ‘Solomon’ smiled, amused at its speech and said: “O’ My Lord, grant me the power to be grateful to You for Your generous favor which You have bestowed upon me, and upon my parents so as to behave righteously in a manner that will be well-pleasing to You, and admit me by Your (divine) clemency among Your righteous servants.”

20.Munir Mezyed: He inspected the birds, and said: "How is it that I do not see the hoopoe (here)? Or is it among the absentees?

21.Munir Mezyed: I will definitely punish it with a stern punishment, or slaughter it, unless it brings me good reason.”

22.Munir Mezyed: However, the hoopoe has not tarried too long. (After returning), it said: “I have compassed which you have not compassed; and I have come to you from Saba’ with true news.”

23.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, I found (there) a woman ruling over them, who is blessed with everything, possessing a majestic throne.

24.Munir Mezyed: I found her and her people venerating and idolizing the sun instead of Allâh, (the Lord of all the worlds). The devil has beautified their (sinful deed) in their eyes. Thus, he was able to keep them away from the (right) path so that they may remain spiritually blind.

25.Munir Mezyed: And that they will not prostrate before Allâh who brings forth what is hidden in the heavens and earth, and who knows whatever you hide and whatever you disclose.

26.Munir Mezyed: (It is) Allâh, (the Lord of all the worlds), there is no  God but Him, the Lord of the Supreme Throne.”

27.Munir Mezyed: ‘Solomon’ said: "We shall (investigate) and see whether you are telling (us) the truth; or you are of the liars.

28.Munir Mezyed: Go you with this letter of mine and throw it down to them Then turn back from them and see what they will return."

29.Munir Mezyed: She (-the queen of Sheba-) said: "O’ noble chiefs, an honorable letter has been thrown to me.

30.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, it is from (king) ‘Solomon’, and it is: 'In the name of Allâh, the Most Beneficent, the Most Merciful;

31.Munir Mezyed: Do not act arrogantly toward me, but come to me in submission as Muslims.'"

32.Munir Mezyed: She said: "O’ noble chiefs, advise me what I should do regarding this matter of mine. I ‘d never decide anything unless you were present with me."

33.Munir Mezyed: They said: "We do possess the quality of being strong and the quality of being brave in battle, but the command is yours. Thus, think carefully about what you will command."

34.Munir Mezyed: She said: “Surely the kings, when they enter a township, they sabotage it, and degrade its noblemen. This is what they do.

35.Munir Mezyed: Surely I am going to send a gift to them, and to see with what (answer) the messengers return."

36.Munir Mezyed: So when (the envoys) came to (king) ‘Solomon’, he said: “Do you think we seek financial support? What Allâh has given me is far better than that which He has given you. Nay, you are the ones who are rejoicing in your gift!

37.Munir Mezyed: Return to them! We shall definitely come to them with an army which they have no power to confront; and we shall definitely drive them out from there, dishonored and completely debased."

38.Munir Mezyed: He said: "O’ noble chiefs, which of you can bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?"

39.Munir Mezyed: One strong from the jinn said: "I will bring it to you before you rise from your place. Indeed, I am strong, and trustworthy for such work."

40.Munir Mezyed: One who had the knowledge of the book said: "I will bring it to you within the twinkling of an eye!" Then, when he saw it settled before him, he said: "This is by the grace of my Lord so as to test me whether I will show gratitude or become impious. Thus, whoever shows gratitude shows gratitude to the good of his own self. Whoever becomes impious (needs to know that) my Lord is absolutely Self-sufficient, Most Generous.”

41.Munir Mezyed: He said: "Disguise her throne for her! Let us see whether she will be rightly guided or will be of those who are banned from receiving  spiritual insight."

42.Munir Mezyed: So, when she came, it was said (unto her): "Is your throne like this?" She said: "It is similar in every detail.” (king ‘Solomon’ said):” We were given the knowledge before her; and we had submitted ourselves ( entirely to Allâh, the Lord of all the worlds). "

43.Munir Mezyed: What she used to worship (& venerate) other than Allâh prevented her (from submission to Him), for she belonged to a people who lack Faith ( in Allâh).

44.Munir Mezyed: It was said unto her: "Enter the palace." But when she saw it, she thought it was a pool, and bared her legs. (‘Solomon’) said: "Indeed, it is a palace paved with crystal." She said: "My Lord, indeed I have wronged myself; and I submit (myself entirely with ‘Solomon’ to Allâh, the Lord of all the worlds."

45.Munir Mezyed: And verily We sent to (the people of) ‘Thamūd’ their brother, 'Sālih', saying: "Worship (& venerate) Allâh Alone." (As soon as he started preaching to them the message), they split into two parties quarreling with each other."

46.Munir Mezyed: He said: "O’ my people, why do you hasten to commit evil deed rather than doing righteous good deed? Why do you not ask forgiveness of Allâh so that you may be delivered from the consequences of your sins”

47.Munir Mezyed: They said: "We augur bad omen from your part and from those who chose to convert to your faith. He said: "Your evil augury is with Allâh. You are a people who are led into temptation.”

48.Munir Mezyed: In the city (of Thamūd), there were a company of nine persons (among their chiefs), who were indulging in corruption in the land, and were not willing to reform (their ways).

49.Munir Mezyed: They said: "Let us swear one to another by Allâh that we shall make a sudden surprise attack on him and his household (during the night), and afterwards we will definitely say to his first-degree relative: 'We witnessed not the killing of his family. We are absolutely telling the truth.”

50.Munir Mezyed: However, they devised an evil plan on the very spot, and We likewise planned a plan on the very spot, while they perceived not (the outcome of their evil plan).

51.Munir Mezyed: Thus, look and see how (dreadful) was the outcome of their evil plan. Lo! We destroyed them completely as well as their people, all of them.

52.Munir Mezyed: So those are their houses empty and left deserted because they were grossly unfair and morally wrong. Indeed, (in devastating ‘Thamūd’) is a lesson for a people who have  spiritual gift of knowledge .

53.Munir Mezyed: On the other hand, We saved those who placed their faith (in Allâh) and used to act piously.

54.Munir Mezyed: (Mention) ‘Lot’ when he said unto his people: “What! Do you commit such an obscenity, overtly, while you see?

55.Munir Mezyed: What! Do you indeed approach men lustfully instead of women? Nay, but you are truly a people in ignorance”(of the consequence of your conducts).

56.Munir Mezyed: But the response of his people was naught except that they said: "Drive out the family of ‘Lot’ from your township. Indeed, they are people who would like to keep themselves pure and immaculate.”

57.Munir Mezyed: Thus, We saved him and his family, except for his (sinful) wife. We destined for her to be one of those who remained behind.

58.Munir Mezyed: We poured down on them a a shower (of stones of hard clay). Evil indeed is the shower of those who have been warned.

59.Munir Mezyed: (O’ ‘Muhammad’), say: "All the praises and gratitude belong to Allâh! Peace be upon His (pious) servants, whom He has been chosen (to convey & promulgate (His Message)! Is Allâh better or (the mythological deities) they associate with Him?"

60.Munir Mezyed: Is not He (better than the mythological deities)? He is the One who created the heavens and earth, sending down for you water from the sky, causing to grow thereby gardens of delightful beauty, which you could not have grown the trees thereof. What! Is there any god other than Allâh? Nay! But they are a people who ascribe equals to Him.

61.Munir Mezyed: Is not He (better than the mythological deities)? He is the One who has made the earth a stable place where He placed rivers in its midst, appointed for it firm hills and set up a barrier between the two seas (i.e. between the salty and the sweet water). What! Is there any god other than Allâh? Nay! But most of them they do lack knowledge (of Allâh's Power & Glory).

62.Munir Mezyed: Is not He (better than the mythological deities)? He is the One who answers the desperate one when he implores and prays to Him, and who removes the evil (that touches you) and makes you inheritors of the earth. What! Is there any god other than Allâh? Little is that which you remember!

63.Munir Mezyed: Is not He (better than the mythological deities)? He is the One who leads you out of the veils of darkness of the land and the sea, and who sends the winds a herald of joyful news before His (divine) clemency. What! Is there any god other than Allâh? Highly Exalted is Allâh above all that which they associate with Him as partners.

64.Munir Mezyed: Is not He (better than the mythological deities)? He is the One Who originates the creation, then repeats it, and who supplies you with provision from the heaven and earth. What! Is there any god other than Allâh? (O’ ‘Muhammad’), say (unto them): “"Bring forth your clear evidence, if you are truthful."

65.Munir Mezyed: (O’ ‘Muhammad’), say: "No one in the heaven or on the earth does (really) know the (secrets of) unseen except Allâh, neither do they perceive when they will be resurrected."

66.Munir Mezyed: Nay, their knowledge fails them as to grasp the 'Hereafter’. But the fact is that  they are skeptical about it. The truth is that they are kept blind to it.

67.Munir Mezyed: Those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) say: "What! When we have become dust as well as our forefathers, shall we really be brought forth (again)?

68.Munir Mezyed: Verily, we have been promised this, we and our forefathers before. This is not more than legends (or myths) of the ancients."

69.Munir Mezyed: (O’ ‘Muhammad’), say: "Travel in the land and see how (dreadful) was the outcome of the ungodly sinners..”

70.Munir Mezyed: (O’ ‘Muhammad’), grieve not for them, and stop being hard on yourself because of what they intrigue.

71.Munir Mezyed: They say: “When will this promise be fulfilled, if you are truthful?”

72.Munir Mezyed: (O’ ‘Muhammad’), say: "It may well be that something of that which you seek to hasten has drawn quite near behind you.

73.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, your Lord is extremely bountiful for mankind, but most of them do not give thanks (to Him for His endless blessings).”

74.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, Allâh knows perfectly well what their hearts conceal and what they disclose.

75.Munir Mezyed: There is nothing in the heavens or on the earth but it is in a comprehensive book.

76.Munir Mezyed: Absolutely, this (Glorious) 'Qur’ān' narrates to the ‘Children of Israel’ most of that about which they differ.

77.Munir Mezyed: It is certainly a source of spiritual insight and a clemency for the ‘Monotheistic Believers’ (who seek salvation).

78.Munir Mezyed: Certainly your Lord will decide between them by His Judgment. He is the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing.

79.Munir Mezyed: Thus, depend on Allâh with full trust! You are absolutely on the apparent truth.

80.Munir Mezyed: Surely you cannot make the dead to hear, nor can you make the deaf to hear the call , (mostly) when they go back retreating.

81.Munir Mezyed: Nor can you lead the blind out of their error. You can only make those hear who believe in Our ‘Verses’ and so have submitted (themselves entirely to the authority of Allâh).

82.Munir Mezyed: When the time for the fulfillment of the word  against them is about to come, We will bring forth for them a living creature from the earth that will say unto them that : ‘People have no certainty in Our Verses.”

83.Munir Mezyed: The day will come when We gather out of every nation a group of those who used to belie Our ‘Revelations’. They will be set in rows

84.Munir Mezyed: Till, when they arrive (at the place of reckoning), He will say: Did you belie My ‘Verses’ while you did not (try to) investigate thoroughly (so as to determine their nature), or what was it that you have been doing?"

85.Munir Mezyed: The word will be fulfilled against them because they were grossly unfair and morally wrong. Thus, they will be incapable of defending themselves.

86.Munir Mezyed: Have they not seen that We made the night for them to rest therein, and the day a sight-giving (for them to labor and strive)? Certainly there are signs (of Allâh's Power and Glory) for the people who place their faith in Allâh.

87.Munir Mezyed: The day will come when the Trumpet is blown. Thus, all those who are in the heaven and all those who are on the earth will be horrified except those whom Allâh intends to exempt. All will come to him, completely humbled.

88.Munir Mezyed: Seeing the mountains (on that day), you will think that they are solid, while they will pass as the passing of clouds. This is the artistic work of Allâh, who perfected all things. Indeed, He is Fully Aware of what you do.

89.Munir Mezyed: Whoever brings a single righteous good deed, he will have better than it, and such will be safe from the horror of that day.

90.Munir Mezyed: On the other hand, whoever brings a single evil deed, such will be thrown down on their faces into the Fire. (It will be said unto them): "Are you requited except for that which you used to do?"

91.Munir Mezyed: (O’ ‘Muhammad’, say unto all the people): "I have been commanded only to worship (& venerate) the Lord of this city, (Mecca), who has sanctified it; and unto Him belongs all things. I am commanded to be one of those who submit (themselves entirely to the authority of Allâh),

92.Munir Mezyed: And to recite the ‘Qur'an." Lo! If anyone accepts to receive spiritual insight, he will do it for the benefit of his own self, and if anyone strays, say: "I am only a warner.”

93.Munir Mezyed: (O’ ‘Muhammad’), say: "All the praises and gratitude belong to Allâh! He will show you His Signs (of power & glory), and you will be able to recognize them. Your Lord is not oblivious to that which you do.

1.Munir Mezyed: Ta. Si’in. Mim!

2.Munir Mezyed: These are the ( Holy) ‘Verses’ of the ‘Distinctive Book’,

3.Munir Mezyed: We narrate to you the anecdote of ‘Moses’ and ‘Pharaoh’ with truth for the people who place their faith in (Allâh).

4.Munir Mezyed: ‘Pharaoh’ became an arrogant tyrant in the land and made its people sects, persecuting one (ethnic) group, slaughtering their sons and sparing their women. Surely, he was one of those who spread corruption.

5.Munir Mezyed: However, We intended to bestow Our Favor upon those who are persecuted in the land, to make them (spiritual) leaders and inheritors,

6.Munir Mezyed: And to establish them in the land with authority, but in the meantime, we intended to let ‘Pharaoh, ’Hāmān’ and their hosts experience that of which they were apprehensive.

7.Munir Mezyed: We inspired the mother of ‘Moses’, (saying): "Suckle him; but when you fear for his life, cast him into the river. Let not fear stop you from doing this, neither do you let your heart be troubled. We shall definitely bring him back to you. And We shall make him one of (Our) Messengers.”

8.Munir Mezyed: Consequently, the family of ‘Pharaoh’ picked him up so that he might become an enemy to them and (a source of) grief. Surely, ‘Pharaoh, ’Hāmān’ and their hosts were malefactors.

9.Munir Mezyed: The wife of ‘Pharaoh’ said: “(This is a) source of comfort to me as well as to you. Thus, do not kill him! Maybe he will be of some benefit for us, or we may adopt him as a son.” They were not aware of (what fate had in store for them).

10.Munir Mezyed: (On the other hand), the heart of Moses’ mother became hollow. She would have almost disclosed (the truth about) him if We had not strengthened her heart so that she would be of those who place their Faith ( Allâh).

11.Munir Mezyed: She said unto his sister: "Follow him!” Thus, she secretly watched him from a distance while they were not aware (of her observation).

12.Munir Mezyed: We had already forbidden wet nurses for him. Thus, (his sister) said: "Shall I direct you to a household that will nurse him for you, and sincerely they will take good care of him?"

13.Munir Mezyed: Thus, We restored him to his mother so that she would be in ecstasy;  that she would forget (all her) sorrows, and that she would come to know that the promise of Allâh is true. But most of them know not.

14.Munir Mezyed: When he attained his full strength and became mature, We bestowed upon him the authority of moral judgments and divine knowledge. This is how We do reward those whose heart is perfect towards Allâh.

15.Munir Mezyed: (One day) he surreptitiously entered the city without being noticed by its people. He found therein two men fighting, one of his own ethnicity, and the other of his enemies. The one from his own ethnicity called on him for help against his foe. Thus,  ‘Moses’ struck him upon the face with his fist and (unintentionally) killed him. He said: ”This (fighting) is an act of devil. Indeed, he is a genuine deceiver and veritable enemy.”

16.Munir Mezyed: He said: “My Lord, surely I have been grossly unfair towards myself, so forgive me." Then He forgave him. Indeed, He is the One who is the Oft-Forgiving, the Most Merciful.

17.Munir Mezyed: He said: "My Lord, for the favor You bestowed upon me, I will never be a supporter of the ungodly sinners."

18.Munir Mezyed: Now, in the morning, he was in the city, frightening and prudent. Unexpectedly the man, who had sought his help the day before, called him again for his help. ‘Moses’ said unto him: "You are obviously a petulant person."

19.Munir Mezyed: So when he intended to attack the man who was an enemy to both of them, the man said: “O ‘Moses’, do you want to kill me as you killed a man yesterday? You seek nothing but to be tyrant in the land, and you do not want to be of those who strive improve the welfare of others.”

20.Munir Mezyed: Then a man came running from the farthest end of the city and said: "’Moses’, the noble chiefs are consulting each other regarding your case to kill you. Thus, I advise you to leave (the city as soon as possible). Indeed, I am giving you a good advice.”

21.Munir Mezyed: He fled the city, frightening and prudent. He said: "My Lord, save me from those people who are grossly unfair and morally wrong."

22.Munir Mezyed: When he directed himself towards Midian, he said: “I do hope that my Lord will lead me into the right way."

23.Munir Mezyed: As soon as he arrived at the water stream of Midian, he found there a group of men watering (their flocks); and he found besides them two women keeping back (their flocks). He asked (the two women): "What is the matter with you?" They replied: "We cannot water (our flocks) until the shepherds take back theirs. (As you see, we are hopeless two women) and our father is an old man.”

24.Munir Mezyed: Thus, he watered their flocks for them. Then he turned aside into the shade, and said: “My Lord! Indeed, I am in need of whatever good You would send down upon me.”

25.Munir Mezyed: Then one of the two women came to him walking bashfully, and said: “Indeed, my father would like to invite you so as to pay you for watering our flock for us.” So when ‘Moses’ came to him and told him all he thought prudent to disclose of his story.  (The father of the two women) said: “Do not be afraid! You have been saved from the people who are grossly unfair and morally wrong."

26.Munir Mezyed: One of the two daughters said: "O’ my father, employ him! The best one you can employ is the strong and the trustworthy."

27.Munir Mezyed: He said: "I intend to let you wed one of these, my two daughters, on the condition that you serve me for eight years. But if you complete ten years, then  it will be (a favor) from your part. I have no intention of letting you work extremely hard. You will find me, if Allâh wills, one of the righteous."

28.Munir Mezyed: He said: “This will be between you and me. Whichever of the two terms I fulfill, there will be no injustice done to me, and Allâh is Surety over what we say.

29.Munir Mezyed: Then, when ‘Moses’ had fulfilled the term, and was travelling with his family, he spotted a fire on the side of the Mount (Sinai).  He said unto his family: “Stay where you are! I have seen a fire far off. I may bring you from there some information or a burning brand from the fire so that you may warm yourselves."

30.Munir Mezyed: As soon as he reached it, he was called from the right side of the valley, in the blessed spot, from the tree: "O’ Moses, surely I am Allâh, the Lord of all the worlds.

31.Munir Mezyed: Do cast down your stick!” When he saw it moving as if it were a serpent, he turned in flight and returned not. (Then he was called again): "O’ ‘Moses’, come forward and do not be afraid!  You are indeed of those who are secure.

32.Munir Mezyed: (Now) put your (right) hand into your bosom, it will come forth glittering white without patches (on the skin). Hold your arms close to you as protection from fear, for those are two proofs from your Lord to ‘Pharaoh’ and his personal advisors. Lo! they are sons of disobedience. ”

33.Munir Mezyed: He said: "My Lord! Indeed, I killed a man and I fear that they will kill me.

34.Munir Mezyed: My brother ‘Aaron’ is more eloquent than me in speech. Thus, let him accompany me as a helper to confirm me. Lo! I (also) fear that they will not believe me.”

35.Munir Mezyed: Allâh said: "We will strengthen your arm through your brother; and We will give you both supremacy so they will not be able to reach you. By Our Signs (of power and glory), you and those who follow you, will be the victorious.”

36.Munir Mezyed: But when ‘Moses’ came to them with Our Signs as intelligible and conclusive proofs, they said: "This is nothing but a fabricated sorcery (and devilry). We never heard of such a thing among our forefathers."

37.Munir Mezyed: ‘Moses’ said: "My Lord knows best him who came with guidance (into all the truth) from Him, and to whom the ultimate abode of ecstasy will be his ( in the ‘Hereafter’). Surely those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong will never ever achieve a blissful life/ or gain eternal salvation..”

38.Munir Mezyed: ‘Pharaoh’ said: O’ noble chiefs, I know not that you have another god besides me. Thus, kindle a fire for me, O’ Hāmān, to bake bricks, and make me a lofty tower so that I may be able to have a look at the God of ‘Moses’, although I am inclined to believe that he is a liar”.

39.Munir Mezyed: He and his hosts acted arrogantly in the land without right, and they thought that they would not be brought back to Us.

40.Munir Mezyed: Eventually, We seized him and his hosts. And We threw them all into the sea. Thus, look and see how (dreadful) was the outcome of those who were grossly unfair and morally wrong.

41.Munir Mezyed: We made them, (-the iniquitous-), leaders inviting (people) to the Fire, and on the ‘Day of Resurrection’, they will not be helped.

42.Munir Mezyed: We have caused a curse to chase them in this ‘worldly life’, and on the ‘Day of Resurrection', they will be among the despicable.

43.Munir Mezyed: Verily, We gave ‘Moses’, after We had utterly destroyed the former generations, the ‘Scripture’ as enlightenment (or edification) for the people, a guide (into all the truth) and (divine) clemency so that they may be mindful (of their obligations towards Allâh, toward themselves and others).

44.Munir Mezyed: You were not there on the western side (of the Mount) when We revealed unto ‘Moses’ the commandment, neither were you among the witnesses.

45.Munir Mezyed: But We raised up many generations (after ‘Moses’), then life became prolonged to them. You were not one of the inhabitants of Midian, reciting to them Our ‘Verses’. But it is We who persist in sending messengers (in order to guide the people into all the truth).

46.Munir Mezyed: You were not present at the side of the ‘Mount Sinai’ when We called out (to ‘Moses’), but (We reveal this to you) as a clemency from your Lord so that you may give warning to a people to whom no warner had come before you, so that they may be mindful.

47.Munir Mezyed: If (We had) not (sent you to Quraysh)- in case a catastrophe should befall them for (their evil deeds) that their hands have sent forth- they would have said: "Our Lord, why did You not send us a messenger so that we might have followed Your ‘Revelations’ and been among the Monotheistic Believers?"

48.Munir Mezyed: But when the truth has come to them from Us, they say: "Why is he not given the like of what was given to ‘Moses’? Did they not disbelieve in that which was given to ‘Moses’ before? They say: "Two kinds of sorcery (the ‘Torah’ & the 'Qur’ān') supporting each other!" They say: “Indeed, in both of them, we are not going to believe."

49.Munir Mezyed: Say (unto them, O’ Muhammad): "Then bring a book from Allâh, which gives better spiritual insight than these two, so that I may follow it if you are truthful.”

50.Munir Mezyed: But if they do not answer you, then you need to know that they take in their self-deceived beliefs for the epistemic. Who is more astray than one who takes in his self-deceived beliefs for the epistemic without receiving spiritual insight form Allâh? Indeed, Allâh would not give those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong spiritual insight.

51.Munir Mezyed: Surely, We have conveyed to them the Word so that they may be mindful.

52.Munir Mezyed: Those to whom We gave the ‘Scripture’ (the Old Testament & the New Testament) before it, they believe in the Glorious 'Qur’ān'.

53.Munir Mezyed: When it is recited to them, they say: "We believe in it. Indeed, it is the (absolute) truth from our Lord. Certainly even before it, we have been from those who submit (themselves completely to the authority of Allâh).

54.Munir Mezyed: These will be granted their reward twice over because of what they patiently endure, and use to expel the evil deed by the righteous deed, and expend of what we have provided them.

55.Munir Mezyed: When they use to hear evil vain talk, they turn away from it and say: "To us our deeds and to you your deeds. Peace be upon you! We desire not (to associate ourselves with) the ignorant.”

56.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, (O’ Muhammad), you guide not whom you desire, but Allâh guides whom He wills. He knows perfectly well those who attain spiritual insight.

57.Munir Mezyed: They say: "If it happens that we follow the guidance with you, we will be obliterated from our land.” Have We not established them in a secure sanctuary, to which are brought the fruits of all kinds as provision from Us?  But most of them know not.

58.Munir Mezyed: How many a township have We utterly destroyed that was excessively exaggerated in its style of living, so these are their dwelling-places, which have not been dwelt in after them but a little. Indeed! It is always We who are the inheritors.

59.Munir Mezyed: Never would your Lord have intended to destroy these townships until He had sent to their mother town (metropolis) a messenger reciting to them Our ‘Verses’. We would not destroy any townships except while their inhabitants were grossly unfair and morally wrong.

60.Munir Mezyed: Whatever thing you have been given is only a provision of this ‘worldly life’, and its adornment, and whatever is with Allâh is far better and more enduring. Do you not possess self- awareness that allows you to understand?

61.Munir Mezyed: Is he whom We have promised an excellent promise (‘Al-Jannah’), which he will find true, like him whom We have made to enjoy great comfort and extravagant living of this ‘worldly life’, then on the ‘Day of Resurrection’, he will be of those arraigned?

62.Munir Mezyed: The day will come when He calls upon them, saying: "Where are My associates whom you used to allege?”

63.Munir Mezyed: Those whom the word has been rightly justified against them will say: "Our Lord, these are the ones whom we led astray. We led them astray as we ourselves were astray. We declare our innocence unto You. It was not us that they used to worship (& venerate).”

64.Munir Mezyed: It will be said: "Call upon your associate-gods." They will call upon them but they will not be able to answer (or even hear) them. Consequently, they will see the punishment. (They will wish) if only they had sought spiritual insight!

65.Munir Mezyed: They will come when the Lord calls unto them and says: ”What was the answer you gave to the messengers?"

66.Munir Mezyed: On that day, (all ways of obtaining) information will be made gloomy to them, and they will not even be able to question one another.

67.Munir Mezyed: However, as for the one who repents, adheres to Islamic monotheism and does righteous good deeds, hopefully he will be of those who achieve a blissful life.

68.Munir Mezyed: Your Lord creates whatever he desires and chooses. They have no choice about this matter. Glorified is Allâh and Highly Exalted above what they associate with Him.

69.Munir Mezyed: Your Lord knows what their hearts conceal, and what they disclose.

70.Munir Mezyed: He is Allâh, there is no god but Him! Unto Him belongs all praises in this first (i.e. this ‘worldly life’), and in the ‘Hereafter’. His is the judgment, and you are destined to be brought back to Him.

71.Munir Mezyed: Say: "Have you ever thought carefully that if Allâh would cause the night to be perpetual over you until the ‘Day of Resurrection’, is there a deity, other than Allâh, who could bring you light? Will you not then hear?"

72.Munir Mezyed: Say: "Have you ever thought carefully that if Allâh would cause the day to be perpetual over you until the ‘Day of Resurrection’, is there a deity,  other than Allâh, who could bring you night wherein you rest? Will you not then see?"

73.Munir Mezyed: Out of His ( divine) Clemency, He made for you the night and day so that you may rest therein, that you may seek of His bounty, and that you may show gratitude (to Him for His endless Blessings).

74.Munir Mezyed: The day will come when He calls upon them, saying: "Where are My associates whom you used to allege?”

75.Munir Mezyed: We shall pick out from every nation a witness, and We shall say: "Bring your proofs (that will support your allegation that Allâh has partners)!" Then they will come to know that the truth is with Allâh (Alone), and all (the mythological deities) which they have mythologized will fail them.

76.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, Korah was of the people of ‘Moses’, but he tyrannized them. We had granted him such great treasures whose keys would burden a band of strong men. His people said unto him: "Do not express much happiness about your wealth (& forget to express your gratitude to Allâh for His Blessings). Indeed, Allâh demonstrates not his own love for the ones who are jubilant.

77.Munir Mezyed: You should strive for the abode of the ‘Hereafter’ by means of what Allâh has granted you,  do not forget your share (of rightful enjoyment) in this ‘worldly life’, seek to promote the welfare of others as Allâh has been extremely generous towards you, and do not seek to spread corruption on the earth. Indeed, Allâh does not like those who indulge in corruption."

78.Munir Mezyed: He said: "All this has been given to me only as a result of the knowledge I possess." Does he not know that Allâh had already destroyed before him generations of people who were more powerful than him in strength, and greater in wealth accumulated? The ungodly sinners will not be questioned concerning their sins.

79.Munir Mezyed: So he went forth before his people in his pomp. Those who seek (the pleasure) of this ‘worldly life’ said: "Ah, if we had the like of what Korah has been given! Indeed, he possesses a great fortune."

80.Munir Mezyed: Those who have spiritual gift of knowledge said: ”Woe unto you! The reward of Allâh is far better for the one who places his faith (in Him) and acts righteously. No one can receive such reward except for those persist in patience and constancy.”

81.Munir Mezyed: Thus, We caused the earth to swallow him and his house, and there was no squad to help him other than Allâh, nor was he of those who were capable of defending themselves.

82.Munir Mezyed: In the morning, those who had intense feeling of longing for being in his place, began to say (in a sorrowful tone), "Ah ( we must have known that) Allâh spreads out and straitens the means of subsistence for whom He wills of His servants! If Allâh had not been Benignant to us, He would have caused the earth to swallow us (also). Ah! those who fall into disbelief will never achieve a blissful life/ or gain eternal salvation."

83.Munir Mezyed: As for that Abode of the ‘Hereafter’, We assign it to those who desires not to be supercilious on the earth or to be involved in spreading corruption. The great end is for the ‘Pious’ (or for those who show honor and reverence for Allâh/ or for those who guard themselves against falling into sin and temptation).

84.Munir Mezyed: Whoever comes (on the ‘Judgment Day’) with a single righteous deed will have better than it. Whoever comes (on the ‘Judgment Day’) with a single evil deed- then those who committed evil deeds will only be chastised for what they used to do.

85.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, He who has assigned the responsibility for (teaching) the 'Qur’ān' to you, (O’ Muhammad), will definitely bring you back to the place of return (Mecca). Say, “My Lord is Fully Aware of the one who brings spiritual guidance and the one who is in utter deception.”

86.Munir Mezyed: You were not anticipating that the ‘Book’ would be inspired into you, but it was a (divine) Clemency from your Lord. Thus, do not ever be a strong proponent of those who lack Faith ( in the Lord of all the worlds).

87.Munir Mezyed: Let them not preclude you from (preaching & teaching) the ‘Revelations’ of Allâh after they have been revealed unto you. Invite the people to come to your Lord, and be not of the polytheists!

88.Munir Mezyed: Invoke not your prayer, apart from Allâh, to any (mythological) deity. There is no god except Him. Everything will perish save His (Glorious) Face.  His is the judgment, and you are all bound to return unto Him.

1.Munir Mezyed: Alif. La’am. Mi’em..

2.Munir Mezyed: Do the people think that they will be left to say, "We profess belief” (in Allâh) and they will not be led into temptation?

3.Munir Mezyed: Verily, We have led those before them into temptation, so Allâh will certainly identify the ones who are true; and will certainly identify the ones who are liars.

4.Munir Mezyed: Or do those who keep on falling into sin think that they can outstrip Us? How repugnant is that which they judge!

5.Munir Mezyed: Whoever looks forward to the meeting with Allâh (needs to know that) the term predetermined by Allâh is definitely coming. He is the All-Hearer, the All-Knowing.

6.Munir Mezyed: Whoever strives hard struggles for the benefit of his own self. Indeed, Allâh is Self-sufficient, above (need of His) creatures.

7.Munir Mezyed: Those who adhere to Islamic monotheism and do righteous acts ( in this ‘worldly life’), We will definitely deliver them for the consequences of all their sins, and award them according to the best of that which they used to do.

8.Munir Mezyed: We have enjoined on man to be kind and dutiful to his own parents. However, if it happens that they try to oblige you to associate with Me that whereof you have no knowledge, then do not obey them. Unto Me is your return, and I shall inform you of what you used to do.

9.Munir Mezyed: Those who adhere to Islamic monotheism and do righteous acts (in this ‘worldly life’), We will definitely admit them into the (company) of the righteous.

10.Munir Mezyed: Among the people are some who say, "We believe in Allâh," but if it happens that one of them suffered religious persecution because of his Faith in Allâh, he would consider the persecution which done by the people as (equal as) the tribulation of Allâh. If it happens that victory comes from your Lord, (the Hypocrites) will say, "Indeed, We were with you.” Is not Allâh most knowing of what is within the hearts of all creatures.

11.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, Allâh knows the Monotheistic Believers, and indeed, He knows (also)  the Hypocrites.

12.Munir Mezyed: Those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) say unto those who adhere to Islamic monotheism: "Follow our way (i.e. our creed) and will definitely bear your sins.” They cannot bear aught of their sins. Indeed, they are veritable liars.

13.Munir Mezyed: But they will definitely bear their own burdens and other burdens beside their own burdens. They will definitely be questioned on the ‘Day of Resurrection’ regarding what they used to mythologize.

14.Munir Mezyed: Verily, We sent ‘Noah’ (as Our messenger) to his own people, and he tarried among them a thousand years, less fifty. Subsequently, the severe flood seized them while they were grossly unfair and morally wrong.

15.Munir Mezyed: Thus, We saved him as well as the companions of the vessel. We made the ‘Deluge’ a lesson for all the worlds.

16.Munir Mezyed: (Mention) ‘Abraham’ when he said unto his people, “Worship (& venerate) Allâh (Alone), and act piously towards him, that is better for you if you did but know.

17.Munir Mezyed: You only (venerate &) worship (senseless) idols besides of Allâh. And you create an (intelligible) mendacity. Indeed, those whom you worship (& venerate) besides Allâh have no power to give you sustenance. Thus, seek your sustenance from Allâh, worship (& venerate him alone), and show your gratitude to Him.  Eventually, you are all bound to return unto Him.

18.Munir Mezyed: But if it happens that you (choose to) deny, then generations before you have also (chosen to) to deny. The responsibility of the messenger is only to preach (& to convey) the message distinctly.
