55.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, the ‘Companions of Al-Jannah’, that day, will be too busy to enjoy themselves.

56.Munir Mezyed: They and their spouses will be in delightful shades, reclining on couches.

57.Munir Mezyed: They will have therein fruits and whatever they desire.

58.Munir Mezyed: ‘Peace’! A word from the Lord, the Most Merciful.

59.Munir Mezyed: (The Lord will command): “As for you, O’ ungodly sinners, stand apart from the others on this day!"

60.Munir Mezyed: Did I not make a covenant with you, O’ Children of ‘Adam’, that you should not worship (& venerate) the Devil - certainly, He is an obvious enemy to you-

61.Munir Mezyed: And that you should worship (& venerate) Me Alone? This is the straight path.

62.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, he led astray numerous people from among you. Did you not possess self- awareness that allowed you to understand?

63.Munir Mezyed: This is ‘Gehenna’ which you were promised!

64.Munir Mezyed: Burn therein this day, as an outcome of your constant refusal to accept Islamic monotheism."

65.Munir Mezyed: On that day, We shall seal up their mouths, letting their hands speak to Us and their feet testify to what they used to do.

66.Munir Mezyed: If We had willed, We would surely have obliterated their eyes, so that they should struggle for the way, but how would they see?

67.Munir Mezyed: If We had willed, We would surely have transformed them (into animals or objects) in their place. Thus, they would not be able to precede or turn back.

68.Munir Mezyed: The one whom We cause to live long life; We reverse in creation. Do they not possess self- awareness that allows them to understand?

69.Munir Mezyed: We have not taught him the (art) of poetry, it is not appropriate for him. This is naught but a ‘Reminder’ and incontrovertible 'Qur’ān',

70.Munir Mezyed: So as to forewarn those who are alive, and to allow the word to come true against those who lack Faith in (Allâh).

71.Munir Mezyed: Have they not seen that we created livestock for them, out of what Our hands have wrought, and then they are their owners?

72.Munir Mezyed: We have subjected the livestock to them. Some they ride, and some they eat.

73.Munir Mezyed: They have other advantages from them, as well as beverages. Will they not then be grateful?

74.Munir Mezyed: They have taken (for worship mythological) deities besides Allâh so that they may be helped.

75.Munir Mezyed: In fact, they are incapable of helping them. They made themselves soldiers serving and helping (their mythological deities).

76.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, let not their words sadden you. We certainly know whatever they hide and whatever they disclose.

77.Munir Mezyed: Does not man see that We have created him from a semen-drop? Then lo! He is a compulsive conversationalist!

78.Munir Mezyed: He sets forth for us a similitude, and forgets his own creation. He says: "Who will give life to these bones, when they disintegrate and fall lifeless into the ashes."

79.Munir Mezyed: Say: "The one who will give life to them is the One who initiated them in the first place. He is the All-Knowing of every creation.

80.Munir Mezyed: The One Who produces for you fire out of the green tree, and then from it you kindle.

81.Munir Mezyed: Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth capable of creating the like of them? Yea! He is indeed the Supreme Creator, the Omniscient.

82.Munir Mezyed: Verily, His Command, when He intends to create a thing, is only to say unto it, "Be," consequently, there it is.

83.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, Glory be unto Him in Whose Hand is the sovereignty of all things, and to Him, you are destined to be brought back."

37.SurahEnglishNames: Those Who Set The Ranks, Drawn up in Ranks, The Rangers

1.Munir Mezyed: By those (‘Angels’) who stand in ranks,

2.Munir Mezyed: Then by those (‘Angels’) who drive (the clouds) robustly,

3.Munir Mezyed: Then by those (‘Angels’) who recite the divine ‘Verses’ (of this ‘Qur’ān’),

4.Munir Mezyed: Your Lord is absolutely One,

5.Munir Mezyed: The Lord of the heaven and earth, and whatever is between them, and the Lord of the Eastern regions.

6.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We have embellished the lower heavens with planets,

7.Munir Mezyed: Protecting it from every rebellious devil,

8.Munir Mezyed: They cannot listen to the exalted assembly because they will be pelted from every side,

9.Munir Mezyed: Driven away, and for them is an endless chastisement,

10.Munir Mezyed: Except for the one who snatches away something by stealing, then there follows him a piercing flame.

11.Munir Mezyed: Then ask them, (-those who deny the ‘Resurrection’ -), "Are they stronger in creation or those (others) whom We have created?" Indeed, We created them of a glutinous clay.

12.Munir Mezyed: Nay, you wonder (at their disbelief) while they mock at (you and the ‘Qur’ān’).

13.Munir Mezyed: When they are admonished, they pay no attention.

14.Munir Mezyed: When they see a sign (of Allâh’s power & glory), they start talking about it in a scornfully derisive way.

15.Munir Mezyed: And Saying: “This is nothing but an apparent sorcery (& devilry).

16.Munir Mezyed: What, when we are dead and become dust and bones, shall we indeed be resurrected?

17.Munir Mezyed: What, even our fathers in former times?”

18.Munir Mezyed: Say (unto them): “Yea, and you will be completely demeaned.”

19.Munir Mezyed: So it will be but one cry, then behold, they are contemplating.

20.Munir Mezyed: They will say: “"Woe unto us! This is the ‘Day of Judgment’."

21.Munir Mezyed: (It will be said unto them): “This is the decisive day which you used to deny."

22.Munir Mezyed: (It will be said unto the ‘Angels’): “Gather those who used to show an arrogant attitude together with their companions (from the devils), and what they used to worship,

23.Munir Mezyed: Besides Allâh, then lead them into the way to ‘Gehenna’.

24.Munir Mezyed: Stop them!  Indeed, they are to be questioned.

25.Munir Mezyed: What is wrong with you? Why do you not help each other?”

26.Munir Mezyed: Nay, on that day they will be totally submissive (and helpless).

27.Munir Mezyed: They will approach one another, questioning one another,

28.Munir Mezyed: Saying: “Indeed, you are the ones who used to come to us from the right side.”

29.Munir Mezyed: They will say: “Nay, you are the ones who were not inclined to believe in Allâh.

30.Munir Mezyed: We had no authority over you, but you were oppressive (or tyrannical) personalities.

31.Munir Mezyed: Thus the Word of our Lord has been justified against us.  Surely we are going to taste (the chastisement).

32.Munir Mezyed: Apparently, we have seduced you away (from following the upright faith), only because we are seducers.”

33.Munir Mezyed: So, that day they will all take part in the torment.

34.Munir Mezyed: (37: 34) Verily, that is how We deal with the ungodly sinners.

35.Munir Mezyed: In fact, when it was said unto them: "There is no god but Allâh," they acted  imperiously.

36.Munir Mezyed: And said: "Are we going to forsake our gods for the sake of a demented poet".

37.Munir Mezyed: Nay! He has come with the truth and has authenticated (the divine message of) the ‘Messengers’ (who were sent before him).

38.Munir Mezyed: Verily, you are going to taste the agonizing torment.

39.Munir Mezyed: You will be chastised only for what you used to do (in the ‘worldly life’),

40.Munir Mezyed: But the faithful servants of Allâh (will be saved).

41.Munir Mezyed: Those will have determined sustenance.

42.Munir Mezyed: All types fruits. They will be highly honored:

43.Munir Mezyed: In the gardens of bliss.

44.Munir Mezyed: On thrones, facing each other.

45.Munir Mezyed: Glass of sparkling wine will be circulated around them,

46.Munir Mezyed: Pure brilliant white, very palatable for those who like to drink.

47.Munir Mezyed: It has no bad effect on them, neither will it make them drunk.

48.Munir Mezyed: With them will be voluptuous maidens

49.Munir Mezyed: As if they were hidden eggs (of the ostrich, sheltered by their feathers from dust).

50.Munir Mezyed: They will approach one another, questioning one another.

51.Munir Mezyed: A speaker of them will say: "Indeed, I had a companion (in the ‘worldly life’),

52.Munir Mezyed: Who used to say: "Are you of those who believe (in the resurrection)?

53.Munir Mezyed: When we are dead and become dust and bones,  shall we actually be called to account (for every deed we committed)?

54.Munir Mezyed: He will say: "Will you have a look?"

55.Munir Mezyed: Thus, he looked down and saw him in the depth of ‘Gehenna’.

56.Munir Mezyed: He will say: "By Allâh! You had almost led me into to perdition.

57.Munir Mezyed: Had it not been for the benevolence of my Lord, I would definitely have been among those who brought up."

58.Munir Mezyed: Is it then that we will not die,

59.Munir Mezyed: Except for our first death, and that we shall not be chastised?"

60.Munir Mezyed: This is absolutely the ultimate and supreme success .

61.Munir Mezyed: For the like of this, then, let those who struggle pursue.

62.Munir Mezyed: Is this a better hospitality or the tree of ‘Zaqqum’?

63.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We have made it an allurement for the iniquitous.

64.Munir Mezyed: Verily, It is a tree that grows in the core of ‘Gehenna’.

65.Munir Mezyed: Its emerging fruit are like the head of the of devils.

66.Munir Mezyed: The ‘Companions of Hellfire’ will certainly eat thereof and fill their bellies therewith.

67.Munir Mezyed: After eating from it, they will be given a mixture made of scalding water.

68.Munir Mezyed: Then indeed, their return will be to the inferno.

69.Munir Mezyed: They indeed found their fathers going astray,

70.Munir Mezyed: And so they rushed to follow their creed.

71.Munir Mezyed: Most of the ancients certainly went astray before them,

72.Munir Mezyed: And indeed We sent among them warners.

73.Munir Mezyed: Then see how (dreadful) was the outcome of those who were warned,

74.Munir Mezyed: Except for the faithful servants of Allâh.

75.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, ‘Noah’ prayed to Us (for help), and how excellent responders of Prayers We are!

76.Munir Mezyed: We saved him and his family from the great distress,

77.Munir Mezyed: Made his progeny the survivors,

78.Munir Mezyed: And perpetuated his good legacy in later generations,

79.Munir Mezyed: Peace be upon ‘Noah’ among (all men and jinn) in the worlds.

80.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, this is how We do reward those who pursue righteousness.

81.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, he was one of Our pious servants,

82.Munir Mezyed: Then We drowned the others.

83.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, among those who followed the (upright) creed of ‘Noah’ was ‘Abraham’.

84.Munir Mezyed: He came to his Lord with Pure and Faultless heart.

85.Munir Mezyed: He said unto his father and his people: “What is that you worship (& venerate)?

86.Munir Mezyed: Is it a mendacity - gods beside Allâh- that you seek?

87.Munir Mezyed: Then what is your speculation about the Lord of the worlds.

88.Munir Mezyed: Then he took a glance at the stars,

89.Munir Mezyed: And said: “I am sick (with plague).”

90.Munir Mezyed: Thus they turned away from him, departing (for fear of getting infected).

91.Munir Mezyed: Then he turned unto their gods and said: “What! Do you not eat?

92.Munir Mezyed: What is wrong with you that you speak not?”

93.Munir Mezyed: Then he turned furtively unto them, smiting them with the right hand.

94.Munir Mezyed: Then they came toward him, hastening.

95.Munir Mezyed: He said: “Do you worship (& venerate) that which you sculpt

96.Munir Mezyed: Whilst Allâh has created you and what we make?”

97.Munir Mezyed: They said: “Build for him a building (i.e. pyre), then cast him into the inferno.”

98.Munir Mezyed: Apparently, They wanted to outwit him, but We brought them low.

99.Munir Mezyed: He said: "Indeed, I am going unto my Lord. He will guide me (into all the truth).

100.Munir Mezyed: My Lord, vouchsafe me one of the righteous."

101.Munir Mezyed: Thus, We gave him the glad tidings of a forbearing boy.

102.Munir Mezyed: But when (his son) became old enough to toil with him, (‘Abraham’) said: "O’ my son, indeed I see in a dream that I must scarify you. What do you think of this?" He said: "O’ my father, do what you are commanded to do. You will find me, if Allâh wills, one of the steadfast."

103.Munir Mezyed: Then, when they had both surrendered, and he had flung him down upon his forehead,

105.Munir Mezyed: You have indeed fulfilled the vision of truth.” Nevertheless, We do reward those who attain perfection in Faith.

106.Munir Mezyed: This was certainly the real ordeal.

107.Munir Mezyed: Thus, We ransomed his son with a great sacrifice.

108.Munir Mezyed: We perpetuated his good legacy in later generations.

110.Munir Mezyed: This is how We do reward those who attain perfection in righteousness /or in Faith .

111.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, he was  of Our Pious servants.

112.Munir Mezyed: We gave him the glad tidings of ‘Isaac’, one of the righteous ‘Prophets’.

113.Munir Mezyed: We blessed him and ‘Isaac’. Some of their offspring were righteous and others were obviously wrongful towards their own selves.

114.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We conferred a favor on ‘Moses’ and ‘Aaron’.

115.Munir Mezyed: We saved them and their people from the great ordeal,

116.Munir Mezyed: And helped them. Thus, they were victorious. .

117.Munir Mezyed: We gave them both the Explicative Scripture,

118.Munir Mezyed: Guided them both to the right path,

119.Munir Mezyed: And perpetuated their good legacy in later generations.

121.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, this is how We do reward those who attain perfection in righteousness /or in Faith

122.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, they were both of Our pious servants .

123.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, ‘Elias’ was one of the ‘Messengers’ of Allâh.

124.Munir Mezyed: He said unto his people: “Will you not act piously?

125.Munir Mezyed: What! Do you implore and pray to ‘Baal’ and forsake the Best of the creators,

126.Munir Mezyed: Allâh, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers?"

127.Munir Mezyed: They denied him. Thus, they will be brought forth (to the doom)

128.Munir Mezyed: Except for the faithful servants of Allâh.

129.Munir Mezyed: We perpetuated his good legacy in the later generations.

131.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, this is how We do reward those who attain perfection in Faith

132.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, he was  of Our pious servants.

133.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, ‘Lot’ was  of the ‘Messengers’ of Allâh.

134.Munir Mezyed: We saved him and all his family,

135.Munir Mezyed: Except for an old woman, (-his wife-), who was among those who stayed behind.

137.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, you pass by them in the morning,

138.Munir Mezyed: And at night. Do you not then have self- awareness that allows you to understand?

139.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, ‘Jonah’ was of the ‘Messengers’ of Allâh.

140.Munir Mezyed: He ran away and (embarked) on a ship heavily laden.

141.Munir Mezyed: Then he drew lots, and he was among the losers.

142.Munir Mezyed: Then a great fish swallowed him as he was culpable.

143.Munir Mezyed: Had he not been of those who celebrate the praise (of Allâh) and declare His glory,

144.Munir Mezyed: He would have remained in its belly until the day when they are raised.

145.Munir Mezyed: Thus, We cast him into the open shore while he was seriously injured.

146.Munir Mezyed: We caused a pumpkin tree to grow above him.

147.Munir Mezyed: We sent him to a hundred thousand (people) or more.

148.Munir Mezyed: they believed and so We gave them comforts for a while.

149.Munir Mezyed: So do ask them, (O’ Muhammad): “Does your Lord have daughters whereas they have sons?

150.Munir Mezyed: Or did We create the ‘Angels’ females while they were witnesses?”

151.Munir Mezyed: Emphatically, it is out of their mendacity that they say:

152.Munir Mezyed: “Allâh has begotten.” They are absolutely lairs.

153.Munir Mezyed: Has He chosen daughters over sons?

154.Munir Mezyed: What is wrong with you? How do you judge (things)?

155.Munir Mezyed: Will you not then tale a heed?

156.Munir Mezyed: Or do you have a clear authority?

157.Munir Mezyed: Thus, bring your book if you are truthful.

158.Munir Mezyed: They even invented consanguinity between Him and the Jinn. In fact, The Jinn know well that they will be brought up (for retribution).

159.Munir Mezyed: Glory be to Allâh from what they describe!

160.Munir Mezyed: Except for the faithful servants of Allâh.

161.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, you and whatever you worship

162.Munir Mezyed: Cannot tempt any one away (from the upright faith)

163.Munir Mezyed: Except for the ones who are predestined to burn in the inferno.

164.Munir Mezyed: The ‘Angels’ said: “There is not one of us but has an appointed place.

165.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We do stand in ranks (for prayer)

166.Munir Mezyed: And We do indeed hymn His praise.”

168.Munir Mezyed: “If only we had had a Reminder like that of the people of old,

169.Munir Mezyed: We would have been the faithful servants of Allâh.”

170.Munir Mezyed: But, (when the 'Qur’ān' has come to them), they disbelieve in it. They will soon come to know (the consequences of their disbelief).

171.Munir Mezyed: Our word has already foregone for Our servants, the ‘Messengers’,

172.Munir Mezyed: That they would certainly be helped,

173.Munir Mezyed: And that our soldiers would certainly be the victors.

174.Munir Mezyed: Thus, turn away from them, (O’ ‘Muhammad’), for a little while,

175.Munir Mezyed: And watch (what will befall) them, for they are going to see.

176.Munir Mezyed: What! Do they seek to hasten Our divine retribution?

177.Munir Mezyed: But when it descends in their courtyard, then pernicious is the morning of those who are heedless of Our warnings.

178.Munir Mezyed: Turn away from them, (O’ Muhammad), for a little while,

179.Munir Mezyed: And watch (what will befall) them, for they are going to see.

180.Munir Mezyed: Glory be to your Lord, the Lord of Honor and Power, above what they describe!

181.Munir Mezyed: Peace shall be upon the ‘Messengers’ of Allâh.

182.Munir Mezyed: All the praises and gratitude belong to Allâh, Lord of all the worlds.

1.Munir Mezyed: Sād! By the  'Qur’ān', (which is) full of enlightenment and awakening.

2.Munir Mezyed: Nay, but those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) are in excessive pride and schism.

3.Munir Mezyed: So many generations We have destroyed before them, (the Pagan Arabs).  (When they beheld the doom approaching them), they cried out (for help) but it was too late.

4.Munir Mezyed: They, (-the Pagan Arabs-), wonder that a warner has come to them from among themselves. Those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) say: “This (man) is a sorcerer and a charlatan.

5.Munir Mezyed: What! Does he claim that all the gods are but one God? This is absolutely an astonishing thing (to claim).”

6.Munir Mezyed: Their chiefs among them went forth (saying): "Go on, and remain faithful to your gods. This is certainly a thing intended.

7.Munir Mezyed: We never heard of this in the latest religion. This is certainly nothing but an invention.

8.Munir Mezyed: What! Has the Reminder, 'Revealer of Truth', been revealed unto him out of us all?" Nay, they are skeptical about My ‘Reminder’. Nay, they haven't tasted yet My chastisement!

9.Munir Mezyed: Or do they have the treasures of mercy of your Lord, the All-Mighty, the Great Benefactor (God)?

10.Munir Mezyed: Or is theirs the sovereignty of the heavens and earth and all that is between them? If so, let them (first) ascend with means (to the heavens and then decide to whom the revelations should be sent down).

11.Munir Mezyed: They are but despicable opponents who will be defeated like the confederates of the old times.

12.Munir Mezyed: Before them, the people of ‘Noah’ refused to admit (the truth of the Oneness of Allâh), and (so did the tribe of) ‘A'ad’, and ‘Pharaoh’, the owner of stakes,

13.Munir Mezyed: And (the tribe of) ‘Thamūd’, the people of ‘Lot’, and the ‘companions of the thicket’. These were the (sinful) confederates.

14.Munir Mezyed: Not one of them but denied the ‘Messengers’. Thus, My divine retribution was fully justified.

15.Munir Mezyed: These, (-ungodly sinners-), await not but a single cry, wherein there will be no delay.

16.Munir Mezyed: They say: “Our Lord, hasten to us our share (of the punishment) before the ‘Day of Reckoning’.”

17.Munir Mezyed: Persist in patience and constancy, (O’ ‘Muhammad’), over what they say, and remember Our servant, ‘David’, who was endued with impressive strength. Indeed, he was one who constantly sought forgiveness from Allâh.

18.Munir Mezyed: We made the mountains to sing praises (to Allâh) with him at nightfall and sunrise,

19.Munir Mezyed: And the birds assembled; all joined in singing with him.

20.Munir Mezyed: We strengthened his kingdom, and We gave him wisdom and decisive aphorism.

21.Munir Mezyed: Has the anecdote of the antagonists come to you? When they climbed over the wall of his Sanctuary,

22.Munir Mezyed: When they entered upon ‘David’, and he was afraid of them, they said:  "Fear not. We are two litigants, one of whom has wronged the other, thus, judge between us with truth, deal fairly, and guide us into the right path.

23.Munir Mezyed: Well, this my brother has ninety-nine ewes, and I have one ewe. Then he said: "Entrust it to me. Thus, he overpowered me in speech."

24.Munir Mezyed: (‘David’) said: “He has absolutely wronged you in demanding your ewe in addition to his ewes. Indeed, many partners do oppress one another, except for those who place their Faith in Allâh and do righteous acts, and how few they are!” Afterwards, ‘David’ presumed that We had tried him, and he sought forgiveness from his Lord, knelt down and repented.

25.Munir Mezyed: Thus, We forgave him that. Indeed, he has a place near Our Presence and an exquisite abode.

26.Munir Mezyed: O’ ‘David’, indeed, We have appointed you a vicegerent on the earth, therefore, judge between the people equitably and take not in the self-deceived beliefs for the epistemic as they will mislead you from the path of Allâh. verily, severe chastisement awaits those who stray from the Path of Allah, because they forget the ‘Day of Reckoning’.

27.Munir Mezyed: We created not the heavens and earth and all that is between them without a reason. That is the speculation of those who keep on falling into disbelief (in Allah). Then woe unto those who keep on falling into disbelief from the Inferno!

28.Munir Mezyed: Or shall We treat those who attain Faith in Allâh and do righteous acts same as those who spread corruption on the earth? Or shall We treat the Pious as the lecherous?

29.Munir Mezyed: It is a Blessed ‘Book’ that We have sent down to you so that they may contemplate its (Holy) ‘Verses’, and those who have high self-awareness may celebrate the praise of Allâh and declare His glory.

30.Munir Mezyed: To ‘David’ we granted ‘Solomon’. How excellent a servant he was! He was always returning to Allâh.

31.Munir Mezyed: When there were displayed before him amazing galloping horses at eventide,

32.Munir Mezyed: He then said: “Indeed, I opted the love of good things, (-horses-,) because they make me celebrate the praise of my Lord - until the sun was hidden behind the veil.

33.Munir Mezyed: Bring them back, (-the horses-), to me." Then he began to rub their legs and necks.

34.Munir Mezyed: We certainly tried ‘Solomon’, and We cast upon his throne a mere body. Thus, he (rushed and) turned unto Us in repentance.

35.Munir Mezyed: He said: "My Lord, forgive me and grant me a kingdom such as may not belong to any other after me: Indeed, You are the Greatest Benefactor."

36.Munir Mezyed: We made the wind subservient unto him. It blew gently to his command whenever he willed,

37.Munir Mezyed: And also the devils, every builder and diver,

38.Munir Mezyed: And others bound together in manacles.

39.Munir Mezyed: (We said): “This is Our free gift, and so you may give generously, or withhold, without reckoning.”

40.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, he has a place near Our presence and an exquisite abode.

41.Munir Mezyed: Commemorate Our Servant ‘Job’. When he implored and prayed to the Lord, “Indeed, ‘Satan’ has touched me with sufferance and anguish."

42.Munir Mezyed: (He was told): ”Strike the ground with your foot. Here is a cool water to bathe and to drink.”

43.Munir Mezyed: We gave him back his family and therewith the likes thereof, a mercy from Us, and a remembrance for the those who have highly-developed intellects.

44.Munir Mezyed: Take in your hand a bunch of basil leaves and strike therewith (your wife), so that you may not break your oath. Indeed, We found him patient, an excellent servant. Indeed, he was one who constantly sought forgiveness from Allâh.

45.Munir Mezyed: Commemorate Our servants ‘Abraham’, ‘Isaac’ and ‘Jacob’, men of strength and prudence!

46.Munir Mezyed: We purified them with a pure thought, (instilling in their hearts) the remembrance of the Home (of the ‘Hereafter’).

47.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, they are, in Our sight, of the chosen ones and the best!

48.Munir Mezyed: Commemorate ‘Ishmael’, ‘Elisha’ and ‘Dhu'l-Kifl’. They were all of the best.

49.Munir Mezyed: This is a ‘Revealer of Truth’. Indeed, the Pious will have the best place of return:

50.Munir Mezyed: Gardens of Eden, whereof the doors are opened for them,

51.Munir Mezyed: Reclining therein, calling for plenteous fruit and drink.

52.Munir Mezyed: With them maidens restraining their glances of equal age.

53.Munir Mezyed: This is what you are promised for the ‘Day of Reckoning’.

54.Munir Mezyed: Absolutely, this is Our sustenance which is inexhaustible.

55.Munir Mezyed: This (is for the virtuous) but for the oppressors will have the evil place of return:

56.Munir Mezyed: ‘Gehenna’, wherein they will burn. Evil indeed is the cradle.

57.Munir Mezyed: This (shall be so). Thus, let them taste its boiling fluid and purulence.

58.Munir Mezyed: And other anguishes of similar kind, all together!

59.Munir Mezyed: (The dwellers of the ‘Hellfire’ will say): “This is a troop bursting in with you. No word of greeting for them! Verily, they will burn in the Inferno.”

60.Munir Mezyed: They shall say: Nay! No word of greeting for you! You, (our leaders), brought this upon us, and dreadful is the dwelling.”

61.Munir Mezyed: They will say: "Our Lord, whoever led us into this, give him double doze of the torment of Fire."

62.Munir Mezyed: They will say: "What is wrong with us? We see not men whom we used to count among the wicked people?

63.Munir Mezyed: Did We take them as an object of contemptuous ridicule, or have our eyes swerved away from them?”

64.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, that is very true:  the quarreling of the inhabitants of the Fire.

65.Munir Mezyed: Say, (O’ ‘Muhammad’): "I am only a warner, and there isn't any deity except Allâh, the One, the Omnipotent,

66.Munir Mezyed: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the All-Mighty, the Oft- Forgiving."

67.Munir Mezyed: Say: "It is great news

68.Munir Mezyed: From which you are turning aside from it.

69.Munir Mezyed: I had no knowledge of the exalted assembly (of ‘Angels’) when they exchange views on (certain matters) among themselves.

70.Munir Mezyed: It has not been revealed unto me except that I am a plain warner."

71.Munir Mezyed: (Thus, mention) when your Lord said unto the ‘Angels’: "Verily, I am going to create a mortal from wet clay.

72.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, when I have fashioned him and breathed into him of My Spirit, then fall down to him in prostration."

73.Munir Mezyed: The ‘Angels’ prostrated, all of them together

74.Munir Mezyed: Except ‘Iblīs’ (‘Satan’) who showed  an arrogant attitude and became among the insubordinate.

75.Munir Mezyed: (Allâh) said: "O’ Iblīs , what prevented you from prostrating before what I have created with My Own Hands? Are you supercilious or are you of the exalted ones?

76.Munir Mezyed: He said: "I am far better than him. You created me from Fire while You created him from wet clay."

77.Munir Mezyed: (The Lord) said: "Then get out of here, for verily, you are ostracized!

78.Munir Mezyed: And verily, My curse will abide in you until the ‘Day of Judgment’."

79.Munir Mezyed: He said: "My Lord, then reprieve me until the ‘Day’ they will be raised."

80.Munir Mezyed: (The Lord) said: “Verily, you are of those who are given respite

81.Munir Mezyed: Until the day of the time appointed."

82.Munir Mezyed: He said: "Then, by Your might, I will certainly seduce them all

83.Munir Mezyed: Except for Your faithful servants among them.”

84.Munir Mezyed: He said: "The Truth is, and the Truth I speak,

85.Munir Mezyed: I shall certainly fill ‘Gehenna’ with you and with everyone who follows you among them.”

86.Munir Mezyed: Say, (O’ ‘Muhammad’): “I ask of you no reward for (my efforts to guide you into all the truth), neither am I one of the pretentious.

87.Munir Mezyed: It, (this  ‘Qur’ān’), is only a ‘ Revealer of Truth’ for all the Worlds.

88.Munir Mezyed: You will come to know for sure the Truth of it after a while."

1.Munir Mezyed: The ‘Revelation’ of this ‘Book’ is from Allâh, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise..

2.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We have sent down the ‘Book’ to you, (O’ ‘Muhammad’), in truth. Thus, worship Allâh (alone), and be fully devoted follower serving Him faithfully.

3.Munir Mezyed: Absolutely, the pure Faith and worship is totally devoted to Allâh only. Those who choose guardians besides Him (say): “We worship (& venerate) these idols only to bring us closer to Allâh.” Verily, Allâh will judge between them concerning that in which they differ. Indeed, Allâh will not illuminate the path of the one who is impious lair.

4.Munir Mezyed: Had Allâh intended to take a son, He could have chosen whom He willed out of those whom He created. Glory be to Him! He is Allâh, the One and the Omnipotent.

5.Munir Mezyed: He has created the heavens and earth for specific reasons. He causes the night to enfold completely the day, and causes the day to enfold completely the night. He has subjected the sun and the moon, each of them running for an appointed term. Indeed, He is the All-Mighty, the Oft-Forgiving.

6.Munir Mezyed: He created you from a single ‘Human Self’, (‘Adam’), and then He made from (that entity) its mate (‘Eve’). He sent down for you eight pairs of cattle. He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation, in threefold darkness. This is Allâh, your Lord. His is the (Absolute) Sovereignty. There is no god but He. So what has caused you to diverge (from the established course)?

7.Munir Mezyed: If you keep on falling into disbelief (in Allâh) , then (you’ll need know that) Allâh is certainly not in need of you, neither will He be satisfied with your ingratitude. Nevertheless, if it happens that you show your gratitude to Him (for His endless Blessings) , He will be pleased to accept it from you. No bearer of a burden will bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord will be your return. He will inform you of what you used to do. Indeed, He is the All-Knowing of that which is in the hearts.

8.Munir Mezyed: When misfortune touches a man, He implores and prays to his Lord, turning unto Him in repentance. Then when He bestows on him a boon from Him, he forgets that for which he implored and prayed for before, and he sets up rivals to Allâh, so that he may cause others to go astray from His path. Say (O’ ‘Muhammad’): “Rejoice in your impiety for a while, for sure you are of the ‘Companions of the Fire’.

9.Munir Mezyed: Would it be possible to consider the one who is obedient to Allâh during the hours of the night, prostrating himself, standing (in prayer), being vigilant of the ‘Hereafter’, and hoping for (obtaining) the Mercy of his Lord (be accounted equal with the impious one)? Say (O’ ‘Muhammad’): "Are those who attain enlightenment equal with those who lack knowledge and awareness?" Only those who possess intelligence invigorate (their faith).

10.Munir Mezyed: (Declare, O’ Muhammad, what Allâh says): "O’ My servants who adhere to Islamic monotheism, do act piously towards your Lord. For those who pursue righteousness in this ‘worldly life’, there is a good reward. And the land of Allâh is capacious. Verily, those who persist in patience and constancy will receive a reward without measure!"

11.Munir Mezyed: Say, “I am commanded to worship (& venerate) Allâh (alone), and to be fully devoted follower serving Allâh faithfully.

12.Munir Mezyed: And I am commanded (also) to be the first of those who submit (entirely themselves to the authority of Allâh ).”

13.Munir Mezyed: Say: “I fear, if I disobey my Lord, the chastisement of a great day.”

14.Munir Mezyed: Say: “I worship (& venerate) Allâh (alone), being fully devoted follower serving Him faithfully.

15.Munir Mezyed: Thus, worship (& venerate) whatever you desire beside Him! Say: "Verily, the losers are the ones who will lose their own selves and their families on the ‘Day of Resurrection’. Emphatically, that is the tremendous loss.”

16.Munir Mezyed: They will have coverings of fire above them and beneath them by that which Allâh threatens His servants. O’ My servants,  thus, do act piously.

17.Munir Mezyed: Those who keep away from the worship of mythological deities and turn unto Allâh in repentance, for them is a joyful news (of eternal salvation). Therefore, announce the joyful news to My servants,

18.Munir Mezyed: Who listen to the words and follow the best ones:  those are the ones whom Allâh has given them divine insight and those are the ones who have high self- awareness that allows them to understand.

19.Munir Mezyed: Can he, then, against whom the sentence of retribution has become due, be guided? Can you save him who is already in the inferno?

20.Munir Mezyed: But those who act piously towards their Lord, For them are lofty compartments, above which are built lofty compartment, underneath which rivers flow. (This is) the Promise of Allâh.  For lo! Allâh will never fail in His Promise.

21.Munir Mezyed: Have you not seen how Allâh sends down water from the sky and causes it to penetrate into the earth as springs, then produces with it plants of different colors, then they shrivel and so you could see them turning yellow, then He makes them chaff? Indeed, in this, a remembrance for those who have self- awareness that allows them to understand.

22.Munir Mezyed: Is the one whose chest Allâh has expanded to embrace Islam and so he follows a light from his Lord (like the one who is impious)? Woe, then, unto those whose hearts are hardened against celebrating the Praises of Allâh! They are in manifest deception!

23.Munir Mezyed: Allâh has sent down the finest rhetoric as a ‘Book’, harmonious in its oft-repeated. It makes the skin of those who show honor and proper reverence for Allâh, to crawl, and then it softens their skins and their hearts by celebrating the Praise of Allâh and declaring His glory. This is the divine guidance of Allâh. He guides (into all the truth) therewith whom He wills. However, whom Allâh sends astray, there is no guide for him.

24.Munir Mezyed: Is the one who shields himself with his face against the evil of the torment of the ‘Day of Resurrection’ (as the one who is admitted into ‘Al- Jannah’)? It will be said to those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong: "Taste the flavor of what you used to earn."

25.Munir Mezyed: Those before them refused to admit the Truth, and so the chastisement came to them whence they never expected.

26.Munir Mezyed: Thus, Allâh made them to taste the flavor of ignominy in this ‘worldly life’, but the chastisement of the ‘Hereafter’ is far greater, if they only have spiritual gift of knowledge!

27.Munir Mezyed: We have set forth every kind of similitude in this ‘Qur’ān’ for the people so that they may be admonished.

28.Munir Mezyed: (It is) a ‘Qur’ān’ in Arabic, without fault so that they may act piously.

29.Munir Mezyed: Allâh sets forth a similitude: There is a slave in whom are many partners at variance with each other, and there is another slave belonging exclusively to one man - are they equal in comparison? All the praises and gratitude belong to Allâh! Nay, most of them know not.

30.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, you (O’ ‘Muhammad’), will die and they (too) will die;

31.Munir Mezyed: Then indeed, on the ‘Day of Resurrection’, you will settle your disputes in the presence of your Lord.

32.Munir Mezyed: Who is more grossly unfair than the one who utters a lie against Allâh, and refuses to admit the Truth when it comes to Him? Is it not ‘Hellfire’ a suitable abode for those who lack Faith in Allâh?

33.Munir Mezyed: He, (the ‘Prophet’), who has brought the Truth, (the ‘Glorious Qur’ān’), and (those who) believe therein are the Pious.

34.Munir Mezyed: They will have whatever they desire with their Lord. That is the reward of those whose heart is perfect towards Allâh,

35.Munir Mezyed: So that Allâh may acquit them of the worst of what they did, and may reward them much more for what they used to do.

36.Munir Mezyed: Is not Allâh sufficient for His servant? They seek to frighten you with the idols they set up beside Him! Whomever Allâh sends astray, there is no guide for him.

37.Munir Mezyed: Whoever Allâh illuminates his path, there is none that can cause him to go astray. Is not Allâh All-Mighty, the Lord of Retribution?

38.Munir Mezyed: If it should happen that you ask them: "Who created the heavens and the earth?" Certainly, they would say, "It is Allâh." Say: "Why then do you implore and pray (to those idols) instead of Allâh? If Allâh intended any adversity for me, could they relieve such an adversity? If He intended to show me some mercy, could they withhold His mercy?" Say: “Allâh is sufficient for me. In Him, let those who trust put their trust.”

39.Munir Mezyed: Say: “O’ my people, Work according to your position. Definitely, I am working.  Soon you will come to know

40.Munir Mezyed: The one to whom will come the chastisement that humiliates him, and on whom the everlasting punishment will descend.”

41.Munir Mezyed: Verily, We have sent down to you the ‘Book’ for the people in truth. Thus, whosoever follows the upright faith, it is only for the benefits of his own self, and whosoever goes astray, it is only for his own loss. You, (O’ ‘Muhammad’), are not their advocate.

42.Munir Mezyed: It is Allâh Who gathers the souls (of the human beings) at the time of their death, and those that die not during their sleep. He withholds those (souls) for which He has ordained death and releases the others till an appointed term. Verily, in this are signs (of the power & glory of Allâh) for people who (seek) to ruminate.

43.Munir Mezyed: Or, have they taken others as intercessors instead of Allâh? Say: " What! Even though they possess no power over anything, nor do they have self- awareness that allows them to understand.

44.Munir Mezyed: Say: "Unto Allâh belongs all intercession. His is the Absolute Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth. Eventually, you will be brought back to Him.”

45.Munir Mezyed: When Allâh alone is mentioned, the hearts of those who believe not in the ‘Hereafter’ are filled with revulsion, and when (whom they worship) beside Him are mentioned, they feel more joyous.

46.Munir Mezyed: Say: "O’ Allâh, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, the All-Knowing of the unseen and the seen, You are the only One Who judges between your servants regarding  that wherein they used to differ."

47.Munir Mezyed: Those who acted wrongfully, if they had all that is in earth, even twice as much, they would certainly offer it as a ransom to be saved from the evil of the retribution on the ‘Day of Resurrection’. Eventually, Allâh will reveal clearly to them what they had never reckoned.

48.Munir Mezyed: There will appear to them the evil deeds of what they earned, and they will be encompassed by that which they used to scoff.

49.Munir Mezyed: So when a misfortune touches the man, he implores and prays to Us. But, as soon as We bestow a grace upon him, he says: “I attained this because of the knowledge (that I possess)” Nay, it is only a temptation, but most of them know not.

50.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, Those before them said the same things, but what they used to earn availed them not.

51.Munir Mezyed: Thus, the evil deeds of what they have earned tantalized them. Those who act wrongfully among them will be touched by the evil deeds of what they earn; and they will not be able to escape.

52.Munir Mezyed: Do they not see that Allâh spreads out sustenance to whom He wills and straitens it? Unquestionably, there are signs (of Allâh’s  Power and Glory) in this for a people who accept Allâh into their life.

53.Munir Mezyed: (Declare, O’ Muhammad, what Allâh says): "O’ my servants who have wasted your lives in sin, dismay not of the mercy of Allâh. Indeed Allâh forgives all sins. Absolutely, He is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

54.Munir Mezyed: Turn in repentance unto your Lord and submit (yourself entirely to his authority) before the (divine) retribution comes to you: then you will not be helped.

55.Munir Mezyed: Follow the best of that which is sent down to you from your Lord before the (divine) retribution comes to you unexpectedly, while you perceive not.

56.Munir Mezyed: Lest a person should say: "Alas for me, in that I failed to care for my duty towards Allâh properly! Indeed, I was among those who mock at (the ‘Revelations’).”

57.Munir Mezyed: Or, lest he should say: "If only Allâh had illuminated my path, I would certainly have been among the Pious.

58.Munir Mezyed: Or, lest he should say when he beholds the chastisement: “If only I had another chance, I would certainly be among those whose Faith is placed in Allâh.”

59.Munir Mezyed: Aye! My ‘Revelations’ came (clearly) to you, but you refused to admit the truth of them and showed an arrogant attitude, becoming among the Faithless People.

60.Munir Mezyed: On the ‘Day of Resurrection’, you will see the faces of those who lied against Allâh being blackened. Isn't it ‘Gehenna’ a suitable abode for the arrogant?

61.Munir Mezyed: Allâh will save the Pious because of their achievements. No harm will overtake them; neither will they grieve.

62.Munir Mezyed: Allâh is the Creator of all things, and He is Guardian over all things.

63.Munir Mezyed: Unto Him, belong the keys of the heavens and the earth. Those who act impiously toward the revelations of Allâh are the sons of eternal perdition.

64.Munir Mezyed: Say (O’ Muhammad): "Do you, O’ ignorant, command me to worship other than Allâh?"

65.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, It has been revealed unto you as unto those before you. If it should happen that you associate partners with Allâh, then all your works would be definitely null and void, and you would be among the sons of eternal perdition..

66.Munir Mezyed: Nay! But worship (& venerate) Allâh (alone), and be among the grateful.

67.Munir Mezyed: They venerate not Allâh in accordance with what is appropriate for Him. The whole earth will be in His grip on the ‘Day of Resurrection’, and the heaven will be folded in His right hand. Glory be to Him! Highly exalted is He above what they associate (with Him).

68.Munir Mezyed: The Trumpet will be blown, and so whosoever is in the heaven, and whosoever is in the earth, will be dazed, except whom Allâh wills. Then it will be blown again, and at once they will be standing and waiting.

69.Munir Mezyed: Eventually, the earth will shine brightly with the Light of its Lord. The Book (of Deeds) will be laid down, the ‘Prophets’ and the witnesses are brought forward. It will be judged between them equitably, and they will not be wronged.

70.Munir Mezyed: Each self person will be paid in full of what he did, for He is the Best-Knowing of what you do.

71.Munir Mezyed: Those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) will be driven to ‘Gehenna’ in troops, till, when they reach it, its gates thereof will be opened. Its keepers will say unto them: “Did not there come to you ‘Messengers’ from among you, reciting to you the (Holy) ‘Verses’ of your Lord, and warning you of the meeting of this day of yours?" They will say: “Yea, but the word of the punishment has been proven true against the Faithless People."

72.Munir Mezyed: It will be said (unto them): "Enter the gates of ‘Gehenna’ to abide therein. Pernicious is the abode of the arrogant.”

73.Munir Mezyed: Those who used to act piously towards their Lord will be driven to ‘Al-Jannah’, in troops, till, when they reach it, its gates thereof will be opened. Its keepers will say unto them: ”Peace be upon you. You are delivered from all the consequences of your sins. Thus, do enter it to abide"

74.Munir Mezyed: They will say:“All the praises and gratitude belong to Allâh, Who has fulfilled His Promise to us, and has made us inherit the land of ‘Al- Jannah’ where we can dwell in it wherever we desire. How marvelous is the wage of workers!

75.Munir Mezyed: You will see the ‘Angels’ surrounding the Throne (of Allâh) from all round, glorifying the praises of their Lord, it will be judged between them in truth, and it will be said: “All the praises and gratitude belong to Allâh, the Lord of the Worlds!"

1.Munir Mezyed: Haa. Me’im.

2.Munir Mezyed: The Revelation Knowledge of this book, (Qur’ān), is from Allâh, the All-Mighty, the All-Knowing

3.Munir Mezyed: The Forgiver of sin, the Acceptor of repentance., the Rigorous in punishment, the Lord of the abundant grace. There is no God but He. Towards Him is the eventual return.

4.Munir Mezyed: No one (dares) to dispute over the (Holy) ‘Verses’ of Allâh except for those who lack Faith (in the oneness of Allâh). Therefore, let not their successful movement throughout the land delude you.

5.Munir Mezyed: The people of ‘Noah’ and the confederates after them belied (their Messengers) before the Pagan Arabs. And every nation purposed to persecute their messenger, and disputed by all means of falsehood to rebut therewith the Truth. Thus, I seized them. How dreadful was My requital!

6.Munir Mezyed: Thus, was the Word, (i.e. the divine tribulation), of your Lord rightfully fulfilled against those who lack Faith (in the oneness of Allâh). They are indeed the ‘Companions of the Fire’.

7.Munir Mezyed: Those (‘Angels’) who bear the ‘( Glorious)  Throne’  and all those around it do glorify the praises of their Lord and believe in Him, asking forgiveness for those who adhere to Islamic monotheism, (saying), “Our Lord, You encompass all things in mercy and knowledge and therefore forgive those who repent and follow Your path, and protect them from the chastisement of ‘Hellfire’.

8.Munir Mezyed: Our Lord, admit them into the ‘Gardens of Eden’, which you have promised them, with the righteous among their fathers, their wives, and their progeny. Indeed, You are the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

9.Munir Mezyed: And ward off from them evil deeds. Whomever You ward him off evil deeds this day has received mercy from You. This is most ultimate success and the supreme one.

10.Munir Mezyed: Those who persist in disbelief in Allâh will be told: “The reluctance of Allâh towards you is much greater than your reluctance towards one another, because whenever you are called to Faith, you choose to act impiously ( & to walk in the path of disobedience)."

11.Munir Mezyed: They will say: “Our Lord, You have caused us to die twice. And You have given us life twice. Thus, we confess our sins. Is there then any way out of this?”

12.Munir Mezyed: (It will be said unto them): This is (your plight) because when Allâh was called upon, you  persist in disbelief ( in Him).  But if others were associated with Him, you would accept it as true. Thus, the verdict belongs to Allâh, the Most High, the Most Great."

13.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who shows you His signs ( of power & glory)  and sends down for you livelihood from the heavens. No one remembers but the one who turns unto Allâh in repentance.

14.Munir Mezyed: Therefor, (O' ‘Monotheistic Believers’), implore and pray to Allâh (Alone), dedicating yourselves to the worship and service of (almighty Allâh). No matter how detestable is to those who lack Faith (in the oneness of Allâh)

15.Munir Mezyed: (Allâh is the) Possessor of the highest ranks, Lord of the (Glorious) Throne.  He places the inspiration of His Command upon whom He wills of His servants to warn (all) of the day of meeting (Him).

16.Munir Mezyed: The day will come when they appear before Allâh, nothing will remain hidden from Allâh concerning them. Unto Whom belongs the (absolute) sovereignty this day? Unto Allâh, the One, the Omnipotent!

17.Munir Mezyed: On that day, every ‘Human Self’ will be remunerated (fairly) for what it earned. There will be no injustice on that day. Indeed, Allâh is extremely Swift in reckoning.

18.Munir Mezyed: Warn them, (O’ ‘Muhammad’), against an ‘ imminent day’ when hearts will rise up to the throats, grieving inwardly. Those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong will have neither an intimate friend, nor an intercessor whose intercession might be accepted (by the Lord).

19.Munir Mezyed: He knows perfectly well that which beguiles the eyes, and what the hearts conceal.

20.Munir Mezyed: Allâh judges (the peoples) with equity. And those to whom they implore and pray besides Him cannot judge anything. Indeed, Allâh is the All-Hearer, the All-Seer.

21.Munir Mezyed: Have they, ( the Pagan Arabs), not travelled through the land and seen what was the dreadful outcome of those who were before them? They were more powerful than them in strength, and in leaving behind their traces on earth. But Allâh destroyed them for their sins. They had none to defend and to save them from the retribution of Allâh.

22.Munir Mezyed: That was because there came to them their ‘Messengers’ with the full knowledge of the truth, but they persist in denying. Therefore, Allâh seized them. Indeed, He is All-Strong, Rigorous in executing  punishment.

23.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We sent ‘Moses’ (as Our ‘Messenger’) with Our Sings (of power & glory) as well as with evident authority

24.Munir Mezyed: To ‘Pharaoh’, ‘Hāmān’ and ‘Korah’, but they said: ”(This man is) a sorcerer and big liar!”

25.Munir Mezyed: Then, when he brought to them the Truth from Us, they said: “Kill the sons of those who adhere to monotheism, and spare their women." But the guile of those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) ends in naught but deception.

26.Munir Mezyed: ‘Pharaoh’ said: "Allow me to kill ‘Moses’, and let him implore and pray to his Lord. Indeed, I truly fear that he may change your system of faith and worship, or he may cause corruption to appear throughout the land."

27.Munir Mezyed: ‘Moses’ said: "Indeed, I seek earnestly refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant who refuses to believe in the ‘Day of Judgment’.”

28.Munir Mezyed: A monotheistic believer from the clan of ‘Pharaoh’ who hid his faith said: "Do you kill a man just because he says Allâh is my Lord? He has come to you with the knowledge of the truth from your Lord. However, if it happens that he is a liar, upon him will be his lie, and if he is truthful, there will befall you some of that which he threatens you with. Indeed, Allâh illuminates not the path of the one who is a prodigal, a liar.

29.Munir Mezyed: O’ my people, yours is the sovereignty today.  You are being dominant in the land. But who could protect us from the retribution of Allâh if it came to us.”  ‘Pharaoh’ said: "I let you see only which I see and guide you only to the right way."

30.Munir Mezyed: The monotheistic believer said: "O’ my people, indeed, I truly fear for you (a dreadful) day like that one of the Confederates.

31.Munir Mezyed: (A calamity) like that of the people of ‘Noah’, ‘‘Ād’, ‘Thamūd’, and those who came after them. Allâh never intends to do injustice to his Servants.

32.Munir Mezyed: O’ my people, I truly fear for you the day of calling out.

33.Munir Mezyed: The day when you will turn your backs and flee while having no protector from the (the divine tribulation) of Allâh. Whomsoever Allâh caused to go astray will have no one to guide him.”

34.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, ‘Joseph’ came to you before with the knowledge of the truth but you continued to doubt concerning what he brought you. Then, when he died you said:  "Allâh will not send any ‘Messenger’ after him."Thus, Allâh lets the one who is prodigal and skeptic live in deception.

35.Munir Mezyed: Those who dispute over the ‘Revelations of Allâh’ without any authority that has come to them (need to know that) disputing over ‘the Revelations of Allâh’ is greatly detestable in the sight of Allâh, and in the sight of those who adhere to monotheism. Thus does Allâh seal up the heart of every arrogant, supercilious.

36.Munir Mezyed: ‘Pharaoh’ said: "O’ Hāmān, construct for me a high tower so that I may attain the means of access,

37.Munir Mezyed: The means of access to the heavens, and then I will climb up to the Lord of ‘Moses’. I definitely think that ‘Moses’ is lying." Thus, the evil deed of ‘Pharaoh’ seemed appealing to his eye and prevented him from following the right path. The guile of ‘Pharaoh’ is nothing but perdition.

38.Munir Mezyed: The monotheistic believer said: “O’ my people, follow me! I will lead you to the right way.

39.Munir Mezyed: O’ my people, indeed, this ‘worldly life’ is nothing but provisions of illusion while the ‘Hereafter’ is truly the Eternal Home.

40.Munir Mezyed: Whoever does one evil deed will be requited only with the like of it. Whoever does one righteous good deed, whether male or female, while being a monotheistic believer, those are the ones who will be admitted into ‘Al- Jannah’, wherein they will receive their sustenance without any measure.

41.Munir Mezyed: O’ my people, how is it possible that I invite you to salvation while you are inviting me to ‘Hellfire’?

42.Munir Mezyed: You invite me to disbelieve in Allâh and to associate with Him that of which I have no knowledge while I am calling you to (believe in) the All-Mighty, the Oft-Forgiving!

43.Munir Mezyed: Unquestionably, what you invite me to do has no basis in this ‘worldly life’; neither in ‘Hereafter’. Indeed, our eventual return will be towards Allâh. Indeed, the prodigals will be the ‘companions of the Fire’.

44.Munir Mezyed: Someday you will remember what I say unto you. I confide my issue to Allâh. Indeed, Allâh is Well Aware of all His servants."

45.Munir Mezyed: Thus, Allâh saved him from the evil consequences of what they conspired, while the evil punishment encompassed the clan of ‘Pharaoh’:

46.Munir Mezyed: They are exposed to Fire (in their graves) morning and evening. On the day when the ‘Hour’ of (Reckoning) comes to pass, (it will be said to the ‘Angels’): “Let the clan of ‘Pharaoh’ enter the most severe chastisement."

47.Munir Mezyed: (Mention) when they will quarrel in the Fire, the weak will say to those who used to act superciliously: “Indeed, we were your followers. Will you then avert from us a portion of the Fire?"

48.Munir Mezyed: The ones who used to act superciliously: “We are all in it. Indeed, Allâh has already judged between the servants!"

49.Munir Mezyed: Those in the Fire will say to the guards of Gehenna: ""Call upon your Lord to lighten for us the chastisement for a day."

50.Munir Mezyed: They will say: “Did not your ‘Messengers’ come to you with the knowledge of the truth?” They will say: "Yea." The guards will then say: "You may pray and implore (as much as you can) but the supplication of those who lack Faith (in the oneness of Allâh) will be totally in vain."

51.Munir Mezyed: Verily, We will grant victory to Our ‘Messengers’ and to those who adhere firmly to monotheism in this ‘worldly life’, and on the day when the witnesses will stand forth,

52.Munir Mezyed: The day when their excuses will not avail those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong. For them will be the curse (of Allâh), and for them will be the evil abode.

53.Munir Mezyed: Indeed We gave ‘Moses’ the guidance (into all the truth); and We let the Children of Israel inherit the ‘Scripture’,

54.Munir Mezyed: A source of spiritual insight and a reminder for those who possess self- awareness that allows them to understand.

55.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, endure patiently! Indeed, the promise of Allâh is all true. Seek forgiveness for your sins, celebrate the praises of your Lord and declare His divine glory in the evenings and in the early mornings.

56.Munir Mezyed: Those who dispute over the ‘Revelations’ of Allâh without any authority that has come to them, there is nothing else in their hearts but greed for dominance, which they will never be able to obtain. Therefore, seek refuge in Allâh. Indeed, He is the One Who is the All- Hearer, the All-Seer.

57.Munir Mezyed: Verily, the creation of the heavens and earth is greater than the creation of human beings, but most people do lack knowledge (of Allâh).

58.Munir Mezyed: Not equal are the (spiritual) blind person and the enlightened one, neither are those who attain to Faith (in Allâh) and do righteous acts equal to the sinners. Little do you cerebrate!

59.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, the ‘Hour’ (of Reckoning) is about to come, there is no doubt therein, but most people refuse to accept Allâh (into their life).

60.Munir Mezyed: Your Lord says: "Implore and pray to Me, I will answer you. Those who are too proud to worship Me will definitely be admitted into ‘Hellfire’, forcibly."

61.Munir Mezyed: Allâh is the One Who has made the night for you so that you may be able to rest therein, and the day for you to be able to see.  Allâh is Benevolent towards the people, but most people are ungrateful.

62.Munir Mezyed: This is Allâh, your Lord, the Creator of all things. There is no God but He. So how they are deceived into going away?

63.Munir Mezyed: This is how those who used to act impiously towards the ‘Revelations’ of Allâh were also deceived.

64.Munir Mezyed: Allâh is the One Who has made for you the earth a dwelling place and the heavens a structure, and fashioned you in the best form, providing you with wholesome good things. This is Allâh, your Lord. So blessed is Allâh, the Lord of all the worlds.

65.Munir Mezyed: He is the Ever Living One. There is no God but He. Therefore, implore and pray to Allâh, dedicating yourselves to the worship and service of (almighty Allâh). All the praises and gratitude belong to Allâh, the Lord of all the worlds.

66.Munir Mezyed: Say, (O’ ‘Muhammad’): "I am forbidden to worship ( & venerate) those whom you implore and pray besides Allâh, since there have come to me the full knowledge of the truth from my Lord. And I am commanded to submit (myself completely) to the Lord of all the worlds.

67.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who created you from dust, then from a semen-drop, then from a clinging substance, then He brings you forth as a child, then He makes you reach maturity, then you become old - though some among you die before - and that you may reach a predetermined age, and that you may be able to comprehend.

68.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who gives life and causes death. When He decrees a matter, He only says unto it, "Be," consequently, there it is.

69.Munir Mezyed: Have you not seen those who dispute over the ‘Revelations’ of Allâh? How could they give no heed?!

70.Munir Mezyed: Those who give no credence to the ‘Book’, (-this Qur’ān-), and to the (revelations) with which We sent down to our ‘Messengers’, will come to know (the consequences of their denial).

71.Munir Mezyed: (The day will come) when the shackles will be placed around their necks and be dragged

72.Munir Mezyed: Into the scalding water, and then they will be completely burned in the Fire.

73.Munir Mezyed: Then it will be said unto them: "Where are (the deities) which you used to associate (with Him in worship)

74.Munir Mezyed: Besides Allâh?" They will say: “They have vanished away from us. Actually, we used to worship (& venerate) nothing.”  This is how Allâh leaves those who lack Faith (in Him) to go astray.

75.Munir Mezyed: (They will be told),˺ “(This punishment) is for being prideful on earth unjustly and for behaving insolently.

76.Munir Mezyed: Thus, enter the gates of ‘Hellfire’ to abide therein. How dreadful is the abode of the imperious!”

77.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, endure patiently, (O’ ‘Prophet’)! Surely the Promise of Allâh is all true. Whether We may allow you to see part of what We threaten them with, or We may cause you to die (before that) , still unto Us will they be returned.

78.Munir Mezyed: Indeed We have sent ‘Messengers’ before you, among them those of whom We have mentioned to you, and some of whom We have not mentioned to you. It is not possible for a ‘Messenger’ to be able to produce any revelation knowledge without the permission of Allâh. Thus, when the Command of Allâh comes, the matter will be decided with truth. And there where the promoters of falsehood are the ones who are doomed to eternal perdition.

79.Munir Mezyed: Allâh is the One Who has created the livestock for you so that you may ride on some of them, and some of them you may eat.

80.Munir Mezyed: There are many benefits in them for you so that you may satisfy by their means a need that is in your hearts. On them and on ships, you are carried.

81.Munir Mezyed: He shows you His Signs (of power & glory). Then, which is it, of the Sings of your Lord, that you seek to deny?

82.Munir Mezyed: Have they (-the Pagan Arabs-) not travelled through the land and seen what was the dreadful consequence of those who were before them? They were more powerful than them in strength, and in leaving behind their traces on earth, yet all that which they used to earn did not avail them .

83.Munir Mezyed: Then when their ‘Messengers’ came to them with the full knowledge of the truth, they rejoiced over the (worldly) knowledge that they had. However, they were encompassed by what they used to scoff.

84.Munir Mezyed: Then, when they saw Our divine retribution, they said: “We believe in Allâh only, and disbelieve in all what we used to associate with Him,"

85.Munir Mezyed: But their faith could not avail them, when they saw Our divine retribution. This is the (divine) law of Allâh, which has been established to deal with His servants. And there where those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) are doomed to eternal perdition.

41.SurahEnglishNames: Explained in Detail, Revelations Well Expounded

1.Munir Mezyed: Haa. Me’im.

2.Munir Mezyed: (This Glorious Qur’ān is) a revelation knowledge from the Most Beneficent, the Most Merciful.

3.Munir Mezyed: (It is a) ‘Book’ whose (Holy) ‘Verses’ are elucidated in full detail, an Arabic ‘Qur’ān’ for a people who have spiritual gift of knowledge..

4.Munir Mezyed: It contains joyful news (of how to attain eternal salvation) and sufficient warning (about how to avoid ‘Hellfire’). But most of them pay not heed to it, so they listen not.

5.Munir Mezyed: They say: “Our hearts are under coverings from that to which you, (O‘ ‘Muhammad’), invite us, while there is deafness in our ears, and there is a veil between you and us. Subsequently, do what you intend to do and so will we."

6.Munir Mezyed: Say: “I am not more than a human being like you. It is revealed to me that your god is One God. Thus, follow the upright path to Him and crave for His Forgiveness. Woe unto the ‘Polytheists’!

7.Munir Mezyed: They are the ones who refuse to pay Zakāt (i.e. the Prescribed Purifying Alms), and  refuse to admit the truth of the ‘Hereafter’!

8.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who adhere firmly to monotheism and do righteous acts will have a never-ending reward."

9.Munir Mezyed: Say: "Do you really disbelieve in the One who created the earth in two days?! Do you ascribe to Him rivals?! He is the Lord of all the worlds.”

10.Munir Mezyed: He placed therein firmly-set mountains above its surface. And He blessed it and ordained therein its sustenance in four periods in order to fulfill the needs of all its inhabitants.

11.Munir Mezyed: Then turned He to the sky when it was smoke and said to it, and (also) to the earth: “Come both of you, willingly or reluctantly." They said: "We come willingly.

12.Munir Mezyed: Thus, He formed the seven heavens in two days and inspired in each firmament its affair. He embellished the lowest sky with lamps and kept it safe. That is the measuring of the All- Mighty, the All-Knowing.

13.Munir Mezyed: But if they take no heed, then say: “I warn you of a thunderbolt like the thunderbolt (that struck the people of ) ‘of ‘Ād’ and ‘Thamūd’.”

14.Munir Mezyed: When the ‘Messengers’ came o them and behind them, saying: "Worship none but Allâh," they said: "If our Lord had willed, He would definitely have sent down ‘Angels’ (to us). Therefore, we are not going to believe in whatever you say."

15.Munir Mezyed: As for (the people of) ‘Ād’, they were so imperious in the land without justification.  They said: "Who is more powerful than us?" Could they not see that Allâh Who created them is more powerful than them? And they used to act impiously towards Our ‘Revelations’.

16.Munir Mezyed: We sent upon them a furious wind in very unfortunate days, so that We may let them taste the retribution of humiliation in this ‘worldly life’, and the retribution of the ‘Hereafter’ is more humiliating. They will never be able to get help..

17.Munir Mezyed: As for (the people of) ‘Thamūd’, We showed them the right path but they preferred blindness instead of spiritual insight. Thus, the chastisement of thunderbolt overtook them for what they used to gain.

18.Munir Mezyed: We saved those who attained Faith in Allâh, and used to act piously.

19.Munir Mezyed: The day will come when the enemies of Allâh will be gathered to the Fire, and they will be divided into groups;

20.Munir Mezyed: Till when they reach it, their ears, their eyes and their skins will testify against them, as to what they used to do.

21.Munir Mezyed: They will say to their skins: "Why did you testify against us?" They will say: “Allâh has made us to speak, as He makes all things to speak.” He is the One who created you the first time, and to Him, you are destined to be brought back.

22.Munir Mezyed: And you did not hide yourselves, (when you used to commit evil acts), lest your hearing or your eyes or your skins should bear witness against you. Actually you speculated that Allâh would not know too much about what you did.

23.Munir Mezyed: That was your speculation which you speculated about your Lord. It  brought you nothing but ruin (over ruin), and you have become among those who are doomed to eternal perdition.

24.Munir Mezyed: Then if they cannot endure, still the Fire will be their abode. If they ask for favor, they will not be of those who are  allowed to receive (God’s) favor.

25.Munir Mezyed: We have appointed for them intimate companions, who made whatever was before them and whatever was behind them, appear appealing to them.  The Word, (the divine retribution), has come into effect against them among the nations of jinn and men, that have passed away before them. Indeed, they were the sons of eternal perdition."

26.Munir Mezyed: Those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh), say: “Do not listen to this ‘Qur’ān’ but create disturbances in the midst of its (recitation), so that you may overcome.”

27.Munir Mezyed: We will definitely let those who persist in disbelief (in the oneness of Allâh) taste a dreadful retribution. We will definitely chastise them the worst of what they used to do.

28.Munir Mezyed: That is the remuneration of the enemies of Allâh: The Fire, therein will be for them an eternal home as a remuneration because they used to act impiously toward Our ‘Revelations’.

29.Munir Mezyed: Those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) will say: “Our Lord, show us the ones who led us astray from among the jinn and humankind. We will trample them under our feet so that they may become among the lowest."

30.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who used to say: “Our Lord is Allâh” and then behaved uprightly and religiously, the ‘Angels’ will descend upon them, saying unto them: “Fear not nor grieve. But receive the joyful news of ‘Al-Jannah’, which you were promised.

31.Munir Mezyed: We are your guardians in ‘worldly life’ and in the ‘Hereafter’. You will have therein whatever you desire. And you will have therein whatever you ask for:

32.Munir Mezyed: A welcome gift from the Oft- Forgiving, Most Merciful."

33.Munir Mezyed: Who is better in speech than the one who invites to Allâh and does righteous acts while saying: "Indeed, I am one of those who submit themselves (completely to the authority of Allâh) ."

34.Munir Mezyed: Not equal are the good deed and the evil deed. Repel against the evil deed with one which is better. Thus, it could be possible that the one who used to be your enemy might become (one day) your best friend.

35.Munir Mezyed: But no one is granted it but those who are patient, and none is granted it but the one who has good fortune!

36.Munir Mezyed: In case there comes to you an evil suggestion from the devil, then seek refuge in Allâh. Indeed, He is the All-Hearer, the All-Knowing.

37.Munir Mezyed: Of His Signs (of power & glory) are the night and the day, the sun and the moon. Thus, prostrate neither to the sun nor to the moon. But prostrate to Allâh, who created them, if you truly worship (& venerate) Him alone.

38.Munir Mezyed: If they acted superciliously, (let them know, O’ Muhammad, that there are others) who are near your Lord, celebrate His infinite glory during the night and the day without being worn out.

39.Munir Mezyed: (One) of His Signs (of power & glory) is that you see the earth barren but when We send down water thereon, it trembles and grows. Indeed, the One Who gives it life is the Granter of life to the dead. Indeed, He is capable of doing whatever He wills.

40.Munir Mezyed: Those who deny (the divine credibility of) Our ‘Verses’ are not hidden from Us. Is the one who is cast into the Fire better or the one who comes safe on the ‘Day of Resurrection’? Do whatever you like. Indeed, He is All-Seer of all what you do.

41.Munir Mezyed: Those who disbelieve in the ‘ Reminder (or) Revealer of Truth’, (the ‘Qur’ān’) when it comes to them, (need to know that) it is certainly an Irrefutable Book.

42.Munir Mezyed: Falsehood cannot approach it from before it or from behind it. (It is) a ‘Revelation Knowledge’ from the All-Wise, Worthy of all praise.

43.Munir Mezyed: Nothing is said to you but what was said unto the ‘Messengers’ before you. Indeed, your Lord is the Lord of forgiveness, and (also) the Lord of Painful chastisement.

44.Munir Mezyed: If We had made the ‘Qur’ān’ in a foreign language other than Arabic, they would have certainly argued, “Why are its verses not explained in detail ( in our language)? Is it a foreign (recitation) and an Arab (‘Messenger’)?" Say unto them, (O’ ‘Muhammad’): "It is a source of spiritual insight and healing for those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism. As for those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh), there is deafness in their ears while blindness is upon them. They are the ones who are called from a distant place.

45.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We gave ‘Moses’ the ‘Scripture’, but disagreement arose therein. Had it not been for a Word that had already gone forth from your Lord, (the divine retribution of Allâh would have overtaken them) and then the whole issue would have been settled between them. Indeed, they were deeply skeptical about It..

46.Munir Mezyed: Whoever does a righteous good deed, it is for his own benefit. Whoever does an evil deed, it is for his own loss. Your Lord would never intend to be iniquitous towards His servants.

47.Munir Mezyed: To Him is referred the Knowledge of the ‘Hour’ (of Reckoning). No fruit comes forth from its sheath, nor does a female conceive or gives birth except with His knowledge. On the day when He will call unto them: "Where are My (so- called) partners?" They will say: “"We proclaim to You that none of us is a witness."

48.Munir Mezyed: Those whom they used to (venerate &) worship before will fail them. They will realize there is no way for them to escape.

49.Munir Mezyed: Man never gets tired of imploring and praying for good things. But if evil touches him, then he will give up hope, and will be driven to despair.

50.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, if we let him taste mercy from Us after some affliction that has touched him, he will definitely say: "This is due to me. I do not deem that the ‘Hour’ (of Reckoning) will ever come to pass. Even if I am brought back to my Lord, certainly, I will be better off with Him.” Then, We verily will inform those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) of what they have done. And We will let them taste harsh chastisement.

51.Munir Mezyed: When We show favor to a human being, he turns away and withdraws aside. And when evil touches him, then he is full of prolonged supplication.

52.Munir Mezyed: Say: “Tell me, if (this ‘Qur’ān’) is from Allâh, and you disbelieve in it, then, who is in greater error than the one who is in a prolonged schism?"

53.Munir Mezyed: We will show them Our Signs (of power & glory) on the horizons and within themselves until it becomes evident to them that (this ‘Qur’ān’) is the ultimate truth. Is it not sufficient that your Lord is a Witness over all things?

54.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, they are deeply skeptical about the meeting with their Lord! He distinctly encompasses all things.

1.Munir Mezyed: Haa. Me’im!

2.Munir Mezyed: A'in. Siin. Qaf!

3.Munir Mezyed: Thus does Allâh, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise, reveal ( the truth about Himself) to you (as He revealed it) to those before you.

4.Munir Mezyed: Unto Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. He is the Most High, the Most Great.

5.Munir Mezyed: The heavens are almost about to disintegrate above them, and the ‘Angels’ glorify the praises of their Lord, asking for forgiveness for those on the earth. Unquestionably, Allâh is the Oft-Forgiving, the Most Merciful.

6.Munir Mezyed: As for those who take guardians besides Him (need to know that) Allâh is Guardian over them, and you (Muhammad) are not their advocate.

7.Munir Mezyed: We thus reveal to you an Arabic ‘Qur’ān’ so that you may forewarn the mother of the towns (‘Mecca’) and all around it, and you may give warning of the inevitable ‘Day of Resurrection’ when some will be in ‘Al- Jannah’ and others will be in the ‘Inferno’.

8.Munir Mezyed: If Allâh had willed, He would definitely have made them one community. But He admits whom He wills into His (divine) clemency. Those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong will have neither guardian nor helper.

9.Munir Mezyed: Or have they taken guardians besides Him? Allâh alone is the guardian. He is the One Who gives life to the dead.  And He is capable of doing whatever He wills.

10.Munir Mezyed: In whatever you differ, the verdict thereof is with Allâh. This is Allâh, my Lord. I depend on Him with full trust. And unto Him, I do turn in repentance.

11.Munir Mezyed: ( He is) the Creator of the heavens and of the earth. He has made for you pairs from among yourselves, and pairs of the cattle, too, multiplying you thereby. There is nothing like to Him. He is the All-Hearer, the All-Seer.

12.Munir Mezyed: Unto Him belong the keys of the heavens and of the earth. He extends and straitens His sustenance to whom He wills. Indeed, He is the All-Knowing of everything.

13.Munir Mezyed: He has ordained for you of religion which He commended to ‘Noah’, that which We have revealed unto you, (O’ ‘Muhammad’), and what We commended to ‘Abraham’, ‘Moses’ and ‘Jesus’  to establish firmly the Faith , and do not be divided therein. Intractable for ‘Polytheists’ is that to which you invite them. Allâh chooses for Himself whom He wills, and guides into Himself whoever turns unto Him in repentance.

14.Munir Mezyed: They were not divided until after the knowledge of Truth had come to them because of jealousy and resentment among themselves. Had it not been for a Word that had already gone forth from your Lord for an appointed term, then the whole issue would have been settled between them. Those who were made to inherit the ‘Scripture’ after them are verily in deeply skeptical about it.

15.Munir Mezyed: So, to that (Faith), keep on inviting, remain on the right course as you are commanded, take not in their self-deceived beliefs for the epistemic and say: ”I believe fully and absolutely in what Allâh has revealed of the Qur’ān. And I am commanded to do justice between you. Allâh is our Lord and your Lord. It is incumbent on us to bear the burden of our deeds, and on you to bear the burden of your deeds. There is no (need for) disputation between us. Allâh will bring us together. And to Him is the definitive course."

16.Munir Mezyed: Those who dispute about Allâh after obedience has been rendered to Him, their argument is invalidated in the sight of their Lord. And upon them is wrath. They will be subjected to a vehement punishment.

17.Munir Mezyed: He is Allâh, the One Who sent down the ‘Book’, (the ‘Qur’ān’), in truth, and the scale. What will make you know? Perhaps the (Inevitable) ‘Hour’ (of Reckoning) is close at hand.

18.Munir Mezyed: Those who disbelieve in it (ask) to hasten it. But those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism are fearful of it since they know that it is the (ultimate) truth. Indeed, those who harbor doubts about the (Inevitable) ‘Hour’ (of Reckoning) have gone far astray.

19.Munir Mezyed: Allâh is extremely Benevolent towards His servants. He gives sustenance to whom He wills. He is the All-Strong, the All-Mighty.

20.Munir Mezyed: Whoever seeks the tillage of the ‘Hereafter’, We will increase his tillage. Whoever seeks the tillage of this ‘worldly life’, We will give him thereof. But he will have no share in the ‘Hereafter’.

21.Munir Mezyed: What! Have they partners (-deities-), who have made lawful for them in the divine faith that which Allâh did not permit? Had it not been for the decisive Word, the whole issue would have been settled between them. Indeed, those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong will be subjected to a painful punishment.

22.Munir Mezyed: You will see those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong, fearful of that which they have earned, and the divine retribution will certainly befall them. But those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism and do righteous acts (in this ‘worldly life’) will be in the flowering meadows of the Gardens. They will have whatever they desire from their Lord. That is the supreme bounty.

23.Munir Mezyed: That is of which Allâh gives the joyful tidings to His pious savants who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism and do righteous acts (in this ‘worldly life’). Say: (O’ ‘Muhammad’), “I ask of you no reward for (my efforts to guide you into all the truth), except love for the kinsfolk." Whoever does a good righteous deed, We will give him more of good therein.  Indeed, Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, All-Appreciative.

24.Munir Mezyed: Or do they say: "He has invented a lie about Allâh?” If Allâh willed, He would close securely your heart. Allâh will completely remove falsehood and will entrench the truth by His Word. Indeed, He is All-Knowing of what is hidden in the hearts.

25.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who accepts repentance from His servants and delivers people from the punishment of their sins. He is Fully Aware of everything you do.
