26.Munir Mezyed: And He answers those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism and do righteous acts (in this ‘worldly life’). He will give them more out of His Grace. As for those who lack Faith (in the oneness of Allâh), there is a vehement punishment.

27.Munir Mezyed: If Allâh were to extend excessively the sustenance for his servants, they would certainly rebel in the earth. But He sends down by measure as He wills. Indeed, He is All-Aware, All-Seer of His serpents.

28.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who sends down the rain after they have despaired, and spreads out His Mercy. He is the Guardian, Worthy of all Praise.

29.Munir Mezyed: (One) of His Signs (of power & glory) is the creation of the heavens and of the earth, and of whatever beasts He hath dispersed therein. He is extremely capable of gathering them together whenever He wills.

30.Munir Mezyed: Whatever misfortune befalls you, it is due to what your own hands have earned.

31.Munir Mezyed: And you cannot frustrate the power (of Allâh) on the earth, and you will have no one besides Him as your guardian or helper.

32.Munir Mezyed: (One) of His Signs (of power & glory) is the ships in the sea like the mountains.

33.Munir Mezyed: If He wills, He can cause the wind to become still, and let the ships remain motionless on the top of water - there are signs in this for every patient, grateful.

34.Munir Mezyed: Or He can destroy them (by drowning) as a divine retribution for their evil deeds.  But He pardons much.

35.Munir Mezyed: Those who dispute over Our ‘Holy Verses’ will find out that there is no place of refuge for them.

36.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, whatever you are given is but a provision of this ‘worldly life’. And that which Allâh has is far better and more lasting for those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, and depend on their Lord with full trust.

37.Munir Mezyed: And those who shun the major sins and indecencies, and whenever they are angry, they forgive.

38.Munir Mezyed: Those who respond to their Lord and establish prayers, and whose affairs are a matter of mutual consultation, and who expend of what We have bestowed on them.

39.Munir Mezyed: And those who when injustice is done to them know how to defend themselves.

40.Munir Mezyed: The divine retribution for an evil is an evil like thereof, but whoever forgives and mends his ways, his reward is due from Allâh. Indeed, Allâh demonstrates not his own love for those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong.

41.Munir Mezyed: Certainly, there is no blame on the one who avenges himself after being wronged.

42.Munir Mezyed: The way (of blame) is only against those who oppress people, and wrongfully revolt on the earth. For those, there will be painful chastisement.

43.Munir Mezyed: Resorting to patience and forgiveness reflects a true strength of character.

44.Munir Mezyed: Whomever Allâh sends astray, he will never be able to find guardian after this. You will see those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong when they behold the punishment, saying: “Is there any way of return?”

45.Munir Mezyed: You see them when they are exposed to the Fire, being humbled due to humiliation, looking with a stealthy glance. Those who had attained Faith ( in Allâh)  will say: “Indeed, the real losers are the ones who brought destruction to themselves and to their families on the ‘Day of Resurrection’. Definitely, those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong will be in perpetual torment."

46.Munir Mezyed: They will have no guardians to help them other than Allâh. Whomever Allâh sends astray, for him there is no way to guide him.

47.Munir Mezyed: Respond to your Lord before there comes to you from Allâh a day which cannot be averted when you will find no refuge to escape from the chastisement of Allâh, nor can you deny your evil deeds.

48.Munir Mezyed: But if it happens that they take no heed, (then remember), We have sent you not as a guardian over them but to convey (the message & to preach). Indeed, When We let man taste mercy from Us, he rejoices over it. But when he is afflicted by evil because of what his own hands have sent before, then definitely he becomes ungrateful.

49.Munir Mezyed: Unto Allâh belongs the (absolute) sovereignty of the heavens and of the earth, creating whatever He wills, giving daughters to whomever He wills, and giving sons to whomever He wills.

50.Munir Mezyed: Or He gives both males and females, causing whomever He wills to be barren. Indeed, He is the All-Knowing and is capable of doing whatever He wills.

51.Munir Mezyed: It is not possible for a human being to communicate with Allâh except through inspiration, or from behind a veil, or by sending an ‘Apostle’ through whom He reveals whatever He wills. Indeed, He is Most High, Most Wise.

52.Munir Mezyed: In the same manner, We inspired in you, (‘Muhammad’), a Spirit of Our command. You knew not what the ‘Book’ is, or what ‘Faith’ is. But We have made it (-this ‘Qur’ān’ -) a light, illuminating the inner self of whom We will of Our servants.  (O’ ‘Muhammad’, through your preaching), you are certainly illuminating the inner self of the people into the straight path,

53.Munir Mezyed: The path of Allâh, to Whom belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is on the earth. Definitely, with Allâh, all matters do end up.

43.SurahEnglishNames: Ornaments of Gold, Luxury, The Embellishment

1.Munir Mezyed: Haa. Me’im!

2.Munir Mezyed: By this divine ‘Book’, which reveals the ultimate truth, is a Revelation Knowledge from Allâh.

3.Munir Mezyed: We certainly made it an Arabic ‘Qur’ān’ so that you may be able to comprehend (the divine order).

4.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, It is in the Mother of the Book which We possess, truly elevated and fraught with wisdom.

5.Munir Mezyed: Well then, should We take away the Reminder (or) 'Revealer of Truth' and ignore you because you are folk of prodigals?

6.Munir Mezyed: We sent so many ‘Prophets’ to the ancient people.

7.Munir Mezyed: Never came there to them a ‘Prophet’ but they mocked at him.

8.Munir Mezyed: Then We annihilated those who were more powerful than these (Pagan Arabs), and the divine retribution of the ancients has gone before.

9.Munir Mezyed: If it happens that you ask them, (the Pagan Arabs) : "Who created the heavens and earth?” they would definitely say: "It is the All-Mighty (Allâh), the All-Knowing Who has created them."

10.Munir Mezyed: He made the earth for you a cradle and set up roads therein so that you may be able to find your way.

11.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who sent down from the sky water according to a measure. Then, We resuscitate a dead land therewith. In the same manner you will be resurrected.

12.Munir Mezyed: He is the One who created all things in pairs and made for you ships and cattle on which you ride,

13.Munir Mezyed: So that you may mount upon their backs, remember the grace of your Lord when you thereon and say: "Glory be to Him who has subjected this to us since we were incapable of doing it.

14.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, to our Lord, we are all destined to return."

15.Munir Mezyed: Yet they ascribe to some of His servants a share with Him. Indeed man is evidently ungrateful.

16.Munir Mezyed: Or has He taken daughters to Himself of what He creates and favored you with sons?

17.Munir Mezyed: When one of them is informed of the news of that the like of which he ascribes to the Most Beneficent (God), his face becomes gloomy. And he is filled with sorrow.

18.Munir Mezyed: Do they ascribe to Allâh one who is reared amid ornaments and incapable of making plain speech in disputes?

19.Munir Mezyed: They have mythologized that the ‘Angels’ who are the servants of the Most Beneficent (God) are females. Their testimony will be set down in writing and they will be questioned.

20.Munir Mezyed: They even said: "If the Most Beneficent (God) had willed, we would not have worshiped (& venerated) them, (-the mythological gods-)." They have no knowledge whatsoever of that. They only try to impose a misleading belief.

21.Munir Mezyed: Or have We given them any book before, (this ‘Qur’ān’), and so they are holding fast to it?

22.Munir Mezyed: Nay, they say, "We found our fathers following a certain system of faith and worship, and so we are certainly guided by their footsteps."

23.Munir Mezyed: In the same manner, whenever We sent a ‘Messenger’ before you into a township (to warn & preach), the wealthy ones of it said: “We found our fathers following a certain system of faith and worship. Thus, it is part of our duty to walk in their Footsteps."

24.Munir Mezyed: He said: “What! Even if I bring you better guide on which you found your fathers following?” They said: “Undoubtedly, we are not going to believe in whatever you bring.”

25.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, We inflicted the divine retribution on them. Look and see the dreadful end of those who belied the ‘Messenger’.

26.Munir Mezyed: (Mention) when ‘Abraham’ said to his father and his people: "I disown what you worship (& venerate)

27.Munir Mezyed: Except Him Who created me. Indeed, He will illuminate my path."

28.Munir Mezyed: He made it a word to enduring among his posterity so that they might return.

29.Munir Mezyed: Nay, I gave enjoyment to these (-people of Mecca-), and to their fathers until there came to them the truth and a ‘Messenger’ making things explicit (for them).

30.Munir Mezyed: When the knowledge of Truth came to them, they said: “This mere magic, and we are not going to give credence to it."

31.Munir Mezyed: They said: "Why was not this ‘Qur’ān’ sent down upon a great man from one of the two cities?"

32.Munir Mezyed: Are they the ones who divide and allocate the mercy of your Lord? It is We who distribute between them their livelihood in this ‘worldly life’. And We exalt some of them above others in rank so that some of them may take others in subjection. The mercy of your Lord is far better than that which they accumulate.

33.Munir Mezyed: If it were not that, the people would have become one community. And We would have made for those who disbelieve in the Most Beneficent (God) - for their houses - roofs and stairs of silver whereby to mount,

34.Munir Mezyed: And for their houses, doors (of silver), and couches (of silver) on which they recline,

35.Munir Mezyed: And ornaments of gold. Yet all this is naught but a provision of ‘this worldly life’. The ‘Hereafter’ with your Lord is only for the ‘Pious ones’ (whose faith is unfeigned) .

36.Munir Mezyed: The one whose sight is dim to the remembrance of the Most Beneficent ( God)- We assign to him a devil who becomes his intimate companion.

37.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, these companions will surely make them to turn way from the (right) path, and yet they presume that they attain spiritual insight.

38.Munir Mezyed: Until when he comes to Us, he says (unto his companion): “"Oh, I wish there was between you and me the distance between the east and west - how wretched a companion!"

39.Munir Mezyed: Since you acted wrongfully, regret will not profit you this ‘Day’. Thus, both of you will be partners in punishment!

40.Munir Mezyed: Are you, (O’ ‘Muhammad’), capable of making the deaf hear, or guiding the blind and the one who is in manifest error?

41.Munir Mezyed: Even if We take you away, still We are going to inflict retribution on them,

42.Munir Mezyed: Or We may show you the chastisement, which We have promised them. Definitely, We have all the capability over them.

43.Munir Mezyed: Thus, hold fast to that which has been revealed to you ( from Allâh, the Lord of all the worlds) . You are absolutely on the right path.

44.Munir Mezyed: This ‘Qur’ān’ is absolutely a ‘Revealer of Truth’ for you and for your people. And you will soon be questioned.

45.Munir Mezyed: Ask those of Our ‘Messengers’ whom We sent before you. Did We ever appoint gods to be worshiped beside the Most Beneficent ( God)?

46.Munir Mezyed: We have sent ‘Moses’ (as Our ‘Messenger’) with Our ‘Revelations’ to ‘Pharaoh’ and his chiefs, so he said: "I am the ‘Messenger’ of the Lord of all the worlds."

47.Munir Mezyed: But when he brought them Our Signs (of power& glory), they mocked at them.

48.Munir Mezyed: Every sign We showed them was greater than its sister (sign). We overtook them with chastisement so that they may quit their perversion.

49.Munir Mezyed: They said: "O’ you magician, pray to your Lord for us since He has made a covenant with you.  We will then attain spiritual insight."

50.Munir Mezyed: But when We removed the chastisement from them, they broke (their solemn promise).

51.Munir Mezyed: ‘Pharaoh’ announced to his people: "O’ my people, is not mine the sovereignty of Egypt and these rivers flowing under me? Do you not then see?

52.Munir Mezyed: Am I not better than this one, who is despicable, and can hardly speak the words clearly?

53.Munir Mezyed: Then why have there not been placed upon him armlets of gold or angels been sent down to accompany him?"

54.Munir Mezyed: Thus, he bluffed his people, and so they followed him. They certainly were a people who preferred to walk in the path of disobedience.

55.Munir Mezyed: But when they continued to oppose us, We inflicted a divine retribution on them and drowned them all.

56.Munir Mezyed: We made them a precedent and an example for the others.

57.Munir Mezyed: When the ‘son of Mary’ is presented as an example, your people laughed aloud.

58.Munir Mezyed: They said: "Are our gods better, or is he?" They mentioned not this example except for argument. Nay, they are but pugnacious folk.

59.Munir Mezyed: He, (‘Jesus’), was not more than a servant on whom We bestowed favor. And We made him an epitome for the ‘Children of Israel’.

60.Munir Mezyed: If We willed, We could assign among you ‘Angels’ to be successors on the earth.

61.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, he (-’Jesus’ -) is a sign of the inevitable ‘Hour’ (of Reckoning). Therefore, do not harbour doubts about It and follow me. This is the straight path.

62.Munir Mezyed: Let not ‘Satan’ avert you (away from the right path). He is your sworn enemy.

63.Munir Mezyed: When ‘Jesus’ came with the full knowledge of the truth, he said: "I have come to you indeed with wisdom, and to clarify for you some of the issues in which you differ. Therefore, act piously toward your Lord and follow me.

64.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, Allâh is my Lord and your Lord. Thus, worship Him (Alone). This is the straight path.”

65.Munir Mezyed: But the sects from among themselves differed. Then woe unto those who do wrong from the chastisement of a painful day!

66.Munir Mezyed: Are they waiting for the Inevitable ‘Hour’ (of Reckoning) to come on them all of a sudden when they least expect it?

67.Munir Mezyed: The intimate friends on that day will be enemies one to another, except for the ‘Pious’ (whose faith is unfeigned) .

68.Munir Mezyed: O’ My monotheistic servants, there will be no fear upon you this ‘Day’, nor will you ever grieve.

69.Munir Mezyed: (O’ You) who believed in Our ‘Revelations’ and submitted (yourselves completely to the authority of Allâh),

70.Munir Mezyed: Enter ‘Al-Jannah’, you and your wives, in utter delight!

71.Munir Mezyed: Trays of gold and cups will be circulated among them. Therein will be all that the inner-selves could desires and all that the eyes might delight in. Therein shall you abide.

72.Munir Mezyed: This is Al-Jannah which you are made to inherit as a result of what you used to do.

73.Munir Mezyed: For you therein will be different kinds of fruits, which you would desire to eat.

74.Munir Mezyed: Unquestionably, the ungodly sinners will be subjected to the eternal chastisement of ‘Hellfire’.

75.Munir Mezyed: The chastisement will not be lightened for them and they, therein, will be completely nonplussed.

76.Munir Mezyed: We wronged them not, but they themselves were grossly unfair and morally wrong.

77.Munir Mezyed: They will cry: "O’ ‘Malik’, (Keeper of Hell), let Your Lord put an end to us!” He will say: “Here where you must remain.”

78.Munir Mezyed: We certainly brought the ultimate truth to you but most of you loathe the truth.

79.Munir Mezyed: Or Have they devised a plan? Then We too are devising.

80.Munir Mezyed: Or do they think that We do not hear their secrets and their consultations? Nay, but Our emissaries with them set down in writing.

81.Munir Mezyed: Say, (O’ ‘Muhammad’): "If the Most Beneficent (God) had a son, then I would be the first to worship (& venerate).”

82.Munir Mezyed: Glory be to the Lord of the heavens and of the earth, the Lord of the Throne, from all that which they ascribe.

83.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, let them converse vainly and play until they meet the ‘Day’ of theirs, which they have been promised.

84.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who is God in the heavens and God on the earth. He is the All-Wise, the All-Knowing.

85.Munir Mezyed: Most Exalted is He to Whom belongs the (absolute) sovereignty of the heavens and of the earth, and all that is between them, and with Whom is the knowledge of the ‘Hour’ of (Reckoning). And to Whom you are all destined to return.

86.Munir Mezyed: Those whom they implore and pray besides Him possess no power of intercession, except for the one who bears witness of the truth and they know (Him).

87.Munir Mezyed: If it happens that you ask them who created these idols, they would certainly say: “ It is Allâh.” So how they are deceived into going away from the established course?

88.Munir Mezyed: His saying: "O my Lord, indeed, these are a people who are not willing to accept Allâh (into their life) ."

89.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, turn away from them and say: “Peace”. Indeed, they will come to know (the consequence of their disbelief).

1.Munir Mezyed: Haa. Me’im!

2.Munir Mezyed: By this divine ‘Book’, which reveals the ultimate truth, is a revelation from Allâh.

3.Munir Mezyed: We sent it down on a ‘Blessed Night’. We truthfully are ever warning.

4.Munir Mezyed: On this night, every wise command is made distinct.

5.Munir Mezyed: A command from Us, We truthfully are ever sending ‘Messengers’

6.Munir Mezyed: As a (divine) clemency from your Lord. Indeed, He is All-hearing and All-knowing.

7.Munir Mezyed: (Allâh is) the Lord of the heavens and of the earth and of all that is between them if you do have a definite faith.

8.Munir Mezyed: There is no God but He. He is the One Who gives life and causes death. He is your Lord and the Lord of your fore-fathers.

9.Munir Mezyed: Nay, they harbour doubts, playing.

10.Munir Mezyed: Then wait for the Day when the sky brings dense smoke,

11.Munir Mezyed: Enveloping the people. This is an agonizing chastisement.

12.Munir Mezyed: (They will say): "Our Lord, has put an end to this chastisement. Of course, we are really of those who are inclined to believe in Him.”

13.Munir Mezyed: How could there be remembrance for them, when a ‘Messenger’ distinctly had come to them.

14.Munir Mezyed: But they turned away from him, saying: "(He has been) taught, (and he is) a lunatic."

15.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We will put an end to the chastisement for a while. Indeed, you, , (‘Polytheists’), will return again (to your sinful & impious acts).

16.Munir Mezyed: On the day when We will seize them with the most fierce seizing. Definitely, We will exact divine retribution.

17.Munir Mezyed: Indeed We tried the clan of ‘Pharaoh’ before them, and there came to them an honorable ‘Messenger’,

18.Munir Mezyed: Saying: “Deliver to me the servants of Allâh (among the ‘children of Israel’). I am truly faithful ‘Messenger’ to you.”

19.Munir Mezyed: Exalt not yourselves against Allâh. Indeed, I come to you with a manifest authority.

20.Munir Mezyed: I truly seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord, lest you stone me to death.

21.Munir Mezyed: But if you do not believe in me, then at least stay away from me.”

22.Munir Mezyed: Then he appealed to his Lord, saying: “These are a folk of ungodly sinners .”

23.Munir Mezyed: (The Lord Allâh said): “Then set out with My servants by night. Surely, you will be followed,

24.Munir Mezyed: And leave the sea as it is. (“Pharaoh” & his) army are (doomed) to be drowned."

25.Munir Mezyed: How many they left behind of gardens, springs,

26.Munir Mezyed: Cornfields, luxury homes

27.Munir Mezyed: And other bounties which they enjoyed.

28.Munir Mezyed: Thus, (it was). We caused all these things to be inherited by other people.

29.Munir Mezyed: Neither the sky nor the earth shed a tear over them; nor were they reprieved.

30.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We saved the ‘Children of Israel’ from the humiliating torment,

31.Munir Mezyed: Inflicted by ‘Pharaoh’. Indeed, he was supercilious and one of the prodigals.

32.Munir Mezyed: We chose them, out of a knowledge, above all creatures.

33.Munir Mezyed: We gave them of the signs that in which there was a hard test.

34.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, these people, (-the Quraysh Tribe of Mecca-), are saying:

35.Munir Mezyed: "There is naught but our first death. And we shall not be resurrected.

36.Munir Mezyed: Thus, bring back our fore-fathers, if you are truthful.

37.Munir Mezyed: Are they better or the folk of ‘Tubba' and those before them? We annihilated them because they were truly ungodly sinners.

38.Munir Mezyed: We created not the heavens or the earth, or all that is between them, for no reason.

39.Munir Mezyed: We created them not except for a specific reason, but most of them don’t know.

40.Munir Mezyed: Absolutely, the ‘Decisive Day’ is the term for them all,

41.Munir Mezyed: The day when no friend will be able to avail his friend in any way, nor will they be helped,

42.Munir Mezyed: Except the one to whom Allâh will show (His) mercy. Indeed, He is the All-Mighty, the Most Merciful.

43.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, the tree of ‘Zaqqum’

44.Munir Mezyed: Will be the food of the sinful,

45.Munir Mezyed: Like the murky oil boiling in the bellies.

46.Munir Mezyed: Like the boiling of scalding water.

47.Munir Mezyed: (It will be said): "Seize him and thrust him into the midst of ‘Hellfire’.

48.Munir Mezyed: Then pour over his head the chastisement of scalding water."

49.Munir Mezyed: (It will be said), “Savor! Indeed, you are the mighty, the generous!

50.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, this is what you used to doubt.”

51.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, The ‘Pious’ (whose faith is unfeigned) will be in a safety place

52.Munir Mezyed: In gardens and springs,

53.Munir Mezyed: Clothed in fine silk and rich fabric, sitting face to face with one another.

54.Munir Mezyed: Thus, (will it be). We will wed them to fair women with beautiful wide, lustrous eyes.

55.Munir Mezyed: They will enjoy therein all kinds of fruits, in perfect peace and tranquility.

56.Munir Mezyed: They will taste no death therein, except the first death. And He will save them from the chastisement of ‘Hellfire.

57.Munir Mezyed: As a Bounty from your Lord! This is indeed the ultimate success and the supreme one..

58.Munir Mezyed: Verily, We have made this (‘Qur’ān’) easy in your tongue so that they may be able to remember.

59.Munir Mezyed: Wait then, (O ‘Muhammad’); indeed, they (too) are waiting.

1.Munir Mezyed: Haa. Me’im!

2.Munir Mezyed: The revelation knowledge of the Book, (this ‘Qur’ān’), is from Allâh, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

3.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, in the heavens and on the earth are signs (of Allâh’s power & glory) for the ‘Monotheistic Believers’.

4.Munir Mezyed: And in the creation of yourselves and what He scattered (through the earth) of moving creatures are signs (of Allâh’s power & glory) for a people who have a definite faith.

5.Munir Mezyed: And in the difference of night and day, in the provision which Allâh sends down from the sky and then resuscitates it after its death, and in the changing of the winds, are signs (of Allâh’s power & glory) for a people who are able to perceive the intended meaning of (His Signs).

6.Munir Mezyed: These are the (Holy) ‘Verses’ of Allâh, which We recite to you with truth. In which statement other than Allâh and His ‘Verses’ do they believe?

7.Munir Mezyed: Woe unto every sinful liar,

8.Munir Mezyed: Who hears the (Holy) ‘Verses’ of Allâh being recited to him, then displays an arrogant attitude towards them as if he had not heard them. Thus, announce to him the agonizing chastisement.

9.Munir Mezyed: When he learns something from Our (Holy) ‘Verses’, he takes them for a jest. For such there will be a humiliating chastisement.

10.Munir Mezyed: In front of them, there is hellfire, and that which they have earned will avail them not, nor those whom they have taken as guardians besides Allâh. And they will be subjected to a tremendous chastisement.

11.Munir Mezyed: This (‘Qur’ān’) is the source of inner guidance and spiritual transformation. Those who disbelieve in the (Holy) ‘Verses’ of their Lord will be subjected to an extremely agonizing punishment.

12.Munir Mezyed: Allâh is the One Who made subservient unto you the sea so that the ships may run therein by His Command, that you may seek of His Bounty, and that you may show gratitude (to Him for His endless blessings) .

13.Munir Mezyed: He also made subservient to you all that is in the heavens and all that is on the earth; it is all from Him. Indeed, there are signs (of Allâh’s power & glory) in this for a people who ruminate (on the nature of existence).

14.Munir Mezyed: Tell those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism to forgive those who do not look for the days of Allâh , so much so that He will recompense the people for what they used to earn.

15.Munir Mezyed: Whoever does righteous good deed, it is for  the benefit of himself, and whoever does evil, it is against himself. Then to your Lord, you are all destined to be brought back.

16.Munir Mezyed: Verily we gave the ‘Children of Israel’ the ‘Scripture’, the authority and ‘Prophethood’, provided them with wholesome good things and preferred them over all the other nations.

17.Munir Mezyed: We also gave them the knowledge of truth about (divine) matters. Thus, they did not differ until after knowledge of Truth had come to them, out of jealousy (and animosity) among themselves. Definitely, Your Lord will judge between them on the ‘Day of Resurrection’ concerning that wherein they used to differ.

18.Munir Mezyed: Then We put you, (‘Muhammad’), on a clear way of (Our) commandment. Therefore, follow it, and take not in the self-deceived beliefs of those who lack knowledge (of Allâh) for the epistemic.

19.Munir Mezyed: Absolutely, they can avail you naught against (the wrath of) Allâh. It must be the case that the iniquitous are allies of one another while Allâh is a close ally of the ‘Pious’ (whose faith is unfeigned).

20.Munir Mezyed: This (‘Qur’ān’) is absolutely an evident enlightenment for mankind, a source of spiritual insight, and divine clemency, for a people who have a definite faith in It.

21.Munir Mezyed: Or do those who commit evil deeds think that We shall make their life and death identical to those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism and do righteous good deeds (in the worldly life)? Evil is what they judge!

22.Munir Mezyed: Allâh created the heavens and earth for a specific reason. It must be the case that every ‘Human Self’ will be duly recompensed for his deeds. They will not be wronged.

23.Munir Mezyed: Have you seen the one who has taken his own whim as his god? Thus, Allâh sends him astray purposely, seals up his hearing and his heart, and places on his insight a covering. Then who can guide him after Allâh (has condemned him)? Will you not then celebrate the praise of Allâh and declare His divine glory?

24.Munir Mezyed: They say: "We only live in this ‘worldly life’. We live and die. And nothing causes us to perish but a long course of time.” They have of that no knowledge. They are only speculating.

25.Munir Mezyed: When Our (Holy) ‘Verses’ are recited to them as revelation in the knowledge of Allâh, their only argument is that they say: "Bring back our forefathers, if you are truthful."

26.Munir Mezyed: Say: "Allâh gives you life, then causes you to die, then will He bring you together to the ‘Day of Resurrection’ whereof there is no doubt. But most of the people do not posses enough knowledge (of Allâh).

27.Munir Mezyed: Unto Allâh belongs the (absolute) sovereignty of the heavens and of the earth. On the day when the ‘Hour’ of (Reckoning) comes to pass, there will be a great loss to the those who used to promote falsehood.

28.Munir Mezyed: You will behold each nation kneeling down. Each nation will be called to its record. They will be told: "On this day, you are going to be requited for what you used to do."

29.Munir Mezyed: This is Our Book (of Deeds), speaking about you with truth. Indeed, We put everything that you used to do in writing!

30.Munir Mezyed: Thus those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism and do righteous good deeds (in this ‘worldly life’), their Lord will admit them into His (divine) clemency. This is ultimate success and the supreme one.

31.Munir Mezyed: But as for those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) , (it will be said unto them): "Were not Our ‘Verses’ recited to you? But you displayed an arrogant attitude and you were a folk of ungodly sinners."

32.Munir Mezyed: When it was said: "definitely, the promise of Allâh is true, and that the ‘Hour’ (of Reckoning) is inevitable." You said: “We do not know what the ‘Hour’ (of Reckoning) is. We think it to be nothing more than a mere speculation. Therefore, we are by no means convinced.”

33.Munir Mezyed: The evil of their deeds will appear to them, and they will be encompassed by what they used to scoff.

34.Munir Mezyed: It will be said: "This ‘Day’ We will forget you, just as you forgot the meeting of this day of yours. Your abode is going to be Hellfire, and there is none to help you.

35.Munir Mezyed: That is because you made the (Holy) ‘Verses’ of Allâh a (source of) mockery, being deceived by this ‘worldly life’.” Therefore, on that day, they will not be taken out of it, nor will they be allowed to make amends.

36.Munir Mezyed: All the praises and gratitude belong to Allâh, the Lord of the heavens, the Lord of the earth, and the Lord of all the worlds!

37.Munir Mezyed: Unto Him belongs the Majesty in the heavens and on the earth, and He is the All-Mighty, the All- Wise.

46.SurahEnglishNames: The Wind-curved Sandhills, The Dunes, The Sandhills

1.Munir Mezyed: Haa. Me’im!

2.Munir Mezyed: The revelation knowledge of the Book, (this Qur’ān), is from Allâh, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

3.Munir Mezyed: We created not the heavens or the earth or all that is between them, except for a specific reason. But those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) are not paying attention to that of which they are admonished.

4.Munir Mezyed: Say (unto them, O’ ‘Muhammad’): ”Have you thought on all that you used to implore and pray besides Allâh? Show me what they have created of the earth, or do they have a share in (the creation of) the heavens? Bring me a book before this, or some trace of knowledge, if you are truthful!"

5.Munir Mezyed: Who is more greatly astray than he who invokes, besides Allâh, those who will not respond to him until the ‘Day of Resurrection’? Such as are heedless of their invocation.

6.Munir Mezyed: When the people are gathered, such (mythological deities) will become their enemies. And they will repudiate their meaningless worship.

7.Munir Mezyed: When Our ( Holy) ‘Verses’ are recited to them as revelation in the knowledge of Allâh , those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh)  say of the Truth when it comes to them: "This is conspicuous sorcery!"

8.Munir Mezyed: Or do they say, “He has mythologized it?” Say: “If it happens that I have mythologized it, still you will have no power to save me from (the wrath of) Allâh. He knows best what you say about it among yourselves. Sufficient is He as Witness between you and me. He is the Oft-Forgiving, the Most Merciful."

9.Munir Mezyed: Say: "I am not different from the other ‘Messengers’, nor do I know what will be done with me or with you. I only follow what is revealed to me. And my mission is only to give clear warning (about how to avoid ‘Hellfire’)."

10.Munir Mezyed: Say: "Have you thought of the consequences, if the Qur’ān is from Allâh, and you disbelieve in it? Nevertheless, a witness from the Children of Israel has already testified to the like thereof. Thus, he acknowledged the Truth, while you still display an arrogant attitude (towards ‘Qur’ān’).” Indeed, Allâh will not illuminate the path of those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong.

11.Munir Mezyed: Those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) said about those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism: "If it had been good, then they would not have preceded us to it."  Since they are not guided thereby, they say: “This is an ancient falsification."

12.Munir Mezyed: Before, it was the Scripture of ‘Moses’, a source of spiritual insight and divine clemency. This is a confirming Book in an Arabic tongue to warn those who do wrong, and to announce the joyful news (of how to attain eternal salvation) for those who pursue righteousness.

13.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who say: "Our Lord is Allâh," and then behave uprightly and religiously, there will come no fear upon them, neither will they ever grieve.

14.Munir Mezyed: Those are the ‘Companions of Al-Jannah’, abiding therein; a recompense for what they used to do.

15.Munir Mezyed: We have enjoined on man to show kindness and dutifulness to his parents. His mother bears him with great exertion and brings him forth with great exertion. The bearing of him and the weaning of him is thirty months, till when he attained full strength and reaches forty years, he says: "My Lord, grant me the strength so that I may be thankful for Your Favor which You have bestowed upon me and upon my parents, and that I may do righteous good deeds which please You, and make my offspring be virtuous ones. I have truly turned unto You in repentance, and truly, I am one of the those who surrender (themselves completely to Your authority).

16.Munir Mezyed: Those are the ones from whom We will accept the best of what they do, and will overlook their evil deeds. They will be among the ‘Companions of Al- Jannah’. This is the promise of truth which was made to them.

17.Munir Mezyed: (Yet) there is one who says: "Fie upon you both! Do you threaten me that I shall be raised up, when already generations have passed away before me?” They both cry unto Allâh for help and say to their child, "Woe unto you! Have Faith in Allâh! It is absolutely, without doubt, that the promise of Allâh is true." But he says, “This is nothing but myths of the ancients."

18.Munir Mezyed: Those are the ones against whom the word proves true among the previous generations of the jinn and mankind which have passed away before them. Indeed, they are the ones who are doomed to eternal perdition.

19.Munir Mezyed: For all, there will be degrees according to what they have done, that He may recompense them in full for their deeds. And they will not be treated unfairly.

20.Munir Mezyed: The day will come when those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) are exposed to the Fire, (it will be said unto them): "You squandered your good things in your ‘worldly life’, which you enjoyed wasting. Today, you are going to be recompensed with the chastisement of humiliation, because you used to show an arrogant attitude in the land without a good reason, and because you used to indulge excessively in debauchery, (and walk in the path of of disobedience).

21.Munir Mezyed: (O’ ‘Muhammad’), recall (Hūd), the brother of ‘Ād’, when he warned his folk (in the valley of) “el-aḥqāf”– indeed, there were so many warnings were delivered before him and after him- saying: "Worship (& venerate) none but Allâh. I truly fear for you the divine retribution of a disastrous day."

22.Munir Mezyed: They said: “What! Did you come to make us renounce our gods? Thus, bring us that with which you threaten us if you are one of the truthful."

23.Munir Mezyed: He said: “Indeed, the knowledge about this is with Allâh, and I only notify you for what I have been sent. But I can see that you are a people who do lack knowledge (of God).”

24.Munir Mezyed: Then, when they beheld it as a dense cloud approaching their valleys, they said: "This cloud will bring us rain." Nay, it is that which you sought to hasten, a wind wherein is an agonizing chastisement,

25.Munir Mezyed: Devastating everything by the command of its Lord. Therefore, they became such that nothing could be seen, except for their homes. This is how We do chastise the ungodly sinners.

26.Munir Mezyed: Indeed We had established them, (the people of ‘A'ad’), with that wherewith We have not established you, (O’ clan of Quraysh). And We had given them ears, eyes and hearts, but neither their ears, nor their eyes, nor their hearts availed them because they used to act impiously toward Our ‘Revelations’. Thus, they were encompassed by that which they used to scoff.

27.Munir Mezyed: We have destroyed towns round about you. And We have constantly shown them Our ‘Revelations’ so that they may quit their perversion.

28.Munir Mezyed: Then why did those whom they took for gods, besides Allâh, so as to bring them closer to him, fail to help them? Nay, but they disappeared suddenly and completely from them, (when the tribulation of Allâh came upon them). This was their falsification, and that which they used to mythologize.

29.Munir Mezyed: When We directed a party of the jinn to you in order to listen to the Qur’ān.  When they attended the recitation, they said: "Listen attentively!" As soon as the recitation was ended, they rushed backed to their clan, warning.

30.Munir Mezyed: They said: "O’ our fellow jinn, we have heard a ‘Book’ that was revealed after ‘Moses’. It substantiates that which is before it, guiding into a straight path.

31.Munir Mezyed: O’ our fellow jinn, respond to the caller of Allâh and believe (in his message). Allâh will redeem you from your sins, and will save you from an agonizing punishment.”

32.Munir Mezyed: The one who resounds not to the Caller of Allâh cannot thwart (the will) of Allâh on earth, and there will be no guardians for him besides Allâh. Such are in utter deception.

33.Munir Mezyed: Do they not see that Allâh, Who created the heavens and earth, was not tired by their creation, is capable of giving life to the dead? Indeed, He is capable of doing whatever He wills.

34.Munir Mezyed: The day will come when those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) will be exposed to the Fire, and (it will be said to them): "Is this not the truth?" They will say: "Yea, by our Lord!"  He will say: "Then taste the chastisement as an outcome of your constant refusal to accept Islamic monotheism."

35.Munir Mezyed: Exercise patience as the ‘Messengers’ did who are endowed with insistence and strength, and seek not to hasten for them (their doom). The day will come to pass when they see that (chastisement) with which they are promised as if they had not stayed more than an hour in a single day. (O’ mankind, this ‘Qur’ān’ is sufficient as) an evident message. Will then any be destroyed other than a people who excessively indulge in debauchery, (and walk in the path of of disobedience)?.

1.Munir Mezyed: Those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) and hinder people from the path of Allâh. Allâh will cause their works to be null and void.

2.Munir Mezyed: Yet those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism and do righteous good deeds (in this ‘wordily life’), and believe in that which has been revealed to Muhammad- and it is the truth from their Lord - He will redeem them from their sins and improve their condition.

3.Munir Mezyed: That is because those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) follow falsehood, and those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism follow the Truth from their Lord. This is how Allâh presents to the people their parables.

4.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, when you encounter (in battle) those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh), smite the necks until when you have inflicted slaughter upon them, then tie fast their bonds, then set them free, either as a favor or by taking ransom, till the war lays down its loads. That (is the ordinance). If Allâh willed, He would certainly chastise them (without you). But (He ordered you to fight) so that He may try some of you by means of others. Allâh will never allow the deeds of those who are slain in (serving) the cause of Allâh to be lost in vain.

5.Munir Mezyed: He will illuminate their path and improve their condition,

6.Munir Mezyed: Admitting them into ‘Al-Jannah’, which He has made known to them.

7.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, if you participate in supporting (the cause of) Allâh, He will certainly support you and plant firmly your feet.

8.Munir Mezyed: But those who who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) are the ones who are doomed to eternal perdition. He will make their deeds be lost in vain.

9.Munir Mezyed: That is because they loathe what Allâh has sent down. Thus He has made their deeds null and void.

10.Munir Mezyed: Have they, (-the Pagan Arabs-), not travelled in the land and seen the dreadful end of those before them? Allâh brought upon them utter destruction. Thus, those who lack Faith ( in Allâh) will also encounter similar perdition.

11.Munir Mezyed: That is because Allâh is the guardian of those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, and because those who lack Faith (in Allâh) have no guardian.

12.Munir Mezyed: It is absolutely without a doubt that Allâh will admit those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism and do righteous acts (in this ‘worldly life’) into gardens, underneath which rivers flow. Yet those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) enjoy themselves and eat as cattle eat. Thus, Fire will be an eternal home for them.

13.Munir Mezyed: So many townships more powerful than your town, (Mecca), that has expelled you, We have put an end to the existence of their inhabitants. And there was no helper for them.

14.Munir Mezyed: Is the one who relies on clear proof from His Lord like the one whose evil deeds are made to seem appealing to him, and who takes in his self-deceived beliefs for the epistemic?

15.Munir Mezyed: The similitude of ‘Al-Jannah’ which is promised to the ‘Pious’  (whose faith is unfeigned): therein are rivers of pure water, rivers of milk whereof the taste changes not, rivers of wine delicious to the drinkers, and rivers of raw honey.  And for them therein are all kinds of fruits and protection from their Lord. (Are these) like those who abide in the Fire, and are given scalding water to drink, and so as to it tears up their intestines?

16.Munir Mezyed: Among them are some who seek to listen to you, then as soon as they leave, they ask those who have been given the spiritual gift of knowledge, "What was it that he said just now?" Those upon whose hearts Allâh has set a seal have taken in their self-deceived beliefs for the epistemic.

17.Munir Mezyed: As for those who attain spiritual insight, He will increase their inner guidance and spiritual transformation, and bestow on them their righteousness.

18.Munir Mezyed: Are they waiting for the ‘Hour’ (of reckoning) to come on them all of a sudden? But some of its indications have already come. Thus, when it comes to them, how they will have their reminder?

19.Munir Mezyed: So know, (O' ‘Muhammad’), that there is no god except Allâh and ask forgiveness for your sin, and for the ‘Monotheistic Believers’, men and women. Allâh knows well your movements (during the day) and your place of rest.

20.Munir Mezyed: Those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism say: "Why has a Sūrat (i.e. Chapter from the ‘Qur’ān’) not been sent down? But when a conclusive Sūrat is sent down, and fighting is mentioned therein, you see the ones in whose hearts is a disease looking at you as the one who is fainting even to death. But more adequate for them would be

21.Munir Mezyed: Obedience, and speaking words of kindness. Then when the issue (of fighting) is determined,  if they were true to Allâh, it would be better for them.

22.Munir Mezyed: Then, is it expected that you will spread corruption in the land and sever your ties of kinship if you are given authority.

23.Munir Mezyed: Those are the ones whom Allâh has cursed. Thus, He has made them deaf, and blinded their sights.

24.Munir Mezyed: What! Do they not then think about the ‘Qur’ān’ carefully? or is that there are padlocks on their hearts?

25.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who have turned back after the divine guidance has been manifested to them-the devil has adorned it for them, and has prolonged false hopes for them.

26.Munir Mezyed: That is because they said to those who loathe what Allâh has sent down: “We will obey you in some issues.” Allâh knows their secrets.

27.Munir Mezyed: Then how will it be for them when the ‘Angels’ take them in death, smiting their faces and their backs?

28.Munir Mezyed: That is because they have followed what provokes the wrath of Allâh, and loathed His good pleasure. Thus, He made their deeds null and void.

29.Munir Mezyed: Or do those in whose hearts is a disease deem that Allâh will not divulge their aversions?

30.Munir Mezyed: If We willed, We could show them to you. Then you would know them by their marks. Definitely, you will know them by the tone of their voice. Allâh knows perfectly well your deeds.

31.Munir Mezyed: We will cause you to experience hardship so that We may identify those who strive hard among you, and those who exercise patience, and may reveal your true character.

32.Munir Mezyed: Definitely, those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh), hinder (people) from the path of Allâh, and oppose the ‘Messenger’ after the divine guidance has been manifested to them, cannot cause any harm to Allâh. He will actually make their deeds null and void.

33.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, obey Allâh and obey the ‘Messenger’, and do not invalidate your deeds.!

34.Munir Mezyed: Definitely, those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) and hinder (the people) from (serving) the cause of Allâh, and then die while they are still indulging in disbelief, not by any means will Allâh forgive them.

35.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, do not weaken and cry out for peace since you are the uppermost. Allâh is (always) with you. And he will never deprive you of your deeds.

36.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, this ‘worldly life’ is but recreation and amusement. But if you adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism and act piously, He will grant you your rewards. And he will not ask you to give away your entire wealth (as Zakāt).

37.Munir Mezyed: If He should ask you for it and importune you, you would withhold, and He would divulge your aversions.

38.Munir Mezyed: Behold! You are those who are called to expend on (serving) the cause of Allâh. Yet among you are some who withhold. Whoever withholds; he withholds only from his own self. Allâh is Self-Sufficient and you are the poor. If you take no no heed, He will replace you with other folk. Then they will not be like you.

1.Munir Mezyed: It is absolutely without a doubt that We have granted you a manifest victory,

2.Munir Mezyed: So that Allâh may redeem you from your former and your latter sins, fulfill his favor upon  you, and guide you into the straight path.

3.Munir Mezyed: And that Allâh may grant you a magnificent triumph.

4.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who sent down tranquility into the hearts of the Monotheistic Believers in order to add more Faith to their Faith. Unto Allâh belong the soldiers of the heavens and of the earth. Allâh is All-knowing and All-wise.

5.Munir Mezyed: He will definitely admit the Monotheistic Believers, men and women, into gardens underneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide. And He will redeem them from their sins. That is, in the Sight of Allâh, the most ultimate success and the supreme one.

6.Munir Mezyed: He will chastise the hypocritical men and women, the polytheistic men and women, who speculate evil speculations about Allâh. For them is the evil turn of fortune:  The wrath of Allâh abides in them:  He has cursed them and prepared the Hellfire for them (to abide therein). Worst indeed is that destination.

7.Munir Mezyed: Unto Allâh belong the soldiers of the heavens and earth. Allâh is All-Mighty and All-wise.

8.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We have sent you as a witness, as a herald (bringing to the people the joyful news of how to attain eternal salvation), and as warner (giving  the people sufficient warning about how to avoid ‘Hellfire’),

9.Munir Mezyed: So that you, (O’ mankind), may believe in Allâh and His ‘Messenger’, and may honor and respect him, and may celebrate His infinite glory at the dawn and in the evening.

10.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who swear allegiance to you swear allegiance to Allâh. The hand of Allâh is above their hands. Thus, whoever breaks his oath breaks only to his own harm, and whoever fulfills his covenant with Allâh, He will bestow on him an immense reward.

11.Munir Mezyed: Those who remained behind of the Bedouin Arabs will say unto you: “We have been preoccupied with our properties and our families, and so ask forgiveness for us." They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say: "Who then possesses any power (to interfere) on your behalf with Allâh, if He intends to hurt  you, or intend to let you obtain benefit? Nay, but Allâh is Ever All-Aware of all what you do.

12.Munir Mezyed: Nay, but you speculated that the ‘Messenger’ and the ‘Monotheistic Believers’ would never return to their families. And that was decked out fair in your hearts. You speculated evil speculations. And you are a people doomed to perish."

13.Munir Mezyed: Whoever believes not in Allâh and His ‘Messenger’ (needs to know that) We have certainly prepared for those who lack Faith (in Allâh) a blazing Fire.

14.Munir Mezyed: Unto Allâh belongs the (absolute) Sovereignty of the heavens and of the earth. He forgives whom He wills, and chastises whom He wills. Allâh is Ever Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

15.Munir Mezyed: Those who remained behind will say: "When you set forth to collect the spoils, let us follow you." They desire to change the Words of Allâh. Say: "You will not follow us. This is what Allâh had said beforehand." Then they will say: "Nay, you are just envious of us." Nay, They were incapable of understanding and recognizing the truth from falsehood except a little.

16.Munir Mezyed: Say unto those who remained behind of the Bedouin Arabs: "You will be called against a folk of mighty prowess. You will fight against them until they surrender. Thus, if you obey, Allâh will give you a good reward. But if you turn away as you did before, He will chastise you with an agonizing chastisement."

17.Munir Mezyed: There is no blame on the blind, nor is there blame on the lame, nor is there blame on the sick. Whoever obeys Allâh and His Messenger, He will admit him into gardens underneath which rivers flow. Whosoever turns back, He will chastise him with an agonizing chastisement.

18.Munir Mezyed: Allâh indeed was well pleased with the Monotheistic Believers when they swore allegiance to you beneath the tree.  He knew what was in their hearts, and so He sent down tranquility upon them and rewarded them with an imminent conquest,

19.Munir Mezyed: And great spoils which they will take. Allâh is Ever All-Mighty, All-Wise.

20.Munir Mezyed: Allâh has promised you many spoils that you will take, then He hastened this on for you, and withheld the hands of people from you; that it may be a sign for the  ‘Monotheistic Believers’, and that He may guide you into a straight path;

21.Munir Mezyed: Other gains which you could not obtain. Allâh has encompassed them.  Allâh is capable of doing whatever He wills.

22.Munir Mezyed: If it happens that those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) fight against you, they will turn around and flee. And they will find no guardian nor a helper.

23.Munir Mezyed: This is the Law of Allâh which has taken course aforetime. Never will you find in the law of Allâh any change.

24.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who has withheld their hands from you and your hands from them in the valley of Mecca after He had granted you victory over them. Allâh is Ever the All-Seer of all what you do.

25.Munir Mezyed: They are the ones who refused to accept Allâh (into their life), prevented you from (entering) the ‘Sacred Mosque’, and debarred the offering from reaching its destination. If it had not been for certain ‘Monotheistic Believers’, men and women,  whom you did not know, lest you might trample them, and thus, something hateful might have afflicted you unwittingly on their account- so that Allâh may admit into His Mercy who He wills. If they had been apart (from them), We would have chastised those who refused to accept Allâh (into their life) among them with an agonizing torment.

26.Munir Mezyed: When those who lack faith (in Allâh) were motivated by fervency which abides in their hearts- the fervency of the days of ignorance- Allâh sent down His Tranquility upon His ‘Messenger’ and upon the ‘Monotheistic Believers’, and obliged them with the word of unfeigned piety as they were entitled to it and worthy of it. Allâh is ever Knowing of all things.

27.Munir Mezyed: Verily, Allâh made the vision He vouchsafed to His ‘Messenger’ come true. You shall certainly enter the ‘Sacred Mosque’, if Allâh wills, in safety, with your heads shaved and hair cut short, not fearing. He knew what you knew not, so He has ordained before that a near conquest.

28.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who has sent his ‘Messenger’ with the source of spiritual insight and the religion of truth in order to make it prevail over all religions. Sufficient is Allâh as Witness.

29.Munir Mezyed: ‘Muhammad’ is the ‘Messenger’ of Allâh, and those with him are harsh with those who lack faith (in Allâh), and merciful among themselves. You see them bowing and falling prostrating (in prayer) seeking bounty from Allâh and (His) pleasure. Their marks are on their faces from the traces of prostration. That is their likeness in the ‘Torah’, and their likeness in the ‘Gospel’; a seed that puts forth its sprout, then strengthens it, and it grows stout and rises straight on its stem, delighting the sowers, that He may outrage those who lack faith ( in Allâh) by them. Allâh has promised those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism and do righteous acts (in this ‘worldly life’), among them, forgiveness and an immense reward.

49.SurahEnglishNames: The Private Apartments, The Inner Apartments, The Chambers

1.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, put not yourselves forward before Allâh and His ‘Messenger’, and act piously toward Allâh. Indeed, Allâh is All-Hearer, All-Knowing.

2.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism , raise not your voices above the voice of the Prophet, neither do you speak loudly to him as you speak loudly to one another, lest your deeds may become null and void, while you do not perceive it.

3.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who lower their voices before the Messenger of Allâh are the ones whose hearts have been tested for piety by Allâh. For them, there will be forgiveness and an immense reward.

4.Munir Mezyed: Those who call out for you behind the private apartments, most of them do not possess self- awareness that allows them to understand.

5.Munir Mezyed: If they had exercised patience until you could come out to them, it would have been far better for them. Indeed, Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

6.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, if a debauchee, son of disobedience, came to you with a news, you ought to verify it (first), lest you harm people in ignorance, and afterwards you become remorseful over what you have done.

7.Munir Mezyed: Know that the ‘Messenger’ of Allâh is among you. If he were to obey you in much of the matters, you would have been stressful. But Allâh has endeared Faith to you and adorned it in your hearts, and made you loathe blasphemy, debauchery and disobedience . Those are the ones who attain spiritual insight.

8.Munir Mezyed: (This is) a bounty and a grace from Allâh. Allâh is All-Knowing All-wise.

9.Munir Mezyed: If it happens that two parties of ‘Monotheistic Believers’ fall to fighting, then reconcile between them. But if one of them initiates an aggressively hostile position to the other one, then fight against the one that initiates an aggressively hostile position till it complies with the command of Allâh. If it complies, then reconcile between them in justice, and act justly. Indeed, Allâh demonstrates his own love for those who deal fairly.

10.Munir Mezyed: The ‘Monotheistic Believers’ are brethren. Thus, reconcile between your brethren and act piously toward Allâh, so that you may receive mercy.

11.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, let not a folk poke fun at a folk who may be better then them; and let not women poke fun at women who may be better then them; neither do revile one another, nor defame one another by using bad names. An evil name is the name of debauchery after Faith. The one who dose not repents , such are the ones who are grossly unfair and morally wrong.

12.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, avoid any kind of suspicion. Indeed, suspicion in some cases is a sin. Spy not, or backbite one another. Would anyone of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother when you detest it?! Thus, act piously toward Allâh. Indeed, Allâh is Oft-Returning, Most Merciful.

13.Munir Mezyed: O’ mankind, indeed, We have created you from a male and a female, and made you nations and tribes, so that you may know one another. The most honorable among you in the sight of Allâh is one who is most pious among you. Indeed, Allâh is All-Knowing, All-Aware.

14.Munir Mezyed: The Bedouin Arabs say: "We believe." Say, "You believe not but you only say, ‘We have submitted (ourselves entirely to the authority Allâh),” for Faith has not yet entered your hearts. If you obey Allâh and His Messenger, He will not diminish you anything of your deeds. Indeed, Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful."

15.Munir Mezyed: The ‘Monotheistic Believers’ are those only who believe in Allâh and His Messenger, then they do not harbour doubts. They strive hard for (serving) the cause of Allâh with their wealth and their lives. Those are the truthful ones.

16.Munir Mezyed: Say: 'What! Are you going to instruct Allâh about your religion while Allâh knows perfectly well whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth?! Allâh is All-Aware of everything.”

17.Munir Mezyed: They consider it as a favor to you, that they have embraced Islam.  Say, "You are not doing me any favors by embracing Islam. Nay, but Allâh has conferred a favor on you, that He has guided you to the (upright) Faith, if you are truthful.

18.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, Allâh knows well the unseen of the heavens and of the earth. Allâh is all Seer of all what you do.

1.Munir Mezyed: Qāf. By the Glorious Qur’ān!

2.Munir Mezyed: Nay, they are amazed that there has come to them a warner from among themselves. Thus, those who lack Faith (in Allâh) said: "This is very bizarre thing.

3.Munir Mezyed: What! When we die and become dust, (shall we be raised up again)? That is far off return.”

4.Munir Mezyed: We know perfectly well what the earth diminishes of them. We have a book that keeps all the records.

5.Munir Mezyed: Nay, they gave no credence to the Truth (-this ‘Qur’ān’-) when it has come to them. Thus, they are in state of perplexity.

6.Munir Mezyed: Have they not looked at the heavens above them (and see) how We have constructed and adorned it? There are no rifts in it.

7.Munir Mezyed: As for the earth, We spread it out, set thereon mountains standing firm and produced therein every kind of beautiful growth in pairs.

8.Munir Mezyed: This is an enlightenment and a Reminder (or) ‘Revealer of the Truth’ for every devoted worshiper (of the Most High God), who turns (unto Him in repentance).

9.Munir Mezyed: We send down blessed water from the sky, then We cause to grow thereby gardens, grain of crops

10.Munir Mezyed: And lofty palm trees with clustered fruit,

11.Munir Mezyed: A sustenance for the servants. And We give life thereby to a dead land. This is how the resurrection will be!.

12.Munir Mezyed: The folk of ‘Noah’ refused to admit the Truth before them, (the Pagan Arabs), and so did the dwellers of ‘Ar-Rass’, (the tribe of) ‘Thamūd’,

13.Munir Mezyed: (The tribe of) ‘Ād’,  ‘Pharaoh’, the brethren of ‘Lot’,

14.Munir Mezyed: The companions of the Thicket and the people of Tubba'. All of them denied the messengers (of Allâh). Thus My threat was justly fulfilled.

15.Munir Mezyed: Were We then worn out by (the task of) the first creation? Nay, they are in confusion over a new creation.

16.Munir Mezyed: Indeed We created man. And We know very well what his Inner Self whispers into him. We are closer to him than his jugular vein.

17.Munir Mezyed: When the two recording angels receive, sitting on the right and on the left,

18.Munir Mezyed: Not a word does he utter but there is by him a keeper at hand.

19.Munir Mezyed: The agony of death comes in truth. That is what you have been avoiding.

20.Munir Mezyed: The trumpet will be blown. That will be the day of threatening.

21.Munir Mezyed: Every Human Self will come forth along with a driver and a witness.

22.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, you were unaware of this. We have removed your veil, thus, your sight, this day, is sharp.

23.Munir Mezyed: His companion will say: "This is what I have made ready of his record."

24.Munir Mezyed: Throw into ‘Gehenna’ every obstinate who lacks faith in Allâh.  .

25.Munir Mezyed: (He was) hinderer of good, transgressor, wasting life in doubts .

26.Munir Mezyed: He used to set up another god with Allâh. Thus, throw him in the severe punishment!

27.Munir Mezyed: His companion will say: “Our Lord, I caused him not to transgress but he was far astray."

28.Munir Mezyed: Allâh will say: “Quarrel not in My presence since I gave you warning beforehand.

29.Munir Mezyed: The Sentence that comes from Me can't be changed, and I am not iniquitous toward the servants."

30.Munir Mezyed: The day will come when We say to ‘Gehenna’: "Are you filled?" It will Ask: "Are there any more?"

31.Munir Mezyed: ‘Al-Jannah’ will be brought near to the ‘Pious’ , not far off.

32.Munir Mezyed: This is what you are promised for every one who turns unto Allâh in repentance, and keeps His Limits,

33.Munir Mezyed: Who shows honor and reverence for the Most Beneficent (God) in secret and comes (to Him) with faithful heart.

34.Munir Mezyed: ( It will be said unto him): “Enter ‘Al- Jannah’ in Peace! This is the day of immortality”.

35.Munir Mezyed: They will have therein whatever they desire, and We have even more.

36.Munir Mezyed: How many generations We destroyed before them, (the Pagan Arabs), who were more powerful than them. (When Our divine retribution came), they went about in the lands. Was there any place of escape?!

37.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, in this is a remembrance for the one who has (an active) heart and gives ear while his mind is completely attentive (to the sermons).

38.Munir Mezyed: We created the heavens and earth, and all that is between them in six days without being touched by fatigue.

39.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, bear then with patience whatever they say, and glorify the praises of your Lord and declare His infinite glory before sunrise and sunset.

40.Munir Mezyed: During the night, celebrate His infinite glory, and after prostration.

41.Munir Mezyed: Listen on the day when the caller will call from a nearby place,

42.Munir Mezyed: On the day, when they will hear the (Inevitable) Blast in truth. That will be the ‘Day of Resurrection’.

43.Munir Mezyed: Verily it is We who give life and cause death, and to Us is the definitive course.

44.Munir Mezyed: On the day when the earth will split asunder, they will rush out of their graves. That is a gathering easy to Us.

45.Munir Mezyed: We know perfectly well what they say, and you, (O' ‘Muhammad’), are not a tyrant over them. Therefore, remind him by means of the ‘Qur’ān’ who pays attention to My threat.

1.Munir Mezyed: By those (winds) that circulate dust!

2.Munir Mezyed: Then those (clouds) that carry the burden,

3.Munir Mezyed: Then those (ships) that glide smoothly (upon the sea),

4.Munir Mezyed: Then those (‘Angels’ who) distribute (blessings) by Our Command,

5.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, what you are promised is true,

6.Munir Mezyed: And the ‘Day of Judgment’ is absolutely inevitable.

7.Munir Mezyed: By the heavens with its beauty and (numerous) pathways,

8.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, you have different views over (‘Muhammad’ & the ‘Qur’ān’).

9.Munir Mezyed: He who is turned away from (the ‘Qur’ān’) is decreed to be turned away.

10.Munir Mezyed: Curse be upon the liars!

11.Munir Mezyed: Who are wasting life in doubts

12.Munir Mezyed: They ask: "When will be the ‘Day of Judgment’?"

13.Munir Mezyed: (It will be) the day when they will be punished by the Fire.

14.Munir Mezyed: (It will be said unto them): “Taste your penalization! This is what you used to ask to be hastened.”

15.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, the ‘Pious’ will dwell in (Great) Gardens and water springs,

16.Munir Mezyed: Receiving what their Lord gives them. They were benefactors aforetime.

17.Munir Mezyed: They used to sleep but a little of the night,

18.Munir Mezyed: And to ask for forgiveness in the early morning,

19.Munir Mezyed: While in their wealth, there was a due share for the beggar and for the needy.

20.Munir Mezyed: On the earth are signs (of Allâh’s power & glory) for those who have a definite faith.

21.Munir Mezyed: And also in your own selves. Do you not see?

22.Munir Mezyed: In the heavens is your livelihood and that which you are promised.

23.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, by the Lord of the heavens and earth, this is definitely the Truth, just as it is true that you speak.

24.Munir Mezyed: Has the anecdote of the honorable guests of ‘Abraham’ reached you?

25.Munir Mezyed: When they came to him, they said: "Peace". He said, "Peace to you, strangers!"

26.Munir Mezyed: Then he went quietly to his household and brought a fat (roasted) calf.

27.Munir Mezyed: He placed it before them. Then he said: "Will you not eat?"

28.Munir Mezyed: He felt afraid of them. They said: “Do not be afraid," and then gave him the joyful news of a boy possessing knowledge.

29.Munir Mezyed: Then his wife came forward, wailing, slapping her face and saying: “A barren old woman!”

30.Munir Mezyed: They said: “This is what your Lord said. Indeed, He is the All-Wise, the All-Knowing."

31.Munir Mezyed: He said: "What is your mission, O' messengers?"

32.Munir Mezyed: They said: "We have been sent to a folk of ungodly sinners

33.Munir Mezyed: To strike them with stones of baked clay,

34.Munir Mezyed: Marked by your Lord for the prodigal ones.”

35.Munir Mezyed: Thus, We brought out from therein the monotheistic believers.

36.Munir Mezyed: But We did not find therein except for one house of those who submitted (themselves to the will of Allâh)

37.Munir Mezyed: We left behind therein a portent for those who fear the painful punishment.

38.Munir Mezyed: In ‘Moses’ (too, there is a lesson) when We sent him to ‘Pharaoh’ with evident authority.

39.Munir Mezyed: But he turned away in arrogance, and said: “He is either a magician or a lunatic."

40.Munir Mezyed: Thus, We seized him and his soldiers, and threw them into the sea, as he was the one to be blamed.

41.Munir Mezyed: In (the tribe of) 'Aad’ (there is also a lesson) when We sent upon them the barren wind.

42.Munir Mezyed: It spared nothing that reached it, but made it like a rotten bone.

43.Munir Mezyed: In (the tribe of) ‘Thamūd’ (there is also a lesson) when they were told, "Enjoy yourselves for a while!"

44.Munir Mezyed: They rebelled against the command of their Lord, so the thunderbolt overtook them while they were looking.

45.Munir Mezyed: Thus, they were not able to rise up, or to help their own selves.

46.Munir Mezyed: (There is also a lesson) in the folk of ‘Noah’ before them. They were a folk of debauchees walking in the path of disobedience.

47.Munir Mezyed: The heavens, We have built with Our Hands. Indeed, We will continue to expand it.

48.Munir Mezyed: The earth, We have spread it out. How brilliantly We do spread out!

49.Munir Mezyed: Of everything, We have created pairs so that you may ruminate (on the sovereignty of Allâh).

50.Munir Mezyed: (O’ ‘Muhammad’, say unto them): “Seek refuge in Allâh! Truly I am a perspicuous warner to you from Him.

51.Munir Mezyed: Set not up any other god along with Allâh. Indeed, I am just a perspicuous warner to you from Him.”

52.Munir Mezyed: Similarly, no ‘Messenger’ came to those before them, but they said: “He is either a magician or a lunatic."

53.Munir Mezyed: Did they transmit this saying to each other? Nay, they are really cruel and oppressive people.

54.Munir Mezyed: Thus, turn away from them and you will not be blamed (for that).

55.Munir Mezyed: keep on reminding, Surely such a reminder will eventfully profit those who placed their faith in Allâh.

56.Munir Mezyed: I have created not the jinn and the mankind except that they should worship (& venerate) Me.

57.Munir Mezyed: I desire no livelihood from them, nor do I desire that they should feed Me.

58.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, Allâh is the All-Provider, the Lord of all power, the Potent.

59.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, the dreadful end of those who keep on sinning will be like the end of those who lived before them. Thus, let them not ask Me to hasten on.

60.Munir Mezyed: Then, woe unto those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) because of their day which they are threatened with.

1.Munir Mezyed: By the Mount (Sinai),

2.Munir Mezyed: By the Book inscribed

3.Munir Mezyed: In an outstretched vellum,

4.Munir Mezyed: By the established House (‘Mecca’),

5.Munir Mezyed: By the elevated roof (the sky),

6.Munir Mezyed: And by the swollen sea,

7.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, the retribution of your Lord will come to pass.

8.Munir Mezyed: There shall be no one to preclude it.

9.Munir Mezyed: The day will come when the heavens fluctuates with a dreadful fluctuation

10.Munir Mezyed: And the mountains move away with rapid movement.

11.Munir Mezyed: Woe on that day unto those who fall in disbelief,

12.Munir Mezyed: Who excessively indulge in vain talks.

13.Munir Mezyed: The day will come when they are driven to the Fire of Hell with violence.

14.Munir Mezyed: (It will be said unto them): “This is the Fire in which you refused to admit the truth of its existence.

15.Munir Mezyed: Is this magic: ?  Or do you not see?

16.Munir Mezyed: (It will be said unto them): “Burn in it! Whether you are patient of it or impatient of it, it will be the same for you. You are chastised only for what you used to do.”

17.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, the ‘Pious’ will dwell in (Great) Gardens and Bliss,

18.Munir Mezyed: Rejoicing in what their Lord will bestow upon them. And their Lord will save them from the punishment of the blazing Fire.

19.Munir Mezyed: (It will be said unto them): “Eat and drink with pleasure for what you used to do.”

20.Munir Mezyed: They will recline on couches set in lines, and We will wed them to maidens with wide, lovely eyes.

21.Munir Mezyed: Those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism and whose offspring follow them in faith; We shall join their offspring with them. We shall not decrease the reward of their deeds in anything. Every man is pledged for what he gains.

22.Munir Mezyed: We shall supply them with fruits and meat that they desire.

23.Munir Mezyed: They will pass therein from one to another a cup, wherein is neither vanity nor sin.

24.Munir Mezyed: They will be served by youths of their own as if they were hidden pearls.

25.Munir Mezyed: Some of them will approach the other, questioning,

26.Munir Mezyed: Saying: “Indeed, before this, we used to be frightened on account of our families.

27.Munir Mezyed: Allâh has conferred favor upon us and saved us from the agony of scorching Fire.

28.Munir Mezyed: We used to implore and pray to Him. Indeed, He is the Most Kind, the Most Merciful.”

29.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, keep on reminding! By the Grace of your Lord, you are neither a soothsayer, nor a lunatic.

30.Munir Mezyed: Or do they say: “He is a poet for whom we await the evil events of time?”

31.Munir Mezyed: Say: “Keep on waiting! I am waiting along with you.”

32.Munir Mezyed: Do their minds command them to do this? Or are they cruel and oppressive people?

33.Munir Mezyed: Or do they say, "He has mythologized it (this ‘Qur’ān’)?" Nay, they believe not!

34.Munir Mezyed: Let them produce just one discourse like it if they are truthful.

35.Munir Mezyed: Or were they created from nothing?  Or are they the creators?

36.Munir Mezyed: Or did they create the heavens and earth?  Nay, but they have no definite faith.

37.Munir Mezyed: Or do they have the treasures of the Lord with them? Or are they the ones who hold the absolute power?

38.Munir Mezyed: Or do they have a stairway (to the heavens) by means of which they listen (to the angels)? Then let their listener bring an evident proof.

39.Munir Mezyed: Or Has He only daughters and you have the sons?

40.Munir Mezyed: Or do you ask them a reward for (your efforts to guide them), while they are heavily burdened with debt?

41.Munir Mezyed: Or do they have (the knowledge of) the unseen and so they write it down?

42.Munir Mezyed: Or do they intend to plot evil plans against you (O’ ‘Muhammad’)? But  those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) will be the victims of their own evil conspiracy.

43.Munir Mezyed: Or do they have another god besides Allâh? Glory be to Allâh from all that which they ascribe as partner to Him!

44.Munir Mezyed: If they were to see a fragment of the heavens falling down, they would say: “Heaped-up clouds"

45.Munir Mezyed: Thus, leave them alone till they meet that day of theirs, wherein they will be plunged into profound horror and shock.

46.Munir Mezyed: On that day, their evil plans will not avail them at all, nor will they receive any aid.

47.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, for those who do wrong, there is another punishment besides this. But most of them do not posses enough knowledge.

48.Munir Mezyed: Wait patiently for the verdict of your Lord. Indeed, you are before Our Eyes. Celebrate the praises of your Lord and declare His divine glory when you rise up for prayer.

49.Munir Mezyed: In the night-time, celebrate His infinite glory, and at the setting of the stars.

1.Munir Mezyed: By the star when it inclines,

2.Munir Mezyed: Your companion, (‘Muhammad’), has neither gone astray, nor has he erred,

3.Munir Mezyed: Nor does he speak of his own fantasy.

4.Munir Mezyed: (This glorious ‘Qur’ān’) is nothing but the knowledge of Allâh's Word that has been revealed.

5.Munir Mezyed: (‘Muhammad’) has been taught (the ‘Qur’ān’) by one mighty in power (i.e. Archangel ‘Gabriel’),

6.Munir Mezyed: Endued with beauty, sturdiness and wisdom. He grew clear to view

7.Munir Mezyed: When he was in the highest part of the horizon.

8.Munir Mezyed: Then he approached and came down.

9.Munir Mezyed: He was as close to (‘Muhammad’) as the distance of two bows or even less.

10.Munir Mezyed: So did (Allâh) reveal to His servant (‘Muhammad’) what was to be revealed (through the Archangel ‘Gabriel’).

11.Munir Mezyed: The heart (of ‘Muhammad’) has not deluded him in seeing what he saw.

12.Munir Mezyed: Will you then dispute with him over what he saw?

13.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, he saw Him in another descent,

14.Munir Mezyed: Near ‘Sidrat al-Muntahā’,

15.Munir Mezyed: Near it is the Garden of eternal abode.

16.Munir Mezyed: When ‘Sidrat al-Muntahā’ was covered with that which covers.

17.Munir Mezyed: (His) sight deviated not, neither did it transgress.

18.Munir Mezyed: Indeed he did see (some) of the Greatest Signs of his Lord.

19.Munir Mezyed: Have you then thought carefully about  al-Lāt and al-‘Uzzā,

20.Munir Mezyed: and Manāt, the third, of the preceding two, the other?

21.Munir Mezyed: Is it for you the males and for Him the females?

22.Munir Mezyed: This indeed is an unfair division!

23.Munir Mezyed: They are nothing but names which you have named - you and your fathers- for which Allâh has sent down no authority. They follow nothing but speculation and their personal desires although the source of inner guidance and spiritual transformation (i.e. the Glorious ‘Qur’ān’) has come to them from their Lord.

24.Munir Mezyed: Or shall man have what he desires?

25.Munir Mezyed: But unto Allâh belongs the ‘End’ and the ‘Beginning’ (of all things).

26.Munir Mezyed: How many ‘Angels’ are in the heavens whose intercession avails nothing except after Allâh gives permission to whom He wills and with whom He is pleased.

27.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who refuse to admit (the existence of) the ‘Hereafter’ have named the ‘Angels’ with female names.

28.Munir Mezyed: They have no knowledge of it. They follow nothing but speculation. Indeed, speculation avails nothing against the Truth.

29.Munir Mezyed: Thus, shun whoever turns away from Our remembrance. He seeks nothing but the deception of this ‘worldly life’.

30.Munir Mezyed: That is their attainment of knowledge. Indeed, your Lord knows best the one who goes astray from His path; and He knows best the one who attains spiritual insight.

31.Munir Mezyed: Unto Allâh, belongs whatever is in the heavens, and whatever is in the earth. He will chastise those who commit evil deeds with (the penalty of) what they have done, and will reward those who do virtuous good deeds with the best reward, (‘Al-Jannah’).

32.Munir Mezyed: Those who avoid by all means committing the great sins and abominations except for minor offenses (let them be sure that) your Lord is extremely vast in forgiveness. He knows best about you since He initiated you from the earth, and while you were embryos in the wombs of your mothers. Therefore, ascribe not purity to yourselves. He knows best the one who acts piously.

33.Munir Mezyed: Have you then seen the one who turned away?

34.Munir Mezyed: He gave a little, then he refused to give.

35.Munir Mezyed: Does he have the knowledge of the unseen, and so he is capable of catching sight of all things?

36.Munir Mezyed: Or has he not been informed of what is in the Scriptures of ‘Moses’

37.Munir Mezyed: And ‘Abraham’ who fulfilled (his function of promulgating the Message of God)?

38.Munir Mezyed: No ‘Human Self’ will ever bear the responsibility of the sins of another.

39.Munir Mezyed: Man will have only what he (seriously) strives for.

40.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, (the fruit of) his struggle will be seen.

41.Munir Mezyed: Then he will be rewarded for it with the fullest reward.

42.Munir Mezyed: Verily, to your Lord do all things ultimately return.

43.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who makes (whom He wills) laugh or cry.

44.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who causes death and gives life.

45.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who creates the pairs, male and female,

46.Munir Mezyed: From a semen-drop when it is emitted.

47.Munir Mezyed: It is incumbent on Him to bring forth the second creation (the Resurrection).
