48.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who enriches (whom He wills) and satisfies (whom He wills).

49.Munir Mezyed: He is the Lord of ‘Sirius’.

50.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who put an end to the existence of the ancient people of ‘Ād’

51.Munir Mezyed: And (the people of) ‘Thamūd’. He spared none of them.

52.Munir Mezyed: (He put an end to the existence of) the folk of ‘Noah’ before them. They were more iniquitous and more rebellious.

53.Munir Mezyed: He overthrew the subverted cities (of ‘Sodom’ & ‘Gomorrah’).

54.Munir Mezyed: Thus, they were covered with that which covers.

55.Munir Mezyed: Which then, of the marvels of your Lord, will you doubt?

56.Munir Mezyed: This is a warner of the (series of) Warners of the ancient.

57.Munir Mezyed: The approaching day, (‘Last Judgment’), has become imminent.

58.Munir Mezyed: No one besides Allâh can disclose it.

59.Munir Mezyed: Do you then wonder at this discourse

60.Munir Mezyed: And poke fun at it instead of weeping,

61.Munir Mezyed: While you are indulging in fun and amusement?

62.Munir Mezyed: Thus, bow down in prostration to Allâh, worship (& venerate) Him Alone.

1.Munir Mezyed: The inevitable ‘Hour’ (of Reckoning) has drawn nigh, and the moon has been rent asunder.

2.Munir Mezyed: Whenever they behold an intelligible sign (of Allah’s Power & glory), they take no heed and say: "Continuous magic."

3.Munir Mezyed: They paid no heed (to the warning of their ‘Messengers’) and took in their self-deceived beliefs for the epistemic. Yet every affair has its appointed time.

4.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, there have already come to them narratives, wherein there are sufficient warnings to deter them,

5.Munir Mezyed: Consummate wisdom; yet warnings avail (them) not.

6.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, (O’ ‘Muhammad’), ignore them and (wait for) the day when the caller will call them to something dreadful.

7.Munir Mezyed: Their eyes humbled, they will go forth from their graves as if they were scattered locusts,

8.Munir Mezyed: Hastening towards the caller. Those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) will say: "This is an arduous day."

9.Munir Mezyed: The folk of ‘Noah’, who lived before them, had also refused to accept the Truth. They bellied Our servant and said: “Lunatic”; and he was repulsed.

10.Munir Mezyed: Then he implored and prayed to his Lord (saying): "Lo! I have been defeated and so I need Your help."

11.Munir Mezyed: Thus, We opened the gates of heavens with water pouring forth,

12.Munir Mezyed: Causing the earth to burst forth with springs, so that the two waters would meet for a predestined purpose.

13.Munir Mezyed: We carried him, (‘Noah’), on a (ship) made of planks and nails,

14.Munir Mezyed: Sailing, before Our Eyes. The flood was a chastisement for the deeds of those who refused to accept (Allâh into their life).

15.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We left it as a lesson, but is there anyone who would like to receive admonition?

16.Munir Mezyed: How dreadful was then My chastisement after My warnings!

17.Munir Mezyed: Verily, We made the ‘Qur’ān’ easy for remembrance, but is there anyone who would like to receive admonition?

18.Munir Mezyed: (The people of) '‘Ād’ bellied (their prophet ‘Hūd’), then how dreadful was My chastisement after My warnings!

19.Munir Mezyed: Verily, We sent against them a wrathful wind on a day of continuous misfortune,

20.Munir Mezyed: Sweeping men away as if they were decayed palm tree trunks.

21.Munir Mezyed: How dreadful was then My chastisement after My warnings!

22.Munir Mezyed: Verily, We made the ‘Qur’ān’ easy for remembrance, but is there anyone who would like to receive admonition?

23.Munir Mezyed: (The people of) ‘Thamūd’ refused to take heed of Our warnings.

24.Munir Mezyed: They said: “What! Is it a mortal man, one of us, that we should follow? Verily, we should then be in error and madness.

25.Munir Mezyed: Has the remembrance been given to him alone among us? Nay, but he is an insolent liar!"

26.Munir Mezyed: They will know tomorrow who is the liar, the insolent!

27.Munir Mezyed: Verily, We are going to send the ‘She-camel’ a temptation for them. Thus, watch them, (O’ ‘Sālih’), and resort to patience.

28.Munir Mezyed: Inform them that the water is going to be divided among them. Every drinking time will be regulated.

29.Munir Mezyed: But they called their companion, so he took (a sword) and hamstrung the ‘She-camel’.

30.Munir Mezyed: How dreadful was then My chastisement after My warnings!

31.Munir Mezyed: Verily, We sent upon them one awful blast and so they became like dry twig fragments (used by) a fence builder.

32.Munir Mezyed: Verily, We made the ‘Qur’ān’ easy for remembrance, but is there anyone who would like to receive admonition.

33.Munir Mezyed: The folk of ‘Lot’ refused to take heed of Our warnings.

34.Munir Mezyed: Verily, We sent upon them a storm of stones, except for the followers of ‘Lot’. We saved them in the early morning,

35.Munir Mezyed: As a grace from Us. This is how We reward those who show gratitude.

36.Munir Mezyed: He, verily, warned them of Our punishment but they. disregarded intentionally the warnings!

37.Munir Mezyed: Verily, they tried to turn him from his guests, but We wipe out their eyes. Thus, taste My chastisement and My warning.

38.Munir Mezyed: Verily, an abiding chastisement seized them early in the morning.

39.Munir Mezyed: Then taste My chastisement and My warning.

40.Munir Mezyed: Verily, We made the ‘Qur’ān’ easy for remembrance, but is there anyone who would like receive admonition?

41.Munir Mezyed: Verily, warnings came to the clan of ‘Pharaoh’.

42.Munir Mezyed: They sought to refute (the divine origin of) Our ‘Revelations’, therefore, We seized them with a Seizure of the All-Mighty, All-powerful One.

43.Munir Mezyed: Are those of yours, (O’ Quraysh), who lack Faith (in the oneness of the Allâh) better than these? Or have you received amnesty through the ‘Scriptures’?

44.Munir Mezyed: Or do they say: "We shall be triumphant because of our unity?"

45.Munir Mezyed: The hosts will be defeated. They will turn and flee.

46.Munir Mezyed: Nay, but the Inevitable ‘Hour’ of (Reckoning) is their promised time, and It will be the most grievous and bitter!

47.Munir Mezyed: Verily, the ungodly sinners are in deception and insanity.

48.Munir Mezyed: The day will come when they are dragged upon their faces into the Fire. (It will be said unto them): “Taste the touch of the Hellfire!”

49.Munir Mezyed: Verily, We have created everything for a specific reason.

50.Munir Mezyed: Our Command is but one, as the twinkling of an eye.

51.Munir Mezyed: Verily, We have put an end (to the existence of) so many people like you, but is there anyone who would like to receive admonition?

52.Munir Mezyed: Everything they did is in the ‘Scriptures’.

53.Munir Mezyed: Everything , small or large, is written down.

54.Munir Mezyed: Verily, the ‘Pious’ will be in (Great) Gardens and rivers,

55.Munir Mezyed: In a ‘Seat of Truth’ in the Presence of the Most Powerful King.

55.SurahEnglishNames: The Beneficent, The Mercy Giving, The Merciful

1.Munir Mezyed: The Most Gracious One

2.Munir Mezyed: Taught the ‘Qur’ān’.

3.Munir Mezyed: He created man.

4.Munir Mezyed: He taught him the art of articulation.

5.Munir Mezyed: The sun and the moon are made punctual.

6.Munir Mezyed: The herbage and trees do prostrate.

7.Munir Mezyed: The heavens, He raised it high. And He set up the scale

8.Munir Mezyed: So that you may not transgress.

9.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, maintain the scale with equity and fall not short of the measure.

10.Munir Mezyed: The earth, He laid it for the creatures.

11.Munir Mezyed: Therein are fruit and palm-trees with sheaths,

12.Munir Mezyed: And also husked grain and basil.

13.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn) seek to deny?

14.Munir Mezyed: He created man from dry clay like baked pottery;

15.Munir Mezyed: And He created the Jinn from smokeless flame of fire.

16.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?

17.Munir Mezyed: He is the Lord of the East and the West.

18.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?

19.Munir Mezyed: He released the two seas, meeting (side by side).

20.Munir Mezyed: Between them is a barrier so neither of them can transgress.

21.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?

22.Munir Mezyed: There come forth from both of them pearl and coral.

23.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?

24.Munir Mezyed: His are the ships displayed upon the sea like mountains.

25.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?

26.Munir Mezyed: Whatever is in this ‘worldly life’ will perish.

27.Munir Mezyed: But will remain the Face of your Lord, the Lord of Majesty and Honor.

28.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?

29.Munir Mezyed: All those in the heavens and on the earth implore and pray to Him. Every day He has a (new) matter to bring forth.

30.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?

31.Munir Mezyed: We shall call you to account, O’ you two prominent beings, (mankind & jinn).

32.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?

33.Munir Mezyed: O’ company of jinn and mankind, if you (think that you) are capable of passing through the regions of the heavens and earth, then pass through. But you will not be capable of passing through, except with power and authority.

34.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?

35.Munir Mezyed: There will be sent upon you both flames of fire and sparks of brass, then you will not be capable of protecting your own selves.

36.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?

37.Munir Mezyed: When the heavens is rent asunder, it becomes red like murky oil.

38.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?

39.Munir Mezyed: On that day neither man nor jinni will be asked about his sin.

40.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?

41.Munir Mezyed: The ungodly sinners will be recognized by their marks. They will be seized by their forelocks and their feet.

42.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny.

43.Munir Mezyed: This is ‘Gehenna’ which the ungodly sinners denied.

44.Munir Mezyed: They will circulate between it, and between scalding boiling water.

45.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?

46.Munir Mezyed: For him who shows honor and reverence for the infinite glory of his Lord are two gardens -

47.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?-

48.Munir Mezyed: Containing various trees!

49.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?

50.Munir Mezyed: Therein are two flowing springs.

51.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?

52.Munir Mezyed: Therein are pairs of every fruit.

53.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?

54.Munir Mezyed: (The ‘Denizens of Al-Jannah’) will recline on couches lined with silk brocade, and the fruits of the two gardens are within reach.

55.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?

56.Munir Mezyed: Therein are bashful maidens whom neither man nor jinni has ever touched them before-

57.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to  deny?-

58.Munir Mezyed: As though they were rubies and coral.

59.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn) , you seek  to deny?

60.Munir Mezyed: Is the reward of goodness aught but goodness?

61.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?

62.Munir Mezyed: Beside those two, there will be two other gardens -

63.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny? –

64.Munir Mezyed: light-green.

65.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny.

66.Munir Mezyed: Therein are two abundant springs.

67.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?

68.Munir Mezyed: Therein are fruits, palms and pomegranates.

69.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?

70.Munir Mezyed: Therein are maidens, beautiful and gorgeous -

71.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?-

72.Munir Mezyed: With wide, lovely black eyes, dwelling in pavilions.

73.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you (O’ mankind & jinn) seek to deny.

74.Munir Mezyed: No human ever touched them, neither jinni.

75.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you (O’ mankind & jinn) seek to deny?

76.Munir Mezyed: (The ‘Denizens of Al-Jannah’) will recline on green cushions and fine carpets.

77.Munir Mezyed: Then, which is it, of the marvels of your Lord, that you, (O’ mankind & jinn), seek to deny?

78.Munir Mezyed: Most exalted is the Name of your Lord, the Lord of Majesty and Honor.

56.SurahEnglishNames: The Event, The Inevitable, That Which is Coming

1.Munir Mezyed: When the inevitable event comes to pass,

2.Munir Mezyed: Then its occurrence can not be denied.

3.Munir Mezyed: It will put some down and elevate others.

4.Munir Mezyed: When the earth is shaken with violent shock,

5.Munir Mezyed: The Mountains will crumble to ground,

6.Munir Mezyed: Becoming dust particles floating around.

7.Munir Mezyed: You will be divided into three categories.

8.Munir Mezyed: Those on the right hand; what of those on the right hand?

9.Munir Mezyed: Those on the left hand; what of those on the left hand?

10.Munir Mezyed: The foremost ones (who were monotheists) are the foremost ones (in receiving their reward).

11.Munir Mezyed: Those are the ones who will be brought nigh (to Allâh),

12.Munir Mezyed: (56: 12) Abiding in the gardens of bliss.

13.Munir Mezyed: A multitude of those foremost will be from the ancient people

14.Munir Mezyed: And a few will be from the later generations.

15.Munir Mezyed: (They will sit) on bejeweled thrones,

16.Munir Mezyed: Reclining thereon, facing one another.

17.Munir Mezyed: Round about them will go immortal youths,

18.Munir Mezyed: Carrying goblets, pitchers and a cup of pure drink.

19.Munir Mezyed: Where from they will neither get headache, nor will they get intoxicated-

20.Munir Mezyed: Carrying also fruits that they choose

21.Munir Mezyed: And flesh of fowls that they desire.

22.Munir Mezyed: They will have immortal maidens, wide, lovely black eyes

23.Munir Mezyed: Like hidden pearls;

24.Munir Mezyed: A reward for what they used to do.

25.Munir Mezyed: They will not hear therein any evil vain talk or sinful speeches

26.Munir Mezyed: But only the word of greeting, “Peace, Peace.”

27.Munir Mezyed: Those on the right hand; what of those on the right hand?

28.Munir Mezyed: (They will be) amid thornless lot trees,

29.Munir Mezyed: And banana palms,

30.Munir Mezyed: In an extended shade,

31.Munir Mezyed: By water flowing constantly,

32.Munir Mezyed: Many types of fruits,

33.Munir Mezyed: Neither intercepted, nor forbidden,

34.Munir Mezyed: And on exalted thrones.

35.Munir Mezyed: Verily, We created those maidens of special creation

36.Munir Mezyed: And then We made them virgins,

37.Munir Mezyed: Loving, equals in age,

38.Munir Mezyed: For those on the right hand.

39.Munir Mezyed: A multitude of those on the right hand will be from the ancient people,

40.Munir Mezyed: And another multitude will be from the later generations.

41.Munir Mezyed: Those on the left hand; what of those on the left hand?

42.Munir Mezyed: (They will be) in scorching wind and scalding hot water,

43.Munir Mezyed: And under a shadow of black smoke,

44.Munir Mezyed: Neither cool nor refreshing.

45.Munir Mezyed: Verily, they were, before that, indulging in affluence,

46.Munir Mezyed: And they used to persist in the great blasphemy.

47.Munir Mezyed: They used to say: "When we die and turn to dust and bones, shall we be resurrected?

48.Munir Mezyed: Or our fathers of yore?”

49.Munir Mezyed: Say: "(Yes) indeed, all the ancients and the later generations

50.Munir Mezyed: Will be gathered together for the appointed hour of predetermined day.

51.Munir Mezyed: Then O’ you who had gone astray, and refused to acknowledge the Truth!

52.Munir Mezyed: You verily will eat from the fruit of ‘Zaqqum Tree’,

53.Munir Mezyed: Filling your bellies with it.

54.Munir Mezyed: On top of this, you will drink boiling water,

55.Munir Mezyed: Drinking like a thirsty camel"

56.Munir Mezyed: This is their provision on the ‘Day of Judgment’.

57.Munir Mezyed: It is We Who have created you. Will you then consent to receive this fact?

58.Munir Mezyed: Have you seen that which you ejaculate?

59.Munir Mezyed: Is it you who create it, or are We the Creators?

60.Munir Mezyed: We have destined death for you; and We are not to be overcome,

61.Munir Mezyed: In order that We may transfigure you, and may make you grow into what you know not.

62.Munir Mezyed: Verily, you have already known about the first creation, then why do you not celebrate His praises and declare His infinite glory?

63.Munir Mezyed: Have you seen the seed that you sow in the ground?

64.Munir Mezyed: Are you the ones who cause it to grow, or We who cause it to grow?

65.Munir Mezyed: If we willed, we could turn it into debris, then you would be left wondering,

66.Munir Mezyed: (Saying): ” Definitely we are burdened with debt,

67.Munir Mezyed: Nay, but we are deprived!"

68.Munir Mezyed: Have you seen the water which you drink?

69.Munir Mezyed: Are you the ones who cause it to come down from the rain clouds? Or We who cause to come down?

70.Munir Mezyed: If we willed, we could make it very salty. Then why do you not show any gratitude (to your Lord for His endless blessings).

71.Munir Mezyed: Have you seen the fire which you kindle?

72.Munir Mezyed: Are you the ones who initiated its tree, or We who initiated it?

73.Munir Mezyed: We have made it a reminder, and a useful item for the inhabitants of the wilderness.

74.Munir Mezyed: Thus, glorify with praises the Name of your Lord, the Most Great.

75.Munir Mezyed: Nay, I swear by the positions of the stars.

76.Munir Mezyed: Verily, this is definitely a great oath, if you but know-

77.Munir Mezyed: This is, indeed, an honorable ‘Qur’ān’

78.Munir Mezyed: In a well-preserved Book.

79.Munir Mezyed: No one shall touch it except the purified ones.

80.Munir Mezyed: It is a revelation from the Lord of all the worlds.

81.Munir Mezyed: Is it such a discourse, (this’ Qur’ān’), that you refuse to acknowledge the truth of It.

82.Munir Mezyed: And you make your disbelief thereof your means of livelihood?

83.Munir Mezyed: Then why (can't you help a soul) when it comes up to the throat?

84.Munir Mezyed: You at the moment are looking on

85.Munir Mezyed: While We are closer to it than you are, but you see not.

86.Munir Mezyed: Since you are not held under authority,

87.Munir Mezyed: Why do you not bring it back (to its body), if you are truthful?

88.Munir Mezyed: Then if he is one of those who are drawn nigh (to Allâh),

89.Munir Mezyed: (His soul) will be a breath of life with the scent of basil in the gardens of bliss.

90.Munir Mezyed: But if he is one of those on the right hand,

91.Munir Mezyed: His soul will be (greeted by the word) “Peace” from those on the right hand.

92.Munir Mezyed: But if he is one of those who refused to accept the Truth, and went astray (from the right path),

93.Munir Mezyed: Then his accommodation will be scalding hot water

94.Munir Mezyed: And the heat of the burning Fire.

95.Munir Mezyed: Verily, this is the Ultimate Truth.

96.Munir Mezyed: Thus, glorify with praises the Name of your Lord, the Most Great.

1.Munir Mezyed: Whatever is in the heavens and on the earth celebrates the praise of Allâh and declares His infinite glory. He is the All-Mighty, All- Wise.

2.Munir Mezyed: His is the (absolute) sovereignty of the heavens and of the earth. He gives life and causes death. He is capable of doing whatever He wills.

3.Munir Mezyed: He is the First, the Last, the Visible and the Hidden. He is fully aware of all things.

4.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who created the heavens and earth in six days, and then established Himself above the (Glorious) Throne. He knows whatever goes into the earth, and whatever comes forth from it, whatever comes down from the heavens, and whatever goes up to it. He is always with you wherever you are. Allâh is the All-Seer of what you do.

5.Munir Mezyed: His is the (absolute) sovereignty of the heavens and of the earth. To Allâh all things are destined to be brought back.

6.Munir Mezyed: He lets the night pass into the day, and lets the day pass into the night. He is All-Knowing of what is in the hearts.

7.Munir Mezyed: Believe in Allâh and His ‘Messenger’, and expend of that whereof He has made you trustees. Those of you who attain Faith (in Allâh) and expend, will have an immense reward.

8.Munir Mezyed: And what reason do you have that you should not believe in Allah? And the ‘Messenger’ is calling you to believe in your Lord, who has already taken a pledge from you?

9.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who sends down the full knowledge of the Truth to His servant, so that He may bring you out of darkness into light. Verily, Allâh is All-Compassionate and Most Merciful to you.

10.Munir Mezyed: And what reason do you have that you should not expend on (serving) the cause of Allâh since (you know that) the heritage of the heavens and of the earth belongs to Allâh? Not equal among you are those who spent (on the serving the cause of Allâh) and fought (bravely) before the conquest with other. They are greater in rank than those who spent and fought afterwards. However, to both parties Allâh has promised the best reward (‘Al-Jannah’). Allâh is All-Aware of what you do.

11.Munir Mezyed: Who is he that will lend to Allâh a goodly loan so that He will multiply it for him, and he will have a generous reward?

12.Munir Mezyed: On that day, you will see the light of the ‘Monotheistic Believers’, men, and women, shimmering before them and on their right hand. Joyful news for you this ‘Day’! Gardens beneath which rivers flow, where you will abide therein. That is the most ultimate success and the supreme one."

13.Munir Mezyed: On that day, the Hypocrites, men and women, will say to those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism: "Look at us so that we may get some light from your light." It will be said: "Go back and seek for light." Thus, a wall with a gate in it will be put up between them. Inside it there will be mercy, but outside of it there will be agony and suffering.

14.Munir Mezyed: (The ‘Hypocrites’) will cry unto the ‘Monotheistic Believers’: ‘Did we not use to be with you (in the ‘worldly life’)?’ They will reply: “Yea, but you caused yourselves to fall into temptation, longed for our destruction, doubted (the Resurrection), and let your vain desire delude you, until there came the command of Allâh. Thus, (You let) the arch-deceiver, (Satan), deceive you concerning Allâh.”

15.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, this day no ransom will be accepted from you, neither from those who refused to accept (Allâh in their Life). Your abode is the Fire. It is your benefactor. Evil is the abode!

16.Munir Mezyed: Has not the time yet come for the ‘Monotheistic Believers’ that their hearts should become humbly submissive at the remembrance of Allâh, and at the Truth which is revealed, lest they become like those who were given the ‘Scripture’ before, and the term was prolonged for them, and so their hearts were hardened? However, most of them are debauchees walking in the path of disobedience.

17.Munir Mezyed: Know that Allâh gives life to the earth after its death!. Indeed, We have made Our (Holy) ‘Verses’ manifest to you so that you may be able to perceive (their intended meaning).

18.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those men and women who give alms, and lend to Allâh a goodly loan, it will be multiplied for them. They will (also) receive a generous recompense.

19.Munir Mezyed: Those who believe in Allâh and in His ‘Messengers’ are (in the rank) of the truthful, and the witnesses, with their Lord. They will have their reward and their light. Yest those  who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) and refuse to give credence to Our Revelations are the ‘Denizens of Hellfire’.

20.Munir Mezyed: Know that this ‘worldly life’ is only playing, amusement, ornament, boasting among you, and competition in increase of wealth and children, as the likeness of abundant rain whose vegetation pleases those who lack Faith in Allâh. Then it shrivels and you can see it turning yellow and then it becomes debris. In the ‘Hereafter’, there will  be severe chastisement for those who refuse to accept (Allâh into their Life), and there will be forgiveness from Allâh and His graceful Pleasure (for the ‘Monotheistic Believers’). Consequently, this ‘worldly life’ is not more than provision of vanities.

21.Munir Mezyed: Hasten to forgiveness from your Lord and to a garden, the width whereof is as the width of heaven and earth, prepared for those who believe in Allâh and His ‘Messengers’. That is the bounty of Allâh. He bestows upon Whom He wills. Allâh is the Lord of the great bounty.

22.Munir Mezyed: No misfortune befalls on the earth or among you except that it is written in a book before, We bring it into existence. Verily, that is easy for Allâh to do.

23.Munir Mezyed: You ought not to be depressed over that which has escaped you, nor rejoice over what Allâh has bestowed upon you. Allâh demonstrates not his own love for any arrogant boaster.

24.Munir Mezyed: Such  are misers and enjoin upon the people parsimony. Whoever turns away (needs to know that) Allâh is the Self-Sufficient, Worthy of all praise.

25.Munir Mezyed: We verily sent Our ‘Messengers’ with the knowledge of the truth, and revealed with them the ‘Scripture’ and the Balance, so that the people may observe the right measure (i.e. maintain justice). We sent down iron wherein strong power and benefit for the people so that Allâh will identify those who give support to His cause and to His messenger in secret. Indeed, Allâh is All- Strong, All-Might.

26.Munir Mezyed: We verily sent ‘Noah’ and ‘Abraham’ (as Our ‘Messengers’) and placed ‘Prophethood’ and ‘Scripture’ in their offspring. Therefore, some of them attain spiritual insight, while many of them are debauchees walking in the path of disobedience.

27.Munir Mezyed: Then We made Our ‘Messengers’ to follow in their footsteps. And We made ‘Jesus’, son of Mary, to follow, giving him the ‘Gospel’, and placing compassion and mercy in the hearts of those who followed him. But they innovated ‘Monasticism’ which We did not prescribe it for them. (They sought it) only to please Allâh, but they did not observe it in accordance with what is required. Thus, We give those of them who have accepted monotheism their reward, but many of them are debauchees walking in the path of disobedience.

28.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, act piously towards your Lord, and believe in His ‘Messenger’, (‘Muhammad’). He will give you twofold of His mercy while giving you light wherein you will walk, and forgiving your sins. Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

29.Munir Mezyed: That The ‘People of the Scripture’ (Jews & Christians) may come to know that they control naught of the bounty of Allâh, but that (His) bounty is in His Hand. He bestows it upon whom He wills. Allâh is the Lord of the great bounty.

58.SurahEnglishNames: She That Disputeth, The Pleading Woman, She Who Pleaded

1.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, Allâh has heard the words of the woman who argued with you concerning her husband and complained to Allâh. He was listening to the contentions of both of you. Indeed, Allâh is All-Hearing, All-Seer.

2.Munir Mezyed: Those of you who deliberately seek to estrange their wives by declaring them to be as their mothers (should know) that their wives could never become their mothers. Their mothers are only those women who gave birth to them.  The words they utter are evil words and falsehood. Indeed, Allâh is Oft- Pardoning, Oft-Forgiving.

3.Munir Mezyed: Those who deliberately seek to estrange their wives by declaring them to be as their mothers, and then go back on that which they said, they should free a captive before they touch each other. That is what you are admonished thereby. Allâh is All-Aware of all what you do.

4.Munir Mezyed: However, the one who can not find (a slave to free) must fast for two consecutive months before they touch each other. In case he can not fast, then he should feed sixty needy ones. This is the command of Allâh, so that you may have perfect trust in Allâh and His ‘Messenger’. These are the limits (i.e laws and rules) set by Allâh. Those who persist in disbelief (in Allâh) will be subjected to a painful punishment.

5.Munir Mezyed: Verily, those who oppose Allâh and His ‘Messenger’ will be humiliated and perished, just as those before them. Verily We sent down intelligible revelations, and Those who persist in disbelief (in Allâh) will be subjected to a disgraceful chastisement.

6.Munir Mezyed: The day will come when Allâh resurrects them all, then inform them of what they used to do. Allâh has enumerated every deed, while they have forgotten it. Allâh is Witness over all things.

7.Munir Mezyed: Have you not seen that Allâh knows best whatever is in the heavens, and whatever is on the earth? There is no secret conversation of three but He is their fourth, nor of five but He is their sixth, nor of less than that or more but He is (always) with them wherever they might be. Then He will inform them of all what they did on the ‘Day of Resurrection’. Indeed, Allâh is Fully Aware of all things.

8.Munir Mezyed: Have you not seen those who were forbidden to plot evil plans and afterward returned to that which they had been forbidden? They conspire to commit sins, transgression, and disobeying the ‘Messenger’. When they come to you, they greet you with a greeting with which Allâh greets you not, saying within themselves: ”Why should Allâh punish us for what we say?” ‘Hellfire’ will be sufficient for them, where they will burn in it. Dreadful is the abode!

9.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, when you collaborate secretly, collaborate not for the purpose of committing sins or transgression or disobedience to the ‘Messenger’, but collaborate for righteousness and piety, and act piously towards Allâh, to Whom you are destined to be gathered.

10.Munir Mezyed: Engaging in plots and intrigues is inspired by the devil in order to cause sorrow to the those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, but he cannot harm them at all, except with the permission of Allâh. Thus, let those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism rely on Allâh with full trust.

11.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, if it happens that you were asked to make room in the assemblies, then you should do so. Allâh will give you ample. If it happens that you were asked to get up and move, then you should do so. Allâh will exalt in degree those of you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism and those who are given the spiritual gift of knowledge. Allâh is Well-Aware of all what you do.

12.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, when you want to consult privately the ‘Messenger’, offer an alms before your consultation. That is better for you and purer. However, if it happens that you do not find anything to give, (then be sure) Allâh is indeed Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

13.Munir Mezyed: Were you afraid that offering alms before your consultation would make you poor?  Even though you did not offer any alms, Allâh would forgive you for that. Thus, establish the regular Prayer, pay Zakāt (i.e. the Prescribed Purifying Alms and obey Allâh and His ‘Messenger’. Allâh is Well-Aware of all what you do.

14.Munir Mezyed: Have you not seen those ‘Hypocrites’ who take for friends a folk of people whom the wrath of Allâh abides in them? They are neither of you nor of them. They swear falsely while they know.

15.Munir Mezyed: Allâh has prepared for them a vehement chastisement. Dreadful, indeed, is that which they used to do.

16.Munir Mezyed: They used their oaths as a cover to hinder the people from the path of Allâh.  For them, therefore, will be a disgraceful chastisement.

17.Munir Mezyed: Neither their wealth, nor their children will avail them naught against ( the chastisement of) Allâh. They are the ‘Denizens of the Fire’, where they will abide therein.

18.Munir Mezyed: On the ‘Day’ when Allâh will resurrect them all, then they will swear to Him as they swear to you, thinking that they have a cause. They are, indeed, the liars.

19.Munir Mezyed: The devil has overwhelmed them and has made them forget the to celebrate the praises of Allâh. They are (the members) of devil’s party. Indeed, (the members of) the devil’s party are the sons of eternal perdition.

20.Munir Mezyed: Those who oppose Allâh and His Messenger will be among the most humiliated.

21.Munir Mezyed: Allâh has decreed: "Indeed, it is I and My Messengers, who will be the triumphant." Indeed, Allâh is All-Strong, All-Mighty.

22.Munir Mezyed: You will not find people who believe in Allâh and in the Last Day being in love with those who oppose Allâh and His ‘Messenger’, even though they be their fathers or their sons or their brethren or their clan. For these, He has firmly established Faith in their hearts, and has strengthened them with a Spirit from Himself. He will admit them into gardens underneath which rivers flow, where they will abide therein. Allâh is well pleased with them, and they are well pleased with Him. These are the (members of) Allâh’s party. Definitely, (the members of) the Allâh’s party are the ones who will ultimately achieve a blissful life/ or gain eternal salvation.

1.Munir Mezyed: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth celebrates the praises of Allâh and declares His infinite glory. He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

2.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who caused (Banū al-Nadīr) who excessively indulged in disbelief (in Allâh) among the people of the Scripture (Jews & Christians) to go forth from their homes to the first exile. You deemed not that they would go forth, while they thought that their strongholds would defend them against (the wrath of) Allâh. But the (chastisement of) Allâh came to them whence they never expected; and He cast terror into their hearts. Thus, they destroyed their own houses by their own hands, and by the hands of the ‘Monotheistic Believers’. Thus, take heed, O' you who have vision!

3.Munir Mezyed: Had it not been that Allâh had decreed exile for them, He would definitely have punished them in this ‘worldly life’, and theirs in the ‘Hereafter’ is the chastisement of the Fire.

4.Munir Mezyed: That is because they opposed Allâh and His ‘Messenger’. Whosoever opposes Allâh (let him be sure that) Allâh is extremely severe in executing punishment.

5.Munir Mezyed: Whatever palm-tree you cut down or leave it standing upon its roots, it is by the permission of Allâh. He will definitely humiliate the debauchees who walk in the path of disobedience.

6.Munir Mezyed: Whatever Allâh gives as spoil to His ‘Messenger’ from them, you urge not any horse or riding-camel. But Allâh gives authority to His ‘Messengers’ against whom He wills. Lo! Allâh is capable of doing whatever He wills.

7.Munir Mezyed: Whatever Allâh gives as spoil to His ‘Messenger’ from the people of the towns, it is for (serving the cause of) Allâh and for the ‘Messenger’, as well as for the near of kin, for the orphans, for the needy and for the wayfarer, so that it may not become a fortune used by the rich among you. Thus, whatever the ‘Messenger’ gives you, accept it (with pleasure). And whatever he forbids, abstain from it and do act piously toward Allâh. Verily, Allâh is extremely severe in executing punishment.

8.Munir Mezyed: The spoils of war is for the poor immigrants, who were expelled from their homes and their possessions, seeking bounty from Allâh and His pleasure, and for giving support to the cause of Allâh and to His ‘Messenger’. These are indeed the truthful.

9.Munir Mezyed: Those who had homes in the City (‘Medina’), and had attained Faith (in Allâh),  before the arrival of the immigrants, love those who emigrated to them, finding in their hearts no need of what they are given, and preferring (the immigrants) over themselves, even when they themselves need what they give away. Whoever is protected from their own parsimony, they are the ones who will ultimately achieve a blissful life /or gain eternal salvation.

10.Munir Mezyed: Those who came after them say: “Our Lord, forgive us and our brethren, who were before us in faith, and leave not in our hearts any malevolence toward those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism. Our Lord! You are indeed Full of Compassion, Most Merciful.”

11.Munir Mezyed: Have you not seen the behavior of the ‘Hypocrites’? They say to their brethren who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) among the people of the Scripture (Jews & Christians): “If you are expelled, we will definitely leave with you. And we will never obey anyone who is against you. If it happens that you are attacked, we will assist you and go with you to fight by your side.” Allâh testified that they are truly liars.

12.Munir Mezyed: Definitely, if it happens that they are expelled, the Hypocrites will never leave with them. And if it happens that they are attacked, they will never assist them and go to fight with their side. Consequently, if they were to assist them and to go to fight with their side, they would turn their back and flee from the battle, leaving them helpless.

13.Munir Mezyed: You are definitely greater in being feared in their hearts than Allâh. That is because they are a people who are incapable of understanding (& recognizing the truth from falsehood).

14.Munir Mezyed: They will not (dare to) fight against you all together except in fortified villages or from behind walls. Their brutality among themselves is very intense. You would think they were united but the fact is that their hearts are divided. That is because they are a people who possess no self- awareness that allows them to understand.

15.Munir Mezyed: They are like the example of those who, a short time before, tasted the dreadful consequences of their evil deeds, and they will have to incur a painful chastisement.

16.Munir Mezyed: (The ‘Hypocrites’ are) like the example of ‘Satan’ when he says to the human being: "Disbelieve in Allâh." But when he disbelieves, he says (unto him): "Indeed, I disown you. I fear (the wrath of) Allâh, the Lord of all the worlds."

17.Munir Mezyed: Thus, the consequence for both of them will be that they will be in the Fire, where they will abide therein. This is the chastisement for those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong.

18.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to monotheism, act piously towards Allâh and let every Human Self look to what it has sent forth for the morrow. Act piously towards Allâh. He is certainly All-Aware of all what you do.

19.Munir Mezyed: Be not like those who forgot to act piously toward Allâh and so He caused them to forget their own selves. These are the debauchees who walk in the path of disobedience.

20.Munir Mezyed: Not equal are the the ‘Denizens of Hell’, and the ‘Denizens of Al-Jannah’. The the ‘Denizens of Jannah ‘are (indeed) the ones who achieved eternal salvation.

21.Munir Mezyed: If We had caused this ‘Qur’ān’ to descend upon a mountain, you would certainly have seen it falling down, splitting asunder, out of reverence for Allâh. We set forth these parables to men so that they may be able to ruminate (on the nature of existence).

22.Munir Mezyed: He is Allâh besides Whom there is no god, the All-Knowing of the unseen and the visible. He is the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful.

23.Munir Mezyed: He is Allâh, besides Whom there is no God, the Sovereign, the Holy One, the Giver of Peace, the Giver of Security, the Guardian, the All-Mighty, the Omnipotent, the Supreme. Glory be to Allâh from all what they associate with Him.

24.Munir Mezyed: He is Allâh, the Creator, the Inventor, the Fashioner. Unto Him belong the Most Honorable and Gracious Names. Whatever is in the heavens and the earth does celebrate His praises and declare His glory. He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

60.SurahEnglishNames: She That is to be Examined, Examining her, She Who is Tested

1.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, take not My enemies and your enemies for friends, offering them (your) love, even though they have refused to acknowledge the Truth that has come to you, driving out the ‘Messenger’ (‘Muhammad’) and yourselves (from your homes), because you believe in Allâh, your Lord. If you go forth to fight in My cause (in the service of promulgating the Message), and to seek My good pleasure, (then associate not with them). You secretly convey affection to them. I am fully aware of whatever you divulge and whatever you conceal. And whoever among you does that has verily strayed from the right way.

2.Munir Mezyed: If it should happen that they gained dominance over you, they would still regard you as their enemies, and they would stretch forth their hands and their tongues against you with evil. They earnestly desire that you would abandon your monotheistic belief and worship.

3.Munir Mezyed: Neither your relatives nor your children will avail you on the ‘Day of Resurrection’. He will judge among you. Lo! Allâh is the All-Seer of what you do.

4.Munir Mezyed: There is an excellent pattern for you in ‘Abraham’ and those with him, when they said unto their own people: “Indeed, we disown you and the idols which you worship (& venerate) besides Allâh. We renounce you, and there has arisen between you and us animosity and hatred forever until you accept Allâh into your life”- except the saying of Abraham unto his father,"Indeed, I will pray for your forgiveness, but I have no power to do aught for you against the (will of) Allâh-”(They prayed): "Our Lord, We do depend on you with full trust, and unto You, we turn repentant. And to you is the definitive course..

5.Munir Mezyed: Our Lord, make us not a temptation for those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh), and forgive us, our Lord. Indeed, You, only You are the All-Mighty, the All-Wise."

6.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, there has been for you in them an excellent pattern, for him who hopes for (clemency of) Allâh and for the Last Day. Whoever takes no heed, (must know that) Allâh is indeed the Self-Sufficient and the Owner of Praise.

7.Munir Mezyed: It may be that Allâh will ordain love between you and those whom you hold as enemies. Allâh is All-powerful. He is Oft- Forgiving, Most Merciful.

8.Munir Mezyed: Allâh forbids you not to show kindness and to deal justly with those who do not wage war against you on account of religion and do not seek to expel you from your homes. Indeed Allâh demonstrates his own love for those who are just.

9.Munir Mezyed: He only forbids you to be friends with those who fight you on account of your your faith and belief, and seek to expel you from your homes or to support others in your expulsion. Whoever makes friends with them, they are indeed grossly unfair and morally wrong.

10.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic Monotheism, when the monotheistic Muslim women  come to you as refugees, examine (their faith) carefully: Allâh is All- Aware of their faith: if you find out that they (sincerely) accepted Allâh (into their life) , do not send them back to those who lack Faith in Allâh because they are not lawful (wives) for them, neither are the Unbelievers lawful (husbands) for them. Thus, pay the Unbelievers that (amount of money) that which they have spent (on their dower). There will be no blame on you to wed them if you pay them their dowries. However, hold not to the ties of marriage of the impious women: ask for what you have spent (on their dowers), and let them ask for what the Unbelievers have spent. That is the verdict of Allâh. He judges between you. Lo! Allâh is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

11.Munir Mezyed: And if any of your wives ran away from you to the Unbelievers and she did not give you back the dowry which you spent on her, let the Muslims pay back such dowry from the property of the Unbelievers which may come into their hands. Thus, act piously towards Allâh in Whom you believe ( & trust).

12.Munir Mezyed: O’ Prophet, when the monotheistic Muslim women come to you to give you the pledge that they will not associate anything in worship with Allâh, will not steal, will not commit adultery, will not kill their own children, will not bring a calumny which they have forged of themselves, and will not disobey you in what is right, then accept their pledge and ask forgiveness for them from Allâh. Indeed, Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

13.Munir Mezyed: O’ you O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic Monotheism, do not make friends with a folk who incurred the wrath of Allâh! Indeed, they have despaired of the ‘Hereafter’ as those who lack Faith (in Allâh) despaired of those in the graves.

1.Munir Mezyed: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth celebrates the praise of Allâh and declares His divine glory. He is the All- Mighty, the All-Wise.

2.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, why do you say that which you do not do?

3.Munir Mezyed: The most detestable thing in the sight of Allâh is that you say which you do not fulfill.

4.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, Allâh demonstrates his own love for those who fight (bravely) for His cause in rows as if they were a solid structure.

5.Munir Mezyed: Behold! ‘Moses’ said unto his people: "Why do you intend to hurt me while you know well that I am a Messenger of Allâh to you?” So when they departed from the established course, Allâh caused their hearts to depart from the established course. Allâh will not illuminate the path of the sons of disobedience.

6.Munir Mezyed: Behold! ‘Jesus, son of Mary’, said: "O’ Children of Israel, I am the ‘Messenger’ of Allâh to you, verifying that which was revealed before me in the ‘Torah’, and bringing joyful news of a ‘Messenger’ who will come after me, whose name will be Ahmed. But when he, (‘Muhammad’), came to them with the full knowledge of the Truth (which confirms that he is a ‘Messenger’ of Allâh), they say: "This is an apparent sorcery (and devilry)."

7.Munir Mezyed: Who is more grossly unfair than the one who creates falsehood against Allâh while he is being invited to Islam? Lo! Allâh will not illuminate the path of those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong.

8.Munir Mezyed: They eagerly pursue and seek to extinguish the Light of Allâh with their mouths. But Allâh intends no other than to perfect His Light. No matter how detestable is to those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh).

9.Munir Mezyed: He is the One who has sent His Messenger with the source of spiritual insight, and with the religion of truth, in order to overshadow all other religions, No matter how detestable is to those who excessively indulge in polytheism .

10.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic Monotheism, shall I guide you into a commerce that will deliver you from a 'painful doom'?

11.Munir Mezyed: That you believe in Allâh and His ( blessed) Messenger, and that you strive hard for (serving) the cause of Allâh with your wealth and your lives. That is better for you if you but knew!

12.Munir Mezyed: If you do so, He will redeem you from your sins, and admit you into Gardens underneath which rivers flow, and beautiful mansions in the gardens of Eden. That is the ultimate success and the supreme one.

13.Munir Mezyed: Additionally, there is something you truly long for, victory from Allâh and an imminent conquest. Thus, announce the joyful news, (O' ‘Muhammad’), to the ‘Monotheistic Believers’.

14.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic Monotheism, be great supporters of the cause of Allâh as ‘Jesus , son of Mary’, (when) he said unto the disciples: "Who will support me (in serving the cause) of Allâh?" The disciples said: We are (indeed) the supporters of Allâh. Thus, a party of the ‘Children of Israel’ attained Faith in Allâh, and another party persisted in disbelief. Then We strengthened those who attained  Faith in Allâh against their enemy. Thus, they became the triumphant.

62.SurahEnglishNames: The Congregation, Friday, The Day of Congregation

1.Munir Mezyed: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth celebrates the praises of Allâh and declares His divine glory, the King, the Holy, the All-Mighty, the All- Wise.

2.Munir Mezyed: He is the One who sent among the inhabitants of ‘Mecca’ a ‘Messenger’ from among themselves, reciting to them His (Holy) ‘Verses’, purifying them (from Polytheism & Atheism), and teaching them the ‘Book’ and wisdom, though heretofore they were indeed in utter deception,

3.Munir Mezyed: Along with others of them who have not joined them yet. Lo! He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

4.Munir Mezyed: That is the Bounty of Allâh: He grants it to whom He wills. Lo! Allâh is the Lord of the Mighty Grace.

5.Munir Mezyed: The likeness of those who were charged with the ‘Torah’, then they didn't observe it, is as the likeness of a donkey carrying big load of books. Evil is the likeness of the people who give no credence to (the Holy) Verses of Allâh. Lo! Allâh will not illuminate the path of those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong.

6.Munir Mezyed: Say: "O’ you, who are Jews, if you allege that you are the devoted servants of Allâh, excluding the other people, then invoke death, if you are really truthful."

7.Munir Mezyed: But they will never invoke it because of what their hands have sent before. Lo! Allâh is All- Aware of those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong.

8.Munir Mezyed: Say: "Indeed, the death from which you run away will certainly overtake you, and then you will be sent back to the All-Knowing of the unseen and the visible. Lo! He will inform you of what you used to do."

9.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic Monotheism, when the call is sounded for prayer on Friday, hasten to the remembrance of Allâh and leave trade. That is better for you if you but have Faith in Allâh!

10.Munir Mezyed: However, when the prayer is ended, you may spread through the land, seek of the bounty of Allâh, and celebrate the praises of Allâh and declare His divine Glory so much so that you may achieve salvation and blissful life.

11.Munir Mezyed: (Just by chance) when some of them come across a business deal, or some entertainment, they rush towards it and leave you alone standing. Say: "That which Allâh has is far better than entertainment or transaction. And Allâh is the best of providers."

1.Munir Mezyed: When the ‘Hypocrites’ come to you, they say: "We bear witness that you are indeed the ‘Messenger’ of Allâh." Allâh knows that you are indeed His ‘Messenger’, and Allâh bears witness that the ‘Hypocrites’ are indeed big liars.

2.Munir Mezyed: They have made their oaths a cover. Thus, they were able to avert people from the path of Allâh. Indeed, evil is that which they have been doing.

3.Munir Mezyed: That is because they have accepted Allâh (into their life), then they have renounced their Faith and so a seal has been set on their hearts. Thus, they are incapable of recognizing the truth from falsehood.

4.Munir Mezyed: When you see them, you may be impressed by their looks. And when they speak, their words may sink into your ears. They are like standing logs. They think that every cry is against them. They are the real enemy, so beware of them.  May Allâh assail them! How can they be deceived into going away from the established course?

5.Munir Mezyed: When it is said to them: "Come and let the ‘Messenger’ of Allâh pray for your forgiveness," they turn aside their heads, and you can see them arrogantly evading.

6.Munir Mezyed: It is the same for them, whether you pray for their forgiveness or not. Allâh intends not to forgive them. Lo! Allâh will not illuminate path of the sons of disobedience.

7.Munir Mezyed: They are the ones who say: "Spend nothing on those who are with the Messenger of Allâh until they (are compelled to) abandon him. Yet the treasures of the heavens and of the earth are the property of Allâh, but the Hypocrites are incapable of recognizing the truth from falsehood.

8.Munir Mezyed: They (‘Hypocrites’) say: "If it happens that we return to ‘Medina’, surely the powerful ones therein will expel the more humble ones." Honor belongs unto Allâh, unto His Messenger and the Monotheistic Believers; but the Hypocrites don't  have true faith in ( Allâh).

9.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic Monotheism, let not your wealth or your children divert you from celebrating the praise of Allâh and declaring His divine glory. Those who do so are the ones who are doomed to eternal perdition.

10.Munir Mezyed: Expend of that wherewith We have provided you before death comes to one of you, and then he says: "My Lord, if only You would reprieve me for a little while, then I would give alms and join the righteous!"

11.Munir Mezyed: Allâh would never delay the appointed time of death for any person. Lo! Allâh is All- Aware of all what you do.

1.Munir Mezyed: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth does celebrate the praises of Allâh and declare His divine glory. Unto Him belongs, the (absolute) sovereignty (of the heavens & of earth). And unto Him belong all the praises and gratitude. Lo! He is capable of doing whatever He wills.

2.Munir Mezyed: He is the One who created you. Some of you believe in Allâh while others deny the Truth. Lo! Allâh is All-Seer of all what you do.

3.Munir Mezyed: He created the heavens and the earth for a genuine reason, and then shaped you and perfected your shape. To Him is the definitive course.

4.Munir Mezyed: He knows perfectly well whatever is in the heavens and on the earth. and He (also) knows perfectly well whatever you divulge and whatever you conceal. Lo! Allâh is All- Aware of what is in the hearts.

5.Munir Mezyed: Has there not come to you the news of those who refused to accept Allâh (into their life) aforetime? Thus, they tasted the horrific consequence of their denial. And they will be subjected to a painful punishment (in the ‘Hereafter’).

6.Munir Mezyed: That was because their ‘Messengers’ came to them with the full knowledge of the truth, but they persisted in saying unto them: ”Shall we let mortals guide us?” So they refused to accept Allâh (into their life) and took no heed. Lo! Allâh is above all need. Lo! Allâh is Self-sufficient, Worthy of all praise.

7.Munir Mezyed: Those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) have alleged that they would never be resurrected. Say: “Yes indeed, by my Lord, you will be resurrected, then you will be informed of what you did. Lo! This is an easy task for Allâh to do.

8.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, believe in Allâh and His ‘Messenger’, and in the Light, (this Glorious ‘Qur'an’), which We have revealed. Lo! Allâh is All-Aware of what you do.

9.Munir Mezyed: The day will come when He gathers you to the day of assembling, that will be a day of mutual disillusion. Whoever believes in Allâh and does righteous acts will be delivered from all the consequences of his sins, and will be admitted into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, where they will abide therein. This is the ultimate success and the supreme one.

10.Munir Mezyed: As for those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh), and give no credence to Our ‘Revelations’ will be the ‘Companions of the Fire’ where they will abide therein. And what a dreadful journey’s end!

11.Munir Mezyed: No calamity befalls except by the permission of Allâh. Whoever accepts Allâh (into his life); He will enlighten his heart. Lo! Allâh is the All-Knowing of everything.

12.Munir Mezyed: Obey Allâh and the ‘Messenger’! If  it happens that you take no heed, (then you’ll need to know that) the only thing is incumbent on Our ‘Messenger’ is to convey the Message clearly.

13.Munir Mezyed: Allâh! There is no God but He. Therefore, let the ‘Monotheistic Believers’ depend on Allâh with full trust.

14.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic Monotheism, among your wives and your children, there are enemies for you. Therefore, beware of them. However, if you pardon, forget, and forgive, then (you’ll need to know that) Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

15.Munir Mezyed: Your wealth and your children are only a temptation; but with Allâh is a great reward.

16.Munir Mezyed: Thus, act piously towards Allâh as much as you can, listen (attentively) and obey (the ‘Prophet’) and spend (money on charitable activities) for the sake of your own happiness. Whoever is saved from his own avarice, such are the ones who will ultimately achieve a blissful life/or gain eternal salvation.

17.Munir Mezyed: If you lend to Allâh a righteous loan, He will double it for you, and forgive you. Allâh is Most Appreciative, Most Forbearing.

18.Munir Mezyed: Lo! He is All-Knowing of the unseen and the visible, the All- Mighty, the All-Wise.

1.Munir Mezyed: O’ ‘Prophet’! When you, (O' Muslims), divorce women, divorce them for their prescribed time, calculate the number of the days prescribed, and act piously toward Allâh, your Lord. Evict them not from their homes; neither let them go forth unless they commit a proven adultery. These are the limits of Allâh (i.e. the divine laws & rules). Whoever transgresses the limits of Allâh has wronged himself. You never know; maybe Allâh will cause something new to happen after that.

2.Munir Mezyed: Then, when they have reached their prescribed time, either take them according to an acceptable terms or part with them according to an acceptable term.  Call to witness two men of justice from among you, and give upright testimony for Allâh. That is an admonition given to the one who believes in Allâh and the Last Day. Whosoever acts piously towards Allâh; He will make a way out for him.

3.Munir Mezyed: He will provide him the means of subsistence from where he expects not. Whoever depends on Allâh with full trust (let him be sure that) Allâh is Sufficient for him. Indeed, Allâh will accomplish His command. Indeed, Allâh has set a measure for all things.

4.Munir Mezyed: As for the women who have reached menopause, if you have any doubts, their prescribed time will be three months, along with those who have it not. However, for those who are pregnant, their prescribed time is until they lay down their burdens. Whosoever acts piously towards Allâh; He will make his affair be easy for him.

5.Munir Mezyed: That is the Command of Allâh, which He has sent down to you. Whosoever acts piously towards Allâh, He will redeem him from his sins, and magnify his reward.

6.Munir Mezyed: Lodge them where you live according to your means, and intimidate them not in order to make life intolerable for them. If they are pregnant, then spend on them till they deliver. If they breast-feed your children for you, you have to pay them their wages, and confer among yourselves in the acceptable way. If you are unable to resolve your disputes, then you can hire another woman to nurse the child.

7.Munir Mezyed: Let the wealthy man expend according to his means, and let the poor expend from what Allâh has given him. Allâh lays not on any one a burden beyond what He has given him. Allâh will bring about ease after hardship.

8.Munir Mezyed: So many inhabitants revolted against the command of their Lord and His ‘Messengers’. Therefore, We called them to a stern account, and chastised them with a dreadful punishment.

9.Munir Mezyed: They tasted the horrific consequence of their conduct, and the outcome of their affair was perdition.

10.Munir Mezyed: Allâh has prepared for them a severe punishment. Therefore, act piously toward Allâh, O’ men who possess self- awareness. O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic Monotheism, Allâh has indeed sent down unto you a 'Revealer of Truth', (the Qur’ān).

11.Munir Mezyed: (He has also sent to you) a ‘Messenger’, who recites to you the Decisive ‘Verses’ of Allâh, so that He may bring those who adhere firmly to Islamic monotheism, and do righteous acts ( in this worldly life), out of darkness into the light. Whoever believes in Allâh and does righteous acts, He will admit him into Gardens underneath which rivers flow where they will abide therein. Allâh has indeed made splendid provision for him.

12.Munir Mezyed: Allâh is the One Who created seven heavens, and of the earth the like thereof. His Command descends between them so that you may know that Allâh is capable of doing whatever He wills, and that Allâh encompasses all things in His Knowledge.

1.Munir Mezyed: O’ ‘Prophet’! Why do you forbid what Allâh has made lawful for you, seeking to please your wives? Lo! Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

2.Munir Mezyed: Allâh indeed has sanctioned for you the expiation of your oaths. Lo! Allâh is your Guardian, the All-Knowing and the All-Wise.

3.Munir Mezyed: The ‘Prophet’ disclosed a matter in confidence to one of his wives (Hafsa bint Umar), and then she divulged the secret to (Ā'ishah bint Abī Bakr). Lo! Allâh made it known to him. Thus, he informed his wife of part of the issue, and disregarded part. She asked: "Who informed you of this?" He said: "I was informed by the One Who is the All-Knowing, the All-Aware.”

4.Munir Mezyed: If you both (Hafsa & Ā'ishah) do turn in repentance to Allâh as your hearts are already so inclined, then it will be better for you both. But if it happens that you band together against him, then (you’ll need to know that) Allâh is his Guardian, and so is ‘Gabriel’ and the righteous among the ‘Monotheistic Believers’, and furthermore, the ‘Angels’ are his supporters.

5.Munir Mezyed: Maybe, his Lord, if he divorces you, will substitute other wives in your place, who are better than you, submissive, faithful, obedient, repentant, worshipers, given to fasting, either previously married, or virgins.

6.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic Monotheism, protect yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is men and stones. Over it are ‘Angels’, vigorous and vehement. They comply with everything Allâh has commanded them. And they do whatever they are commanded.

7.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh), make no excuses for yourselves this day. You are only being paid for what you used to do.

8.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who adhere firmly to Islamic Monotheism, turn to Allâh with truthful repentance. It maybe your Lord intends to deliver you from all consequences of your sins, and admit you into Gardens underneath which rivers flow, on the day on which Allâh will not humiliate the ‘Prophet’ and those who attain Faith in Allâh with him. Their light will coruscate before them on their right hands.  They will say: “Our Lord, make our light perfect for us, and forgive us! Lo! You are capable of doing whatever You will.”

9.Munir Mezyed: O’ ‘Prophet’, strive hard against those lack Faith in Allâh , as well as against the ‘Hypocrites’, and be so tough on them. Their abode will be ‘Hellfire’. What a dreadful  journey’s end!

10.Munir Mezyed: Allâh sets forth an example for those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh), the wife of ‘Noah’ and the wife of ‘Lot’. They were under two of our righteous servants but they both betrayed them. Thus, they benefited them not against (the will of) Allâh, and it was said unto them: “Enter both the Fire along with those who enter."

11.Munir Mezyed: Allâh sets forth an example to those who attain to Faith in Allâh, the wife of ‘Pharaoh’ when she said: "My Lord, build a home for me in ‘Al- Jannah’ near you, and save me from ‘Pharaoh’ and his work, and save me from those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong).”

12.Munir Mezyed: Also ‘Mary’, the daughter of ‘Imrān, who maintained her chastity. Thus, We breathed something of Our Spirit into (her womb). She placed her faith in the Word of her Lord, and His Scriptures, and was among of the obedient.

1.Munir Mezyed: Most exalted is the One in whose hand is the (absolute) sovereignty (of the heavens and of earth); and He is capable of doing whatever He wills.

2.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who created life and death so that He may let you experience hardship in order to identify those among you who would do better. Lo! He is the All-Mighty, the Oft-Forgiving,

3.Munir Mezyed: Who has created the seven heavens in layers, you can see no imperfection in the creation of the Most Beneficent. Keep on looking, do you see any flaw?

4.Munir Mezyed: Then look again and yet again, your sight will return to you humbled while it is fatigued.

5.Munir Mezyed: We adorned the lowest heavens with lamps, making them as missile launch facilities to strike against the devils. For them, We have prepared a punishment of the blazing Fire (in the ‘Hereafter’).

6.Munir Mezyed: (We have also prepared) for those who lack Faith in their Lord, the punishment of ‘Hellfire’. What a dreadful journey’s end!

7.Munir Mezyed: When they are flung therein, they will hear a loud moaning while it boils.

8.Munir Mezyed: It almost bursts up with fury. Every time a group is flung therein, its keepers will ask them: "Did no warner come to you?"

9.Munir Mezyed: They will say: "Yes indeed; a warner did come unto us, but we belied him and said: “Allâh has revealed nothing. You are only in a utter deception.”

10.Munir Mezyed: They also say: "If we had heard or used our intelligence, we would not have been among the denizens of the blazing Fire."

11.Munir Mezyed: Thus, they confessed their sins: Woe unto the ‘Denizens of the blazing Fire’!

12.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who show honor and reverence for their Lord in secret  will have forgiveness and a great reward.

13.Munir Mezyed: Whether you conceal your word or disclose it, (be sure that) Allâh is All- Aware of what is in the hearts.

14.Munir Mezyed: Would He Who has created not know? while He is the Subtle, the All-Aware.

15.Munir Mezyed: He is the One Who has made the earth subservient unto you, so walk in the path thereof and eat of His provision. To Him will be the resurrection.

16.Munir Mezyed: Do you feel secure that the One Who is in the heavens will not cause you to sink into the earth when it is quivering violently?

17.Munir Mezyed: Or do you feel secure that the One Who is in the heavens will not send against you a violent whirlwind? Then you will come to know how serious the warning was.

18.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who lived before them belied (the ‘Messengers’ of Allâh).  How (dreadful) was then My Denunciation!

19.Munir Mezyed: Do they not see the birds above them spreading out their wings and closing them? Not anything upholds them except the Most Gracious. Indeed, He is the All-Seer of everything.

20.Munir Mezyed: Or who is it that will be a host for you to help you against (the divine retribution of) the Most Gracious (Lord)? Those who lack Faith in Allâh are in nothing but delusion.

21.Munir Mezyed: Or who is it that will be provide you with means of sustenance if He withholds His provisions? Nay, but they persist in impudence and aversion.

22.Munir Mezyed: Is he who walks with his head hanging down, more rightly guided, or he who walks upright on a straight path?

23.Munir Mezyed: Say: "He is the One Who brought you into being, and endowed you with hearing, sight, and hearts. Little gratitude you show!

24.Munir Mezyed: Say: "He is the One who multiplies you in earth, and to Him will you be gathered together."

25.Munir Mezyed: They say: “When will the promise (‘Day of Judgment’) be fulfilled, if you are truthful?"

26.Munir Mezyed: Say, "Such knowledge is with Allâh. I am only a manifest warner (who gives humanity sufficient warning about how to avoid ‘Hellfire’)."

27.Munir Mezyed: But when they see it nigh, the faces of those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) will be distressed. It will be said (unto them): "This is what you used to call for."

28.Munir Mezyed: Say: "Have you not deemed that whether Allâh decides to obliterate me and those who are with me, or to shower us with His Mercy, who is there to protect those who lack Faith in Allâh from a painful punishment?"

29.Munir Mezyed: Say: "He is the Most Gracious. We believe in Him; and we do depend on Him with full trust. Thus, you will come to know the one who is in manifest error."

30.Munir Mezyed: Say: "Have you deemed that if it happens that your water sinks away, who then, will bring you flowing water?!

1.Munir Mezyed: Nu’on. By the pen and what they write down,

2.Munir Mezyed: You, (O' ‘Muhammad’), are not, by the Grace of your Lord, a madman.

3.Munir Mezyed: For you, most surely, there will be a never-ending reward.

4.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, You are endowed with sublime moral excellence.

5.Munir Mezyed: You will see and they will also see

6.Munir Mezyed: Which of you is infatuated with insanity.

7.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, your Lord knows perfectly well who has gone astray from His path. And He knows perfectly well those who attain spiritual insight.

8.Munir Mezyed: Pay no attention to those who refuse to accept the Truth.

9.Munir Mezyed: They would like to (see you) compromise so that they may also compromise.

10.Munir Mezyed: Pay no attention to any despicable oath-maker,

11.Munir Mezyed: Slanderer, spreading vilification (in all directions),

12.Munir Mezyed: Preventer of goodness, a sinful transgressor,

13.Munir Mezyed: Villainous, besides all that, morally corrupt,

14.Munir Mezyed: Even though he possesses hug wealth and many children.

15.Munir Mezyed: When Our (Holy) ‘Verses’ are recited to him, he says: “Myths of the ancients."

16.Munir Mezyed: We shall brand him on the snout.

17.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We have let them experience hardship as We let the owners of the garden experience hardship when they swore to pluck all its fruits in the morning

18.Munir Mezyed: Without saying: “If Allâh wills it.”

19.Munir Mezyed: So there came upon it a visitation form your Lord while they were asleep.

20.Munir Mezyed: It became like dark gloomy night.

21.Munir Mezyed: Then they called out to each other in the early morning:

22.Munir Mezyed: “Go early to your cultivated garden, if you want to pluck the fruits.”

23.Munir Mezyed: Thus, they set out while whispering to each other.

24.Munir Mezyed: “Let not any poor enter it today while you are there.”

25.Munir Mezyed: They went forth early in the morning, thinking that they were able to (drive the poor away from their garden).

26.Munir Mezyed: But when they saw it, they said: "Indeed, we have gone astray.

27.Munir Mezyed: No but the fact is we are deprived.

28.Munir Mezyed: The most moderate one of them said: "Did I not tell you that you should celebrate the praises of your Lord and declare His divine glory?"

29.Munir Mezyed: They said: "All glory belongs to our Lord. Indeed, we were grossly unfair and morally wrong."

30.Munir Mezyed: Then they started blaming each other.

31.Munir Mezyed: They said: "Woe unto us! Indeed, we were sinful aggressors.

32.Munir Mezyed: Maybe, our Lord will give us in exchange a better one than this. Indeed, we turn in repentance to our Lord".

33.Munir Mezyed: Such is the punishment. Indeed the punishment of the ‘Hereafter’ is greater if they did but know.

34.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, the Pious will have, in the presence of their Lord, Gardens of bliss (in ‘Al-Jannah’)

35.Munir Mezyed: Shall We then treat the ones who submit (themselves completely to the authority of Allâh) like the ungodly sinners?

36.Munir Mezyed: What is the matter with you? How do you judge?

37.Munir Mezyed: Or do you have a book in which you learn

38.Munir Mezyed: That you will indeed have whatever you choose?

39.Munir Mezyed: Or do you have covenants from Us on oath, extending to the day of Resurrection, that yours is surely whatever you judge?

40.Munir Mezyed: Ask them which of them will vouch for that,

41.Munir Mezyed: Or do they have partners? Then let them bring their partners if they are truthful.

42.Munir Mezyed: The day will come when there will be a severe affliction. They will be ordered to prostrate themselves, but they will be unable to do so.

43.Munir Mezyed: Their eyes will be cast down, and humiliation will cover them. They used to be called to prostrate themselves while they were yet unhurt.

44.Munir Mezyed: Thus, leave Me alone with him who refuse this pronouncement. We will progressively lead them into their own destruction from whence they know not.

45.Munir Mezyed: I will give them respite. My plan is firmly established.

46.Munir Mezyed: Or do you ask them to give you a reward for (your efforts to guide them) while they are heavily burdened with debt?

47.Munir Mezyed: Or do they have (the knowledge of) the unseen, so they write (it) down?

48.Munir Mezyed: So wait with patience for the verdict of your lord and be not like the companion of the whale, (‘Jonah’), who cried out in despair.

49.Munir Mezyed: Had not been a grace from his Lord reached him, he would certainly have been cast into the open land as a sinner.

50.Munir Mezyed: But his Lord chose him and made him among the righteous.

51.Munir Mezyed: Those who excessively indulge in disbelief (in Allâh) would almost smite you with their eyes when they hear the 'Revealer of Truth', (this Qur'an). Then they say: “Indeed, he is lunatic."

52.Munir Mezyed: But it is nothing else than a 'Revealer of Truth' to all the worlds.

1.Munir Mezyed: The ‘Inevitable Reality’!

2.Munir Mezyed: What is The ‘Inevitable Reality’?

3.Munir Mezyed: What would make you aware of what the ‘Inevitable Reality’ might be?

4.Munir Mezyed: (The people of) ‘Thamūd’ and ‘A'ad’ refused to admit the truth of the calamity (i.e. the ‘last Judgment’).

5.Munir Mezyed: As for ‘Thamūd’, its inhabitants were destroyed by loud and dreadful cry.

6.Munir Mezyed: As for ‘A'ad’, its inhabitants were destroyed by furious howling wind,

7.Munir Mezyed: Which Allâh unleashed it upon them for seven nights and eight days continuously. Thus, you could see the people lying dead as if they were hollow trunks of date-palms!,

8.Munir Mezyed: Can you see any remnants of them?

9.Munir Mezyed: There came ‘Pharaoh’, and those who lived before him, and the overthrown cities, (all of them) kept on sinning.

10.Munir Mezyed: They refused to obey the ‘Messengers’ of their Lord, therefore He chastised them with a fierce punishment.

11.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, when the flood rose so high, We carried you in the floating (ship)

12.Munir Mezyed: So that We might make it a remembrance for you, and that the attentive ears might (hear and) understand it.

13.Munir Mezyed: Then when the Trumpet will be blown with one blast,

14.Munir Mezyed: The earth and the mountains will be lifted up and crushed with a single crushing.

15.Munir Mezyed: On that day, the ‘Inevitable Event’ will come to pass.

16.Munir Mezyed: The heavens will split asunder and become frail on that day

17.Munir Mezyed: While the ‘Angels’ will be on its sides. Eight of them, on that day, will carry the (Glorious) Throne of your Lord above all the creatures.

18.Munir Mezyed: On that day, you will be exposed, no secret of yours will remain hidden.

19.Munir Mezyed: Then as for him who is given his record book in his right hand, will say: "Come read my book of deeds.

20.Munir Mezyed: Surely I knew that I would meet my account.”

21.Munir Mezyed: Thus, he will be in a delightful life,

22.Munir Mezyed: In a lofty Garden,

24.Munir Mezyed: (They will be told): “Eat and drink pleasantly for what you put forth in the days past."

25.Munir Mezyed: However, as for him who is given his record book in his left hand, will say: "I wish that I had not been given my book of deeds,

26.Munir Mezyed: And that I had not known what my account was.

27.Munir Mezyed: I wish death had been the end.

28.Munir Mezyed: My wealth has not availed me.

29.Munir Mezyed: My authority has gone from me.”

30.Munir Mezyed: Seize him, then shackle him,

31.Munir Mezyed: Then throw him into the burning Fire,

32.Munir Mezyed: And then tie him up with a chain whereof the length is seventy cubits.

33.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, he refused to accept Allâh, the Most Great, (into his life)

34.Munir Mezyed: He urged not on the feeding of the poor.

35.Munir Mezyed: Thus, this day, he will have no true friend here

36.Munir Mezyed: Neither any food (to eat) but pus.

37.Munir Mezyed: Which no one eats it but the ungodly sinners.

38.Munir Mezyed: But nay! I swear by all that you see

39.Munir Mezyed: And all that you do not see

40.Munir Mezyed: That this is indeed the utterance of an honorable messenger (Archangel ‘Gabriel’)

41.Munir Mezyed: It is not the utterance of a poet, little is that you believe;

42.Munir Mezyed: Neither is it the utterance of sage, little is that you remember.

43.Munir Mezyed: It is a Revelation from the Lord of all the worlds.

44.Munir Mezyed: If he, (‘Mohammed’), had invented false sayings about Us,

45.Munir Mezyed: We would definitely have taken him by the right hand,

46.Munir Mezyed: Then cut off his aorta.

47.Munir Mezyed: No one of you would be able to prevent Us from punishing him.

48.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, (this ‘Qur’ān’) is a 'Revealer of Truth' for the Pious.

49.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We know well that some of you would disbelieve.

50.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, (this Glorious ‘Qur’ān’) will be a misery for those who lack Faith in Allâh.

51.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, it is the ‘Absolute Truth’.

52.Munir Mezyed: Thus, glorify the Name of your Lord, the Most Great.

1.Munir Mezyed: A questioner asked concerning an imminent chastisement

2.Munir Mezyed: For those who lack faith in Allâh, which none can avert,

3.Munir Mezyed: From Allâh, the Lord of the Ascending Stairways.

4.Munir Mezyed: The ‘Angels’ and the Spirit (Archangel ‘Gabriel’) ascend to Him in a day whereof the measure of which is fifty thousand years.

5.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, resort to patience and constancy, (O' Muhammad), with an amiable patience.

6.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, they see that (‘Day’) as a far-off (event).
