7.Munir Mezyed: While We see it very near.

8.Munir Mezyed: The day will come when the heavens become like molten copper

9.Munir Mezyed: And the mountains like flakes of wool.

10.Munir Mezyed: And no friend would care about his close friend

11.Munir Mezyed: Though they are made to see each other. The ungodly sinner wishes he would be able to ransom himself from the chastisement of that day by (sacrificing) his children,

12.Munir Mezyed: His wife, his brother,

13.Munir Mezyed: And his kinsfolk who sheltered him,

14.Munir Mezyed: Even all the people on earth, if that would save him.

15.Munir Mezyed: But nay! Indeed, it is a Flaming Fire,

16.Munir Mezyed: Extremely eager for burning.

17.Munir Mezyed: It will claim the one who takes in his self-deceived beliefs for the epistemic,

18.Munir Mezyed: Hoarded wealth and withheld it.

19.Munir Mezyed: Verily, man was created restless,

20.Munir Mezyed: Extremely anxious when he is touched by evil,

21.Munir Mezyed: Niggardly when he is touched by richness;

22.Munir Mezyed: Except for those who pray (to Allâh),

23.Munir Mezyed: And who are persistent in performing their prayer,

24.Munir Mezyed: And in whose wealth, there is a known right

25.Munir Mezyed: For the beggar and the needy,

26.Munir Mezyed: And those who acknowledge (the existence of) the ‘Day of Judgment’,

27.Munir Mezyed: And t

28.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, the chastisement of their Lord is a thing not to be ignored-

29.Munir Mezyed: And those who guard their chastity,

30.Munir Mezyed: Except from their wives and those whom their right hands possess, in such a case they are not blameworthy,

31.Munir Mezyed: But whoever goes beyond this is a transgressor;

32.Munir Mezyed: And those who are faithful to their trusts and their covenant,

33.Munir Mezyed: Those who act uprightly in their testimonies,

34.Munir Mezyed: And those who always maintain their prayer.

35.Munir Mezyed: These will settle in Gardens, honored.

36.Munir Mezyed: But what is the matter with those who lack faith in Allâh that they rush madly before you

37.Munir Mezyed: From the right and from the left, in crowds?

38.Munir Mezyed: Does every one of them hope to enter the Paradise of Bliss?

39.Munir Mezyed: Nay, indeed, We have created them out of what they know.

40.Munir Mezyed: But nay! I swear by the Lord of the eastern and western regions that We are certainly able

41.Munir Mezyed: To replace them by others better than them. We are not to be outrun.

42.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, leave them alone to converse vainly and amuse themselves until they meet their day which they are promised.

43.Munir Mezyed: The day will come when they come out of the graves in haste as though they were racing to a goal

44.Munir Mezyed: With their eyes lowered in fear and humility, while humiliation covering them. Such is the day which they are promised.

1.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We sent ‘Noah’ (as Our ‘Messenger’) to his people, (saying): "Warn your people before there comes to them a painful doom."

2.Munir Mezyed: He said: "O’ my people, indeed, I am just a perspicuous warner to you

3.Munir Mezyed: That you should worship (& venerate) Allâh Alone, act piously towards Him and follow me.

4.Munir Mezyed: He will redeem you from your sins and respite you to an appointed term. Indeed, the Term of Allâh, when it comes, cannot postponed, if you but know."

5.Munir Mezyed: He said: "O’ my Lord, I have been inviting my people (to embrace the true Monotheistic Faith) night and day,

6.Munir Mezyed: But all my invitations have made them more determined to take in their self-deceived beliefs for the epistemic.

7.Munir Mezyed: Whenever I invite them (to embrace the true monotheistic faith), so that You may forgive them. They thrust their fingers in their ears, covering themselves with their garments, persisting (in ignoring my preaching), and displaying an arrogant attitude (towards Faith) with excessive pride.

8.Munir Mezyed: Then surely I invited them (to embrace the true Monotheistic Faith) openly,

9.Munir Mezyed: Then surely I proclaimed to them in public and spoke to them in private.

10.Munir Mezyed: I said: “Ask forgiveness from your Lord. Indeed, He is Oft-Forgiving.

11.Munir Mezyed: He will send down upon you, from the sky, an abundance of rain .

12.Munir Mezyed: He will give you increase in wealth and children, providing for you gardens and rivers.

13.Munir Mezyed: What is the matter with you that you hope not for grandeur from Allâh?”

14.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, He has created you in several stages.

15.Munir Mezyed: Have you not seen that Allâh has created the seven heavens one above the other,

16.Munir Mezyed: And placed the moon therein as a light, and the sun as a lamp?

17.Munir Mezyed: Allâh caused you to grow out of the earth like plants,

18.Munir Mezyed: And in the end He will return you into it, and raise you forth (again at the ‘Resurrection Day’).

19.Munir Mezyed: Allâh has made the earth a wide expanse for you

20.Munir Mezyed: So that you may go along therein in wide paths.

21.Munir Mezyed: ‘Noah’ said: "My Lord, they refused to obey me, and followed the one whose wealth and children have increased him in naught but perdition.

22.Munir Mezyed: And they have devised a mighty plot.”

23.Munir Mezyed: They said: “Forsake not your gods! Forsake neither ‘Wadd’, nor ‘Suwā‘', and neither  ‘ Yaghūth’,  nor  ‘Ya'ooq ‘ nor  ‘Nisr!’”

24.Munir Mezyed: And they have certainly led many astray. (‘Noah’ supplicated saying): "My Lord, cause those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong to be greatly deceived.

25.Munir Mezyed: As a consequence of their sins, they were drowned, then admitted into the Fire. They could not find any helpers besides ‘Allâh’.

26.Munir Mezyed: ‘Noah’ said: "My Lord, leave not a single dweller on the earth, who lacks Faith in Allâh.

27.Munir Mezyed: Indeed if You spare any of them, they will mislead Your worshipers and will beget only wicked and impious (children).

28.Munir Mezyed: My Lord, forgive me, and my parents, and whoever enters my house as a monotheistic believer, and all the Monotheistic Believers, men and women, and increase not those who are grossly unfair and morally wrong in aught, except  perdition.

1.Munir Mezyed: Say, (O' Muhammad), "It has been revealed unto me that a group of the Jinn listened (attentively to the recitation of the ‘Qurʾān’). (When returning back to their fellow citizens), they said: “Indeed, we have heard an extraordinary recitation.”

2.Munir Mezyed: It leads into righteousness. Since we have believed in it, we shall never join in worship anyone or anything with our Lord, (the Lord of all the worlds).

3.Munir Mezyed: Verily, Exalted is the Majesty of our Lord. He has not taken a wife or a son for himself.

4.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, the imprudent one (-Iblis-), among us has been speaking blasphemous words against Allâh.

5.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, we thought that mankind and Jinn would never speak words of blasphemy against Allâh.

6.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, there were men from mankind who used to seek refuge with certain individuals of the jinn. Thus, those individuals of the jinn increased them in perplexity.

7.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, those who lack faith in Allâh among mankind thought, as we thought, that Allâh would never send any ‘Messenger’.

8.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, we touched the heavens. Thus, we found it filled with vigorous guards and meteors.

9.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, we used to sit in some of its seats and try to listen, but whoever tries to listen will find a meteor lying in wait form him.

10.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, we know not whether evil is prescribed for those who are living on the earth, or whether their Lord intends to lead them into the right path.

11.Munir Mezyed: As for us, some of us are righteous while others are not. Indeed, we are denominations, following different ways.

12.Munir Mezyed: We have come to know with certainty that we could never frustrate the power of Allâh on the earth, neither could we frustrate His power by flight.

13.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, after hearing the divine guidance, (-this ‘Qurʾān’ -), we believed in it. Thus, whoever believes in his Lord should not fear deprivation or injustice.

14.Munir Mezyed: As for us, some of us have submitted (themselves entirely to the authority of Allâh), while others have deviated from the Truth. Whoever submits (himself entirely to the authority of Allâh), they are the ones who have sought rectitude.

15.Munir Mezyed: However, as for the ones who deviated (from the Truth) will be the firewood for ‘Gehenna’.

16.Munir Mezyed: If they, (- the Pagan Arabs-), had followed the right path, We would certainly have given to them abundant water to drink,

17.Munir Mezyed: So that We may tempt them with it. But if it happens that anyone turns away from celebrating the praises of his Lord and declaring His divine glory, He will cause him to be subjected to a severe chastisement.

18.Munir Mezyed: Mosques are meant only for Allâh. Thus, do not implore or pray to anyone along with Allâh.

19.Munir Mezyed: Yet when the Obedient Devotee of Allâh, (‘Muhammad’), stood up imploring and praying to Allâh, they, (the Jinn who heard the recitation of the ‘Qurʾān’), crowded closely together around him.

20.Munir Mezyed: Say: "Indeed, I only implore and pray to my Lord, not associating anyone or anything with Him.”

21.Munir Mezyed: Say: "Surely, I have no power to harm you or to make you attain righteousness.

22.Munir Mezyed: Say:  "Indeed, no one can protect me against the (will of) Allâh, neither can I find, apart from Him, any place of refuge.

23.Munir Mezyed: (It is incumbent on me) to convey (& promulgate) the Message of Allâh. Whoever disobeys Allâh and His ‘Messenger’, then surely, for him is the fire of ‘Hell’. He will abide therein.

24.Munir Mezyed: (They will continue in their disbelief) until the day when they will see that which they have been threatened with, then they will find out who is really weaker in power, and fewer in number.

25.Munir Mezyed: Say: "I know not whether that which you have been threatened with is near, or if my Lord will appoint for it a distant term.”

26.Munir Mezyed: Lo! Allâh is the Knowing of the Unseen. He reveals not His Knowledge of the Unseen to anyone.

27.Munir Mezyed: Except a messenger whom He chooses. Indeed, He places a guard to go before and after him,

28.Munir Mezyed: That he may know that they had truly delivered the messages of their Lord, and that He encompasses that which is with them and records the number of everything.”

73.SurahEnglishNames: The Enshrouded One, Bundled Up, The Mantled One

1.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who wrap himself in garments!

2.Munir Mezyed: Stand (to pray) all night, except for a little.

3.Munir Mezyed: Half of it, or lessen it a little,

4.Munir Mezyed: Or add to it, and recite the ‘Qurʾān’ with measured rhythmic recitation.

5.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We will cast upon you a heavy speech.

6.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, getting up at night for payer is the most potent for purifying (the heart), and the most effective in speech.

7.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, you have, during the day, prolonged occupation.

8.Munir Mezyed: Glorify the (Majestic) Name of your Lord, and devote yourself to Him with a complete devotion.

9.Munir Mezyed: He is the Lord of the east and the west. There is no God but He. Thus, take Him as your Guardian.

10.Munir Mezyed: Resort to patience and constancy, (O' Muhammad), in whatever they say and find a polite way to avoid them.

11.Munir Mezyed: Let Me deal with the possessor of the hoarded (wealth), who refuse to admit the truth of Allah’s Oneness, and give them respite for a little while.

12.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We have prepared for them shackles and blazing fire,

13.Munir Mezyed: As well as bitter foods and painful punishment.

14.Munir Mezyed: There will come a day when the earth and the mountains will quake. And the mountains will turn into flowing sand dunes.

15.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We have sent to you a ‘Messenger’, a witness against you, as We sent a ‘Messenger’ to ‘Pharaoh’.

16.Munir Mezyed: As ‘Pharaoh’ refused to follow the ‘Messenger’, We seized him with stern punishment.

17.Munir Mezyed: Then how, if you refuse to accept Allâh into your life, can you protect yourselves against a day so terrifying that will make the children grey-haired.

18.Munir Mezyed: On that day, the heaven will be rent asunder. His promise is bound to be fulfilled.

19.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, this is an admonition, therefore whoever wills, then let him take a way to his Lord.

20.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, your Lord, (O' ‘Muhammad’), knows perfectly well that you stand forth (to prayer) sometimes nearly two-thirds of the night, or half of it or a third of it, and so does a party of those who are with you. Allah measures the night and the day. He knows perfectly well that you, (‘Monotheistic Believers’), will not be able to pray all night, and so He has turned unto you in forgiveness. Recite, then, of the ‘Qurʾān’ as much as may be easy for you. He knows perfectly well that there will be among you sick, others travelling throughout the land, seeking the Bounty of Allâh; yet others fighting for (serving) the cause of Allâh. Recite, then, of the ‘Qurʾān’ as much as may be easy for you, establish the regular Prayer, pay Zakāt (i.e. the Prescribed Purifying Alms), and give virtuous loans to Allâh. Whatever good thing you put forward for yourselves, you will find it with Allâh, better and greater in the reward. Thus, seek forgiveness of Allâh. Indeed, Allâh is Oft-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

74.SurahEnglishNames: The Cloaked One, The Man Wearing a Cloak, The Clothed One

1.Munir Mezyed: O’ you who cover himself!

2.Munir Mezyed: Arise and warn!

3.Munir Mezyed: Your Lord, do glorify Him!

4.Munir Mezyed: Your clothes, do purify!

5.Munir Mezyed: All kinds of abomination, do shun!

6.Munir Mezyed: Confer not a favor so as to acquire more.

7.Munir Mezyed: For serving the cause of your Lord, do remain dutifully firm.

8.Munir Mezyed: When the Trumpet is blown,

9.Munir Mezyed: Then that day will be an arduous day,

10.Munir Mezyed: Far from easy for those who are inclined to disbelieve in Allâh.

11.Munir Mezyed: Leave Me (to deal) with the one whom I created alone,

12.Munir Mezyed: (Made him rich & powerful) by giving him an extensive wealth

13.Munir Mezyed: (And so many) children around him.

14.Munir Mezyed: I made his life to run smoothly and comfortably.

15.Munir Mezyed: Yet he desires that I should give more!

16.Munir Mezyed: Nay! For lo! he has been stubborn to accept the Truth of Our ‘Revelations’.

17.Munir Mezyed: I shall cause him to feel exhausted by an arduous climb.

18.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, He thought and then he estimated.

19.Munir Mezyed: Woe unto Him! How he estimated!

20.Munir Mezyed: Yea, Woe unto Him! How he estimated!

21.Munir Mezyed: Then he looked around,

22.Munir Mezyed: Then he frowned and scowled,

23.Munir Mezyed: Then he turned his back and displayed an arrogant attitude,

24.Munir Mezyed: Then he said: "This is nothing but mere magical incantation from the magic of the ancients.

25.Munir Mezyed: This is not more than a saying of human being."

26.Munir Mezyed: Soon I shall cast him into ‘Saqar ‘, ‘Hellfire’.

27.Munir Mezyed: What would make you aware of what ‘Saqar ‘ might be?

28.Munir Mezyed: It leaves nothing (untouched by the fire), nor spares any one!

29.Munir Mezyed: It scorches the skin.

30.Munir Mezyed: Over it, there are nineteen (‘Angels’ as its guards & keepers).

31.Munir Mezyed: We have not made the wardens of the Fire except ‘Angels’. We have not made their number except as a temptation for those who excessively indulge  in disbelief (in Allâh) , so that the people of the ‘Scripture’ (Jews & Christians) may come to know (that this ‘Qurʾān’ is absolutely the word of Allâh), and that the Faith of those who adhere to Islamic monotheism may be invigorated, and that both the people of the ‘Scripture’ and the ‘Monotheistic Believers’ may feel certain, and that those in whose hearts is a disease and those who lack Faith in Allâh would say: “What does Allâh mean by this parable?” This is how Allâh leads astray whom He wills, and illuminates the path of whom He wills. No one really knows the soldiers of your Lord but He. All this about (-Saqar-) is no other than a warning to the people.

32.Munir Mezyed: Nay, by the moon,

33.Munir Mezyed: by the night when it retreats,

34.Munir Mezyed: And by daybreak when it coruscates,

35.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, (‘Saqar ‘) is one of the greatest (tribulations),

36.Munir Mezyed: A warning to the people,

37.Munir Mezyed: To him among you who desires to go forward or to remain behind.

38.Munir Mezyed: Every ‘Human Self’ is held in pledge for what it earns

39.Munir Mezyed: Except for the ones on the right hand

40.Munir Mezyed: Who will be in Gardens, wondering

41.Munir Mezyed: About the ungodly sinners , (asking them):

42.Munir Mezyed: ”What has caused you to be thrown into “Saqar ‘?”

43.Munir Mezyed: They will say:  "We were not among those who used to pray,

44.Munir Mezyed: Neither did we use to feed the destitute.

45.Munir Mezyed: We used to indulge excessively into vain disputes with vain disputers.

46.Munir Mezyed: And we used to deny the ‘Day of Judgment’,

47.Munir Mezyed: Till the inevitable truth (death) overtook us.”

48.Munir Mezyed: Thus, the intercession of intercessors will not avail them.

49.Munir Mezyed: What ails them that they turn aside from the admonition

50.Munir Mezyed: As if they were frightened donkeys

51.Munir Mezyed: Fleeing from a lion?!

52.Munir Mezyed: Yes, every man among them desires that he may be given expanded scrolls.

53.Munir Mezyed: Nay, but they fear not the (outcomes of) ‘Hereafter’!

54.Munir Mezyed: Nay, indeed, this is an admonition.

55.Munir Mezyed: Whoever wills may pay attention to it.

56.Munir Mezyed: They will heed not unless Allâh wills it: He is the Lord of unfeigned piety and the Lord of Forgiveness.

75.SurahEnglishNames: The Rising of the Dead, Resurrection

1.Munir Mezyed: Nay, I swear by the ‘Day of Resurrection’!

2.Munir Mezyed: Nay! I swear by the reproachful- ‘Human Self’

3.Munir Mezyed: Does man think that We are incapable of constructing his bones?

4.Munir Mezyed: Yes indeed; We are capable of shaping again his own fingertips.

5.Munir Mezyed: But man desires to continue in sin.

6.Munir Mezyed: He asks: "When will be the ‘Day of Resurrection’?"

7.Munir Mezyed: When the vision will be dazzled,

8.Munir Mezyed: And the moon will be eclipsed,

9.Munir Mezyed: And the sun and the moon will be brought together,

10.Munir Mezyed: Man will say on that day: "Whither to flee?"

11.Munir Mezyed: Nay, there will be no refuge.

12.Munir Mezyed: Unto your Lord that day is the refuge.

13.Munir Mezyed: Man will be informed, on that day, of what He has sent forward, and of what he left behind.

14.Munir Mezyed: Nay, man is an intelligible evidence against himself,

15.Munir Mezyed: Even if he offers his excuses.

16.Munir Mezyed: (O' ‘Muhammad’), move not your tongue concerning (the ‘Qurʾān’) to make haste therewith.

17.Munir Mezyed: It is incumbent on Us to collect and to promulgate it.

18.Munir Mezyed: When We recite it, follow its recitation attentively.

19.Munir Mezyed: Afterwards, It will be incumbent on Us to explain it to you.

20.Munir Mezyed: Nay, indeed, but you are in love with this transient life,

22.Munir Mezyed: Faces on that day will be glowing brightly,

23.Munir Mezyed: Looking steadily and intently on their Lord!

24.Munir Mezyed: Faces on that day will be gloomy,

25.Munir Mezyed: Thinking that a crushing calamity is about to fall on them.

26.Munir Mezyed: Nay, but when the soul comes up into the throat,

27.Munir Mezyed: There will be a cry: “ Where is the enchanter who can save him”.

28.Munir Mezyed: Then man will come to know that it is time to leave.

29.Munir Mezyed: Leg is intertwined with (other) leg.

30.Munir Mezyed: Unto your Lord on that day will be the driving (of the souls) .

31.Munir Mezyed: Neither did he acknowledge (the Truth), nor did he pray.

32.Munir Mezyed: But in fact, he gave no credence to (the ‘Qur’ān’), and took no heed.

33.Munir Mezyed: Then he went to his family, walking with a haughty look.

34.Munir Mezyed: Woe unto you and woe unto you!

35.Munir Mezyed: Again woe unto you and woe unto you!

36.Munir Mezyed: Does man think that he will be left without purpose?

37.Munir Mezyed: Was he not a semen-drop, which was emitted?

38.Munir Mezyed: Afterwards he became a clinging substance; and Allâh formed and molded him,

39.Munir Mezyed: And made of him pairs, male and female.

40.Munir Mezyed: Is not He then capable of bringing the dead back to life?.

1.Munir Mezyed: Has there come on man a period of time when he was not a thing even to be mentioned?

2.Munir Mezyed: We create man from a semen-drop mixture, so as to test him. Thus, We bestowed upon him hearing and seeing.

3.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We showed him the way, whether he will be grateful or not.

4.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We have prepared for those who lack Faith in Allâh chains, shackles and blazing fire.

5.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, the ‘Pure in Heart’ will drink of a cup whereof the mixture is of ‘Kafur’.

6.Munir Mezyed: A fountain where the devotees of Allâh will drink. They will cause it to gush forth abundantly.

7.Munir Mezyed: They fulfill their vows and fear a day whose evil is widely spread

8.Munir Mezyed: And give food, in spite of their needs for it, to a needy person or to an orphan or to a captive,

9.Munir Mezyed: (Saying): “We do feed you only for the countenance of Allâh, not desiring any reward or thanks from your behalf.

10.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, we fear from our Lord a day which is harsh and distressful."

11.Munir Mezyed: Thus, Allâh will protect them from the evil of that day, giving them vivacity and joy,

12.Munir Mezyed: Rewarding them for what they patiently endured, a garden and silk.

13.Munir Mezyed: They will recline therein on couches; and they will feel neither excessive heat nor freezing cold.

14.Munir Mezyed: Its shades will be closely spread upon them while its fruits will be near and easy to be reached.

15.Munir Mezyed: There will be made to pass around them, silver dishes and cups of crystal,

16.Munir Mezyed: Transparent cups made of silver which they will determine the exact measure of drink.

17.Munir Mezyed: They will be given to drink therein a cup whose mixture is ginger

18.Munir Mezyed: From a fountain whose name is called ‘Salsabīl’.

19.Munir Mezyed: They will be served by immortal youths. If you see them, you will think they are scattered pearls.

20.Munir Mezyed: If you look there (in ‘Al- Jannah’), you will see bliss and great dominion.

21.Munir Mezyed: Upon them will be green garments of fine silk and brocade, while they will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will satisfy their thirst with a pure drink.

22.Munir Mezyed: (It will be said unto them): "Indeed, this is a reward for you, and your struggle has been appreciated."

23.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, it is We who have sent down to you, (O' ‘Muhammad’), the ‘Qurʾān’ progressively.

24.Munir Mezyed: Thus, be patient towards the command of your Lord, do not pay attention to any of them, who is a wilful sinner or an impious;

25.Munir Mezyed: And celebrate the (Glorious) Names of your Lord night and day

26.Munir Mezyed: While during the night, prostrate yourself to Him and glorify Him all night long.

27.Munir Mezyed: Absolutely, those who lack Faith in Allâh are in love with this worldly life, leaving behind them a heavy day.

28.Munir Mezyed: It is We Who created them and strengthened their forms, but if We will, We can replace them completely with others like them.

29.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, this is an admonition, therefore, whoever wills; let him take a path to his Lord.

30.Munir Mezyed: Yet you will not (able to do what you intend to do), unless Allâh wills. Indeed, Allâh is ever All-knowing, All-wise.

31.Munir Mezyed: He admits whom He wills into His (divine) Mercy. But the ones who are grossly unfair and morally wrong: He prepared for them a painful punishment.

1.Munir Mezyed: By the emissary winds which are sent forth one after another,

2.Munir Mezyed: And the winds that blow violently,

3.Munir Mezyed: By the winds that scatter far and wide,

4.Munir Mezyed: By the decisive distinguishers, (i.e the ‘Verses’ of the ‘Qur’ān’), that separate (truth from falsehood by the) Criterion,

5.Munir Mezyed: By those (‘Angels’) who bring down the ‘Revelations’

6.Munir Mezyed: To verify or to warn.

7.Munir Mezyed: What you are promised is definitely about to occur!

8.Munir Mezyed: When the stars are obliterated,

9.Munir Mezyed: The sky is rent asunder,

10.Munir Mezyed: And the mountains are blown away,

11.Munir Mezyed: The ‘Messengers’ (of Allâh) are gathered to their appointed time.

12.Munir Mezyed: For what day are (these Portents) postponed?

13.Munir Mezyed: For the ‘Final Judgment’.

14.Munir Mezyed: What would make you aware of what the ‘Final Judgment’ might be?

15.Munir Mezyed: Woe unto those who refuse to admit (the truth) of that day!

16.Munir Mezyed: Did We not put an end to the existence of the ancients (because of their evil deeds)?

17.Munir Mezyed: Then We let them be followed by later generations.

18.Munir Mezyed: Consequently, this is how We deal with the ungodly sinners.

19.Munir Mezyed: Woe unto the ones who refuse to admit the truth of that day!

20.Munir Mezyed: Did We not create you from despicable water?

21.Munir Mezyed: Then We placed it in a safe abode (i.e. womb)

22.Munir Mezyed: Till an appointed time.

23.Munir Mezyed: Thus, We measured, and We are the Best of all who are capable of measuring.

24.Munir Mezyed: Woe unto the ones who refuse to admit the truth of that day!

25.Munir Mezyed: Have We not made the earth a receptacle

26.Munir Mezyed: For the living and the dead,

27.Munir Mezyed: And placed therein high mountains and given you to drink sweet fresh water therein?

28.Munir Mezyed: Woe unto the ones who refuse to admit the truth of that day!

29.Munir Mezyed: Thus, (it will be said unto them): “Go forth to that doom because of that which you used to deny.

30.Munir Mezyed: Go forth to a triple-massing shadow,

31.Munir Mezyed: Which neither can shade, nor can avail against the Blazing Flame.

32.Munir Mezyed: It throws sparks as huge as a palace

33.Munir Mezyed: As if they were dark yellow camels.”

34.Munir Mezyed: Woe unto the ones who refuse to admit the truth of that day!

35.Munir Mezyed: This is the day on which they will speak not,

36.Munir Mezyed: Neither will it be permitted for them to give excuses.

37.Munir Mezyed: Woe unto the ones who refuse to admit the truth of that day!

38.Munir Mezyed: This is the ‘Day of Judgment’. We will bring you and the ancients together.

39.Munir Mezyed: Therefore, if you have any evil plan, then devise it (if you can).

40.Munir Mezyed: Woe unto  the ones who refuse to admit the truth of that day.

41.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, the ‘Pious’ will dwell amid shades and fountains,

42.Munir Mezyed: And fruits from whatever they desire.

43.Munir Mezyed: (They will be told): "Eat and drink blissfully because of the good deeds which you used to do!”

44.Munir Mezyed: This is how We reward those who pursue righteousness

45.Munir Mezyed: Woe unto the ones who refuse to admit the truth of that day!

46.Munir Mezyed: (O’ you who lack Faith in Allâh), eat and enjoy yourselves for a while! Indeed, you are ungodly sinners.

47.Munir Mezyed: Woe unto the ones who refuse to admit the truth of that day!

48.Munir Mezyed: When it is said to them: ”Bow in prayer!", But  they refuse to bow!

49.Munir Mezyed: Woe unto the ones who refuse to admit the truth of that day!

50.Munir Mezyed: In what statement, other than this (Glorious ‘Qur’an’), will they accept (Allâh Almighty into their life)?

1.Munir Mezyed: About what do they ask one another?

2.Munir Mezyed: About the great news

3.Munir Mezyed: That they differ over it.

4.Munir Mezyed: Nay! They will come to know.

5.Munir Mezyed: Nay again! They will come to know.

6.Munir Mezyed: Have We not made the earth (as) a cradle

7.Munir Mezyed: And the mountains (as) stakes?

8.Munir Mezyed: Have We not created you in pairs

9.Munir Mezyed: Appointed your sleep for a rest,

10.Munir Mezyed: Made the night as raiment

11.Munir Mezyed: And the day as the means of livelihood?

12.Munir Mezyed: Have we not built above you seven strong firmaments,

13.Munir Mezyed: Made therein a blazing lamp,

14.Munir Mezyed: And sent down, from the rain clouds, abundant water

15.Munir Mezyed: In order to bring forth thereby grain and herbs,

16.Munir Mezyed: And gardens of thick foliage?

17.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, the decisive day, (-the ‘Day of Judgment’ -), is an appointed time.

18.Munir Mezyed: It is the day when the Trumpet is blown. Thus, you will come forth in multitudes.

19.Munir Mezyed: The sky will be opened, becoming gateways,

20.Munir Mezyed: And the mountains will be removed, becoming a mirage.

21.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, ‘Gehenna’ is a place of ambush

22.Munir Mezyed: For the transgressors: it is a place for return

23.Munir Mezyed: To abide therein for ages.

24.Munir Mezyed: They will taste therein neither coolness nor any drink.

25.Munir Mezyed: But scalding water and purulence

26.Munir Mezyed: As suitable requital for their deeds.

27.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, they hoped there would be no ‘Reckoning Day’,

28.Munir Mezyed: And (falsely) claimed that Our ‘Revelations’ were a big lie.

29.Munir Mezyed: Yet We have recorded everything as a book.

30.Munir Mezyed: Consequently, taste (the painful punishment)! We are not going to increase you except in punishment!.

31.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, for the ‘Pious’, there will be a big reward,

32.Munir Mezyed: Gardens and vineyards,

33.Munir Mezyed: Charming maidens of equal age,

34.Munir Mezyed: And overflowing cup.

35.Munir Mezyed: They will hear therein no evil vain talks or lies.

36.Munir Mezyed: A reward from your Lord - a generous gift in payment –

37.Munir Mezyed: The Lord of the heavens and of the earth, and whatsoever is in between them, the Most Beneficent God. No one can have direct dialogue with Him

38.Munir Mezyed: On the day when the Spirit, (Archangel ‘Gabriel’), and the ‘Angels’ will stand in rows. They speak not except for the one whom the Most Beneficent God allows him as he will speak the right thing.

39.Munir Mezyed: That is the True Day. Therefore, whoever wills can take a safe return to his Lord!

40.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, We have warned you of a near punishment on a day when man will behold what his hands have put forth, and the ‘impious’ one will say: "Oh, I wish I were dust!"

79.SurahEnglishNames: Those Who Drag Forth, Soul-snatchers, Those Who Pulled Out

1.Munir Mezyed: By those (angels) who drag out (the soul of the impious) violently!

2.Munir Mezyed: By those (angels) who draw out (the soul of the monotheist ) smoothly!

3.Munir Mezyed: By those (angels) who slide down (as if they were) swimming!

4.Munir Mezyed: Then by those who race each other (as if they were in) a race.

5.Munir Mezyed: And then by those (angels) who carry out the Command of Allâh.

6.Munir Mezyed: On a day when the trembling thing (-the earth-) will quake (when the first blowing of the Trumpet is blown).

7.Munir Mezyed: Then followed by the second one.

8.Munir Mezyed: The hearts (of the people), on that day, will palpitate with fear

9.Munir Mezyed: While their eyes are downcast.

10.Munir Mezyed: They say: “What! Will we indeed be brought back to our former state

11.Munir Mezyed: Even if we became decayed bones?’

12.Munir Mezyed: They say: "It would be, in that case,  a losing return!"

13.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, it is only one whistle.

14.Munir Mezyed: Then suddenly they are awakened.

15.Munir Mezyed: Has there come to you the  anecdote of ‘Moses’?

16.Munir Mezyed: When his Lord  called upon him in the ‘Scared Valley’, ‘Towa’:

17.Munir Mezyed: (Saying),"Go to “Pharaoh”. Indeed, he has become tyrant.

18.Munir Mezyed: Say unto him: “ Would you like to purify yourself,

19.Munir Mezyed: And that I should guide you to your Lord, so that you may show honor and reverence for (him)?'“

20.Munir Mezyed: ‘Moses’ showed him the greatest sign ( of God’s power & glory).

21.Munir Mezyed: Thus, he belied and refused to yield to the truth.

22.Munir Mezyed: Then turned he away in haste,

23.Munir Mezyed: Then gathered he (the people) and cried aloud,

24.Munir Mezyed: And he proclaimed: “I am your Lord, the Most High."

25.Munir Mezyed: So Allâh seized him with the chastisement of the hereafter and the former life.

26.Munir Mezyed: Indeed in that is a lesson for whoever would show honor and reverence for Allâh.

27.Munir Mezyed: What! Are you more troublesome to create or the sky (above)? (Allâh) has constructed it.

28.Munir Mezyed: He raised the height thereof and proportioned it.

29.Munir Mezyed: He has made its nights dark and extracted its luminosity.

30.Munir Mezyed: And after that He spread the earth.

31.Munir Mezyed: He brought forth from it its water and its pasture,

32.Munir Mezyed: And the mountains He set firm,

33.Munir Mezyed: As provision for you and your cattle.

34.Munir Mezyed: Thus, when the Great Catastrophe comes,

35.Munir Mezyed: Man will remember, on that day, what he used to strive for.

36.Munir Mezyed: ‘Gehenna’ will be made manifest to the one who sees,

37.Munir Mezyed: So as for the one who transgressed,

38.Munir Mezyed: And preferred this worldly life,

39.Munir Mezyed: ‘Gehenna’ will definitely be (his) eternal home.

40.Munir Mezyed: (On the other hand), who shows honor and reverence for the divine glory of his Lord, and guards himself against self-deception-

41.Munir Mezyed: ‘Al-Jannah’ will definitely be (his) eternal home.

42.Munir Mezyed: They ask you, (O' Muhammad), about the ‘Hour’ ( of Reckoning): “when will it happen?”

43.Munir Mezyed: How could you know about it?

44.Munir Mezyed: Unto your Lord belongs the ultimate knowledge of it.

45.Munir Mezyed: You are not more than a ‘warner’ to the one who would like to avoid its awful consequences.

46.Munir Mezyed: On the day when it is made manifest to them, it will be as if they had but tarried for an evening or the morn.

1.Munir Mezyed: He (-Muhammad-) frowned and turned away

2.Munir Mezyed: As there came to him the blind man, (interrupting).

3.Munir Mezyed: How would you know? Probably he came you in order to be purified,

4.Munir Mezyed: Or to receive admonition that might benefit him.

5.Munir Mezyed: But the one who considers himself free from need,

6.Munir Mezyed: You gave him too much attention.

7.Munir Mezyed: Yet it is not your concern if he will not be purified.

8.Munir Mezyed: But, as for the one who came to you, seeking for spiritual insight,

9.Munir Mezyed: Being afraid (of the consequences of his disbelief),

10.Munir Mezyed: You ignored him.

11.Munir Mezyed: Nay! It is indeed an admonishment.

12.Munir Mezyed: Consequently, whoever wills will pay attention to it.

13.Munir Mezyed: It is (mentioned) in Honorable Books,

14.Munir Mezyed: Exalted and purified,

15.Munir Mezyed: In the hands of scribes (the angels),

16.Munir Mezyed: Noble and obedient.

17.Munir Mezyed: Man seeks his own destruction. How ‘impious’ he is!

18.Munir Mezyed: Of what substance did He create him?

19.Munir Mezyed: Of a sperm-drop, He created him. Then He proportioned him.

20.Munir Mezyed: Then He made the path easy for him.

21.Munir Mezyed: Then He caused him to die and made a tomb for him.

22.Munir Mezyed: Consequently, when He wills, He will bring him again to life.

23.Munir Mezyed: Nay! Man has not fulfilled what Allâh has commanded him.

24.Munir Mezyed: Let man look at his food!

25.Munir Mezyed: We poured down water in abundance,

26.Munir Mezyed: And then We split the earth in rifts,

27.Munir Mezyed: Consequently, We caused to grow therein grain,

28.Munir Mezyed: Grapes and green fodder,

29.Munir Mezyed: Olive and date-palms,

30.Munir Mezyed: Gardens of thick foliage,

31.Munir Mezyed: Fruits and grass,

32.Munir Mezyed: A provision for you and your cattle.

33.Munir Mezyed: But when the ‘Deafening Blast’ comes to pass,

34.Munir Mezyed: On the day when a man runs away from his brother,

35.Munir Mezyed: From his mother and his father,

36.Munir Mezyed: From his wife and his children,

37.Munir Mezyed: Since each one of them, that ‘day’, will have enough trouble of his own, which makes him careless of others.

38.Munir Mezyed: Some faces, on that ‘day’, will be so bright,

39.Munir Mezyed: Laughing and rejoicing and over the joyful news

40.Munir Mezyed: While the other faces, on that ‘Day’, will have dust upon them

41.Munir Mezyed: Being completely darkened by dust.

42.Munir Mezyed: Those are the ‘impious’ flagrantly wicked

1.Munir Mezyed: When the sun is darkened,

2.Munir Mezyed: When the stars are caused to fall, losing their luster,

3.Munir Mezyed: When the mountains are moved away,

4.Munir Mezyed: When the pregnant camels are left without care,

5.Munir Mezyed: When the wild beasts are gathered in one place,

6.Munir Mezyed: When the seas are set on fire, starting to boil,

7.Munir Mezyed: When all human beings are paired,

8.Munir Mezyed: When the infant female who was buried alive be asked

9.Munir Mezyed: For what sin she was slain,

10.Munir Mezyed: When the scrolls are laid open,

11.Munir Mezyed: When the sky is stripped away,

12.Munir Mezyed: When the Hellfire is put in flames,

13.Munir Mezyed: And when Al-Jannah is brought near,

14.Munir Mezyed: Then each Human Self will know what has brought (of good and evil).

15.Munir Mezyed: Nay! I swear by the planets

16.Munir Mezyed: As they run their course and hide,

17.Munir Mezyed: By the night when it departs

18.Munir Mezyed: And by the morning when it breathes

19.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, this ‘Qurʾān’ is the word (of God conveyed to ‘Mohammad’) through honorable ‘Messenger’ (‘Archangel Gabriel’),

20.Munir Mezyed: Endued with mighty power, and an honorable place with the Lord of the Throne,

21.Munir Mezyed: Obeyed (by the ‘Angels’) and trustworthy.

22.Munir Mezyed: Your companion, (‘Muhammad’), is not insane.

23.Munir Mezyed: He truly saw him, (‘Archangel Gabriel’), on the clear horizon.

24.Munir Mezyed: He is not niggardly of the Unseen.

25.Munir Mezyed: This ‘Qurʾān’ is not the word of outcast devil.

26.Munir Mezyed: Consequently, where will you go?

27.Munir Mezyed: It is not but a ‘Reminder’ ( or a Revealer of Truth)  to all the beings,

28.Munir Mezyed: For whoever wills among you to follow the right path (to salvation).

29.Munir Mezyed: You are unable to choose or do anything unless Allâh, the Lord of all the worlds, wills it to be so.

100.SurahEnglishNames: The Courser, The Chargers, The Assulters

1.Munir Mezyed: By the running horses while neighing,

2.Munir Mezyed: The producers of sparks,

3.Munir Mezyed: The raiders at dawn.

4.Munir Mezyed: While stirring up waves of dust in it,

5.Munir Mezyed: They penetrate in the center collectively.

6.Munir Mezyed: Indeed man, towards his Lord, is impious.

7.Munir Mezyed: Indeed he is a witness to that.

8.Munir Mezyed: Indeed he is intensely in love with wealth.

9.Munir Mezyed: Does he not know that when that which is in the graves is scattered,

10.Munir Mezyed: And that which is in the hearts is exposed.

11.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, their Lord, on that day, is Fully Aware of them.

101.SurahEnglishNames: The Calamity, The Stunning Blow, The Disaster, The Terrible Calamity

1.Munir Mezyed: The ‘Calamity’!

2.Munir Mezyed: What is the ‘Calamity’?

3.Munir Mezyed: What would make you aware of what the ‘Calamity’ might be?

4.Munir Mezyed: It is the day when the people will be like scattered moths

5.Munir Mezyed: And the mountains like fluffed wool.

6.Munir Mezyed: As for the one whose deeds weigh heavy in the scales

7.Munir Mezyed: Will have pleasant living.

8.Munir Mezyed: But the one whose deeds weigh light in the scales,

9.Munir Mezyed: ‘Abyss’ will be his eternal home.

10.Munir Mezyed: What would make you aware of what ‘Abyss’ might be?

11.Munir Mezyed: It is Raging Fire!

102.SurahEnglishNames: Rivalry in World Increase, Competition, Worldly Gain

1.Munir Mezyed: the competition to increase diverts you away (from serving your Lord)

2.Munir Mezyed: Until you visit the graveyards.

3.Munir Mezyed: Nay! You are going to know.

4.Munir Mezyed: Then nay! You are going to know.

5.Munir Mezyed: Nay! If only you knew with absolute certainty!

6.Munir Mezyed: You will definitely see the Hellfire.

7.Munir Mezyed: Then you will definitely see the Hellfire with the ‘Eye of Certainty’

8.Munir Mezyed: Then, on that day, you will surely be questioned about the (eternal) bliss.

103.SurahEnglishNames: The Declining Day, Eventide, The Epoch, Time

1.Munir Mezyed: By the time!

2.Munir Mezyed: Verily! Man is keen to pursue perdition,

3.Munir Mezyed: Except for those who adhere to Islamic monotheism and do righteous acts (in this ‘worldly life’), exhorting each other to ‘truth’, and exhorting each other to ‘patience’.

104.SurahEnglishNames: The Traducer, The Gossipmonger, The Slanderer

1.Munir Mezyed: Woe unto every slanderer, backbiter!

2.Munir Mezyed: Who collects wealth and continuously counts it.

3.Munir Mezyed: He thinks his wealth would eternalize him.

4.Munir Mezyed: Nay, He will definitely be thrown into the ‘Crusher’.

5.Munir Mezyed: What would make you aware of what the ‘Crusher’ might be?

6.Munir Mezyed: It is the ever-blazing fire of Allâh.

7.Munir Mezyed: Which leaps (directly) to the hearts.

8.Munir Mezyed: It will be closed over them

9.Munir Mezyed: In outstretched columns.

1.Munir Mezyed: Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with the ‘Companions of the Elephant’?

2.Munir Mezyed: Did He not turn their evil scheme into null and void?

3.Munir Mezyed: He sent against them birds in flocks,

4.Munir Mezyed: Striking them with stones of baked clay.

5.Munir Mezyed: Thus, He made them like devoured straw.

1.Munir Mezyed: (In gratitude) for the solidarity among ‘Quraysh’,

2.Munir Mezyed: Their solidarity during the regularity of the caravans journey in the winter to ‘Yemen’ and in the summer to ‘the Levant’

3.Munir Mezyed: Let them worship (& venerate) the Lord of this ‘Sacred House’,

4.Munir Mezyed: Who fed them against hunger, and made them safe from fear.

107.SurahEnglishNames: Small Kindnesses, Almsgiving, Have you Seen, The Daily Necessaries

1.Munir Mezyed: Have you seen the one who refuses to admit (the truth of) the ‘Last Judgment’?

2.Munir Mezyed: He is the one who drives away the orphan,

3.Munir Mezyed: And advocates not the feeding of the needy.

4.Munir Mezyed: Woe unto the worshipers,

5.Munir Mezyed: Who are not paying enough attention to their prayers!

6.Munir Mezyed: They (like only to) make show (of themselves)

7.Munir Mezyed: But not willing to give little alms.

1.Munir Mezyed: We have assuredly awarded you, (O' Muhammad), ‘Al-Kawthar’.

2.Munir Mezyed: Thus, pray to your Lord and sacrifice.

3.Munir Mezyed: Indeed, your enemy is the one who is without posterity.

1.Munir Mezyed: Say: who O' you who refuse to believe in the Oneness and Unity of Allâh

2.Munir Mezyed: I worship not what you worship.

3.Munir Mezyed: Nor are you worshipers of what I do worship.

4.Munir Mezyed: Nor will I be a worshiper of what you do worship.

5.Munir Mezyed: Nor will be worshipers of what I do worship.

6.Munir Mezyed: For you is your religion, and for me is my religion.”

1.Munir Mezyed: When the triumph of Allâh has come and the conquest,

2.Munir Mezyed: And you see the people entering into the doctrine of religion of Allâh in multitudes,

3.Munir Mezyed: Then celebrate the praise of your Lord and declare His divine glory, and ask Him for forgiveness. Indeed, He is the one Who accepts repentance and forgives (the sins).

1.Munir Mezyed: Doomed to perish is the hand of ‘Abu Lahab”! And doomed to eternal perdition is he!

2.Munir Mezyed: Neither his wealth nor what he earned would  benefit him.

3.Munir Mezyed: He will burn (forever and ever) in an inferno of blazing flames!

4.Munir Mezyed: And his wife (too), the firewood carrier.

5.Munir Mezyed: Around her neck will be a rope of palm fiber.

1.Munir Mezyed: Say, "He is Allâh, the One.

2.Munir Mezyed: Allâh is the Eternal One.

3.Munir Mezyed: He neither begets, nor was He begotten,

4.Munir Mezyed: Nor is there any equal to Him."

1.Munir Mezyed: Say, "I seek earnestly the protection of the Lord of the daybreak,

2.Munir Mezyed: From the evil of what He created,

3.Munir Mezyed: The evil of darkness when it spreads,

4.Munir Mezyed: The evil of the witches, who blow on the knots,

5.Munir Mezyed: And from the evil of the envious when he envies."

1.Munir Mezyed: Say, "I seek earnestly the protection of the Lord of mankind,

2.Munir Mezyed: The King of mankind,

3.Munir Mezyed: The God of mankind,

4.Munir Mezyed: From the evil of the invisible retreating whisperer,

5.Munir Mezyed: who whispers lies into the hearts of mankind,

6.Munir Mezyed: From (the evil of the) jinn and the mankind."
